Sense.DEF: the fourth letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第四个字母

Sense.DEF:
the second note in the musical
scale
of C
major
or the musical
key
based on this note
Sense.TRAN: D音〔C大调音阶的第二音〕﹔D 调

Sense.DEF: a mark given to a student’s work to show that it is not very good
Sense.TRAN: D级﹐丁级﹐丁等〔表示学习成绩不太好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a D in history last semester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个学期我历史得了个D。

Sense.DEF:
the number 500 in the system of
roman numerals

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= died死于
Sense.EXAMPLE: John Keats d. 1821
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰·济慈﹐卒于1821年

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= penny or pence in the system of money used in Britain before 1971〔1971年前英国货币体系中的〕便士
the short form of 缩略式=‘do’
Sense.EXAMPLE: D’you know how many people are going to be there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道有多少人要去那儿吗？

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked if she’d be willing to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问她是否愿意帮忙。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody knew where he’d gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人知道他去了哪里。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘did’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’d you get that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那东西你是哪里弄来的？

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= district attorney〔美国〕地方检察官

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something that you put onto a surface
Sense.TRAN: 少量﹐少许〔指放在物体表面的某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dab of butter
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点点黄油

Sense.DEF: a light touch with your hand, a cloth etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wiped her tears away with a dab of her handkerchief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手绢轻轻地擦掉眼泪。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a dab hand at/with sth
Sense.DEF: to be very good at a particular activity
a small flat fish

your
fingerprints
to touch something lightly several times, usually with something such as a cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dabbed her eyes with a handkerchief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手帕轻轻地擦了擦眼睛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dabbed at his bleeding lip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻轻地按了按流血的嘴唇。

Sense.DEF: to put a substance onto something with quick light movements of your hand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dabbed some cream on her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在脸上搽了点面霜。

PIC.HEADING: DAB 轻触﹔轻搽
PIC.PICCONTENT: She dabbed some cream on her face. 她在脸上搽了点面霜。；She dabbed her eyes with a handkerchief. 她用手帕轻轻地擦了擦眼睛。

Sense.DEF:
a system of broadcasting radio programmes using
digital
technology
to do something or be involved in something in a way that is not very serious
Sense.TRAN: 涉猎〔而不深入钻研〕﹐浅尝

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people who dabble in painting as a way of relaxing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把画画当成一种休闲方式的人

Sense.DEF: to move your hands, feet etc about in water
Sense.TRAN: 使〔手﹑脚等〕浸在水中移动﹔用〔手﹑脚等〕玩水[嬉水]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: children dabbling their feet in the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把脚伸进海水里嬉戏的小孩子

Sense.DEF: a large country house in Russia
a type of small dog with short legs and a long body
Sense.TRAN: 猎獾狗﹐腊肠狗〔一种身长腿短的狗〕

Sense.DEF: a type of cloth that is not made from natural materials
a repeated sound pattern in poetry, consisting of one long sound followed by two short sounds, as in the word ‘carefully’
Sense.TRAN: 〔诗歌的〕扬抑抑格〔即一长音后接两个短音﹐如carefully〕

Sense.DEF: father
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives with her mom and dad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和爸爸妈妈一起住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad, will you help me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸﹐帮我一下好吗？

Sense.DEF: father – used especially by children or when speaking to children
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daddy’s home!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸回家啦！

Sense.DEF: the best, most important, or most respected person
Sense.TRAN: 老大〔指最优秀﹑最重要或最受尊敬的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damon won the game for us – he’s the daddy!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴蒙是赢得这场比赛的功臣——他真是好样的！

Sense.DEF: a flying insect with six long legs
the lower part of a wall in a room, especially when it is decorated differently from the upper part of the wall
a creature in ancient Greek stories that is half a god and half a man
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊神话中的〕半人半神的精灵﹐半神

Sense.DEF: a tall yellow spring flower with a tube-shaped part in the middle
silly or crazy in an amusing way
silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a daft idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傻主意
Sense.EXAMPLE: Me, jealous? Don’t be daft that is a silly idea .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我嫉妒？别犯傻了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s as daft as a brush extremely silly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她傻得要命。

Sense.DEF: to be extremely interested in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony’s still daft about cars!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼对汽车还是那么着迷！

Sense.DEF: a short pointed knife used as a weapon
to look at someone angrily
if two people are at daggers drawn, they are extremely angry with each other
dirty or untidy
unfashionable
a very offensive word for someone from Spain, Italy, or Portugal. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 拉丁佬〔对西班牙人﹑意大利人或葡萄牙人的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF: an old type of photograph, or the process used to make it
Sense.TRAN: 达盖尔银版照片[照相法]〔早期的一种照片或照相法〕

Sense.DEF:
an Indian dish made with beans,
pea s
, or
lentil s
Sense.TRAN: 达尔〔一种印度菜肴﹐用豆﹑豌豆或小扁豆煮成〕

Sense.DEF: a large garden flower with a bright colour
happening or done every day
Sense.EXAMPLE: daily flights to Miami
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每日飞往迈阿密的航班

Sense.DEF: the ordinary things that you usually do or experience
relating to a single day
Sense.EXAMPLE: the daily rate of pay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日工资

Sense.DEF: happening or done every day
Sense.EXAMPLE: The zoo is open daily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物园每天开放。

Sense.DEF: a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday
someone, especially a woman, who is employed to clean someone’s house
the prints of a film as it is being made, which are looked at every day after filming ends
small, pretty, and delicate
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dainty gold chain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条精致的金链子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child with dainty features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个容貌俊秀的孩子

Sense.DEF: moving or done in a careful way, using small movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dainty walk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优雅的步态

Sense.DEF: something small that is good to eat, especially something sweet such as a cake
Sense.TRAN: 精美可口的小点心〔尤指糕饼等甜点〕

Sense.DEF:
a sweet alcoholic drink made with
rum
and fruit juice
Sense.TRAN: 代基里酒〔一种由朗姆酒与果汁调成的甜味酒类饮品〕

Sense.DEF: a place on a farm where milk is kept and butter and cheese are made
a company which sells milk and sometimes makes other things from milk, such as cheese
milk, butter, cheese etc
cattle that are kept to produce milk rather than for their meat
a farm that has cows and produces and sells milk
a woman who worked in a dairy in the past
a man who works for a dairy
a low stage in a room that you stand on when you are making a speech or performing, so that people can see and hear you
a white flower with a yellow centre
to be dead – used humorously
daisies attached together into a string that you can wear around your neck or wrist
one of the leaders of the Chinese Tibetan Buddhism
Sense.TRAN: 达赖喇嘛〔中国藏传佛教领袖之一〕

Sense.DEF: a valley – used in the past or in the names of places, especially in the North of England
Sense.TRAN: 山谷〔旧时用法﹐或用于地名中﹐尤指英格兰北部的山谷〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Yorkshire Dales National Park
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约克郡山谷国家公园

Sense.DEF: a romantic or sexual relationship between two people that is not considered serious
to take too long to do something, especially to make a decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: After months of dallying, the government has finally agreed to allow the plan to go ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拖了几个月后﹐政府终于同意实施这个方案。

Sense.DEF: to spend some time in a place, on your way to somewhere else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dallied in the Lake District for a while, then crossed to Belgium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在湖区稍作停留﹐然后穿过海峡到达比利时。

Sense.DEF: to do something or think about something, but not in a very serious way
Sense.TRAN: 随便地做﹔不十分认真地考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve dallied with the idea of touring round the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有过环游世界的念头﹐但只是想想而已。

Sense.DEF: to have a romantic relationship with someone, but not in a serious way
a large dog with short white hair and black or brown spots
a special wall built across a river or stream to stop the water from flowing, especially in order to make a lake or produce electricity
the mother of a four-legged animal, especially a horse
to stop the water in a river or stream from flowing by building a special wall across it
to stop something from being expressed or continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once she allowed her anger to show, it could not be dammed up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一旦发起脾气来就不可收拾。

Sense.DEF: physical harm that is done to something or to a part of someone’s body, so that it is broken or injured

GramExa.EXAMPLE: damage to property
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 财产损失

Sense.EXAMPLE: These chemicals have been found to cause serious environmental damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经发现﹐这些化学物质会造成严重的环境破坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There may be permanent brain damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能有永久性脑损伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyesight suffered irreparable damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的视力受到了无法修复的损伤。

Sense.DEF: harm caused to someone’s emotions or mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: The death of a parent can cause long-lasting psychological damage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丧父或丧母可能会给子女造成长久的心理创伤。

Sense.DEF: a bad effect on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The damage to his reputation was considerable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名誉受到很大的损害。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The closure of the factory will cause severe damage to the local economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关闭这家工厂会严重影响当地的经济。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the attempts at political damage control during the scandal
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑闻期间控制政治上不良影响的努力

Sense.DEF: money that a court orders someone to pay to someone else as a punishment for harming them or their property
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court awarded him £15,000 in damages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院判给他1.5万英镑的损害赔偿金。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something bad has happened which makes it impossible to go back to the way things were before it happened
Sense.TRAN: 已造成的伤害无法挽回﹐木已成舟
Sense.EXAMPLE: She immediately apologized, but the damage was done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她立即道歉﹐但伤害已无法挽回。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to ask how much you have to pay for something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Too much sun can do severe damage to your skin.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 过度日晒会对皮肤造成严重损伤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We surveyed the damage caused by the bomb.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们调查了此次炸弹爆炸造成的破坏情况。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She has suffered damage to her hearing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听力受损。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cost of repairing the damage could be around £300 million.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 弥补损失的花费可能在三亿英镑左右。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Young trees need protecting to prevent damage from the wind.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小树需要加以保护,防止风害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The earthquake caused severe damage to a number of buildings.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震对一些建筑物造成了严重破坏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: covering a large area
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Because of the size of the bomb, the damage was extensive.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹的体积很大﹐因此造成了大面积的破坏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that cannot be repaired
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 永久性的/不可修复的/不可逆转的损害
Collocate.EXAMPLE: By smoking for so long, she may have suffered irreversible damage to her health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有这么长的吸烟史,可能已经对身体造成了不可逆转的损害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fortunately, the fire caused only minor damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸火灾仅造成轻微损失。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is considerable evidence that the drug can cause physical damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有相当多的证据表明,这种药会对人体造成伤害。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to the structure of a building
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The building was checked for structural damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这栋建筑进行了检查以探明结构破坏情况。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The programme will concentrate on reducing environmental damage and pollution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划将把重点放在减少环境破坏和污染上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: caused by fire, storm, flood etc
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 火灾/暴风雨/水灾等造成的损失
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The campsite suffered extensive flood damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 营地遭到了洪水的大面积破坏。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you drink a lot of alcohol it can cause liver damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒会引起肝损伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: caused by an accident
caused by someone committing a crime

Sense.DEF: to cause physical harm to something or to part of someone’s body
Sense.TRAN: 损害﹐损坏﹐损伤〔某物或某人的身体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: insects that damage crops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏庄稼的昆虫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoking can severely damage your health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟会严重损害健康。

PIC.HEADING: DAMAGE 破损
PIC.PICCONTENT: chipped 有缺口的；dented 有凹痕的；smashed 被打碎的；scratched 有划痕的；broken 破碎的；cracked 有裂缝的

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on something or someone in a way that makes them weaker or less successful
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某物或某人〕有不良影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: The changes in share values have damaged investor confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价波动削弱了投资者的信心。

Exponent.DEF: to cause physical harm to something or someone, or have a bad effect on them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Several buildings were damaged by the earthquake.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几幢建筑受到地震破坏。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The scandal could damage his career.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这起丑闻可能影响他的事业。

Exponent.DEF: to have a bad effect on something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They use chemicals that will harm the environment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们使用危害环境的化学物质。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The oil crisis could harm the economy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油危机可能令经济受损。

Exponent.DEF: to have a bad effect on something and make it less successful, enjoyable, useful etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We didn’t let the rain spoil our holiday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没让雨天搅了假期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Local people say the new buildings will spoil the view.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地居民称新建筑会破坏景观。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately damage buildings, vehicles, or public property
Exponent.TRAN: 故意破坏〔建筑物﹑交通工具或公共财产〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the public telephones in the area had been vandalized.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区的公用电话全部被人破坏了。

Exponent.DEF: to secretly damage machines or equipment so that they cannot be used, especially in order to harm an enemy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is evidence that the airplane was sabotaged.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有证据表明飞机遭人为破坏。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately and illegally damage or change a part of something in order to prevent it from working properly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The car’s brakes had been tampered with.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车的车被人动了手脚。

Exponent.DEF: to damage a church or other holy place
Exponent.TRAN: 亵渎,玷污〔教堂或其他宗教场所〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The church had been desecrated by vandals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂遭到故意破坏者的亵渎。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately spoil the appearance of something by writing on it, spraying paint on it etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone had defaced the statue and painted it bright orange.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人污损雕像,将它漆成了亮橙色。

Sense.DEF: something that is damaged has been harmed or injured
Sense.EXAMPLE: a damaged leg
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤腿
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship is badly damaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船严重受损。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shampoo for dry or damaged hair hair that is in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适用于干性或受损发质的洗发液

Sense.DEF: a damaged person has emotional problems because of bad things that have happened to them in the past
Sense.TRAN: 情感受到伤害的﹐有心理创伤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works with emotionally damaged children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作对象是情感受过伤害的儿童。

Sense.DEF: causing physical harm to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 造成损害的﹐造成伤害的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the damaging effects of sunlight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳光的破坏作用

Sense.DEF: affecting someone or something in a bad way
Sense.EXAMPLE: damaging criticism of his policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的政策产生负面影响的批评

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The loss of jobs was damaging to morale.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁员影响了士气。

Sense.DEF: a type of cloth with a pattern woven into it, often used to cover furniture
Sense.TRAN: 〔常用来铺在家具上的〕织花缎子﹐锦缎
Sense.EXAMPLE: a damask tablecloth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块织花桌布

Sense.DEF: a woman

a humorous female character in a
pantomime a special play at Christmas
who is played by a man
Sense.TRAN: 〔童话剧中由男性扮演的〕滑稽女人

Sense.DEF: a British title given to a woman as an honour for achievement or for doing good things, or a woman who has this title
Sense.TRAN: 女爵士〔英国的荣誉头衔或指拥有此头衔的女性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dame Judi Dench
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪·丹奇女爵士
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was made a Dame in 1992.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在1992年被封为女爵士。

Sense.DEF: the rank of being a Dame
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she should be given a Damehood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为应该授予她女爵士爵位。

Sense.DEF: a way of spelling ‘damn it’
used when you are very annoyed or disappointed
Sense.TRAN: 该死﹐见鬼〔表示很生气或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damn! I’ve left my keys in the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见鬼！我把钥匙忘在办公室了。

Sense.DEF: used when something is impressive or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damn, she’s old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天啊﹐她这么老。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything was so damn expensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么东西都贵得要命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band sounded pretty damn good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这乐队听上去真是好极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll damn well do as I please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是想干什么就干什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know damn well what I’m talking about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在说什么你清楚得很。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He damn near almost drowned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他差一点就淹死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It isn’t easy.’ ‘ Damn right , it’s not.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这可不容易。” “没错﹐真不容易。”

Sense.DEF: nothing at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knows damn all about cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对汽车屁也不懂。

Sense.DEF: used when you are angry or annoyed with someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 该死的〔表示对某人或某事物生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn off the damn TV!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把该死的电视机关掉！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize something negative
Sense.TRAN: 该死的﹐十足的〔强调不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a damn shame he left her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开了她﹐真是太可惜了。

Sense.DEF: nothing at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s not a damn thing you can do about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事可真是无能为力。

Sense.DEF: a lot more, a lot better etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a damn sight tougher than you or me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比起你和我可要坚强多了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are extremely angry or annoyed with someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 他妈的！/你这个混蛋！〔表示对某人或某事物极为生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damn it, be careful with that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见鬼﹐那东西要小心点！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop, damn you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住手！你他妈的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damn that telephone!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部该死的电话！

Sense.DEF: used to make a negative statement in a strong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s Wally?’ ‘Damned if I know I don’t know .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “沃利在哪里？” “鬼才知道呢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be damned if I can find my keys I can’t find them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么也找不到钥匙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be damned if I let him in the house I won’t let him in .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不让他进屋。

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised
Sense.TRAN: 我的天﹐真没想到〔表示吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, I’ll be damned! I haven’t seen him for years!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐我的天！我好几年没见到他了！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are going to do something, even though it might have bad results
Sense.TRAN: 管他什么后果/费用/卡路里等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The time has come for me to speak out, and damn the consequences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了我该说出来的时候了﹐管他有什么后果。

Sense.DEF:
to be given the punishment of going to
hell
after you die
to state that something is very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The critics damned the play on the first night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏在首演之夜就被评论家批评得一无是处。

GramExa.GLOSS: show that you think someone or something is not good by only praising them a little
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对（某人/某事物）敷衍几句好话

Sense.LEXUNIT: damned if you do, damned if you don’t
Sense.DEF: used to say that whatever you say or do will be considered wrong
Sense.TRAN: 左也不是﹐右也不是﹔做也不好﹐不做也不好

Sense.DEF: to not care at all about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对（某人/某事物）毫不在乎
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t give a damn about her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才不在乎她呢。

Sense.DEF: to have no value at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her promise isn’t worth a damn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的承诺一钱不值。

Sense.DEF: very bad or annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: This damnable heat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这讨厌的高温！

Sense.DEF:
when someone is punished by being sent to
hell
after their death, or the state of being in hell for ever
used when you are very angry or annoyed
another form of ‘damn’

the people who God will send to
hell
when they die because they have been so bad
to try very hard to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll do my damnedest to fix it, but I can’t promise anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽全力去修﹐但是我不能保证什么。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is unusual, surprising etc
Sense.TRAN: 绝对奇妙的﹐绝对惊人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the damnedest thing you ever saw!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那绝对是你见过的最奇妙的玩意儿！

Sense.DEF: very stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a damn-fool mistake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分愚蠢的错误

Sense.DEF: proving or showing that someone has done something very bad or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 证明某人作恶的﹔提供罪证的
Sense.EXAMPLE: damning evidence of her treachery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她背叛的确凿证据
Sense.EXAMPLE: a damning report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谴责性的报告

Sense.DEF: slightly wet, often in an unpleasant way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wipe the leather with a damp cloth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用湿布擦拭皮面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold, damp day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷潮湿的一天

Sense.DEF: something that is intended to be exciting, effective etc, but which is disappointing
Sense.TRAN: 〔未达到预期效果而〕使人失望的事﹔湿水爆竹

Exponent.DEF: slightly wet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Iron the shirt while it is still damp.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁衬衫还没有全干的时候熨烫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a damp cloth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块湿布

Exponent.DEF: slightly wet, especially when this is pleasant or how something should be
Exponent.TRAN: 湿润的〔尤指令人感觉舒服或本应如此〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a moist chocolate cake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑润的巧克力蛋糕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cream helps to keep your skin moist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种乳霜可以让您的肌肤保持滋润。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the soil is moist.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确保土壤湿润。

Exponent.DEF: slightly wet and sticky, in an unpleasant way – used especially about someone’s skin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His hands were cold and clammy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的双手冷冰冰﹑黏糊糊的。

Exponent.DEF: slightly wet, especially in a cold unpleasant way
Exponent.TRAN: 潮湿的〔尤指寒冷﹑令人不适〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a cold damp morning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个寒冷潮湿的早晨。

Exponent.DEF: hot and damp in an unpleasant way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Florida can be very humid in the summer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗里达夏天有时非常湿热。

Exponent.DEF: warm and damp and making you feel uncomfortable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This muggy weather gives me a headache.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种闷热潮湿的天气让我头痛。

Exponent.DEF: dank air is cold and damp and smells unpleasant – used especially about the air inside a room
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dank air smelled of stale sweat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 潮湿阴冷的空气里有汗臭味。

Sense.DEF: water in walls or in the air that causes things to be slightly wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Damp had stained the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上留下了潮湿的痕迹。

Sense.DEF: to dampen something

to make a fire burn more slowly, often by covering it with
ash
Sense.TRAN: 减弱〔火势〕﹐〔常指用盖灰的方法〕封〔火〕

Sense.DEF: a layer of material which is put into the bottom of a wall to prevent water rising through it
to make something slightly wet
to make something such as a feeling or activity less strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The light rain dampened the crowd’s enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小雨使观众的热情减退了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raising interest rates might dampen the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高利率可能会抑制经济发展。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound or movement less loud or strong
Sense.TRAN: 降低〔音量〕﹔减弱﹐控制〔运动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spring dampens the shock of the impact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹簧减缓碰撞造成的震动。

Sense.DEF: to make something less enjoyable, active, or great than it could have been
Sense.EXAMPLE: A couple of knee injuries put a damper on his football career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几次膝伤阻碍了他的足球生涯。

Sense.DEF:
a type of small metal door that is opened or closed in a
stove
or
furnace
, to control the air reaching the fire so that it burns more or less strongly
a piece of equipment that stops a movement from being too strong
a piece of equipment that stops a piano string from making a sound

a
damp course
a young woman who needs help or protection – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 需要帮助[保护]的年轻女子〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a young woman who is not married, especially a pretty young woman in an old story
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指旧时故事中漂亮的〕未婚少女

Sense.DEF:
a small bitter purple
plum
a special set of movements performed to a particular type of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waltz is an easy dance to learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华尔兹这种舞很容易学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the traditional dances and music of Russia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯传统舞蹈和音乐

Sense.DEF: a social event or party where you dance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you going to the dance this weekend?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个周末你去参加舞会吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校舞会

Sense.DEF: an act of dancing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Claire did a little dance of excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔兴奋地跳了几步舞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s have another dance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们再跳个舞吧。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music which you can dance to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band was playing a slow dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队正在演奏一支节奏舒缓的舞曲。

Sense.DEF: the activity or art of dancing
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern dance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代舞
Sense.EXAMPLE: dance and movement classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞蹈和形体动作班

Crossrefto.REFLEX: lead sb a merry old dance

Sense.DEF: to move your feet and body in a way that matches the style and speed of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, let’s dance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐我们跳舞吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They danced to Ruby Newman’s orchestra the orchestra was playing .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们随着鲁比·纽曼管弦乐队的演奏跳起舞来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bride danced with her father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘和她父亲一起跳舞。

Sense.DEF:
to dance in performances, especially in
ballet
Sense.EXAMPLE: He danced with the Boston Repertory Ballet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在波士顿轮演剧目芭蕾舞团跳舞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nakamura dances several solos in this production.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中村在这出舞剧中有几段独舞。

Sense.DEF: to move up, down, and around quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pink and white balloons danced in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉红色和白色的气球随风舞动。

Sense.DEF: to do what someone wants you to do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 听从某人指挥﹐服从某人差遣〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organizations invariably dance to the tune of the people who control their funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机构组织总要听命于那些掌握他们运转资金的人。

Sense.DEF: to do everything possible in order to please someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a movie star with several young men dancing attendance on her
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被好几个年轻男子大献殷勤的女电影明星

Sense.DEF: a group of musicians who play music that you dance to
a special floor in a restaurant, hotel etc for people to dance on
a large public room where people paid to go and dance in the past
someone who dances as a profession
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dancer’s technique is strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个舞蹈演员舞技精湛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Margot Fonteyn, the famous British ballet dancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛戈·芳廷﹐英国著名芭蕾舞演员

Sense.DEF: someone who dances
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dancers on the floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞池中的舞者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave’s a good dancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫舞跳得很好。

Sense.DEF:
a medical operation to clean out the inside of a woman’s
uterus
a wild plant with a bright yellow flower which later becomes a white ball of seeds that are blown away in the wind
the soft ball of white seeds that grows on the dandelion plant
to make someone angry – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 惹某人生气﹐使某人发火〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a man who is dandified wears very fashionable clothes in a way that shows he cares too much about his appearance
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子〕穿着非常时髦的﹐过分注重外表的

Sense.DEF: to play with a baby or small child by moving them up and down in your arms or on your knee
Sense.TRAN: 颠着逗〔怀中或膝上的孩子〕

Sense.DEF: small pieces of dead skin from someone’s head that can be seen in their hair or on their shoulders
a man who spends a lot of time and money on his clothes and appearance
Sense.TRAN: 讲究衣着和外表的男子﹐好打扮的男子

Sense.DEF: very good – often used in a slightly humorous way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re at our hotel, and everything is fine and dandy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在自己的宾馆里﹐一切都非常好。

Sense.DEF: someone from Denmark

a word meaning
damn
that people use because it is less offensive
the possibility that someone or something will be harmed, destroyed, or killed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danger! No boats beyond this point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险！船只不可越过此处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees believe that their lives are in danger .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民认为他们有生命危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The danger of a fire in the home increases during the holidays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节假日期间发生火灾的隐患增加。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The public was not aware of the danger from nuclear tests in Nevada.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对内华达州举行核试验的危险性并不了解。

Sense.DEF: the possibility that something bad will happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party is in danger of being defeated in the next election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党面临下次大选时被击败的危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a danger that museums will attempt to entertain rather than educate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 存在博物馆追求娱乐功能而忽视教育功能的危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: to guard against the danger of becoming isolated
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 防止变得孤立的危险

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t look pleased, but she ignored the danger signals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去不高兴了﹐但她忽视了这些危险信号。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that may harm or kill you
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dangers that abound in the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充斥该地区的危险

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the dangers of drug use
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸毒的危害

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wreck is a danger to other ships.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘沉船对其他船只是个威胁。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no danger of confusion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会产生混淆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no danger of Darren ever getting up early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达伦从不会早起。

Sense.DEF: to be so ill that you may die

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The public was not in danger at any time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众自始至终未曾有过危险。

Collocate.COLLOC: be in danger of doing sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was clear that the ship was in grave danger of sinking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然,这艘船面临沉没的巨大危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: no longer be in danger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: John is still in hospital but he is out of danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰仍在住院,但他已脱离危险。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 令某人/某人的生命处于危险中
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Firemen put their own lives in danger as part of their job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员出生入死,这是他们工作的一部分。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: involve a lot of danger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Their journey was long and fraught with danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅途漫长且危险重重。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I knew I was in great danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道自己的处境很危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very great
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You have put us all in grave danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让我们大家都身陷巨大的危险之中。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: danger of death
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plane’s crew were now in mortal danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的机组人员现在命悬一线。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: likely to happen very soon
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The passengers on the boat were not in immediate danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船上的乘客眼下没有危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: possible but not definite
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Gloves should be worn because of the potential danger of infection.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于存在感染的潜在威胁,应当戴手套。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: continuing all the time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are in constant danger of attack.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们随时有遭到袭击的危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: danger to your body
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many sports involve some physical danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多体育运动都有人身危险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Today’s police officers face danger every day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的警察每天都面对危险。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: feel that there is danger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The animal lifted its head, sensing danger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只动物感觉到了危险,抬起了头。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: seems likely
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most birds will warn other birds when danger threatens.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数鸟儿感到可能发生危险时会警告其他鸟儿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: there is no longer any danger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At last the sound of bombing had stopped and the danger had passed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸声终于停止,危险过去了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an area that could be dangerous
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People living in the danger area have been told to leave.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 居住在危险地区的民众已被告知撤离。

Sense.DEF: additional money that you are paid for doing dangerous work
able or likely to harm or kill you
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws about dangerous dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关危险犬类的法律
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of these prisoners are extremely dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些囚犯中有些极为危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a highly dangerous situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况十分危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crumbling sidewalks are dangerous for old people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 破旧失修的人行道对老人来说很危险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The virus is probably not dangerous to humans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒对人类可能没有危害。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is dangerous for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s dangerous for a woman to walk alone at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子一个人走夜路有危险。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The powdered milk was not as good as breast milk, and was downright dangerous actually dangerous when it was mixed with unclean water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶粉没有母乳好﹐用不洁净的水冲调更会造成危险。

Sense.DEF: involving a lot of risk, or likely to cause problems
Sense.TRAN: 危险的﹐可能引起麻烦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is in a dangerous financial position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家企业的财务状况危急。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politically dangerous strategy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有政治风险的策略

Sense.DEF: a situation or subject that could make someone very angry or upset
Sense.TRAN: 容易得罪人的处境﹔危险话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers can be on dangerous ground if they discuss religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师讨论宗教可能会引发争议。

Exponent.DEF: likely to cause death or serious harm, or cause something bad to happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Snow and ice are making driving conditions very dangerous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰雪令行车环境相当危险。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: dangerous drugs
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险药物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a dangerous criminal
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名危险罪犯

Exponent.DEF: if something is risky, something bad could easily happen or you could easily make a mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors said it was too risky to operate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说风险太大,不能动手术。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a risky situation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的局势

Exponent.DEF: dangerous – used especially about substances, jobs, and journeys
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指物品﹑工作或旅行〕危险的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hazardous waste
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险废弃物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hazardous chemicals
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险化学物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: hazardous occupations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险职业
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The expedition was extremely hazardous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次探险活动极其危险。

Exponent.DEF: dangerous because someone is very likely to be hurt – used especially about places or conditions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The roads are unsafe for cyclists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些道路对骑车者来说不安全。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: unsafe working conditions
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的工作环境

Exponent.DEF: places or conditions that are treacherous are very dangerous for anyone who is walking, driving, climbing etc in them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The snow turned to ice, making conditions treacherous for walkers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪变成了冰,对行人构成隐患。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the island’s treacherous coastline
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该岛危险的海岸

Exponent.DEF: a perilous journey, situation etc is very dangerous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a perilous journey across the sea
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次危险的跨海之旅

Exponent.DEF: a high-risk job, situation, or behaviour is likely to be dangerous
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Drug users need to know that sharing needles is high-risk behaviour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸毒者要知道,共用针头是很危险的做法。

Sense.DEF: to hang or swing loosely, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A light bulb dangled from a wire in the ceiling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只灯泡悬吊在天花板的一根电线上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I dangled my feet in the clear blue water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把双脚悬在清澈碧蓝的水中荡来荡去。

PIC.HEADING: DANGLE 悬垂
PIC.PICCONTENT: The keys are dangling from the beam. 钥匙挂在梁上。；Their legs are dangling from the ski lift. 他们悬着腿坐在上山吊椅上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: dangle sth in front of sb/before sb
Sense.DEF: to offer something good to someone, in order to persuade them to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good pay package and a company car were dangled in front of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优厚的薪酬和公司配车摆在她面前。

Sense.DEF: the language used in Denmark

a very sweet cake made of light
pastry
relating to Denmark, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 丹麦的﹔丹麦人的﹔丹麦语的

Sense.DEF: a small fairly flat sweet cake, often with fruit inside
unpleasantly wet and cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dank prison cell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴冷的牢房

Sense.DEF: a man who is dapper is nicely dressed, has a neat appearance, and is usually small or thin
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子〕穿着整洁的﹔短小精悍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dapper little man in a grey suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一身灰西装﹑打扮利落的小个子男人

Sense.DEF: to mark something with spots of colour, light, or shade
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕有斑点﹐使〔某物〕斑驳

Sense.DEF: marked with spots of colour, light, or shade
Sense.TRAN: 有花斑的﹔有亮斑的﹔斑驳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dappled shade of the trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斑驳的树影

Sense.DEF: a horse that is grey with spots of darker grey

a system of broadcasting radio programmes using
digital
technology
a type of drum played in Northern Africa and the Middle East
Sense.TRAN: 阿拉伯手鼓〔一种北非和中东地区演奏用的手鼓〕

Sense.DEF: used humorously when talking about an old husband and wife who live very happily together
Sense.TRAN: 一对恩爱的老夫妇〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences
Sense.TRAN: 胆敢﹐敢于〔做危险的或害怕做的事情﹐尤用于疑问句或否定句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted to ask her, but he didn’t dare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想问她﹐但又不敢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll tell Dad.’ ‘You wouldn’t dare!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要告诉爸爸。” “谅你也不敢！”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I daren’t go home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢回家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only a few journalists dared to cover the story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数几个记者敢于报道这一事件。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hardly dared hope that he was alive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎不抱希望他还活着。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dare we admit this?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们敢承认这件事吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Dare can be used like a modal verb, followed by an infinitive without ‘to’, in negative sentences and questions.
F2NBox.TRAN: dare 可以像情态动词一样使用,后接不带 to 的不定式,用于否定句和疑问句中
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I am so afraid that I dare not move.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吓得一动也不敢动。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Dare she ring him at the office?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她敢打电话到办公室找他吗？
F2NBox.EXPL: It can also be used as an ordinary verb, followed by an infinitive with or without ‘to’.
F2NBox.TRAN: dare 也可以用作普通动词,后接带 to 或不带 to 的不定式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Nobody dared to ask any questions.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人敢提任何问题。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: No wonder the party did not dare publish that document.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 难怪该党不敢公布那份文件。
F2NBox.EXPL: The past form is dared for both uses.
F2NBox.TRAN: 两种用法过去式都是 dared。

Sense.DEF: said to show that you are very angry and shocked about what someone has done or said
Sense.TRAN: 你竟敢﹐你怎么敢〔表示对他人行为﹑言辞的愤怒和震惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How dare you accuse me of lying!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你竟敢说我撒谎！

Sense.DEF: said to warn someone not to do something because it makes you angry
Sense.TRAN: 你敢！〔用于警告某人不要做某事以免惹你生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you dare talk to me like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么敢跟我那样讲话！

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to do something dangerous or embarrassing as a way of proving that they are brave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They dared Ed to steal a bottle of his father’s whiskey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们激埃德去偷他爸爸的一瓶威士忌。

Sense.EXAMPLE: So jump, then. I dare you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么跳呀﹐我看你敢不敢。

Sense.DEF: used when saying something that you think people may not accept or believe
Sense.TRAN: 据愚见〔用于说出可能不被认可或相信的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the play was, dare I say it, boring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依我的浅见﹐这部戏枯燥乏味。

Sense.DEF: used when saying or agreeing that something may be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dare say things will improve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想情况会好转的。

Sense.DEF: something dangerous that you have dared someone to do

GramExa.GLOSS: because someone has dared you to
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ran across a busy road for a dare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为受到激将﹐她跑过了一条繁忙的马路。

Sense.DEF: someone who likes doing dangerous things

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘dare not’

Sense.DEF: involving a lot of risk or danger, or brave enough to do risky things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a daring rescue attempt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大胆的营救行动

Sense.DEF: new or unusual in a way that may shock people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a daring new building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢设计大胆的新建筑

Sense.DEF: courage that makes you willing to take risks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plan of great daring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为大胆的计划

Sense.DEF: if it is dark, there is little or no light
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church was dark and quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂里黑魆魆的﹐寂静无声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dark winter days
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴暗的冬日
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, the room went dark became dark .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间突然变暗了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It gets dark night begins about ten o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约十点钟开始天黑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was still dark was night when we boarded the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上火车时天还是黑的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was pitch dark completely dark in the attic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阁楼上漆黑一片。

Sense.DEF: quite close to black in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were dark clouds in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空中有乌云。
Sense.EXAMPLE: men in dark suits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿深色套装的男士
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly darker colour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 略深一点的颜色

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dark blue dress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件深蓝色的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: someone who is dark has hair, eyes, or skin that is brown or black in colour
Sense.TRAN: 〔头发﹑眼睛或皮肤〕褐色的﹐黑色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall, dark man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身材高大﹑皮肤黝黑的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s dark skin and eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的深色皮肤和褐色眼睛

Sense.DEF: mysterious or secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dark secret
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐藏的秘密

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Apparently, he has a son, but he’s kept that very dark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他有个儿子﹐但他把这件事藏得很隐秘。

Sense.DEF: evil or threatening
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a darker side to his character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的性格里有阴暗的一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a place where so many dark deeds had been committed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾经罪恶横行的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dark forces of the universe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇宙的邪恶力量

Sense.DEF: a dark time is unhappy or without hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dark days of the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那段黯淡的战争岁月
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even in the darkest moments, I still had you, my love.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使在最无望的时候我还有你﹐亲爱的。

Sense.DEF: if you have dark feelings or thoughts, you are very sad or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dark depression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴沉的抑郁
Sense.EXAMPLE: her darkest fears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最深的恐惧

Sense.DEF: dark humour deals with things that are bad or upsetting in a funny way
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dark humor common in difficult situations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 常见于困境中的黑色幽默

Sense.DEF: the parts of Africa etc about which we know very little – this use is now often considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 非洲/南美等鲜为人知的地方〔这一用法现常被认为具冒犯性〕

Exponent.DEF: if a place is dark, there is little or no light
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room was very dark.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里很黑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a dark night with clouds covering the moon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个漆黑的夜晚,云层遮住了月亮。

Exponent.DEF: a dimly-lit building or place is fairly dark because the lights there are not very bright
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a dimly-lit restaurant
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间昏暗的餐厅
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The church was dimly lit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂里灯光昏暗。

Exponent.DEF: a dim light is fairly dark
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The camera can take good pictures even in dim lighting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种相机即使在昏暗的光线下也能拍出优质照片。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The evening sky grew dim.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 傍晚的天空暗了下来。

Exponent.DEF: a darkened room or building is darker than usual, especially because its lights have been turned off or the curtains have been drawn
Exponent.TRAN: 〔房间或建筑尤因关上灯或拉上窗帘而〕变暗的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The prisoner lay in a darkened room.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人躺在暗下来的房间里。

Exponent.DEF: a gloomy place or room is not at all bright or cheerful
Exponent.TRAN: 〔场所或房间〕光线不好的,阴暗的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bar was gloomy and smelled of stale cigar smoke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里光线阴暗,有股污浊的雪茄味。

Exponent.DEF: dark and difficult to see through – used especially about water
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the murky waters of the lake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 混浊的湖水

Exponent.DEF: completely dark, so that nothing can be seen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was pitch-dark inside the shed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 棚屋里漆黑一片。

Exponent.DEF: a shady place is cooler and darker than the area around it, because the light of the sun cannot reach it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was nice and shady under the trees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 树下阴凉舒适。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They found a shady spot for a picnic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们找了一处阴凉的野餐地。

Sense.DEF: when there is no light, especially because the sun has gone down
Sense.EXAMPLE: my childish fear of the dark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对黑暗孩子般的恐惧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I turned off the light and lay there in the dark.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我关了灯﹐在黑暗中躺在那儿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood outside in the pitch dark when there is no light at all .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站在黑漆漆的屋外。

Sense.DEF: after, before, or until the sun goes down at night
Sense.TRAN: 天黑以后/天黑以前/直到天黑
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want you home before dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要你天黑前回家。

Sense.DEF: knowing nothing about something important, because you have not been told about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re in the dark just as much as you are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们和你们一样﹐什么都不知道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: College officials were kept in the dark about the investigation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次调查丝毫未向学院行政人员透露。

Sense.DEF: the period in European history from the 6th to the 10th centuries, after the end of the Roman Empire
Sense.TRAN: 黑暗时代〔欧洲历史上在罗马帝国灭亡之后从公元六世纪到十世纪的一段时期〕

Sense.DEF: a time when attitudes, knowledge, technology etc were not as modern or developed as they are now
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑知识﹑技术等不如现在的〕落后的时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed is stuck in the Dark Ages when it comes to his attitudes towards women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德对待女性的态度还停留在落伍的时代。

Sense.DEF: to become dark, or to make something dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky darkened and a few drops of rain fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色变暗﹐落下几滴雨来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a darkened theater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变暗了的剧院
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evening shadows darkened the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜幕使房间暗了下来。

Sense.DEF: to become less hopeful or positive, or to make something like this
Sense.EXAMPLE: As he got drunker, his mood darkened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝得越醉﹐情绪就越是不好。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s face darkens, they start to look angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The captain’s face darkened as he read.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上校读着读着﹐脸色就阴沉下来。

Sense.DEF: said when you do not want to see someone again – now used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 别再让我见到你〔现为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: glasses with dark glass in them that you wear to protect your eyes from the sun or to hide your eyes
someone who is not well known, and who surprises people by winning a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the 1955 golf championship, dark horse Jack Fleck defeated Ben Hogan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在1955年的高尔夫球锦标赛上﹐“黑马” 杰克·弗莱克击败了本·霍根。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not tell people much about themselves, but who has surprising qualities or abilities
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a dark horse. I didn’t know she’d written a novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可真是深藏不露啊﹐我不知道她还写过一部小说。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a black person. Do not use this word.
in a sad, angry, or threatening way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fred scowled darkly at her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗雷德满面怒容地看着她。

Sense.DEF: having a dark colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a darkly handsome man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肤色黝黑的英俊男子

Sense.DEF: dealing with something that is bad or upsetting in a funny way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a darkly comic look at illness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看待疾病的黑色幽默态度

Sense.DEF: a type of matter that scientists think may exist. It cannot be seen but seems to affect the movements of stars.
Sense.TRAN: 〔科学家认为可能存在的〕暗物质

Sense.DEF: when there is no light
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long hours of darkness during winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬季漫长的黑夜

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lamp suddenly went out, leaving us in darkness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯突然熄灭﹐我们陷于一片黑暗中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The room was in total darkness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里漆黑一团。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We lit our campfire as darkness fell it became night .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜幕降临﹐我们点起了篝火。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared out the window at the gathering darkness the night slowly coming .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凝视着窗外渐浓的夜色。

Sense.DEF: evil or the devil
Sense.EXAMPLE: His smooth manner covered a heart of darkness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他温和的举止下隐藏着一颗阴险的心。

Sense.DEF: the dark quality of a colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: the darkness of the lenses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 透镜的暗色

Sense.DEF: a special room with only red light or no light, where film from a camera is made into photographs
used when speaking to someone you love
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐宝贝〔称呼心爱的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, darling, there’s Mary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看呀﹐亲爱的﹐玛丽来了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very nice
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really are a darling, Barney.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴尼﹐你可真是个好人。

Sense.DEF: the most popular person or thing in a particular group or area of activity
Sense.TRAN: …的红人﹐…的宠儿〔某一团体或领域中最受欢迎的人或事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s the darling of the fashion world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是时装界的红人。

Sense.DEF: used of someone you love very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: my two darling daughters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那两个宝贝女儿

Sense.DEF: used when you think someone or something is attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a darling little house!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么漂亮的小屋啊！

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are annoyed or disappointed
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌﹐可恶﹐倒霉〔用于表示生气或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darn! I forgot my keys!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见鬼！我忘记带钥匙了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Darn it! I’ll have to do it all myself!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真气人！都得由我一个人来做！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how bad, stupid, unfair etc someone or something is
Sense.TRAN: 该死的﹐讨厌的〔强调某人或某事物是多么糟糕﹑愚蠢﹑不公平等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The darn fool got lost on the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这该死的笨蛋居然迷了路。

Sense.DEF: a lot better, harder etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d earn a darn sight more money there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在那里会挣到多得多的钱。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It was a darned good movie.

Sense.DEF: to repair a hole in a piece of clothing by stitching wool over it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her cardigan had been darned at the elbows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的羊毛衫肘部缝补过。

Sense.DEF: a place where a hole in a piece of clothing has been repaired neatly with wool
used when you are surprised about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did they really? I’ll be darned!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们真的这样做了？我简直不敢相信！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you will not allow something to happen
used to emphasize that you do not know something
to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill darted forward and pulled him away from the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔冲上前把他从火边拉开。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom darted a terrified glance over his shoulder at his pursuers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆惊恐地回头朝追赶他的人瞥了一眼。

Sense.DEF: a small pointed object that is thrown or shot as a weapon, or one that is thrown in the game of darts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a poisoned dart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒镖

Sense.DEF: a game in which darts are thrown at a round board with numbers on it
a sudden quick movement in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoner made a dart for the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人猛地朝门口冲去。

Sense.DEF: a very sudden, sharp feeling
Sense.TRAN: 突然的一阵内疚/惊慌/疼痛等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sent a dart of terror through her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那使她感到一阵恐惧。

Sense.DEF: a small fold put into a piece of clothing to make it fit better
a round board used in the game of darts
to go or run somewhere very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Olive dashed into the room, grabbed her bag, and ran out again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利芙冲进屋﹐抓起她的手提袋﹐又跑了出来。

Sense.DEF: to disappoint someone by telling them that what they want is not possible
Sense.TRAN: 使某人的希望破灭﹐让某人失望
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopkins’ hopes were dashed when his appeal was denied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍普金斯的上诉被拒后﹐他的希望破灭了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you must leave quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyway, I must dash – I said I’d meet Daniel at eight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐我得赶紧走了﹐我约好了八点钟和丹尼尔见面。

Sense.DEF: to throw or push something violently against something, especially so that it breaks

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship was dashed against the rocks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船猛撞在岩石上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Waves were dashing against the sea wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浪头拍击着海堤。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are slightly annoyed or angry about something
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌！〔表示有些厌烦或生气〕

Sense.DEF: to leave somewhere very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry dashed off before she had a chance to thank him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还没来得及说声谢谢﹐哈里就匆匆离开了。

Sense.DEF: to write or draw something very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dashed off a quick letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她匆匆写了封信。

Subsense.DEF: a small amount of a substance that is added to something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add salt, pepper and a dash of vinegar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加盐﹑胡椒﹐再加一点点醋。

Subsense.DEF: a small amount of a quality that is added to something else
Subsense.TRAN: 一点点﹐少量〔添加的特性〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add a dash of romance to your life with a trip to Paris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去巴黎旅行一次﹐给生活增添一些浪漫。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone runs somewhere very quickly in order to get away from something or someone, or in order to reach them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made a dash for the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地冲向门口。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prisoners made a dash for freedom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯们拔腿飞奔﹐想要逃脱。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s pouring with rain – we’ll have to make a dash for it .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下大雨了——我们得赶紧跑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When the alarm went there was a mad dash for the exit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警报响起﹐人们疯狂地冲向出口处。

Sense.DEF: a line [-] used in writing to separate two closely related parts of a sentence, as for example, in the sentence ‘Go home-they’re waiting for you.’

a long sound or flash of light used for sending messages in
morse code
Sense.TRAN: 〔用莫尔斯电码发报时用的〕长音﹐光的长闪

Sense.DEF:
a
dashboard
style, energy, and courage in someone such as a soldier
to look very impressive and attractive in particular clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿着特定衣服时〕引人注目﹐漂亮
Sense.EXAMPLE: With her new image, she’ll certainly cut a dash on her holiday cruise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以她新的形象﹐她肯定会在乘船度假时吸引人们的目光。

Sense.DEF: the part of a car in front of the driver, which has the controls on it

a clear liquid made with
seaweed
, dried
tuna
, or
mushroom s
which is used in Japanese cooking, for example to make soup
Sense.TRAN: 出汁〔日式料理中使用的一种清汤﹐用海带﹑金枪鱼干或蘑菇熬制而成〕

Sense.DEF: a man who is dashing wears nice clothes and is very attractive and confident
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子〕风度翩翩的﹐时髦的﹐有自信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dashing young doctor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个帅气的年轻医生

Sense.DEF: very cruel or evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: tales of pirates and their dastardly deeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关海盗及其暴行的故事

Sense.DEF:
a system used to record sound or information in
digital
form
information or facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: The research involves collecting data from two random samples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项研究需要从两个随机样本里收集资料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: data on pesticide use
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关杀虫剂使用的资料

GramExa.EXAMPLE: detailed research data
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 详细的研究数据

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: After data, you can use a singular verb or, in formal or technical English, a plural verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: data 之后可以使用动词的单数形式,在正式或科技英语中可使用动词的复数形式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The data is collected by trained interviewers.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据由受过训练的采访人员收集。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: These data are summarized in Table 5.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些数据的概述见表五。
F2NBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘datas’ or 或 ‘a data’.

Sense.DEF: information in a form that can be stored and used, especially on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔能储存﹑使用的〕资料﹐〔尤指计算机中的〕数据
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s possible to store a lot more data on a DVD.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在DVD上可以存储更多的信息。

Sense.DEF: a database
a large amount of data stored in a computer system so that you can find and use it easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔存储在计算机系统中的〕数据库﹐资料库
Sense.EXAMPLE: customer details held on a database
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 存储在数据库内的客户详细信息

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 数据库系统/软件/应用程序等

Sense.DEF: the process of using a computer to examine large amounts of information, for example about customers, in order to discover things that are not easily seen or noticed
Sense.TRAN: 数据挖掘〔使用计算机查阅大量资料﹐以发现不易看到或注意到的信息〕

Sense.DEF: the use of computers to store and organize information, especially in business
a particular day of the month or year, especially shown by a number
Sense.EXAMPLE: The date on the letter was 30th August 1962.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信上的日期是1962年8月30日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s today’s date?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天几号？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the date of the next meeting?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下次会议是几月几号？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should apply at least 8 weeks before your date of departure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该至少在出发前八周提出申请。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have you set a date for the wedding yet?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你定好婚礼日期了吗？

Sense.DEF: at some time in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The details will be agreed at a later date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细节将来再商定。

Sense.DEF: up to now
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost of the work to date has been about £150 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止这项工作花费了大约1.5亿英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her best performance to date was her third place at the World Junior Championships.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迄今为止她最好的成绩是在世界青少年锦标赛上获得第三名。

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when you go out with someone that you like in a romantic way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a date with Andrea tomorrow night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明晚我和安德烈亚有约会。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I felt like a teenager going out on a first date .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉就像第一次去赴约会的少年一样。

Subsense.DEF: someone that you have a date with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I bring my date to the party?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以把恋人带到派对上来吗？

Sense.DEF: a time arranged to meet someone, especially socially
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s make a date to come over and visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们定个时间前去拜访吧。

Sense.DEF: a sweet sticky brown fruit with a long hard seed inside

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember the exact date we moved into this house.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们搬进这栋房子的确切日期我不记得了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that people have agreed on
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The work was not finished by the agreed date.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作没有如期完成。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the last day you can officially do something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The closing date for applications is April 30th.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请截止日期为4月30日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the date by which something is due to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Payment must be made by the due date.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须在支付期限之前付款。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a date on which goods will be delivered
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The delivery date should be around 23rd August.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 交货日期应该是8月23日左右。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the date when something is published
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are aiming at a publication date of mid-November.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是在11月中旬出版。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the date when someone leaves
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My departure date was only a few days away.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的出发日期就在几天之后。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a date on a product after which it cannot be used
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Check the expiry date on your credit card.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 核查信用卡上的到期日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a date on a food product after which it should not be sold
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 销售期限﹐最迟销售日期

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: choose the date when something will happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you decided on a date for the wedding yet?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你选定婚期了吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decide the date when something will happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They haven’t set a date for the election yet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们尚未确定选举日期。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to put today’s date at the top of the letter.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了在信头写上今天的日期。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the day and year when someone was born
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What’s your date of birth?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的出生日期是什么时候？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The insurance will only cover costs incurred on or after the date of departure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项保险只承保出发当天或之后发生的费用。

Sense.DEF: to write or print the date on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a newspaper dated November 23,1963
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份日期为1963年11月23日的报纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure you sign and date it at the bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要在底下签上姓名和日期。

Sense.DEF: to find out when something old was made or formed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rocks are dated by examining the fossils found in the same layer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩石的年代通过查看在同一岩层里发现的化石来鉴定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: radiocarbon dating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碳年代测定法

Sense.DEF: if clothing, art etc dates, it begins to look old-fashioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: His designs are so classic, they’ve hardly dated at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的设计太经典了﹐一点也不过时。

Sense.DEF: to have a romantic relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is he still dating Sarah?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还在和萨拉谈恋爱吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are Chris and Liz dating?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯在和利兹谈恋爱吗？

Sense.DEF: if something that you say, do, or wear dates you, it shows that you are fairly old
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes, I remember the moon landings – that dates me, doesn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是的﹐我记得登月事件——这说明我老了﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: to have existed since a particular time in the past
Sense.TRAN: 自…存在至今﹐追溯到…年代
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church dates from the 13th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂建于13世纪。

Sense.DEF: a small book in which you write things you must do, addresses, telephone numbers etc
old-fashioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: That dress looks a bit dated now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件连衣裙现在看起来有点过时了。

Sense.DEF:
the
international date line
Sense.TRAN: 日界线﹐国际日期变更线

Sense.DEF:
a
rape
that is committed by someone the woman has met in a social situation

Subsense.DEF: an object used for printing the date on documents
the mark that it makes

Sense.DEF: a business that helps people to meet other people in order to have a romantic relationship

a particular form of a noun in some languages such as Latin and German, which shows that the noun is the
indirect object
of a verb
Sense.TRAN: 与格〔拉丁语和德语等语言中名词的一种形式﹐表示这个名词是某个动词的间接宾语〕

Sense.DEF: to put paint or a soft substance on something without being very careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: soldiers’ faces daubed with black mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抹了黑泥的士兵的脸

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a soft or sticky substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a daub of paint
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 少量的油漆

Sense.DEF: mud or clay used for making walls
someone’s female child
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got two daughters and one son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有两个女儿和一个儿子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: our eldest daughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的长女

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the daughter of an English king
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位英格兰国王的女儿

Sense.DEF: your son’s wife
behaving in a way that a daughter is expected to behave
Sense.TRAN: 女儿般的﹔尽女儿之孝的

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel afraid or less confident about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt utterly daunted by the prospect of moving to another country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一想到要移居别的国家就感到十分害怕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be daunted by all the technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要被所有这些技术给吓住。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone continues or starts to do something in spite of difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was steep but, nothing daunted, he started climbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 山很陡峭﹐但他毫不畏惧﹐开始攀登。

Sense.DEF: frightening in a way that makes you feel less confident
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trip seemed rather daunting for a young girl.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅行对一个年轻姑娘来说有点吓人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got the daunting task of following in Ferguson’s footsteps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临继承弗格森事业的艰巨任务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the daunting prospect of asking for a loan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人望而却步的贷款申请事宜

Sense.DEF: confident and not easily frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: dauntless optimism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无所畏惧的乐观

Sense.DEF: to take a long time to do something or walk somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t dawdle – we’re late already!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别磨蹭了——我们已经晚了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I dawdled over a second cup of coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我慢悠悠地喝着第二杯咖啡。

Sense.DEF: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boats set off at dawn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天一亮船队就出发了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When dawn broke the first light of the day appeared , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破晓的时候﹐我们离加尔各答还有50英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was up at the crack of dawn very early in the morning to get the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We worked from dawn to dusk through the whole day while it is light .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从早干到晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cold light of dawn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清冷的晨曦

Sense.DEF: the time when something began or first appeared
Sense.TRAN: 文明的开端/宇宙初开等
Sense.EXAMPLE: People have been falling in love since the dawn of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亘古以来就有爱情。

Sense.DEF: something that seems positive or hopeful but really is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was talk of share prices recovering, but that was just a false dawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人说股价会回升﹐但那不过是镜花水月而已。

Sense.DEF: if day or morning dawns, it begins
Sense.EXAMPLE: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨过后﹐破晓时天朗气清。

Sense.DEF: if a period of time or situation dawns, it begins
Sense.EXAMPLE: The age of Darwin had dawned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文时代开始了。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or idea dawns, you have it for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 第一次有某种感觉[想法]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It began to dawn that something was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 于是开始想到什么地方出了差错。

Sense.DEF: if a fact dawns on you, you realize it for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 开始明白〔某个事实〕﹐醒悟
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ghastly truth dawned on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始明白了可怕的真相。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It dawned on me that Jo had been right all along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始明白乔一直都是对的。

Sense.DEF: the sound of many birds singing at dawn
an attack or operation by soldiers or police that happens very early in the morning
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队或警方的〕凌晨突袭﹐拂晓袭击

Sense.DEF: a period of 24 hours
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent three days in Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在巴黎度过了三天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What day is it today?’ ‘Friday.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “今天星期几？” “星期五。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left two days ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他两天前离开的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll call you in a couple of days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过两天给你电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to hold the party on a different day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得改天开派对了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What really happened on that day so long ago?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么久以前的那一天究竟发生了什么？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over 10,000 soldiers died on that one day in January.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一月份的那一天死了一万多名士兵。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The following day, a letter arrived.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天﹐来了一封信。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Jane the day before yesterday .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前天我看到了简。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re leaving for New York the day after tomorrow .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们后天启程去纽约。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got an email from Sue the other day a few days ago .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前几天﹐我收到休发来的一封电子邮件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women generally use up about 2,000 calories a day each day .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性一般每天消耗大约2,000卡路里。

Sense.DEF: the period of time between when it gets light in the morning and when it gets dark
Sense.EXAMPLE: She only leaves her house during the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只在白天出门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a cold blustery day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个寒风呼啸的冷天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kept in that dark cell, I could no longer tell whether it was day or night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被关在那个漆黑的牢房里﹐不知是白天还是黑夜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She first met Steve on a cold but sunny day in March.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她第一次见到史蒂夫是在三月里的一天﹐那天天气寒冷但是阳光明媚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Owls usually sleep by day and hunt by night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫头鹰通常白天睡觉﹐夜晚猎食。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The day dawned started bright and clear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拂晓时天朗气清。

Sense.DEF: the time during the day when you are awake and active
Sense.EXAMPLE: His day begins at six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一天从六点开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackie starts the day with a few gentle exercises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰基以一些小运动量的锻炼开始一天的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I feel I just can’t face another day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我感觉无法面对又一天的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been a long day used when you have been awake and busy for a long time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是漫长的一天。

GramExa.GLOSS: during the whole time you are awake
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been studying all day. I’m beat!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都在学习﹐我都筋疲力尽了！

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘all the day’. Say 而要说 all day.

Sense.DEF: the time you spend doing your job during a 24-hour period
Sense.EXAMPLE: I work a ten-hour day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天工作十小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rail workers are campaigning for a shorter working day .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路工人在发起运动要求缩短工作时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a day off a day when I do not have to go to work tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我休息。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a time in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew him pretty well from his days as a DJ in the Bounty Club from when he was a DJ .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从他在仁爱俱乐部当唱片播放师那时候起就和他很熟了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always used to do the cooking in the early days of our marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚结婚那时候总是我做饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not much was known about the dangers of smoking in those days then .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候人们对吸烟的危害所知甚少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were very much opposed to the government of the day that existed then .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们极力反对当时的政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One day on a day in the past , a mysterious stranger called at the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天﹐有个神秘的陌生人登门拜访。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From day one from the beginning , I knew I wouldn’t get on with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从一开始我就知道我和他合不来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In my day in the past, when I was young , kids used to have some respect for their elders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们那时候小孩子都尊敬长辈。

GramExa.GLOSS: in the past when someone was a student etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 当某人是学生/在军队/是儿童等时
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I used to run six miles a day in my army days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当兵的时候每天跑六英里。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to talk about a time in the past you think was better than now
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We used to stay in bed all morning and party all night. Those were the days!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前我们常常整个上午不起床﹐还通宵开派对。 那些日子真是好啊！

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the situation that exists now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t do much exercise these days now .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今我不大锻炼了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s incredible that such attitudes still exist in this day and age used to express disapproval that something still exists now .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在还存在这种看法﹐真令人难以置信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To this day until and including now , he denies any involvement in the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至今他仍然否认和这宗罪案有任何瓜葛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This tradition has continued right up until the present day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一传统一直延续到现在。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a time in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to go and visit the States one day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有朝一日我要去美国看看。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some day we might get him to see sense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有朝一日我们或许会让他明白事理的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: One of these dayssome time soon I’m going to walk right out of here and never come back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不久我要离开这里﹐再也不回来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kelly’s expecting the baby any day now very soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉很快就要生孩子了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The day will come the time will come when he won’t be able to care for himself any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总有一天他会无法照顾自己的。

Sense.DEF: a successful period of time in someone’s life or in something’s existence
Sense.EXAMPLE: My uncle was a famous radio personality in his day at the time he was most successful .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叔叔在最风光的时候是广播电台的名人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be too disappointed you didn’t win – your day will come you will be successful in the future .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要因为没有获胜太过失望﹐你成功的时刻会来的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Game shows like that have had their day were successful in the past, but are not any more .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种游戏节目曾经风光一时。

Sense.DEF: a day on which a particular event or celebration takes place
Sense.TRAN: 独立日/选举日/圣诞日等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rioting broke out just three days before polling day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在投票日前三天发生了骚乱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: five/three/nine etc years to the day
Sense.DEF: exactly five years etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s two years to the day since he died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去世正好两年。

Sense.DEF: someone’s life
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ended her days in poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在贫困中死去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something will not exist for much longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems that the hospital’s days are numbered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来这家医院开不久了。

Sense.DEF: continuously for a long time in a way that is annoying or boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stand sitting at a desk day after day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忍受不了日复一日地坐在办公桌前。

Variant.LEXVAR: from one day to the next

Sense.DEF: if a situation changes from day to day or from one day to the next, it changes often
Sense.TRAN: 天天﹐每天〔指情况经常变化〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never know from day to day what I’m going to be doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天都不知道第二天将会干什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His moods swung wildly from one day to the next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的情绪一天天起伏很大。

Sense.DEF: slowly and gradually
Sense.TRAN: 一天天﹐逐日﹐渐渐地﹐慢慢地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her health was improving day by day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的健康状况日渐好转。

Sense.DEF: all the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being together night and day can put a great pressure on any relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日日夜夜在一起会给任何一段关系带来很大的压力。

Sense.DEF: a trip you make for pleasure on a particular day
Sense.EXAMPLE: A visit to the caves makes a fascinating and exciting day out for all the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参观岩洞有趣又刺激﹐适合全家一日游。

Sense.DEF: to be less successful or happy than usual, for no particular reason
Sense.TRAN: 不顺利的时候﹐不顺心的日子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even the greatest athletes have their off days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪怕是最伟大的运动员也有不顺利的时候。

Sense.DEF: to make someone very happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hearing her voice on the phone really made my day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在电话里听到她的声音真令我高兴。

Sense.DEF: a soup, meal etc that a restaurant serves on a particular day in addition to the meals they always offer
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐馆〕当日特别推荐的汤/菜/鱼等

Sense.LEXUNIT: be all in a day’s work
Sense.DEF: if something difficult, unpleasant, or unusual is all in a day’s work for someone, it is a normal part of their job

Sense.LEXUNIT: take each day as it comes

Variant.LEXVAR: take it one day at a time

Sense.DEF: to deal with something as it happens and not worry about the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since I had the accident, I’ve learned to take each day as it comes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从遭遇那次事故后﹐我就学会了一切顺其自然。

Sense.DEF: a time when you have to deal with the bad results of something you did in the past
Sense.TRAN: 报应来临的日子﹐秋后算账的日子 SPOKEN PHRASES 口语短语

Sense.DEF: used to say that everything seems to be going wrong
used when several unpleasant things have happened to someone in one day
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t Chris’s day – he overslept and then his car broke down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这天克里斯很倒霉——他先是睡过了头﹐然后他的汽车又坏了。

Sense.DEF: to spend all day doing something for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the weather’s nice, we’ll make a day of it and take a picnic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果天气好的话﹐我们就去野餐﹐好好地玩上一天。

Sense.DEF: used when warning someone that if they try to do something, you will enjoy stopping, defeating, or punishing them etc. This phrase was made popular by Clint Eastwood in the film ‘Dirty Harry’.
Sense.TRAN: 让我高兴高兴〔用于警告对方﹐要是试图做某事﹐你将乐意将其阻止﹑打败或加以惩罚。 这一短语因克林特·伊斯特伍德在影片《辣手神探夺命枪》中说过而流行起来〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think something is very unlikely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Bill says he’s going to start going to the gym.’ ‘That’ll be the day!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “比尔说他要开始去健身房了。” “这不可能吧！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you want someone to do something faster because you do not have enough time to wait for them to finish
Sense.TRAN: 我/我们没有很多时间〔用于要求某人加紧做事﹐因为你没有时间等他们做完〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up! I haven’t got all day!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点！ 我没那么多时间！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something does not happen often and is therefore very special
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go out and celebrate. After all, it’s not every day you get a new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出去庆祝一下吧﹐毕竟并不是每天都能找到新工作。

Sense.DEF: a long time ago, when you were much younger
to work during the day at a job you sometimes have to do at night
Sense.TRAN: 上日班〔指这一工作有时要上夜班〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m on days this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期我上日班。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is at least as old as you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 他/她至少有40/50/60岁等〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s ninety if she’s a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她至少有90岁。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: at the end of the day
it’s (a little) late in the day

Sense.DEF:
a boy
day pupil
the time of day when light first appears
Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrived in Cairo at daybreak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拂晓时分我们抵达开罗。

Sense.DEF: a place where children can go in the day during the school holidays to do sports, art etc
Sense.TRAN: 日间活动营〔学校放假时孩子们白天可去进行体育运动﹑艺术活动等的地方〕

Sense.DEF: when babies or young children, or sick or old people are looked after during the day, especially while their family members are at work
Sense.TRAN: 日间托儿服务﹔病人[老人]日间看护

GramExa.EXAMPLE: subsidized day care facilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获补贴的日间看护场所

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local authorities may provide day care for under fives.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地政府可能会为五岁以下儿童提供日间托儿服务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a day care centre for the elderly
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人日间看护所

Sense.DEF: a place where sick or old people or people who have a particular problem can go during the day to be looked after, to meet other people, or to get help

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a local day centre for homeless people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地为无家可归者服务的日间服务中心

Sense.DEF: to think about something pleasant, especially when this makes you forget what you should be doing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you daydreaming about? There’s work to be done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在做什么白日梦？活还没干完呢。

Sense.DEF: pleasant thoughts you have while you are awake that make you forget what you are doing

a girl
day pupil
having a very bright orange, green, yellow, or pink colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Day-Glo orange posters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荧光橙色海报

Sense.DEF: your normal job which you earn most of your money from doing, especially as opposed to another interest
Sense.TRAN: 正职﹐白天的工作〔相对于兼职〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d love to be a professional writer, but I’m not giving up my day job just yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想成为职业作家﹐但我目前还不打算辞去正职。

Sense.DEF: the light produced by the sun during the day

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re shy animals and don’t often come out in daylight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们是胆小的动物﹐白天不常出来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The park is open to the public during daylight hours .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园白天对公众开放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If possible, it’s better to work in natural daylight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果条件允许的话﹐最好在自然日光下工作。

Sense.DEF: if you put daylight between yourself and someone else, you make the distance or difference between you larger
Sense.TRAN: 拉大自己与某人的差距
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now the team need to put some daylight between themselves and their rivals for the championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在球队需要拉大自己和对手的差距以夺得冠军。

Sense.LEXUNIT: scare/frighten the (living) daylights out of sb
Sense.DEF: to frighten someone a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: It scared the living daylights out of me when the flames shot out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火焰喷射出来﹐吓得我魂飞魄散。

Sense.LEXUNIT: beat/knock the (living) daylights out of sb
Sense.DEF: to hit someone a lot and seriously hurt them
a situation in which something costs you a lot more than is reasonable
Sense.TRAN: 明目张胆地索取高价﹐光天化日之下敲竹杠
Sense.EXAMPLE: £2.50 for a cup of coffee? It’s daylight robbery!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯咖啡要2.5英镑？ 这简直是白日抢劫！

Sense.DEF: the time during the summer when clocks are one hour ahead of standard time
Sense.TRAN: 夏令时〔钟表比标准时间拨快一小时〕

Sense.DEF: a place where small children can be looked after while their parents are at work
a day when you do not go to work, school etc because you have a holiday or because you are sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: On my days off, you’ll usually find me out in the back garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每逢我休假的日子﹐你通常都可以看到我在后院里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m taking a few days off before the wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼前我要休几天假。

Sense.DEF:
a student who goes to a
boarding school
but who lives at home
a system that allows workers to spend one day a week studying a subject at a college
