Sense.TRAN: 〔准许工人一个星期有一天到大学学习的〕脱产进修制度﹐休假进修制度

Sense.DEF: a train or bus ticket that lets you go somewhere at a cheaper price than usual, if you go there and back on the same day
Sense.TRAN: 〔火车或公共汽车票价较优惠的〕当日来回票

Sense.DEF: a room in a hospital where patients can go to read, watch television etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔医院里供病人去看书和电视等的〕康乐室﹐休息室

Sense.DEF: a school where the students go home in the evening rather than one where they live
the time during the day between the time when it gets light and the time when it gets dark

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t sleep in the daytime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我白天睡不着觉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I take your daytime telephone number the number of the telephone you use during the day ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把你的日间电话号码给我吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: daytime television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日间电视节目

Sense.DEF: day-to-day jobs or activities are ones that you do every day as a normal part of your life, your job etc
Sense.TRAN: 日常[常规]工作/业务/生活等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The manager is responsible for the day-to-day running of the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理负责酒店的日常管理工作。

Sense.DEF: planning for only one day at a time, usually because you are unable to plan for longer
Sense.EXAMPLE: I see a counsellor and can now handle life on a day-to-day basis .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去心理顾问处进行咨询﹐现在好歹能把日子一天天过下去。

Sense.DEF:
the activity of using a computer to buy and sell
share s
on the Internet, often buying and selling very quickly to make a profit out of small price changes
Sense.TRAN: 〔网上操作﹑利用股价浮动赚取小差价的〕当天投机买卖

Sense.DEF: a visit to an interesting place when you go there and come back the same day
Sense.TRAN: 一日游﹐当天往返的旅行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandparents took me on a day trip to Blackpool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的祖父母带我去布莱克浦一日游了。

Sense.DEF: feeling confused and not able to think clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wandered round in a daze, not quite sure what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恍恍惚惚地四处徘徊﹐不知该干什么。

Sense.DEF: unable to think clearly, especially because of a shock, accident etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因震惊﹑意外事故等而〕茫然的﹐迷乱的﹐恍惚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dazed survivors staggered from the wreckage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吓呆了的幸存者踉跄着走出残骸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her face was very pale and she wore a dazed expression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸色惨白﹐一脸茫然。

Sense.DEF: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deer dazzled by the headlights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被车头灯光照得目眩的鹿

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel strong admiration
Sense.EXAMPLE: As children, we were dazzled by my uncle’s good looks and charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小时候﹐我叔叔的英俊外表和魅力令我们倾倒。

Sense.DEF: a light that is dazzling is very bright and makes you unable to see properly for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 使人目眩的﹐令人眼花的

Sense.DEF: very impressive and attractive
Sense.TRAN: 令人印象深刻的﹐特别吸引人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dazzling display of football skills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人眼花缭乱的足球技巧表演

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= decibel or decibels 分贝
the abbreviation of 缩写= direct current 直流电
the abbreviation of 缩写= District of Columbia in the US〔美国的〕哥伦比亚特区

Sense.DEF: 6th June, 1944; in World War II, the day the Allies landed in France to begin the spread of their forces through Europe, under the command of General Eisenhower. D-Day is sometimes used to describe the day on which an important operation or planned action will begin.
Sense.TRAN: 〔第二次世界大战时〕盟军在法国登陆的日子〔即1944年6月6日﹐盟军开始在欧洲布署兵力展开攻击的日子〕﹔重大事件[行动]开始之日

Sense.DEF: a chemical formerly used to kill insects that harm crops
Sense.TRAN: 滴滴涕〔过去使用的一种杀虫剂〕

Sense.DEF: shows an opposite
Sense.EXAMPLE: deindustrialization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去工业化

Sense.DEF: shows that something is removed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Debone the fish remove its bones .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把鱼骨去掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king was dethroned removed from power .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王被废黜了。

Sense.DEF: shows that something is reduced
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government have devalued the currency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已将货币贬值。

Sense.DEF: a religious official, in some Christian churches, who is just below the rank of a priest
Sense.TRAN: 执事﹐会吏〔某些基督教教会的神职人员﹐地位仅低于牧师﹑神父等〕

Sense.DEF: a female religious official, in some Christian churches, who is just below the rank of a priest
Sense.TRAN: 女执事﹐女会吏〔某些基督教教会的神职人员﹐地位仅低于牧师﹑神父等〕

Sense.DEF: to switch something off, especially a piece of equipment, or to stop it from being used any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to type in a code number to deactivate the alarm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要输入一个密码来关闭警报。

Sense.DEF: no longer alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother had been dead for ten years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲去世十年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are trying to contact the family of the dead man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在设法与死者的家属联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pile of dead leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一堆枯叶
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dead body of a young soldier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名年轻士兵的尸体
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two men were shot dead by terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子遭恐怖分子枪杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Magnus was found dead in his car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马格纳斯被人发现死在他自己的车里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One man is still missing, presumed dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仍有一人失踪﹐被推定已经死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He suddenly had a heart attack and dropped dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突发心脏病猝死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was pronounced dead on arrival at the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到达医院时她被宣告已经死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His fellow climbers had left him for dead on the mountain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的登山伙伴以为他已死﹐便把他留在山上走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t know if she was dead or alive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不知道她是死是活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When they found him he was more dead than alive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发现他的时候﹐他已奄奄一息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her parents were long dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母早就去世了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse dead, which is an adjective, with died, which is the past tense and past participle of the verb die. 不要把形容词dead同die的过去式和过去分词died混淆: The man was already dead (NOT 不说 The man was already died). 这人已经死了。

Sense.DEF: not working because there is no power
Sense.EXAMPLE: I picked up the phone but discovered the line was dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿起电话听筒﹐却发现没有声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly the radio went dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收音机突然不响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think the batteries are dead .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想是电池没电了。

Sense.DEF: already used
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small pile of dead matches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小堆擦过的火柴

GramExa.GLOSS: one that someone has finished drinking from in a bar or restaurant
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔酒吧或饭店里〕倒空的酒杯/酒瓶

Sense.DEF: a place that is dead is boring because there is nothing interesting or exciting happening there
Sense.TRAN: 死气沉沉的﹐冷冷清清的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This place is dead after nine o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方九点以后就死气沉沉了。

Sense.DEF: not active or being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The luxury car market has been dead in recent months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近几个月来豪华汽车市场生意萧条。

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is dead has no feeling in it, especially because the blood supply to it has been stopped
Sense.TRAN: 〔胳膊﹑腿等身体部位〕失去知觉的﹐麻木的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I got up my foot had gone dead where I’d been sitting on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我起来的时候﹐脚上坐着时压到的地方都麻了。

Sense.DEF: showing no emotion or sympathy
Sense.TRAN: 神情冷漠的﹔漠不关心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jennie’s eyes were cold and dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮的眼神冷酷而麻木。

Sense.DEF: very tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t go out tonight. I’m absolutely dead!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我不能出去﹐累死了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was dead on her feet and didn’t have the energy to argue used when someone keeps going even though they are very tired .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她累极了﹐没力气争吵。

Sense.DEF: to be very deeply asleep or unconscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Better leave Craig – he’s dead to the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好别打扰克雷格——他睡得正熟。

Sense.DEF: completely or exactly – used to emphasize what you are saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all sat waiting in dead silence complete silence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们全都十分安静地坐着等待。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train came to a dead stop it stopped completely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车完全停下了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The arrow hit the dead centre of the target the exact centre .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支箭正好射中靶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve given the whole thing up as a dead loss completely useless or a complete failure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这件事毫无希望﹐已经完全放弃了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John tells me it’s a dead cert , we can’t lose something which will certainly happen, win, succeed etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰告诉我一定能赢﹐我们不会输。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He fell to the floor in a dead faint completely unconscious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全失去了知觉﹐倒在地板上。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are determined not to allow something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 除非我死了﹐决不〔表示坚决不让某事发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll marry him over my dead body!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我死也不让你和他结婚！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would never wear particular clothes, go to particular places, or do particular things, because you would feel embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 我决不﹐我死也不〔指坚决不穿某种衣服﹑不去某些地方或不做某事﹐因为觉得难堪〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t be seen dead in a dress like that!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我死也不会穿那样的连衣裙！

Sense.DEF: in serious trouble

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If Mum finds out about this, I’m dead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果妈妈发现这件事﹐我就死定了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re in dead trouble now in very serious trouble !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这下你可有大麻烦了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: One word of this to Sam and you’re dead meat you are in serious trouble and someone is very angry with you !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事你要是对萨姆说一个字﹐你就完蛋了！

Sense.DEF: an argument, problem, plan etc that is dead and buried is not worth considering again
Sense.TRAN: 〔争论﹑问题﹑计划等〕不值得再考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old argument about whether the UK should be a member of the EU should now be dead and buried.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前关于英国是否应该加入欧盟的争论﹐现在应该已经失去意义了。

Sense.DEF: if a plan or idea is dead in the water, it is unlikely to continue successfully
used to rudely and angrily tell someone to go away and leave you alone
Sense.TRAN: 滚开！别来烦我！〔用于粗鲁﹑无礼地叫某人离开﹐不许来打扰〕

Sense.DEF: a dead language, for example Latin or Ancient Greek, is no longer used by ordinary people
Sense.TRAN: 死语﹐死语言〔现在普通人不再使用的语言﹐如拉丁语或古希腊语〕

Sense.DEF: something which stops or slows your progress, especially a strong influence
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dead hand of local government bureaucracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地政府官僚作风的桎梏

Sense.DEF:
a dead
planet
has no life on it
when the ball is dead in some games, it is no longer on the playing area
completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s a crazy idea.’ ‘You’re dead right!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “这主意很愚蠢。” “你说得完全对！”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The road was dead straight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路是笔直的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything suddenly went dead still.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切突然变得死一般寂静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her family were dead against the marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的家人坚决反对这桩婚事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was obviously dead drunk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然醉得不行了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he saw her, he stopped dead in his tracks suddenly stopped moving completely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一看见她就呆若木鸡了。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was dead good-looking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长得极为英俊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounded dead boring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事听起来很无聊。

Sense.DEF: directly or exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stared dead ahead at the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直直地盯着门道看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus arrived dead on time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车正点到达。

Sense.DEF: people who have died
Sense.EXAMPLE: Families on both sides buried their dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方家人埋葬了死者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the dead and injured had been passengers on the bus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分死伤者都是公共汽车上的乘客。

Sense.DEF: the middle of the night or the middle of the winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: creeping around in the dead of night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在夜深人静时悄悄而行

Sense.DEF: to become alive again after dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christ rose from the dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣基督死后复活。

Sense.DEF: someone who is lazy and has no plans in life
someone who avoids paying their debts
a strong lock often used on doors
a plan, idea etc that is not worth considering because it is very likely to fail
Sense.TRAN: 无价值的事物﹔很可能失败的计划[主意]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He admitted that the whole project was a dead duck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认整个计划毫无价值。

Sense.DEF: to make a feeling or sound less strong
Sense.TRAN: 减轻〔某种感觉〕﹔降低〔声响〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: medicine to deaden the pain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇痛药

Sense.DEF: a street with no way out at one end
a situation where no more progress is possible

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The negotiations have reached a dead end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判陷入了僵局。

Sense.DEF: a job with low wages and no chance of progress
Sense.TRAN: 低薪且没有前途的工作

Sense.DEF: to remove the dead or dying flowers from a plant

a situation during or at the end of a race or competition in which two or more competitors have the same number of points etc, have reached the same level, or have taken the same time to complete a particular distance
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛的〕胶着状态﹐不分胜负的局面

Sense.DEF: a law, idea etc that still exists but that people no longer obey
Sense.TRAN: 形同虚设的法规﹐空文﹔名存实亡的观念

Sense.DEF: a letter that cannot be delivered or returned
Sense.TRAN: 无法投递[退回]的信﹐死信

Sense.DEF: a date or time by which you have to do or complete something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He missed the deadline for applications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他错过了申请截止期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It has to be in before the deadline of July 1st.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在7月1日截止期前一定要交上去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines finish something on time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve set a deadline of 12 noon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把中午12点定为截止期限。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that must be met but is difficult

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It's easier to work hard if you have a deadline.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有期限的话,工作更容易卖力些。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have to finish something by a deadline
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We're all under pressure and working to deadlines.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们全都顶着压力在赶工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: finish something by a deadline
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone's working extremely hard to meet the deadline.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都在拼命工作以如期完工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: fail to finish something by a deadline
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There will be penalties if the government misses the deadline to cut air pollution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果政府没能在最后期限之前减少空气污染﹐就会被惩处。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decide on a date when something must be finished
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The deadline has been set at January 31st.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后期限定在1月31日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make the date or time later than it was before
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My editor agreed to extend the deadline by two weeks.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的编辑同意延期两周。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Things began to get more frantic as the deadline loomed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着期限临近,事情更加忙乱了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the date or time by which you must do something goes past
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The deadline had already passed for him to raise the money.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他筹款的期限已经过了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a time or date when something must definitely be finished
one that is difficult because it does not allow much time to do something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As a journalist, you have to be able to work to tight deadlines.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为新闻工作者,必须能在时间紧迫的情况下完成工作。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 星期五/十二月等截止期
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The project went on long after the December deadline.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 十二月截止期过了很久之后工程还在继续。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a disagreement cannot be settled
Sense.EXAMPLE: The talks have reached a complete deadlock .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈完全陷入僵局。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a last-ditch effort to break the deadlock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打破僵局的最后努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Negotiations ended in deadlock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判最后陷入了僵局。

Sense.DEF:
a
deadbolt

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Talks between management and unions remain deadlocked.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资双方的谈判仍然处于僵持状态。

Sense.DEF: likely to cause death
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deadly poison
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命的毒药
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deadly weapon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命武器

Sense.DEF: someone who will always be your enemy and will try to harm you as much as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two rapidly became deadly enemies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个人很快就成了不共戴天的仇敌。

Sense.DEF: complete or total
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat in deadly silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一声不吭地坐着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in deadly earnest completely serious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是十分认真的。

Sense.DEF: causing harm in a very effective way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hit the target with deadly accuracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她准确无误地射中目标。

Sense.DEF: like death in appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face had a deadly paleness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸死一般的苍白。

Sense.DEF: very seri-ous, dull etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m deadly serious, this isn’t a game!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是非常认真的﹐这不是儿戏！

Sense.DEF: a poisonous European plant
Sense.TRAN: 颠茄〔一种有毒的欧洲植物〕

Sense.DEF: sounding and looking completely serious when you are saying or doing something funny
Sense.TRAN: 故作严肃的﹐冷面滑稽的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: deadpan humour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷面幽默

Sense.DEF: calculating the position of a ship or aircraft without using the sun, moon, or stars
Sense.TRAN: 〔不依靠天文观测而测定船只或飞机位置的〕航位推测法

Sense.DEF: someone who looks exactly like someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔和另一个人〕酷似的人﹐一模一样的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave’s a dead ringer for Paul McCartney.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫和保罗·麦卡特尼长得很像。

Sense.DEF: something that is very heavy and difficult to carry
Sense.TRAN: 沉重的东西﹐死沉的东西

Sense.DEF: someone or something that prevents you from making progress or being successful
people or things within an organization which are no longer useful or needed
branches of a tree which are no longer alive
physically unable to hear anything or unable to hear well
Sense.EXAMPLE: communication between deaf and hearing people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失聪者和听力正常者之间的交流
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think Mum’s going a bit deaf .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得妈妈有点耳聋了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s deaf and dumb unable to hear or speak and communicates using sign language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又聋又哑﹐用手语交流。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom was born profoundly deaf having great difficulty hearing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆天生几乎全聋。

Sense.DEF: people who are deaf
Sense.EXAMPLE: a school for the deaf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聋人学校

Sense.DEF: to be unwilling to hear or listen to something
Sense.TRAN: 不愿听某事﹐不肯听取某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was deaf to his pleas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他的恳求充耳不闻。

Sense.DEF: to be unwilling to listen to what someone is saying or asking
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory owners turned a deaf ear to the demands of the workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂主对工人们提出的要求置若罔闻。

Sense.DEF: if advice or a warning falls on deaf ears, everyone ignores it
Sense.TRAN: 〔建议﹑警告〕遭人忽视﹐不被理睬

Sense.DEF: if a noise deafens you, it is so loud that you cannot hear anything else
to make someone go deaf
very loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deafening roar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 震耳欲聋的吼声

Sense.DEF: a complete silence, when it is uncomfortable or you are expecting someone to say something
Sense.TRAN: 鸦雀无声﹐死一般的寂静

Sense.DEF: someone who is unable to hear or speak
an agreement or arrangement, especially in business or politics, that helps both sides involved
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指生意或政治方面的〕协议
Sense.EXAMPLE: They made a deal to sell the land to a property developer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们达成了协议把这块地卖给房地产开发商。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rumors that the company had done a deal with Microsoft to market its products
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关该公司已和微软公司达成协议销售其产品的传言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Twelve US soldiers were released after a deal between the army and the guerillas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军方和游击队达成协议之后﹐12名美国士兵获释。

Sense.DEF: a large quantity of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It took a great deal of time and effort.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那需要花费大量时间和精力。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His work has been attracting a great deal of attention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品吸引了大量关注。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He knew a good deal more than I did.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他懂得比我多很多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s married to a man a good deal older than herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁给了一个年龄比她大许多的男人。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a great/good deal of only with uncountable nouns.
F2NBox.TRAN: a great/good deal of 只能与不可数名词连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a great deal of time/money/work
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量时间/金钱/工作
F2NBox.EXPL: With nouns in the plural, use a lot of.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果是名词的复数形式﹐则用a lot of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a lot of people/animals/shops
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的人/动物/商店

Sense.DEF: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a better deal for nurses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给护士的更好待遇

Sense.EXAMPLE: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal a new and fairer system .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women tend to get a raw deal from employers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性常常受到雇主不公正的对待。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree to do some-thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, it’s a deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐就这么办。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to know about a problem or something strange that is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: So what’s the deal? Why is he so mad?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么回事？他干吗发这么大火？

Sense.DEF: when you give out cards to players in a card game
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your deal, Alison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该你发牌了﹐艾莉森。

Sense.DEF:
fir
or
pine
wood used for making things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deal table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷杉[松]木桌子

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The two companies have recently done a major deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司最近达成了一项重要协议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why don't we make a deal to stay out of each other's way?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么不约定互不干涉呢？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree a deal after a lot of discussions
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The two countries reached a deal about the development program.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国就开发计划达成了协议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The singer has signed a $20 million deal with an American TV network.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名歌手与一家美国电视网签下了一份两千万美元的协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree a deal by discussing over a long period
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have negotiated a special deal with one of the world’s leading car hire companies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们与一家世界顶级汽车租赁公司谈成了一项特别协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree a deal formally
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A deal between the two companies has now been concluded.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司现已达成协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: finally agree on a deal, especially one that is good for you
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 达成协议〔尤指对己方有好处〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The salesman was eager to clinch the deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售员急于做成生意。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: agree a deal, especially when it is difficult or you have to accept some things you would rather not accept
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 达成协议〔尤指有难度或出于无奈〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In the end, they had to cut a deal with the Democrats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后,他们只得与民主党达成协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have made or agreed on a deal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do we have a deal?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 说定了？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: buy something at a good price
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He thought he had got a good deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得自己买得很合算。

Collocate.COLLOC: back out of/pull out of a deal
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decide not to make a deal after discussing one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Twenty-five jobs were lost after their partner pulled out of the deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 合伙人变卦减少了25个工作岗位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it happens as arranged
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s 99% certain that the deal will go through.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分之九十九会成交。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: does not happen as arranged
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cost was simply too high, so the deal fell through.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格实在太高,所以没有成交。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a good price, offer, or arrangement
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You can buy two for £10, which sounds like a good deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 10 英镑可以买两个,听上去挺合算的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He lost a fortune in an unwise business deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了一宗不明智的生意,损失惨重。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that involves an agreement about how much people will be paid
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are currently negotiating a new pay deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前他们在商讨新的工资协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an agreement to end fighting between countries
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Hopes of a peace deal are fading.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成和平协议的希望越来越渺茫。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: After weeks of negotiation the prospect of a political deal seemed increasingly unlikely.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 几周谈判下来,达成政治协议的希望似乎越来越渺茫。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one which involves selling weapons
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A number of recent arms deals have embarrassed the government.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来一系列武器交易令政府感到尴尬。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one between a singer or band and a recording company
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s hard for a band to get a record deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队要拿到唱片合约很难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that will be fixed for one year, two years etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The five-year deal is estimated to be worth $17.2 million.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份五年期合约估计价值1,720万美元。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: dishonest or illegal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some senior members of the party were involved in shady deals and bribery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党的一些高级成员涉嫌黑幕交易和受贿。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I got free accommodation as part of the deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据协议条款,我得到免费的食宿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the details or conditions in it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The hotel group refused to release the financial terms of the deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店集团拒绝公布这桩交易的财务细节。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that has been completely agreed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The takeover has been described as a done deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次收购据称已成定局。

Sense.DEF: to give playing cards to each of the players in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose turn is it to deal?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到谁发牌了？

Sense.DEF: to buy and sell illegal drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many users end up dealing to support their habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多吸毒者最后都是靠做毒品买卖来供自己吸毒。

Sense.DEF: to cause harm to someone or something – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: （给某人或某物）造成伤害[损失﹐打击]〔用于新闻报道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sanctions have dealt a severe blow to the local tourism industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 制裁对当地旅游业造成了沉重的打击。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This will deal a blow to consumer confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将对消费者的信心造成打击。

Sense.DEF: to buy and sell a particular type of product

GramExa.EXAMPLE: investors dealing in stocks and shares
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事证券和股票买卖的投资者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He then began dealing in heroin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来他就做起了海洛因买卖。

Sense.DEF: to be interested or involved in something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事感兴趣﹔参与某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a scientist, I do not deal in speculation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一名科学家﹐我对投机不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to include someone in a game of cards
to give playing cards to each of the players in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: I began dealing out the cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始发牌。

Sense.DEF: to decide what kind of punishment someone will get
Sense.TRAN: 决定给予〔某人某种处罚〕

Sense.DEF: to take the necessary action, especially in order to solve a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strategy for dealing with disruptive pupils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对付捣蛋学生的策略
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, I’ll deal with this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我会处理这件事的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The council has failed to deal with the problem of homelessness in the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 市议会未能处理好市里无家可归者的问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They should deal properly and fairly with any complaint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该恰当公正地处理任何投诉。

Sense.DEF: if a book, speech etc deals with a particular subject, it is about that subject
Sense.TRAN: 涉及﹐论及﹐探讨〔某个主题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: These ideas are dealt with more fully in Chapter Four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些观点在第四章中有更全面的阐述。

Sense.DEF: to do business with someone or have a business connection with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most travel agents do not deal directly with these companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分旅行代办人都不直接和这些公司打交道。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in controlling your feelings about an emotional problem so that it does not affect your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: How’s he dealing with the whole thing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事他应付得怎么样？

Exponent.DEF: to take the necessary action, especially in order to solve a problem
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指为了解决问题〕处理某事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need to deal with problems like pollution and climate change.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要处理诸如污染﹑气候变化等问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I spend most of my day dealing with customer enquiries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天大部分时间都在处理顾客咨询。

Exponent.DEF: to deal with a problem or difficult situation by making particular decisions - used especially when talking about how well or badly someone does this
Exponent.TRAN: 处理〔问题或棘手情况,尤用于指做得好坏的程度〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He handled the situation very well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妥善处理了这一情况。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most customers were happy with the way their complaints had been handled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数顾客对他们投诉的受理方式感到满意。

Exponent.DEF: to start to deal with a problem, especially one that is complicated
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need to tackle the issue of drugs in schools.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得处理学生吸毒问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government is introducing new measures to tackle online crime.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在推行新的措施打击网络犯罪。

Exponent.DEF: to deal with all the practical details of something that needs to be done or organized. Attend to is more formal than see to .
Exponent.TRAN: 处理〔实际的细节问题,attend to比see to正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My son saw to all the funeral arrangements.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丧事全部由我儿子负责安排。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have some business to attend to.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有些事要处理。

Exponent.DEF: to do the work or make the arrangements that are necessary for something to happen - used especially when you do this for someone else so that they do not have to worry about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My secretary takes care of all the paperwork.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书负责全部的文书工作。

Exponent.DEF: if a company or organization processes a letter, form etc, they do the things that are usually done as part of their official system, in order to deal with it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It will take a minimum of 14 days to process your passport application.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 处理护照申请至少要14天。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you decide that you do not want a product, relationship, job etc, because you cannot accept that part of it
Sense.TRAN: 使交易[关系]失败的因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: The benefits package became a dealbreaker in the negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福利套餐成了谈判失败的症结。

Sense.DEF: someone who buys and sells a particular product, especially an expensive one
Sense.TRAN: 商人﹔〔尤指贵重物品的〕经销商

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 汽车/古董/艺术品等经销商

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dealer in modern art
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代艺术品商人

Sense.DEF: someone who sells illegal drugs
someone who gives out playing cards in a game
a business that sells a particular company’s product, especially cars
Sense.TRAN: 特许经销商[店]〔尤指汽车经销商〕

Sense.DEF: the business activities or relationships that someone is involved in
Sense.EXAMPLE: his financial dealings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的财务往来

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is ruthless in her dealings with competitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在和竞争对手打交道时毫不留情。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve had dealings with him in the past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过去和他有业务往来。

Sense.DEF: the activity of buying, selling, or doing business with people
Sense.EXAMPLE: penalties for drug dealing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对贩毒的处罚

GramExa.GLOSS: a particular way of doing business
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 光明正大/诚实/公平的交易
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a reputation for fair dealing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平交易的声誉

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
deal
a priest of high rank in the Christian church who is in charge of several priests or churches
Sense.TRAN: 〔主管若干牧师或教堂的〕主任牧师

Sense.DEF: someone in a university who is responsible for a particular area of work
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学的〕学院院长﹐系主任﹐学监
Sense.EXAMPLE: the admissions dean
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招生主任

Sense.DEF: someone with a lot of experience of a particular job or subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项工作或领域的〕权威﹐泰斗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Neier is the dean of American human rights activism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奈尔是美国人权活动的泰斗。

Sense.DEF: the area controlled by a dean or the place where a dean lives
a list of the best students at a university
used to show that you are surprised, upset, or annoyed because something bad has happened
Sense.TRAN: 天哪﹐天啊〔用来表示惊讶﹑不安或恼怒﹐因为发生了糟糕的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh dear, I’ve broken the lamp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天啊﹐我把灯打碎了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I think I’m getting a cold.’ ‘Dear oh dear!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我觉得我要感冒了。” “哦﹐天哪！”

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to someone you love
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的〔用于对所爱的人说话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did the interview go, dear?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面试怎么样﹐亲爱的？

Sense.DEF:
used when speaking in a friendly way to someone, especially someone who is younger or much older than you. This use can sometimes sound rather
patronizing
.
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐乖乖〔尤用于对比自己年轻或年长许多的人说话﹐有时听上去有居高临下的味道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I help you, dear?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的﹐我能为你做什么吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come along, my dear , take a seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐亲爱的﹐坐下吧。

Sense.DEF: someone who is kind and helpful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be a dear and make me a coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做个好人给我弄杯咖啡吧。

Sense.DEF: a fairly rude expression meaning an old woman
Sense.TRAN: 老太婆〔相当无礼的说法〕

Sense.DEF: used before someone’s name or title to begin a letter
Sense.TRAN: 尊敬的﹐亲爱的〔用在信函开头某人姓名或头衔前面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dear Sir or Madam, ...
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尊敬的先生或女士﹐…
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dear Mrs. Wilson, ...
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尊敬的威尔逊夫人﹐…
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dear Meg, ...
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的梅格﹐…

Sense.DEF: expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cars are 59% dearer in Britain than in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车在英国比在欧洲大陆要贵出59%。

Sense.DEF: a dear friend or relative is very important to you and you love them a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark became a dear friend .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克已成为一个亲密的朋友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His sister was very dear to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妹妹是他的心肝宝贝。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Household economy was something my mother held very dear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲非常重视家庭经济。

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone or something in a way that shows your love or liking of them
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的…﹐可爱的…〔表示亲昵或喜爱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here we are, back in dear old Manchester!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到了﹐又回到可爱的曼彻斯特了！

Sense.DEF: if you run, fight, hold on etc for dear life, you do it as fast or as well as you can because you are afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: She grasped the side of the boat and hung on for dear life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住船帮﹐死不松手。

Sense.DEF: a person you love who has died
Sense.TRAN: 逝去的亲人﹔亡故的好友

Sense.DEF: to cause a lot of trouble and suffering for someone
Sense.TRAN: 使某人损失惨重﹔给某人带来许多麻烦和痛苦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carolyn’s marriage to Pete cost her dear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与彼得的婚姻使卡罗琳痛苦不堪。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to someone you love
Sense.TRAN: 最亲爱的〔用以称呼所爱的人〕

Sense.DEF: used when speaking in a friendly way to someone
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的〔用于友好地称呼某人〕

Sense.DEF: very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: James loved her dearly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯非常爱她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would dearly like to know what she said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常想知道她说了什么。

Sense.DEF: in a way that involves a lot of suffering, damage, trouble etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔涉及不少痛苦﹑损坏﹑麻烦等而〕代价巨大地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weakness in their defense has already cost them dearly this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防守薄弱已经使他们在本赛季付出了巨大的代价。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ordinary people are paying dearly for the mistakes of this administration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通民众在为这届政府所犯的错误付出昂贵的代价。

Sense.DEF: used by a priest or minister at the beginning of a Christian service
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的弟兄姊妹〔牧师在基督教仪式上的开场语〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there are very few of something that people want or need

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dearth of job opportunities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作机会的缺乏

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
dearie

Subsense.DEF: the end of the life of a person or animal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The death of his mother came as a tremendous shock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲的去世是个巨大的打击。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Cancer is the leading cause of death in women.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症是女性死亡的主要原因。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How Danielle met her death died will probably never be known.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹妮尔的死因可能永远也无法得知。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His friend was close to death .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友已经生命垂危。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His family are still mourning John’s tragic death .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的家人仍在为他的不幸去世而哀伤。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the anniversary of Lenin’s death
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 列宁逝世纪念日

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a homeless man who froze to death
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冻死的无家可归者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 76-year-old pensioner was beaten to death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位76岁的退休老人被人打死了。

GramExa.GLOSS: kill someone or decide they should be killed as an official punishment
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Legend has it that Sarah was put to death for practising witchcraft.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传说萨拉是因为行巫术被处死的。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Members of the family have received death threats .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家庭的成员遭到了死亡威胁。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He remained president until his untimely death death at a surprisingly young age .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他担任总统一职直至英年早逝。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Two of the passengers managed to escape death avoid being killed .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客中有两位幸免于难。

Subsense.DEF: a particular case when someone dies
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a campaign to reduce the number of traffic deaths
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少交通死亡的宣传运动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: deaths from cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症导致的死亡人数

Subsense.EXAMPLE: I heard there’d been a death in the family .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说这户人家有人去世了。

Sense.DEF: the permanent end of something
Sense.TRAN: 某事的永久终结[毁灭﹐破灭]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The latest bombing is the death of all our hopes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的炸弹爆炸事件使我们所有的希望都化为乌有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These regulations could spell the death lead to the end of the American car industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些规定可能会毁掉美国的汽车工业。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that a feeling or emotion is very strong
Subsense.TRAN: 极度﹐要命〔强调感觉或情绪的强烈〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was scared to death of what might happen next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对接下来可能会发生的事怕得要命。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely sick to death of it very angry, bored, or unhappy about something .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对此厌恶得要命。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He drove at a speed which frightened Leonora to death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的车速让莉奥诺拉吓得要死。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She used to worry me to death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她过去总是让我担心得要命。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that an action is continued with a lot of effort and for as long as possible
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They just work you to death in that place.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们那里就是让你没命地干活。

Sense.DEF: to perform or present an idea, joke etc so often that people become tired of it
Sense.TRAN: 因过多做某事而令人厌烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of his material has been done to death by numerous comedians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大部分笑料已经被许多滑稽演员说滥了。

Subsense.DEF: until someone is dead
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They will fight to the death rather than give an inch of ground.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们宁愿战死也不肯让出一寸土地。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: soldiers locked in a struggle to the death
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陷入殊死搏斗的士兵们

Subsense.DEF: until you achieve something even if it means that you suffer
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The leadership election has become a fight to the death.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导人选举变成了一场你死我活的恶斗。

Sense.DEF:
a creature that looks like a human
skeleton
, used in paintings, stories etc to represent the fact that people die
to be very ill and likely to die
to look or feel very ill or tired
Sense.TRAN: 看起来/感到病得厉害[累得要命]

Sense.DEF: used to warn someone that they are likely to become ill because they are wet or cold
Sense.TRAN: 你会生病的〔因为身上湿或冷〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb will be the death of me
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is causing you a lot of worry and problems
Sense.TRAN: 某人会让我担心死[会要我的命]
Sense.EXAMPLE: That boy will be the death of me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那孩子真是要我的命！

Sense.DEF: the bed on which someone dies or is dying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On her deathbed, Miriam’s mother reveals that she never knew her father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米丽娅姆的母亲临终时吐露﹐她一直不知道她父亲是谁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The disease allowed no time for a deathbed repentance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病让人来不及临终忏悔就死去了。

Sense.DEF: an action or event that makes something fail or end
Sense.TRAN: 导致失败的事﹔致命一击
Sense.EXAMPLE: His decision to leave the show has delivered a death blow to the series.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的弃演决定给这部连续剧以致命一击。

Sense.DEF: a place where large numbers of prisoners are killed or die, usually in a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般指战争时的〕死亡集中营

Sense.DEF: a legal document, signed by a doctor, that states the time and cause of someone’s death
a death-defying action is very dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作〕极度危险的﹐不顾性命的
Sense.EXAMPLE: death-defying film stunts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其危险的电影特技表演

Sense.DEF: a sign that something will soon fail or stop existing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The loss of Georgia would sound the death knell of Republican hopes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失去佐治亚州将预示着共和党希望的破灭。

Sense.DEF: writing that is very bad or boring – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 死而不朽的散文/诗篇/诗行等〔幽默用法﹐指非常差劲或乏味的作品〕

Sense.DEF: reminding you of death or of a dead body
Sense.TRAN: 死一般的[地]﹐让人想到死亡的[地]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was deathly pale, and looked as if she might faint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸色惨白﹐似乎要晕倒的样子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A deathly hush fell over the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋里一片死寂。

Sense.DEF: a model of a dead person’s face, made by covering their face with a soft substance and letting it become hard
the legal punishment of death
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three Britons are facing the death penalty for spying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名英国人因间谍罪而面临死刑。

Sense.DEF: the number of deaths for every 100 or every 1,000 people in a particular year and in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 死亡率〔某年某地每百人或每千人中的死亡人数〕

Sense.DEF: the number of deaths each year from a particular disease or in a particular group
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种疾病或某一群体的〕死亡率
Sense.EXAMPLE: childhood death rates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童死亡率

Sense.DEF: a noise that sometimes comes from the throat or chest of someone who is dying
Sense.TRAN: 临终时的喉鸣[胸鸣]〔有时候临终者喉部或胸部发出的声响〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a prison where prisoners who will be punished by being killed are kept

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a murderer on death row
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关押在死囚区的凶犯

Sense.DEF: the official punishment of death, ordered by a judge
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received a death sentence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判处死刑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Premeditated murder carries is punished by the death sentence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀要判死刑。

Sense.DEF: something such as an illness that makes you sure you will die
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cancer is no longer a death sentence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症已不再是不治之症了。

Sense.DEF: an action or decision that is very harmful to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 造成严重损害的行动[决定]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1987, the government passed a death sentence on the river by granting permission for the new dam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1987 年政府批准修建新的水坝﹐给这条河判了死刑。

Sense.DEF:
a human
skull
, used as a sign of death
a group of people who have been ordered to kill someone’s political opponents
Sense.TRAN: 〔奉命去杀害政敌的〕死亡小分队

Sense.DEF: the final stages before something fails or ends
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事失败或终结前的〕最后阶段
Sense.EXAMPLE: The peace pact seems to be in its death throes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平条约被撕毁的日子似乎已经不远了。

Sense.DEF: sudden violent movements that people sometimes make when they are dying
the total number of people who die in an accident, war etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔事故、战争等的〕死亡总数﹐死亡人数
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the unrest continued, the death toll rose .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着动乱的持续﹐死亡人数在上升。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official death toll stands at 53.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方公布的死亡总数为53人。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle, building, piece of equipment etc that is in very bad condition and might injure or kill someone
Sense.TRAN: 死亡陷阱〔指状况十分糟糕﹑可能有危险的车辆﹑建筑物﹑设备等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car with tires in this condition is simply a death trap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车胎状况这么糟糕的汽车无疑就是个死亡陷阱。

Sense.DEF: an official document stating that someone is to be killed as a punishment
something that is likely to cause you very serious trouble, or even your death
Sense.TRAN: 可能带来极大麻烦[死亡]的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: By indulging in casual sex, many teenagers could be signing their own death warrants .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多青少年随意与人发生性关系并沉迷于此﹐这等于在自寻死路。

Sense.DEF: a desire to die
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before I did the jump, people would ask if I had a death wish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我跳之前﹐人们会问我是否有想死的念头。

Sense.DEF:
a
debutante
Sense.TRAN: 初次参加社交的上流社会年轻女子

Sense.DEF: an event or situation that is a complete failure
Sense.EXAMPLE: the debacle of the 1994 elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1994年大选的惨败

Sense.DEF: to officially prevent someone from doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All five men were debarred from entering France for three years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这五个人三年内全都被禁止进入法国。

Sense.DEF:
to
disembark
get off a ship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I remember how glad I felt debarking from a ship in Bremerhaven after six days on the ocean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得经过海上六天的航行后在不来梅港下船时有多高兴。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something lose its value or people’s respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The medical profession has been debased by these revelations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事被披露后﹐医学界的声誉受到了损害。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: actors who debased themselves by participating in the show
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自降身份参加这个节目的演员

Sense.DEF: things that are debatable are not certain because people have different opinions about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a debatable point
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有争议的地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s debatable whether this book is as good as her last.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书是否和她上一本书一样好是值得商榷的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether the object was used for rituals is highly debatable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一物件是否曾用作礼器有很大的争议。

Sense.DEF: discussion of a particular subject that often continues for a long time and in which people express different opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gun-control debate in the US
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国有关控制枪支的争论
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new drug has become the subject of heated debate within the medical profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新药成了医学界激烈争论的话题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been widespread public debate over the introduction of genetically modified food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众已对引入转基因食品进行了广泛的讨论。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was much lively debate about whether women should spend more time in the home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就妇女是否应该花更多时间待在家里这个话题有许多热烈的争论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A fierce debate raged over which artist’s work should be chosen for the prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就哪位艺术家的作品应该得奖一事展开了激烈的争论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ongoing debate between environmentalists and the road-building lobby over the future of our countryside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护主义者和游说修建公路的团体之间正在进行的有关我们乡村未来的讨论

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nuclear power has always been a topic that has sparked off considerable debate .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核电一直是引起相当多争议的话题。

Sense.DEF: a formal discussion of a particular problem, subject etc in which people express different opinions, and sometimes vote on them
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式的〕讨论﹐辩论〔有时会为此进行投票表决〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a debate on legalized gambling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对赌博合法化的讨论

Sense.EXAMPLE: a televised debate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视转播的辩论会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would have been better to hold the debate during the day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时要是把辩论安排在白天进行可能更好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What topics are under debate in Congress this week?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周国会讨论的是什么议题？

Sense.DEF: if an idea is open to debate, no one has proved yet whether it is true or false
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether that would have made any difference is open to debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样做是否有用还有待商榷。

Sense.DEF: to discuss a subject formally when you are trying to make a decision or find a solution
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue will be debated on Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题将在星期二讨论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meanwhile, philosophers debate whether it’s right to clone an individual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与此同时﹐哲学家们就克隆人是对是错的问题进行辩论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an invitation to debate with William on the future of democracy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和威廉就民主的未来进行辩论的邀请

Sense.EXAMPLE: His conclusions are hotly debated argued about strongly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的结论引发了热烈的讨论。

Sense.DEF: to consider something carefully before making a decision

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I debated with myself whether I should tell anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在反复考虑是否应该告诉别人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m still debating what to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍在考虑该怎么办。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a moment Mary debated telling Rick the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽犹豫了片刻要不要把真相告诉里克。

Sense.DEF: someone who speaks in a formal debate
someone who is debauched behaves in a bad or immoral way, for example by drinking too much alcohol, taking drugs, or having sex with many people
Sense.TRAN: 道德败坏的﹔放荡的﹔堕落的

Sense.DEF: immoral behaviour involving drugs, alcohol, sex etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life of debauchery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放荡淫逸的生活

Sense.DEF:
an official document produced by a company showing how much
interest
it will pay on a
loan
to make someone ill and weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was debilitated by his illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由于生病身体虚弱。

Sense.DEF: to make an organization or system less effective or powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The state is debilitated by inefficiency and corruption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个国家因低效和腐败而衰落了。

Sense.DEF: weakness, especially as the result of illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: physical and mental debility
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体和精神上的衰弱

Sense.DEF: a decrease in the amount of money in a bank account, for example because you have taken money out of it
a record in financial accounts that shows money that has been spent or that is owed
used to say that something is a disadvantage in a particular situation, especially after you have described the advantages
Sense.TRAN: 缺点﹐弊端〔尤在说明了有利方面后使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bikes are easy to park, but on the debit side they can be dangerous in traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车停放方便﹐但缺点是骑在路上比较危险。

Sense.DEF: to take money out of a bank account

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sum of £25 has been debited from your account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从你的账户中提取了25英镑。

Sense.DEF: to record in financial accounts the money that has been spent or that is owed
Sense.TRAN: 〔将花费或应付的金额〕记入…账户的借方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Purchases are debited against the client’s account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购货款记入客户账户的借方。

Sense.DEF: a plastic card with your signature on that you can use to pay for things. The money is taken directly from your bank account
a written record showing that a customer owes money to a company
Sense.TRAN: 借项清单[账单]﹐借方报单﹐借方票﹐借方通知 〔顾客欠公司钱的书面记录〕

Sense.DEF: a man who is debonair is fashionable and confident
to ask someone questions about a job they have just done or an experience they have just had, in order to gather information
Sense.TRAN: 〔为收集信息对完成任务或有某经历者进行〕询问﹐盘问
Sense.EXAMPLE: The returning bomber crews were debriefed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 询问了返回的轰炸机机组人员以了解情况。

Sense.DEF: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

Sense.DEF: pieces of waste material, paper etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clean the ventilation ducts to remove dust and insect debris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清洁通风管道﹐以清除灰尘和昆虫残骸。

Sense.DEF: a sum of money that a person or organization owes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had debts of over £100,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有超过十万英镑的债。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had enough money to pay off his outstanding debts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有足够的钱偿还亏欠的债务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: students who run up huge debts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欠下巨额债务的学生

Sense.DEF: when you owe money to someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nearly half the students said they were in debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近一半的学生说自己负有债务。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band will be in debt to the record company for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐团将向唱片公司欠债很多年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A rash business decision left him $600 in debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意上一个草率的决定使他欠下了600美元的债。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The club sank deeper into debt .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家俱乐部陷入更深的债务之中。

Sense.DEF: the degree to which you have learned from or been influenced by someone or something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Braque acknowledged his debt to Impressionist painting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉克承认受到了印象派绘画的影响。

Sense.DEF: the fact of being grateful to someone who has helped you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I owe a debt of gratitude to my tutors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要感谢我的导师。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fortunately, I have no debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 所幸,我不欠债。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: borrow more and more money
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At that time he was drinking a lot and running up debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时他酗酒,还欠了一屁股债。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay the money back
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The first thing I'm going to do is pay off my debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要做的第一件事就是还债。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay the money back
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was hoping he would soon have enough money to settle his debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望不久会有足够的钱来还债。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: repay all of them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It took him three years to clear his bank debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用了三年时间还清欠银行的债务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: pay the interest on a debt, but not pay it back
Collocate.EXAMPLE: By then, she was borrowing more money just to service her debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时她借钱越来越多,还仅仅是用来还利息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say officially that it does not have to be paid
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bank finally agreed to write off the debt.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行最终同意勾销债务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have big debts
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many poor countries are saddled with huge debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多贫困国家负债累累。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The debts got bigger and bigger.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 债务越欠越多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Young people often leave university with huge debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人常常背着一身债从大学毕业。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not yet paid
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The average outstanding debt on credit cards in Britain is now over £3,000.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在在英国,信用卡的平均未偿债务是三千多英镑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: big debts
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company wanted to reduce its heavy debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司想减少其高额债务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is unlikely to be paid back
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Companies lose millions of pounds each year from having to write off bad debts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司因为勾销坏账每年损失数百万英镑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you owe to a bank
the total amount that is owed by the government of a country

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to get back the money that people owe
a person, group, or organization that owes money
an arrangement in which very poor countries do not have to pay back all the money that has been lent to them by richer countries
Sense.TRAN: 债务减免〔贫困国家不必偿还富裕国家全部贷款的一种协定〕

Sense.DEF: debt-ridden countries or organizations owe so much money that they cannot pay the money back
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家或机构〕负债累累的﹐债台高筑的

Sense.DEF:
to remove the
bug s mistakes
from a computer program
Sense.TRAN: 排除〔计算机程序中〕的错误[故障]

Sense.DEF: to remove secret listening equipment from a place
to show that an idea or belief is false
Sense.EXAMPLE: His claims were later debunked by fellow academics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的断言后来被学术界同行证明是错误的。

Sense.DEF: the first public appearance of an entertainer, sports player etc or of something new and important
Sense.TRAN: 〔演员﹑运动员等的〕首次登台﹐初次亮相﹔〔新事物的〕问世

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made his Major League debut as shortstop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以游击手的身份在联合会职业棒球赛上首次亮相。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His Broadway debut was ‘The Scarlet Pimpernel’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他首次在百老汇舞台上演出是在《红花侠》中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their debut album was recorded in 1991.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的首张专辑是1991年录制的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He scored in his debut match for the club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他第一次代表俱乐部上场比赛就进了球。

Sense.DEF: to appear in public or become available for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show will debut next Monday at 8.00 pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏首演时间是下星期一晚8点。

Sense.DEF: to introduce a product to the public for the first time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ralph Lauren debuted his autumn collection in Paris last week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫·劳伦上周在巴黎推出了他的秋装系列。

Sense.DEF:
a young rich
upper-class
woman who starts going to fashionable events as a way of being introduced to upper-class society
Sense.TRAN: 初次参加社交的上流社会年轻女子
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= December 十二月

Sense.DEF: ten
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decalitre 10 litres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十升
Sense.EXAMPLE: the decathlon a sports competition with 10 different events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十项全能运动

Sense.DEF: a period of 10 years
behaviour that shows that someone has low moral standards and is more concerned with pleasure than serious matters
having low moral standards and being more concerned with pleasure than serious matters
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pop music was condemned as decadent and crude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流行音乐被指责为堕落而又粗俗。

Sense.DEF: decaffeinated coffee

coffee or tea that is decaffeinated does not contain
caffeine
the substance that keeps you awake
a piece of paper with a pattern or picture on it that you stick on a surface
to leave a place quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wealthier inhabitants decamped to the suburbs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 较富裕的居民撤到郊区去居住。

Sense.DEF: to pour liquid, especially wine, from one container into another
Sense.TRAN: 将〔葡萄酒等液体从一个容器〕倒入﹐注入〔另一个容器〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never decant cleaning products into old pop bottles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不要把洗涤剂倒入旧的汽水瓶里。

Sense.DEF: a container used for serving alcoholic drinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a crystal decanter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水晶酒瓶

Sense.DEF: to cut off someone’s head
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decapitated body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一具无头尸体

Sense.DEF: a sports competition with 10 different events
to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body was already starting to decay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂﹑损坏或腐烂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: decaying organic matter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腐烂的有机物

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say rot rather than decay when talking about food.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们谈论食物一般说 rot ,而不用 decay
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There was a smell of rotting vegetables.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有股蔬菜腐烂的味道。

Sense.DEF: if buildings, structures, or areas decay, their condition gradually becomes worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of historic buildings are being allowed to decay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百幢历史建筑被任由破败。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s decaying inner cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国破败的旧城区

Sense.DEF: if traditional beliefs, standards etc decay, people do not believe in them or support them any more
Sense.TRAN: 〔传统观念﹑标准等〕失去影响力﹐衰败﹐衰落
Sense.EXAMPLE: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区﹐集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

Sense.DEF: the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: old cars in various stages of decay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 损坏程度不等的旧车

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛀牙

Sense.DEF: the gradual destruction of buildings, structures etc because they have not been cared for
Sense.TRAN: 〔疏于管理而造成建筑物等的〕破败﹐衰败
Sense.EXAMPLE: poverty and urban decay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫穷和市区的破败

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the war, the area fell into decay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间这个地区衰败了。

Sense.DEF: the gradual destruction of ideas, beliefs, social or political systems etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念﹑信仰﹑社会制度﹑政治制度等的〕衰退﹐没落
Sense.EXAMPLE: moral decay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德的败坏

Sense.DEF: death
Sense.EXAMPLE: On your decease, the house passes to your wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你死后﹐房子由你妻子继承。

Sense.DEF: someone who has died, especially recently
Sense.TRAN: 死者﹐已故之人〔尤指最近去世的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deceased left a large sum of money to his children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死者留给子女一大笔钱。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is intended to make someone believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: an atmosphere of hypocrisy and deceit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满虚伪和欺骗的氛围

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 故意的/蓄意的/彻头彻尾的欺骗

Sense.DEF: someone who is deceitful tells lies in order to get what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: His manner was sly and deceitful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度诡诈而又不老实。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His lawyer argued that his client had not acted deceitfully .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的律师说他的当事人没有欺骗行为。

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had been deceived by a young man claiming to be the son of a millionaire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被一个自称是百万富翁之子的年轻人骗了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to deceive the public into thinking the war could still be won.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图欺骗公众相信这场战争仍有胜算。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t deceive you about anything as important as this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 像这么重要的事我不会欺骗你的。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say trick rather than deceive .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 trick ,而不说 deceive
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She thought they were trying to trick her.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得他们在试图骗她。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to believe that something is true because the truth is unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought she loved me, but I was deceiving myself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为她是爱我的﹐但我是在自我欺骗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t deceive himself that he and Ruth could remain friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他并未自欺地认为他和露丝能继续做朋友。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a wrong belief or opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be deceived by the new cover – this is a rehash of old hits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别被新封面误导﹐这只是一些经典老歌的翻唱作品。

Sense.DEF: to go slower, especially in a vehicle
the 12th month of the year, between November and January

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last December they visited Prague.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年12月他们去了布拉格。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We got married in December.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是12月份结婚的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jake’s birthday is on December 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克的生日是12月6日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The event was to take place on 6th December.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项活动将于12月6日举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her letter arrived December 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的信是12月6日到的。

Sense.DEF: polite, honest, and moral behaviour and attitudes that show respect for other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a judgment reflecting the decency and good sense of the American people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反映美国人民正直和智慧的判断

GramExa.GLOSS: standards of behaviour that are expected of everyone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一般的/人类的/公共的道德
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film was banned on the grounds of public decency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该影片因有悖公共道德标准而遭禁映。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there no sense of decency left in this country?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的道德观难道已经泯灭了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they’re going to charge people a fee, they ought to at least have the decency to tell them in advance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们要对人们收费﹐至少也应该事先告诉一声。

Sense.DEF: standards of acceptable behaviour
of a good enough standard or quality
Sense.TRAN: 可接受的﹐相当好的﹐像样的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decent salary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不错的工资待遇
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you have a decent jacket?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就没有一件像样的外套吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house with a decent-sized yard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 院子还算大的房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their in-flight magazine is halfway decent quite good .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的航班杂志还算可以。

Sense.DEF: following moral standards that are acceptable to society

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The majority of residents here are decent citizens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的大部分居民都是正派的市民。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a decent burial
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得体的葬礼
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul visited the local bars more frequently than was decent for a senior lecturer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗过于频繁地光顾当地酒吧﹐不太合乎高级讲师的身份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman did the decent thing did what people thought he ought to and resigned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席体面地辞去了职务。

Sense.DEF: treating people in a fair and kind way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided her father was a decent guy after all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为她父亲毕竟是个好人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was decent of you to show up today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天来了可真好。

Sense.DEF: wearing enough clothes so that you do not show too much of your body – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 穿好衣服的﹐雅观的〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you decent? Can I come in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿好了吗？我能进来了吗？

Sense.DEF: to move parts of a government, organization etc from a central place to several different smaller ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many firms are decentralizing their operations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多公司在分散经营。

Sense.DEF: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

Sense.DEF: something that is deceptive seems to be one thing but is in fact very different
Sense.TRAN: 造成假象的﹐似是而非的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some snakes move with deceptive speed move faster than you think or expect .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些蛇的爬行速度出乎意料地快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gwen’s students may look angelic, but appearances can be deceptive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格温的学生也许看起来像天使﹐不过人不可貌相。

Sense.DEF: intended to make someone believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: misleading and deceptive adverts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 误导人且带有欺骗性的广告
Sense.EXAMPLE: deceptive practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欺骗行为

Sense.DEF: a 10th part of a unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decilitre 0.1 litres

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring the loudness of sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: noise levels exceeding 85 decibels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过85分贝的噪声强度

Sense.DEF: to make a choice or judgment about something, especially after considering all the possibilities or arguments
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has anything been decided yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经作出什么决定了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tina’s decided to go to Rome for her holidays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂娜已决定去罗马度假。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was decided that four hospitals should close.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已决定要关闭四家医院。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t decide whether I like him or not.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不清是否喜欢他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: People have a right to decide how to spend their own money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众有权决定怎么花自己的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A meeting was called to decide between the three candidates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 召开了一次会议来决定在这三名候选人中选哪位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You must decide for yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须自己作决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The trainees decide among themselves what programs to take.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受训者自行选择课程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He eventually decided against telling her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最终还是决定不告诉她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: After a long discussion, they decided in favour of chose the older applicant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过长时间的讨论﹐他们决定选那位较年长的求职者。

Sense.DEF: to influence a situation or event so that a particular result is produced
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the penalty kick that decided the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个点球决定了比赛的胜负。

Sense.DEF: to be the reason for someone making a particular choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taxes could be the deciding factor for millions of floating voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税收对数百万游离选民来说可能成为决定性因素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The look he gave her decided her not to ask.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看她的神情使她决定不问了。

Sense.DEF: to make an official or legal judgment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Commission will have the power to decide disputes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该委员会将有权裁决争端。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If the Parole Board decides in his favour, the prisoner will be released.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果假释委员会作出对那名犯人有利的判决﹐他就能获释。

Exponent.DEF: to make a choice to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We decided to send our son to a boarding school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定送儿子去一所寄宿学校。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I decided to go home early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定早点回家。

Exponent.DEF: to decide something, especially after thinking about it for a long time. Make up your mind is less formal than decide and is mainly used in spoken English.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指长时间考虑后〕决定〔与decide相比不那么正式,主要用于口语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you made up your mind about where you’ll go on holiday?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你决定去哪里度假了吗？

Exponent.DEF: to decide to do something – especially when this is different from what people expect or tell you to do
Exponent.TRAN: 选择做某事,决定做某事〔尤指不同于他人的预期或吩咐〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She chose to ignore my advice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定不理会我的建议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: More young couples are choosing not to marry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的年轻恋人选择不结婚。

Exponent.DEF: to decide after thinking carefully about something, especially about something that is very important
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指经过仔细考虑后对重要的事〕作出决定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They made a decision not to have children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定不要孩子。

Exponent.DEF: to decide that you will definitely do something, especially because you think it will be better for you, or because of your past experiences
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She resolved to work hard at school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决心在校努力学习。

Exponent.DEF: to officially decide what something shall be
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Each hospital can determine its own pay rates.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 各家医院可以自行决定工资标准。

Exponent.EXP: come down in favour of sth

Variant.ORTHVAR: come down in favor of sth

Exponent.DEF: to decide to support a particular plan, argument etc – used especially about groups of people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指一群人〕决定支持某事物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Eight of the ten committee members came down in favour of the changes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 十个委员会成员中有八人决定支持变革。

Exponent.DEF: to officially decide about something important after discussing and carefully considering it – used especially about groups of people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指一群人经讨论和认真考虑后就重要的事〕作出决定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After two hours of discussion, the committee had still not come to a decision on any of the proposals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过两小时的讨论,委员会仍未对任何一个提案达成决议。

Sense.DEF: to choose something or someone after thinking carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you decided on a date for the wedding?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼日期你选好了没有？

Sense.DEF: definite and easily noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decided change for the better
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明显的好转

Sense.DEF: definitely or in a way that is easily noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cole’s style is decidedly more formal than the previous manager’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科尔的待人处事风格显然比前任经理要拘谨。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows that you are very sure about a decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m not going to do it,’ said Margaret decidedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这件事我不做。” 玛格丽特坚决地说。

Sense.DEF: the last part of a game or competition, which will show who the winner is
Sense.EXAMPLE: This next round will be the decider.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一轮是决胜局。

Sense.DEF: deciduous trees lose their leaves in winter

a
fraction a number less than 1
that is shown as a
full stop
followed by the number of
tenth s
,
hundredth s
etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.
a decimal system is based on the number 10
Sense.EXAMPLE: changing to a decimal system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改为十进制
Sense.EXAMPLE: calculations accurate to three decimal places one of the numbers after the full stop in a decimal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精确到小数点后三位的计算

Sense.DEF: the process of changing to a decimal system of money or measurement
Sense.TRAN: 〔币制或度量衡的〕改为十进制

Sense.DEF:
the
full stop
in a decimal, used to separate whole numbers from
tenth s
,
hundredth s
etc
to destroy a large part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The population has been decimated by disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病导致大量人口死亡。

Sense.DEF: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仔细地看信封﹐试图辨认上面的字迹。

Sense.DEF:
to change a message written in a
code
into ordinary language so that you can read it
a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She refused to discuss her decision to quit the group.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝谈论她要退出该团体的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We finally came to a firm decision on the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于对此事作出了明确的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Viewers make the final decision as to who should be eliminated from the competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁该从比赛中淘汰出局由观众作出最终决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The judges’ decision is final it will not be changed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

Sense.DEF: the quality someone has that makes them able to make choices or judgments quickly and confidently
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ability to act with speed and decision
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 处事迅速果断的能力

Sense.DEF: the act of deciding something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Court has the ultimate power of decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭具有最终的判决权。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I want to think about it a bit longer before I make a decision.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在作出决定前再多考虑一会儿。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an important or formal decision
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 作出〔重要或正式的〕决定
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I fully accept the decision taken by the committee.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全接受委员会作出的决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a decision after a lot of thought
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We hope they will reach their decision as soon as possible.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望他们尽快作出决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: wish you had not made a particular decision
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was already regretting my decision to go on holiday with him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经后悔决定跟他去度假了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: think about changing a decision you have made
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He said he wasn’t prepared to reconsider his decision.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说不准备重新考虑自己的决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: change a decision
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They want him to reverse his decision to quit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望他改变辞职的决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: officially change a decision by another person or group
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A director of the company had overruled that decision.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的一位董事推翻了那个决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not make a decision until later
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has postponed its decision about when to hold the election.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府推迟决定何时举行选举。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My father made all the important decisions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要决定全都是我爸爸作的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an important decision
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Marriage is a big decision.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻是一项重要决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government now has some major decisions to make.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府现在要作出一些重大决定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In the end I took the difficult decision to retire early.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我作出了困难的决定——提前退休。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a good decision to change the name of the product.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 更改产品名称真是个不错的决定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think he made a bad decision.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他作了个糟糕的决定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She chose to study Engineering and it was definitely the right decision.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她选择了读工程专业,这绝对是个正确的决定。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I thought I’d made the wrong decision marrying Jeff.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得嫁给杰夫是个错误的决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you have thought about clearly
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 慎重的/深思熟虑的决定
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Belinda had made a conscious decision to have a baby.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝琳达经慎重考虑决定要生孩子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a definite one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s now time to come to a clear decision on this.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是对此作出明确决定的时候了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that will not be changed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The council will make a final decision in four months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会将在四个月内作出最终决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you make extremely quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police officers often have to make snap decisions on how to act.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察经常需要当机立断。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that people disagree about
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The history of the law is full of controversial decisions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律史上充满着有争议的判决。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that you make without enough thought
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Don’t let yourself be forced into making hasty decisions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让自己被迫作出仓促的决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that two people make together
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Jo and I made a joint decision that we should separate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔和我共同作出决定: 我们应该分居。

Sense.DEF: a person in a large organization who is responsible for making important decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the corporation’s key decision-makers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司关键的决策人物

Sense.DEF: the process of making important decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to involve workers in decision-making
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让工人们参与决策的尝试

Sense.DEF: an action, event etc that is decisive has a big effect on the way that something develops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women can play a decisive role in the debate over cloning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于克隆问题的辩论﹐女性能起到决定作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will take decisive steps towards political union with Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将朝着与欧洲政治上融合的方向迈出关键的步子。

Sense.DEF: someone who is decisive is good at making decisions quickly and with confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decisive leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果断的领袖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talent for quick decisive action
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够迅速而果断地行动的天赋

Sense.DEF: definite and clear in a way that leaves no doubt

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彻底的胜利/明确的结果/显然的失败等

Sense.EXAMPLE: The answer was a decisive no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答是明确否定的。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Yet again, we have failed to act decisively .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们再一次未能果断行动。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the speed and decisiveness of his victory

Subsense.DEF: the outside top level of a ship that you can walk or sit on
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go up on deck .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到甲板上去吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter stayed below deck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得待在甲板下面。

Subsense.DEF: one of the different levels on a ship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a staircase leading to the passenger deck
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往客舱的楼梯

Sense.DEF: one of the levels on a bus, plane etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to find a seat on the upper deck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在上层找到了一个座位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Eddie returned to the flight deck the part of an aircraft where the pilot sits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃迪回到了驾驶舱。

Sense.SIGNPOST: AT THE BACK OF A HOUSE
Sense.DEF: a wooden floor built out from the back of a house, where you can sit and relax outdoors
Sense.EXAMPLE: deck furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木制平台上用的家具

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used for playing music tapes, records etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔录音机的〕走带机构﹔〔唱机的〕转盘托面

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盒带走带机构/磁带走带机构/唱片转盘托面

Sense.DEF: a set of playing cards
Sense.EXAMPLE: Irene shuffled the deck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾琳洗了牌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deck of cards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副纸牌

Sense.DEF: to decorate something with flowers, flags etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The street was decked with flags for the royal wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街道上飘扬着庆祝皇家婚礼的旗帜。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone so hard that they fall over
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerry just swung round and decked him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里一个转身把他打倒在地。

Sense.DEF: a folding chair with a long seat made of cloth, used especially on the beach
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在海滩上使用的〕折叠躺椅

Sense.DEF: someone who works on a ship, cleaning and doing small repairs
a wooden floor next to a house or in a garden
Sense.TRAN: 〔屋旁或花园里的〕木制铺面板

Sense.DEF:
a flat shoe made of
canvas heavy cloth
to speak loudly, sometimes with actions, so that people notice you
Sense.TRAN: 慷慨陈词﹐慷慨激昂地发表（演讲）

Sense.DEF: declamatory speech or writing expresses feelings and opinions very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a declamatory style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慷慨激昂的风格

Sense.DEF: an important official statement about a particular situation or plan, or the act of making this statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ceasefire declaration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停火声明
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under Islamic law it was possible to divorce by simple declaration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从前按照伊斯兰法律﹐作简单的声明就可以离婚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the declaration of war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣战

Sense.DEF: an official or serious statement of what someone believes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《联合国人权宣言》
GramExa.EXAMPLE: declarations of undying love
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠贞不渝的爱情宣言

Sense.DEF: a statement in which you officially give information about yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: a declaration of taxable earnings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应纳税收入的申报

Sense.DEF: a declarative sentence has the form of a statement
to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: A state of emergency has been declared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已宣布进入紧急状态。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court declared that Brown’s case should be reviewed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭宣布布朗的案子应该进行复审。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several countries wanted Antarctica to be declared a ‘world park’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个国家希望将南极洲宣布为 “世界公园” 。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city was declared to be in a state of siege.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市被宣布处于封锁状态。
