GramExa.EXAMPLE: I declare you man and wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宣布你们结为夫妇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The war was declared illegal by the International Court of Justice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战争被国际法庭宣布为非法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt it has been officially stated that he cannot pay his debts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂尔先生被宣布破产了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在9月16日举行庆祝活动﹐这一天是墨西哥摆脱西班牙统治宣布独立的日子。

Sense.DEF: to say publicly what you think or feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s not fair,’ Jane declared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这不公平。” 简宣称道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He declared his intention to stand for president.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他宣布自己打算竞选总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carol held a press conference and declared that she was innocent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡萝尔举行了一个记者招待会宣称自己是无辜的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Edward declared himself angry and frustrated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华宣称自己既气愤又沮丧。

Subsense.DEF: to state officially that you are at war with another country
to say that something is wrong and that you will do everything you can to stop it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Angry residents have declared war on the owners of the factory.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气愤的居民已经向工厂主宣战。

Subsense.DEF: to state on an official government form how much money you have earned, what property you own etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All tips are counted as part of your earnings and must be declared.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的小费都算作你收入的一部分﹐必须申报。

Subsense.DEF:
to tell a
custom s
official that you are carrying goods on which you should pay tax when you enter a country
Subsense.TRAN: 〔向海关官员〕申报〔应征税的物品〕

Sense.DEF: to tell people that you are connected with something that is being discussed
Sense.TRAN: 宣布有关系﹐申报利益关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should, at this point, declare an interest: I own shares in the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在应该申报利益关系: 我拥有这家公司的股份。

Sense.DEF:
to choose to end your team’s turn before all your players have
batted
Sense.TRAN: 〔当击球员还未全部出局时〕宣布一局结束

Sense.DEF: to state publicly that you oppose someone or something
to state publicly that you support someone or something
stated officially and publicly
Sense.TRAN: 正式宣布的﹔公开声明的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is their declared intention to increase taxes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高税收是他们的公开意图。

Sense.DEF: official information that is declassified was secret but is not secret any more

the set of various forms that a noun,
pronoun
, or adjective can have according to whether it is the
subject
,
object
etc of a sentence in a language such as Latin or German
Sense.TRAN: 变格﹐词形变化〔在拉丁语﹑德语等语言中﹐表示一个名词﹑代词或形容词在句子中是主语还是宾语等的一系列不同的形式〕

Sense.DEF: a particular set of nouns etc that all have the same set of forms
Sense.TRAN: 词形变化相同的一组词

Sense.DEF: a decrease in the quality, quantity, or importance of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a decline in the size of families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭的规模已有缩小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the decline of manufacturing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造业的衰落

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rapid decline in unemployment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业的迅速减少

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The island’s population initially numbered 180, but there was a gradual decline until only 40 people were left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该岛人口原来有180人﹐后来逐渐减少到只剩下40人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic decline faced by many cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多城市面临的经济衰退

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the widely held belief that educational standards are in decline
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育水准在下降的普遍观点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The port fell into decline in the 1950s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪50年代﹐这个港口开始衰落了。

Sense.DEF: to decrease in quantity or importance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spending on information technology has declined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于信息技术的支出减少了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Car sales have declined by a quarter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车销量下滑了四分之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, the city declined in importance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后这座城市的重要性下降了。

Sense.DEF: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对担任主席的邀约﹐史密斯拒绝了﹐他宁愿留在现在的职位上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料﹐到自己的房间去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary declined Jay’s invitation to dinner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽谢绝了杰伊请吃晚饭的邀请。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The court declined to review her case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院拒绝复审她的案子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister declined to comment refused to speak to people who report the news about the progress of the peace talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

Sense.DEF: to become gradually worse in quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her health has been declining progressively for several months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个月来她的健康状况不断恶化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Qualified staff are leaving and standards are declining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 称职的员工不断离去﹐质量水平持续下降。

Sense.DEF: the last years of someone’s life

Subsense.DEF:
if a noun,
pronoun
, or adjective declines, its form changes according to whether it is the
subject
,
object
etc of a sentence
Subsense.TRAN: 变格﹐词形变化〔名词﹑代词或形容词根据其在句中是作主语﹑宾语或是其他成分﹐形式发生相应变化〕
列出〔名词等的〕词形变化

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 棒球赛观众人数的减少

Sense.DEF: to make a place tidy by removing things you do not want or need
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided it was time to declutter my bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定该清理一下我的卧室了。

Sense.DEF:
to discover the meaning of a message written in a
code a set of secret signs or letters

if a computer decodes
data
, it receives it and changes it into a form that can be used by the computer or understood by a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The software decodes the information embedded in the satellite broadcasts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种软件能够解读衞星广播中的信息。

Sense.DEF:
to receive electronic or
digital
signals and change them into a picture and sound for a television or radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: decoding boxes for your TV set
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视机用的解码器

Sense.DEF: to understand the meaning of a word
a piece of electronic equipment that receives a signal and changes it for another machine to use, for example to put pictures and sound onto your television
the top edge of a woman’s dress that is cut very low to show part of her shoulders and breasts

to make a former
colony
politically independent
Sense.TRAN: 使〔以前的殖民地〕政治独立﹔使非殖民（地）化

Sense.DEF:
to stop using a ship, weapon, or
nuclear reactor
and to take it to pieces
Sense.TRAN: 拆毁〔船﹑武器或核反应堆〕﹐使退役

Sense.DEF: to decay or make something decay
Sense.EXAMPLE: a partially decomposed body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部分腐烂的尸体

Sense.DEF: to divide into smaller parts, or to make something do this
to reduce the pressure of air on something

to change the information in a computer document back into a form that can be easily read or used, when the information was stored on the computer in a special form that used less space in the computer’s memory
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most Macintosh computers can decompress files automatically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分苹果电脑都能自动解压缩文件。

Sense.DEF: a special room where people go after they have been deep under the sea, so that their bodies can slowly return to normal air pressure
Sense.TRAN: 减压室〔帮助从深海返回的潜水者慢慢恢复到正常气压〕

Sense.DEF: a dangerous medical condition that people get when they come up from deep under the sea too quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔因深海潜水员浮出水面太急而造成的〕减压病

Sense.DEF: medicine that you can take if you have a cold, to help you breathe more easily

a method used in
philosophy
and the criticism of literature which claims that there is no single explanation of the meaning of a piece of writing
Sense.TRAN: 解构〔认为文章不仅仅有一种解释的哲学和文学评论方法〕

Sense.DEF: to remove a dangerous substance from somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may cost over $5 million to decontaminate the whole site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面消除这个地方的污染可能要花费超过500万美元。

Sense.DEF: the way that the inside of a building is decorated
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑内部的〕装饰布局﹐装修风格
Sense.EXAMPLE: The decor is a mix of antique and modern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装修风格是古今合璧。 decorate 装修﹔装饰

PIC.HEADING: DECORATE 装修；装饰
PIC.PICCONTENT: decorating the home 装修住房；decorating the Christmas tree 装饰圣诞树

Sense.DEF: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

Sense.DEF: to make something look more attractive by putting something pretty on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children’s pictures decorated the walls of the classroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教室的墙上装点着儿童画。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old-fashioned dress decorated with ribbons and lace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饰有丝带和花边的老式连衣裙

Sense.DEF:
to give someone a
medal
as an official sign of honour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: soldiers decorated for bravery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因勇敢而获授勋章的士兵

Sense.DEF: something pretty that you put in a place or on top of something to make it look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas decorations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节装饰物
Sense.EXAMPLE: cake decorations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕上的裱花

Sense.DEF: the style in which something is decorated
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is an expert on Islamic decoration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是伊斯兰装饰风格的专家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a box with paper flowers glued to it for decoration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贴了纸花作装饰的盒子

Sense.DEF: when you paint or put special paper on the inside walls, ceiling etc of a house or building

something such as a
medal
that is given to someone as an official sign of honour
pretty or attractive, but not always necessary or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decorative panel above the door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门楣上的饰板

Sense.DEF: someone who paints houses and puts paper on the walls as their job
having the correct appearance or behaviour for a particular occasion

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A servant was hovering decorously behind them.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名仆人恭敬有礼地跟在他们身后。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows respect and is correct for a particular situation, especially a formal occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was disciplined for breaching the Senate’s rules of decorum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因违反参议院的行为准则而受到处罚。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is used to trick someone into going somewhere or doing something, so that you can catch them, attack them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officer Langley acted as a decoy to catch the rapist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警员兰利充当诱饵来抓捕那名强奸犯。

Sense.DEF: a model of a bird used to attract wild birds so that you can watch them or shoot them
Sense.TRAN: 〔观鸟或捕鸟时用于引诱鸟的〕假鸟

Sense.DEF: to become less or go down to a lower level, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of people who have the disease has decreased significantly in recent years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来﹐这种病的患者人数明显下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want to decrease their reliance on oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想减少对石油的依赖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Average house prices decreased by 13% last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年房屋均价下降了13%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By 1881, the population of Ireland had decreased to 5.2 million.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到1881年﹐爱尔兰的人口减少到了520万。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The North’s share of the world’s energy consumption is expected to decrease from 70% to 60%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北方发达国家所占的世界能源消耗比例有望从70%下降到60%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Attacks of asthma decrease in frequency through early adult life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成年早期﹐哮喘的发病频率会降低。

Exponent.DEF: to become less in number or amount
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The average rainfall has decreased by around 30 percent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均降雨量已减少30%左右。

Exponent.DEF: to decrease. Go down is less formal than decrease and is the usual word to use in conversation.
Exponent.TRAN: 减小﹐减少〔与decrease相比不那么正式,常用于会话中〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Unemployment has gone down in the past few months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去几个月里,失业人数下降了。

Exponent.DEF: to decrease – used with numbers or amounts, or about the level or standard of something
Exponent.TRAN: 减小﹔减少〔与数字或数量连用,或用于描述某事物的程度或水平〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The standard of living has declined.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活水准下降了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Support for the government is steadily declining.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府支持率持续下降。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Salaries have declined by around 4.5%.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资减少了4.5%左右。

Exponent.DEF: to become smaller or less important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Union membership diminished from 30,000 at its height to just 2,000 today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会会员数从最高峰时的30,000人减少到如今的区区2,000人。

Exponent.DEF: to decrease, especially by a large amount. Fall and drop are less formal than decrease .
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指大量〕减少〔与decrease相比不那么正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The number of tigers in the wild has fallen to just over 10,000.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生老虎的数量已下降到一万多一点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At night, the temperature drops to minus 20 degrees.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里,温度降至零下20度。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly decrease very quickly and by a very large amount
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Share prices have plummeted 29% in the last four months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去四个月里,股价猛跌29%。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Climate change could cause global temperatures to plummet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候变化可导致全球温度骤降。

Exponent.DEF: if a price or value slides, it gradually decreases in a way that causes problems – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 〔价格或价值〕下滑〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dollar fell in late trading in New York yesterday and slid further this morning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天纽约尾盘交易美元下跌,今天上午继续下滑。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually decrease until there is very little left of something, especially numbers or amounts, popularity, or importance
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指数字﹑数量﹑支持率或重要性〕逐步减少
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Support for the theory is dwindling.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一理论的支持度正在逐渐下降。

Exponent.DEF: if a number or the amount of an activity that is happening tapers off, it gradually decreases, especially so that it stops completely
Exponent.TRAN: 〔数字或活动的次数〕逐渐减少〔尤指完全终止〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Political violence tapered off after the elections.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大选过后,政治暴力逐渐减少。

Sense.DEF: the process of becoming less, or the amount by which something becomes less

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teachers reported decreases in drug use and verbal abuse of teachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师们反映说吸毒和对教师的言语侮辱减少了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There has been a steady decrease of temperature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温在持续下降。

Sense.DEF: an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指由国家统治者颁布的〕命令﹐法令
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Emperor issued the decree repealing martial law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇帝下诏令取消了军事管制。

Sense.DEF: a judgment in a court of law
to make an official judgment or give an official order

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The King decreed that there should be an end to the fighting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王下旨结束这场战斗。

Sense.DEF: an order by a court of law which officially ends a marriage
Sense.TRAN: 〔法院判决离婚正式生效的〕绝对判决﹐终局判决

Sense.DEF: an order by a court of law that a marriage will end at a particular time in the future unless there is a good reason not to end it
Sense.TRAN: 〔法院判决除非有正当理由﹐否则离婚在指定日期即生效的〕暂时判决

Sense.DEF: old and in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The buildings were in a decrepit state.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建筑物破旧不堪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a rather decrepit old man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年老体弱。

Sense.DEF: to state officially that something is not illegal any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign to decriminalize cannabis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使大麻合法化的运动

Sense.DEF: to state publicly that you do not approve of something

to change a message or information on a computer back into a form that can be read, when someone has sent it to you in a type of computer
code
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only certain employees will be able to decrypt sensitive documents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有部分员工能解读内容敏感的文档。

Sense.DEF: to give all your attention and effort to one particular thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The actress now dedicates herself to children’s charity work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名女演员现在致力于儿童慈善工作。

Sense.DEF: to say at the beginning of a book or film, or before a piece of music, that it has been written, made, or performed for someone that you love or respect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book was dedicated to her husband.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书题献给她的丈夫。

Sense.DEF: to state in an official ceremony that a building will be given someone’s name in order to show respect for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某人的名字〕为〔建筑物〕举行命名仪式

Sense.DEF: to use a place, time, money etc only for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company dedicated $50,000 for the study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司为此项研究拨出专款5万美金。

Sense.DEF: someone who is dedicated works very hard at what they do because they care a lot about it
Sense.TRAN: 满腔热忱的﹐有奉献精神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dedicated and thoughtful teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位富有敬业精神﹑待人体贴的教师
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is a dedicated socialist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一名坚定的社会主义者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Woodland Trust is dedicated to preserving our native woodland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 林区信托基金机构致力于保护我们的天然林区。

Sense.DEF: made for or used for only one particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dedicated graphics processor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专用图形处理器

Sense.DEF: hard work or effort that someone puts into a particular activity because they care about it a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某项活动的〕奉献﹐全身心投入
Sense.EXAMPLE: To reach a high level of skill requires talent, dedication, and a lot of hard work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要达到高级水平需要天分﹐还需要全身心的投入和很多的努力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I admire his dedication to the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我佩服他的敬业精神。

Sense.DEF: an act of dedicating something to someone, or a ceremony where this is done
Sense.TRAN: 〔以某人的名字命名某个建筑物的〕命名（典礼）﹔落成典礼

Sense.DEF: the words used at the beginning of a book, film, or piece of music, thanking someone or saying that book etc has been written to show respect for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑电影或音乐作品前的〕献词

Sense.DEF: to use the knowledge and information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From her son’s age, I deduced that her husband must be at least 60.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从她儿子的年龄来推测﹐我想她丈夫肯定至少有60岁了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What did Darwin deduce from the presence of these species?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文从这些物种的存在推断出了什么？

Sense.DEF: to take away an amount or part from a total

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The payments will be deducted from your salary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些款项将从你的工资里扣除。

Sense.DEF: the process of using the knowledge or information you have in order to understand something or form an opinion, or the opinion that you form
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children will soon make deductions about the meaning of a word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童不久就能推断词义了。

Sense.DEF: the process of taking away an amount from a total, or the amount that is taken away
Sense.EXAMPLE: After deductions for tax etc, your salary is about £700 a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扣除税款等之后﹐你的月薪大约有700英镑。

Sense.DEF: using the knowledge and information you have in order to understand or form an opinion about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: deductive reasoning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演绎推理

Sense.DEF: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指很好或很坏的〕行为﹐行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上午做了好事之后﹐他理应休息一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She tried to strangle her baby and her lover helped her finish the evil deed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图掐死自己的宝宝﹐她的情人帮着完成了这个罪恶的勾当。

Sense.DEF: an official paper that is a record of an agreement, especially an agreement concerning who owns property
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指财产所有权的〕契约﹐证书
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mortgage deed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抵押证书

Sense.DEF: in what you do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone sins at some time, in thought if not in deed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都会犯罪﹐不是在行动上就是在思想上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: your good deed for the day
Sense.DEF: something kind or helpful that you do – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 今天行的善事〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a legal document signed by only one person, for example in order to officially change your name
Sense.TRAN: 单边契据﹐单方契据〔如为正式改名而单方签的契据〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve changed his name by deed poll to Elvis Presley-Smith.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫签了一份单边契据﹐把自己的名字改为埃尔维斯·普雷斯利－史密斯。

Sense.DEF:
a
disc jockey
Sense.TRAN: 唱片播放员﹔音乐节目主持人

Sense.DEF: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They deemed that he was no longer capable of managing the business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为他没有能力再管理这家企业了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were told to take whatever action they deemed necessary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被告知可采取任何必要的行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were deemed to be illegal immigrants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被视为非法移民。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: UK plans were deemed to infringe EU law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的计划被认为触犯了欧盟的法律。

Subsense.DEF: going far down from the top or from the surface
Subsense.TRAN: 〔从顶部或表面向下延伸〕深的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The castle is on an island surrounded by a deep lake.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城堡坐落在岛上﹐环岛是一个很深的湖。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The swimming pool has a deep end and a shallow end for kids.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个游泳池一端是深水区﹐一端是供小孩用的浅水区。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll take the boat out into deep water where we can dive.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要把船开到我们可以潜水的深水处去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a deep narrow valley
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又深又窄的山谷

Subsense.DEF: you use deep to say what distance something goes down from the top or surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dig a hole around 12 inches deep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 挖一个约12英寸深的洞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In places, the snow was waist-deep deep enough to reach a person’s waist .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些地方的积雪有齐腰深。

Sense.DEF: going far in from the outside or from the front edge of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔从外部或前缘往里延伸〕深的﹐纵深的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep wound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很深的伤口
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was sitting in a deep leather chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在一张很深的皮椅子里。

Sense.DEF: serious or severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite the peace process, there are deep divisions in the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管启动了和平进程﹐社会依然存在严重分裂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is in a deep recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家正处于严重的经济衰退中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evan would be in deep trouble if he was caught.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文如果被抓住的话﹐他可就麻烦大了。

Sense.DEF:
a deep breath or
sigh
is one in which you breathe a lot of air in or out
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stopped and took a deep breath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她停下来深吸了一口气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom gave a deep sigh of relief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆长长地舒了一口气。

Sense.DEF: a deep feeling, belief etc is very strong and sincere
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情等〕强烈的﹐深厚的﹔〔信念等〕笃定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I express my deepest sympathy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请允许我表示深切的慰问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letters show her deep affection for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些信件显示出她对他的款款深情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a deep understanding of the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对环境有深刻的理解。

Sense.DEF: a deep sound is very low
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her laugh was deep and loud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的笑声低沉而响亮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love that deep bass line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢那深沉的低音部。

Sense.DEF: a deep colour is dark and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gazed at him with wide deep blue eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深蓝色的大眼睛凝视着他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The berries are a deep red colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些浆果是深红色的。

Sense.DEF: important but complicated or difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: These problems are too deep for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题对我来说太深奥了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a deep issue of principle involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里涉及深刻的原则问题。

Sense.DEF: if someone is in a deep sleep, it is difficult to wake them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay down and fell into a deep sleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他躺下便酣然入睡。

Sense.DEF: thinking so hard or paying attention to something so much that you do not notice anything else that is happening around you
Sense.TRAN: 陷入沉思的/专注于谈话的等

Sense.DEF: owing a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 负债累累的﹐债台高筑的

Sense.DEF: a strong effect or influence that remains for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: What he said made a deep impression on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话给我留下了深刻的印象。

Sense.DEF: a deep person is serious and intelligent, but is hard to know well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Henry has always been a deep one . He keeps his views to himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利总是深藏不露﹐不会说出自己的观点。

Sense.DEF: to be in a bad situation because of something you have done
to be in trouble or in a difficult or serious situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is in deep water over their refusal to reduce prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司因不肯降价而陷入困境。

Sense.DEF: a deep ball is hit, thrown, or kicked to a far part of the sports field
Sense.TRAN: 靠近对方底线的﹔深入对方后场的

Sense.LEXUNIT: jump/be thrown in at the deep end
Sense.DEF: to choose to do or be made to do a very difficult job without having prepared for it
Sense.TRAN: 〔在没有准备的情况下〕（使）做困难的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She decided to jump in at the deep end, buy a farm, and teach herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决定冒险买个农场﹐自己摸索着干。

Sense.LEXUNIT: go off at the deep end
Sense.DEF: to become angry suddenly and violently, usually when there is not a good reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般指莫名其妙地〕勃然大怒

Sense.DEF: a long way into or below the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some bones were hidden deep beneath the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些尸骨深埋在地下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tunnel led deep under the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条隧道在山底深处穿过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were deep in a tropical rainforest far from the edge of the forest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在热带雨林深处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom stared deep into her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆深深凝视着她的眼睛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They talked deep into the night very late .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直谈到深夜。

Subsense.DEF: if you know or feel something deep down, you secretly know or feel it even though you do not admit it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He knew, deep down, that he would have to apologise.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他心里知道得去道个歉。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is good, evil etc deep down, that is what they are really like even though they usually hide it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Deep down, she is a caring person.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她本质上是个宅心仁厚的人。

Sense.DEF: if things or people are two deep, three deep etc, there are two, three etc rows or layers of things or people
Sense.TRAN: 二排/三排等﹔二层/三层等
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were standing four deep at the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吧台前站了四排人。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling such as hatred or anger runs deep in someone, they feel it very strongly, especially because of something that has happened in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prejudice runs deep and we need to understand the fears behind it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏见很深﹐我们要理解其背后的恐惧心理。

Sense.DEF: to be very involved in a situation, especially so that it causes you problems
the sea
if a serious situation deepens, it gets worse – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 〔局势﹑情形〕加剧﹐恶化〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recession continues to deepen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济衰退继续加剧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deepening international crisis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日益加深的国际危机

Sense.DEF: to become stronger or greater, or to make something stronger or greater
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeanne liked Simon as a friend but she did not want the relationship to deepen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为朋友珍妮很喜欢西蒙﹐但她不想让这种关系更进一步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea only deepened his gloom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一想法更加重了他的悲观情绪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mystery deepened became even more mysterious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谜团加深了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students explore new ideas as they deepen their understanding understand more of the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着对这门课的理解加深﹐学生们开始探究新的观点。

Sense.DEF:
if someone’s smile or
frown
deepens, they smile even more or frown even more
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her worried frown deepened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眉头皱得更紧了。

Sense.DEF: if water deepens, or if someone deepens it, it becomes deeper
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river deepens beyond the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了城外这条河就变深了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The harbour was deepened to take bigger boats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 港口被挖深以便停泊更大的船只。

Sense.DEF: if light or a colour deepens, it becomes darker
Sense.EXAMPLE: The twilight deepened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暮色更浓了。

Sense.DEF: if a sound deepens, it becomes lower
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice deepened as he relaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放松下来后声音就变低沉了。

Sense.DEF: if your breathing deepens, you take more air into your lungs
a large metal box in which food can be stored at very low temperatures for a long time
to cook food under the surface of hot fat or oil
used to emphasize that a belief, feeling, opinion etc is very strong, important, or sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her lies hurt my father deeply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的谎言深深地伤害了我父亲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is deeply upset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常难受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He loves her deeply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深深地爱着她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers are deeply divided on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上教师们分歧很大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: religious beliefs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虔诚的宗教信仰

Sense.DEF: in a serious, careful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most doctors think deeply about what their patients want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分医生都认真考虑病人的需要。

Sense.DEF: a long way into something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John kept sinking more deeply into the mud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在泥中越陷越深。

Sense.DEF: to take a large breath of air into your lungs
to be in a deep sleep, from which it is hard to wake up
a deep-rooted habit, idea, belief etc is so strong in a person or society that it is very difficult to change or destroy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔习惯﹑观念﹑信仰等〕根深蒂固的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep-rooted suspicion of lawyers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对律师根深蒂固的不信任

Sense.DEF:
deep-sea fishing or
diving
is done in the deep part of the sea, far away from land
a deep-seated attitude, feeling, or idea is strong and is very difficult to change
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑感情﹑观念等〕不易改变的﹐顽固的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deep-seated fear of failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对失败难以消除的恐惧感

Sense.DEF: deep-set eyes seem to be further back into the face than most people’s
to decide not to use something such as a plan

a serious illness which happens when a small amount of blood becomes very thick and causes the heart to stop beating properly. This sometimes happens to people who have been on long plane journeys, because they have been sitting still for so long.

information available on the Internet that
search engines
do not find
Sense.TRAN: 深层网络﹐深度网络〔即因特网上存在但搜索引擎无法找到的信息〕

Sense.DEF: a large wild animal that can run very fast, eats grass, and has horns
a type of soft hat with pieces of cloth that cover your ears
to spoil the surface or appearance of something, especially by writing on it or breaking it
Sense.TRAN: 损坏〔某物〕的表面[外观]﹐污损
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the monuments had been broken or defaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数纪念碑都被破坏或遭污损。

Sense.DEF: really existing although not legally stated to exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔未经法定途径宣布但〕实际存在的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a de facto state of war

Sense.DEF: the act of defaming someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sued the newspaper for defamation of character .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他起诉那家报纸诽谤人格。

Sense.DEF: to write or say bad or untrue things about someone or something, so that people will have a bad opinion of them

Subsense.DEF: if you win a game, competition etc by default, you win it because your opponent did not play or because there were no other competitors
Subsense.TRAN: 因对手弃权[缺席]﹐因无其他参赛者〔而获胜〕

Subsense.DEF: if something happens by default, it happens because you did not do anything to change it

Sense.DEF: failure to pay money that you owe at the right time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is in default on its loan agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司拖欠偿还贷款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bank can seize the asset in the event of a default in payment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果拖欠付款﹐银行可以没收该项资产。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the risk of default by borrowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 借款人不偿还欠款的风险

Sense.DEF: failure to do something that you are supposed to do according to the law or because it is your duty
the way in which things are arranged on a computer screen unless you decide to change them
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机﹑软件等的〕默认状态﹐系统预设状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can change the default settings to suit your needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以根据需要改变默认设置。

Sense.DEF: the usual and expected way in which something is done, unless you decide to do something different
Sense.EXAMPLE: This way of working seems to be the default these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐这种工作方式似乎成了常规做法。

Sense.DEF: because of the lack or absence of something
Sense.TRAN: 因缺乏某物﹔因没有某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: In default of any other instructions, they decided to use the same system as before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为没有收到其他指令﹐他们决定采用与过去一样的方法。

Sense.DEF: to fail to pay money that you owe at the right time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He defaulted on his child support payments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拖欠子女抚养费。

Sense.DEF: to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do
failure to win or succeed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The socialist party suffered a crushing defeat in the elections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党在选举中遭遇惨败。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个不愿认输的女人。

Sense.DEF: victory over someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The defeat of the army was followed by the establishment of constitutional government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打败军队后建立了立宪政体。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be defeated
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The party suffered a defeat in the state elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在州选举中遭遇失败。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: defeat someone, especially easily
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The army inflicted a heavy defeat on the English.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支军队重创英格兰军队。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If I left my job, I would be admitting defeat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我辞职的话就是认输了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It can be very hard to accept defeat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 接受失败相当难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: formally accept that you have lost in a game, election etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His opponent conceded defeat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的对手认输了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be likely to be defeated
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In May 1945 Germany faced defeat at the hands of the Allies.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1945年5月,德军面临着败给盟军的局面。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: by a large amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The polls were forecasting a heavy defeat for the President.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 民调预测总统将遭遇惨败。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a complete defeat, by a very large amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He quit as Prime Minister following a crushing defeat in regional elections.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地方选举一败涂地后,他辞去了首相职务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very embarrassing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are still bitter about their humiliating defeat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对于自己耻辱的失败仍愤愤不平。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very big, and with a very bad result
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The party suffered a disastrous defeat in the 2006 election.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在2006年大选中惨败。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: by a small amount
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper was blamed for the team’s narrow defeat.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队的惜败归咎于守门员。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was their worst general election defeat since 1982.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他们自1982年以来输得最惨的一场大选。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The president resigned following a series of military defeats.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串军事失利后,总统辞职了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very unexpected
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Arsenal are now out of the competition, following their shock defeat by Torquay United.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队意外败给托奎联后,现在被淘汰出局了。

Sense.DEF: to win a victory over someone in a war, competition, game etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They hoped to defeat the enemy at sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望在海上击败敌人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were defeated by 3 goals to 2.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以2比3的比分败北。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say beat rather than defeat when talking about sport, games, or elections.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们谈论体育﹑比赛或选举时一般用 beat ,而不用 defeat
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We were beaten by 3 goals to 2.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以2比3失利。

Sense.DEF: if something defeats you, you cannot understand it and therefore cannot answer or deal with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the last question on the paper that defeated me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考卷上的最后一道题把我难住了。

Sense.DEF: to make something fail

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let your arms relax as that would defeat the object of the exercise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手臂不要放松﹐否则达不到锻炼的目的。

Sense.DEF: sad and unable to deal with problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked lost and defeated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去一副失落沮丧的样子。

Sense.DEF: someone who believes that they will not succeed

to get rid of waste matter from your
bowel s
a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a genetic defect
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗传缺陷

Sense.DEF: to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Russian actor who defected to the West
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名叛逃到西方国家的俄罗斯演员

Sense.DEF: not made properly, or not working properly
Sense.TRAN: 有问题的﹐有毛病的﹐有缺陷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease is caused by a defective gene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病是由缺陷基因引起的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: defective products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残次品

Subsense.DEF: the act of protecting something or someone from attack

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In Britain, the defence of the country has historically been left to the navy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国﹐国防历来由海军负责。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a firm commitment to the defense of human rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对保护人权的坚定承诺

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The first line of defence is a smoke detector.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一道防线是烟雾探测器。

Subsense.DEF: something that can be used to protect something or someone from attack
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The area’s flood defences need repair.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的防洪设施需要整修。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The immune system is the body’s defence against infection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 免疫系统是身体抵御感染的武器。

Subsense.DEF: all the systems, people, materials etc that a country uses to protect itself from attack
Subsense.EXAMPLE: calls for a national debate on defence
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对国防问题进行全国性讨论的呼吁
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the Defense Department
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国防部

Subsense.DEF: all the armies, weapons, structures etc that are available to defend a place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The invading army easily overcame the town’s defences.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侵略军轻易地击败了该镇的守军。

Sense.DEF: something that you say or do in order to support someone or something that is being criticized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean wrote a letter to the paper in Angela’s defense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼写了封信到报社为安杰拉辩护。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a philosophical defence of nationalism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为民族主义所作的哲学辩护

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Evelyn Waugh came to Wilson’s defence and acknowledged the brilliance of the book’s themes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊夫林·沃站出来为威尔逊辩护﹐认为这部书的主题非同凡响。

Subsense.DEF: the things that are said in a court of law to prove that someone is not guilty of a crime
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Major has a good defence and believes he will win the case.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅杰的辩词很有说服力﹐他相信能够打赢这场官司。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a defence lawyer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辩护律师

Subsense.DEF: all the lawyers who try to prove in a court of law that someone is not guilty of a crime
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The defense called only one witness.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辩方只传召了一个证人。

Sense.DEF: something you do or a way of behaving that prevents you from seeming weak or being hurt by others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz dropped her defences and began to relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹放下防备心理﹐开始放松了。

Sense.DEF: the players in a game whose main job is to try to prevent the other team from getting points
weak and unable to protect yourself from attack or harm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a defenceless old lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有自卫能力的老太太

Sense.DEF: a process in your brain that makes you forget things that are painful for you to think about
Sense.TRAN: 防卫机制〔指人脑忘掉痛苦事情的机制〕

Sense.DEF: a reaction in your body that protects you from an illness or danger
Sense.TRAN: 防御机制〔指身体抵御疾病或危险的反应机制〕

Sense.DEF: to do something in order to protect someone or something from being attacked
Sense.EXAMPLE: a struggle to defend our homeland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保卫我们祖国的斗争

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the need to defend democracy against fascism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保卫民主﹑反抗法西斯的需要

GramExa.EXAMPLE: advice on how women can defend themselves from sex attackers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关妇女如何保护自己免受性侵犯的建议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to defend against military aggression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要防御军事侵略。

Sense.DEF: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He defended his wife against rumours and allegations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对谣言和指控﹐他为妻子进行了辩护。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cooper wrote to the journal immediately, defending himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 库珀立刻给那份刊物写信﹐为自己辩护。

F2NBox.HEADING: register 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say stand up for someone rather than defend someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 stand up for someone ,而不说 defend someone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was the only person who stood up for me at the meeting.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是会上唯一一个为我辩护的人。

Sense.DEF: to do something in order to stop something from being taken away or in order to make it possible for something to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: the workers’ attempts to defend their interests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们为维护自己利益所作的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are defending the right to demonstrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在捍卫游行示威的权利。

Sense.DEF: to protect your own team’s end of the field in a game such as football, in order to prevent your opponents from getting points
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bournemouth defended well throughout the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯恩茅斯队在整场比赛中防守得很出色。

Sense.DEF: to take part in a competition that you won the last time it was held, and try to win it again
Sense.TRAN: 在竞争中保住〔原来优胜位置〕﹐卫冕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The world champion was defending his title .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位世界冠军在争取卫冕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the defending champion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫冕冠军
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is defending a Labour majority of 5,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想把工党5,000票的多数局面保持下去。

Sense.DEF: to be a lawyer for someone who has been charged with a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had top lawyers to defend him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有最优秀的律师为他辩护。

Exponent.DEF: to say something to support an idea or person when other people are criticizing them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The mayor defended the action, saying that it was the best option.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长为那次行动辩护,称那是最好的选择。

Exponent.DEF: to strongly defend someone who is being criticized, or strongly defend your ideas or your rights
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My grandfather would always stand up for what was right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爷爷总是会站出来维护正义。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t want him fighting, but I do want him to stand up for himself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是要他去打架,但我确实想让他为自己讨个公道。

Exponent.DEF: to strongly defend someone who is being criticized, especially when no one else will defend them
Exponent.TRAN: 为某人辩护〔尤在其他人都不愿这么做时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The other kids tease her, but Sarah often sticks up for her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他孩子取笑她,但萨拉常常为她出头。

Exponent.DEF: to say something to defend someone who is being criticized
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Aitken’s colleagues quickly came to his defence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾特肯的同事立即出来为他辩护。

Sense.DEF:
the person in a court of law who has been
accused
of doing something illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: We find the defendant not guilty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们裁定被告无罪。

Sense.DEF:
one of the players in a game such as football who have to defend their team’s
goal
from the opposing team
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s his fourth season as an Arsenal defender.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他成为阿森纳队后卫之后踢的第四个赛季。

Sense.DEF: someone who defends a particular idea, belief, person etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He presented himself as a defender of democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以民主捍卫者的姿态出现。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
defence
the players in a game of football etc whose main job is to try to prevent the other team from getting points
a defensible opinion, idea, or action seems reasonable, and you can easily support it
Sense.TRAN: 〔意见﹑想法或行动〕合理的﹐说得过去的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a morally defensible prison system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德上合理的监狱体系

Sense.DEF: a defensible building or area is easy to protect against attack
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或地区〕能防御进攻的﹐可防卫的

Sense.DEF: used or intended to protect someone or something against attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prince drew up his forces in a strong defensive position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲王将部队布成坚固的防御阵势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rockets are a purely defensive measure against nuclear attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火箭弹纯粹是针对核攻击的防御性措施。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows you think someone is criticizing you even if they are not
Sense.TRAN: 戒备的﹐自卫的﹐有戒心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She despised herself for sounding so defensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因自己说的话听起来戒备心过强而自惭形秽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reserved and defensive manner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矜持而又戒备的态度

Sense.DEF: relating to stopping the other team from getting points in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: defensive play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防守型打法

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows that you think that someone is criticizing you even if they are not
Sense.TRAN: 处于戒备状态（的）﹐存有戒心（的）
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his presence, she was constantly on the defensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他面前她总是步步为营。

Sense.DEF: if you put someone on the defensive in an argument, you attack them so that they are in a weaker position
Sense.EXAMPLE: an issue that put the White House on the defensive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使白宫处于被动的问题

Sense.DEF: to delay something until a later date

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Further discussion on the proposal will be deferred until April.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对此提案的进一步讨论将推迟到4月份。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee deferred their decision .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会延期作出决定。

Sense.DEF: to agree to accept someone’s opinion or decision because you have respect for that person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I will defer to your wishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会遵从你的意愿。

Sense.DEF: polite behaviour that shows that you respect someone and are therefore willing to accept their opinions or judgment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lewis was annoyed that Adam did not show enough respect and deference to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯心中不悦﹐因为亚当对他不够尊敬和服从。

GramExa.GLOSS: because you respect someone’s beliefs, opinions etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were married in church out of deference to their parents’ wishes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于对双方父母意愿的尊重﹐他们在教堂结婚。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows you refuse to do what someone tells you to do, especially because you do not respect them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Running away was an act of defiance against his parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离家出走是他对父母的反抗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people were drinking in the streets, in flagrant defiance of the ban.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人在街上喝酒﹐公然违抗禁令。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her fists clenched in defiance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双拳紧握﹐拒绝服从。

Sense.DEF: clearly refusing to do what someone tells you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark smashed a fist on the desk in a defiant gesture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克一拳砸在书桌上以示反抗。

Sense.DEF: a machine that gives the heart an electric shock to make it start beating again after a heart attack
a lack of something that is necessary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a deficiency of safe play areas for children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童安全游戏场地的缺乏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some elderly people suffer from iron deficiency in their diet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些老人日常饮食中缺铁。

Sense.DEF: a weakness or fault in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are deep deficiencies in this law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法律存在严重的缺陷。

Sense.DEF: not containing or having enough of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women who are dieting can become iron deficient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节食的女性有可能缺铁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: patients who were deficient in vitamin C
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏维生素C的病人

Sense.DEF: not good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our prisons are our most deficient social service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的监狱是问题最大的社会机构。

Sense.DEF: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s widening budget deficit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家日益严重的预算赤字
Sense.EXAMPLE: the US’s foreign trade deficit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的对外贸易逆差

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a deficit of £2.5 million
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 250万英镑的亏损

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many countries have a big deficit in food supply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多国家食物供应严重不足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The US balance of payments was in deficit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的国际收支平衡出现逆差。

Sense.DEF: to make something less pure and good, especially by showing no respect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hallam’s tomb had been defiled and looted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈勒姆的坟墓遭到了亵渎和洗劫。

Sense.DEF: a narrow passage, especially through mountains
to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ability to define clients’ needs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确定客户需求的能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tasks will be clearly defined by the tutor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 导师会清楚地说明任务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 70% of the workers can be defined as low-paid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 70%的工人可以被划定为低收入者。

Sense.DEF: to explain exactly the meaning of a particular word or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll now try to define the term ‘popular culture’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在来试试给 “通俗文化” 这个词下定义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A budget is defined as ‘a plan of action expressed in money terms’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “预算” 的定义是 “以钱来表述的行动计划” 。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

Sense.DEF: to show the edge or shape of something clearly
Sense.TRAN: 标明…的界限﹐明确显出…的轮廓
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bird has sharply defined black and rust markings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只鸟长有颜色分明的黑色和铁锈色斑点。

Sense.DEF: clearly known, seen, or stated
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s impossible for me to give you a definite answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不可能给你明确的答复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to record sufficient data to enable definite conclusions to be reached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要记录足够的数据﹐才能得出明确的结论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d shown definite signs of resigning himself to the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明显表现出安于这种状况的样子。

Sense.DEF: a definite arrangement, promise etc will happen in the way that someone has said
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fix a definite date for the delivery of your computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请为你的电脑定个确切的交货日期。

Sense.DEF: saying something very firmly so that people understand exactly what you mean

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s not definite about retiring from the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有明确说是否退出比赛。

Sense.DEF: the word ‘the’ in English
a word in another language that is like ‘the’
without any doubt
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you reckon Margot will be there?’ ‘ Definitely not .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel fitness centre is definitely worth a visit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I definitely need a holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我太需要休假了。

Sense.DEF: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dictionary definition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 词典里的释义

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are many definitions of the word ‘feminism’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “女权主义” 一词有许多定义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the definition of God as infinite
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为上帝即无限者的定义

Sense.DEF: if something has a particular quality by definition, it must have that quality because all things of that type have it
Sense.TRAN: 必然〔有某种品质﹐因为同类事物全都有这种品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People say that students are by definition idealistic and impatient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们说学生必定是理想主义的﹑躁动不安的。

Sense.DEF: the clear edges, shapes, or sound that something has
Sense.EXAMPLE: technologies such as high definition television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高清电视之类的技术
Sense.EXAMPLE: good muscle definition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健美而清晰的肌肉轮廓

Sense.DEF: a definitive book, description etc is considered to be the best and cannot be improved

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the definitive study of Victorian railway stations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对维多利亚时代火车站最权威的研究

Sense.DEF: a definitive agreement, statement etc is one that will not be changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a definitive agreement to buy the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收购这家公司的最终协议

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say an object goes down rather than deflates .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中,人们一般说 go down ,而不说 deflate
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It looks like the air bed has gone down .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 充气床垫似乎瘪了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less important or less confident
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕泄气﹐挫伤〔某人的信心〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was deflated when Fen made no comment on her achievement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬对她的成就没作任何评论﹐她很泄气。

Sense.DEF: to show that a statement, argument etc is wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simkin hoped to find a way to deflate his opponent’s argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西姆金希望能找到击破对手论点的办法。

Sense.DEF: to change economic rules or conditions in a country so that prices fall or stop rising

a reduction in the amount of money in a country’s
economy
, so that prices fall or stop rising
if someone or something deflects something that is moving, or if it deflects, it turns in a different direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: He deflected the blow with his forearm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用前臂挡开了打来的一拳。

Sense.DEF: to do something to stop people paying attention to you, criticizing you etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his attempts to deflect attention away from his private life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想把别人的注意力从其私生活上引开的努力

Sense.EXAMPLE: The committee is seeking to deflect criticism by blaming me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会把责任归咎于我以转移批评的矛头。

Sense.DEF: to take someone’s attention away from something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nothing can deflect me from reaching my goal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么能够阻碍我实现目标。

Sense.DEF: the action of making something change its direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the deflection of the missile away from its target
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使导弹偏离目标

Sense.DEF: the degree to which the moving part on a measuring instrument moves away from zero
Sense.TRAN: 〔计量仪器的指针等的〕偏转度

Sense.DEF: to have sex with a woman who has never had sex before
to remove mist from the windows inside a car, by using heat
Sense.TRAN: 除去〔汽车玻璃上〕的雾水

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance, used especially in war, that makes all the leaves of plants drop off
Sense.TRAN: 脱叶剂〔尤在战争中使用〕

Sense.DEF: to use defoliant on a plant or tree
the cutting or burning down of all the trees in an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deforestation of the tropics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带森林的毁坏

Sense.DEF: if you deform something, or if it deforms, its usual shape changes so that its usefulness or appearance is spoiled
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wearing badly-fitting shoes can deform your feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿不合脚的鞋会使脚变形。

Sense.DEF: a change in the usual shape of something, especially one that makes it worse, or the process of changing something’s shape
something that is deformed has the wrong shape, especially because it has grown or developed wrongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指发育﹑生长不良而〕畸形的
Sense.EXAMPLE: deformed toe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 畸形的脚趾

Sense.DEF: a condition in which part of someone’s body is not the normal shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hip deformity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臀部畸形

Sense.FULLFORM: Department for Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs
Sense.DEF: the British government department which is responsible for farming, food production, and the safety of food products. It is also responsible for protecting the environment in the UK.
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕环境﹑食品及农村事务部

Sense.DEF:
to change the way in which the
file s
on a computer’s
hard drive
are stored and organized, by putting related information together so that the computer works more effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: It should start working faster after we defrag your disk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把你的磁盘进行碎片整理后﹐运行速度应该会快起来。

Sense.DEF: to trick a person or organization in order to get money from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She defrauded her employers of thousands of pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从雇主那里骗取了数千英镑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He faces charges of theft and conspiracy to defraud a secret plan to cheat someone, made by two or more people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临偷窃和合谋诈骗的指控。

Sense.DEF: to give someone back the money that they have spent on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proceeds from the competition help to defray the expenses of the evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛的收入帮助支付晚会的开销。

Sense.DEF: to officially remove a priest from his or her job because he or she did something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 免去〔犯错的牧师〕的圣职

Sense.DEF: if frozen food defrosts, or if you defrost it, it gets warmer until it is not frozen

if a
freezer
or
refrigerator
defrosts, or if you defrost it, it is turned off so that the ice inside it melts
to remove ice from inside the windows of a car by using heat or warm air
a deft movement is skilful, and often quick
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sketched her with quick, deft strokes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给她画素描﹐下笔又快又熟练。
Sense.EXAMPLE: deft footwork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敏捷的步法

Sense.DEF: skilful at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: his deft chairmanship of the company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对公司驾轻就熟的领导

Sense.DEF: not existing any more, or not useful any more
Sense.TRAN: 不再存在的﹐不再使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the now-defunct nuclear reactor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现已废弃的核反应堆

Sense.DEF: to improve a difficult or dangerous situation, for example by making people less angry or by dealing with the causes of a problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beth’s quiet voice helped to defuse the situation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝平静的话音帮助缓和了局面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The agreement was regarded as a means of defusing ethnic tensions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份协议被认为是缓和种族紧张局势的一种手段。

Sense.DEF:
to remove the
fuse
from a bomb in order to prevent it from exploding
to refuse to obey a law or rule, or refuse to do what someone in authority tells you to do
Sense.TRAN: 违抗〔法律或规则〕﹔拒不服从〔有权威者〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who openly defy the law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公然抗拒法律的人

Sense.DEF: to be almost impossible to describe or understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beauty of the scene defies description.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色之美简直无法形容。

Sense.DEF: to not happen according to the principles you would expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 16-week premature baby who defied the odds and survived
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇迹般活下来的早产16周的婴儿

Sense.LEXUNIT: I defy sb to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when you ask someone to do something that you think is impossible
Sense.TRAN: 我倒要看某人能否做成某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I defy anyone to prove otherwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倒要看看哪一位能提出反证。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= degree or 或 degrees 度﹐度数

Sense.DEF: to become worse

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conference degenerated into a complete fiasco.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次大会开得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: morally unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting was condemned as ‘degenerate’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画被谴责为 “有伤风化” 。

Sense.DEF: someone whose behaviour is considered to be morally unacceptable
a degenerative illness gradually gets worse and cannot be stopped
an experience or situation that makes you feel ashamed and angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life of poverty and degradation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穷困潦倒的生活

Sense.DEF: the process by which something changes to a worse condition
to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves
Sense.EXAMPLE: a movie that degrades women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贬损女性的影片

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can you degrade yourself by writing such trash?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么能写这种垃圾作品来自贬身份呢？

Sense.DEF: to make a situation or the condition of something worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dolphin’s habitat is being rapidly degraded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚的栖息环境正遭到越发严重的破坏。

Sense.DEF: if a substance, chemical etc degrades, or if something degrades it, it changes to a simpler form
a degrading experience, event etc is unpleasant and makes you lose respect for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 有辱人格的﹐令人羞耻的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pornography is degrading to women and to the men that look at it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情作品有辱女性人格﹐看它的男人也自贬了身份。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the degrading treatment that the prisoners receive in jail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯在狱中受到的侮辱性待遇

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring temperature. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 70° means 70 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把烘箱预热至425度。

GramExa.PROPFORM: 20 degrees Celsius/70 degrees Fahrenheit/1 degree Centigrade etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The temperature dropped to five degrees Centigrade.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温下降到五摄氏度。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring the size of an angle. It can be shown as a symbol after a number. For example, 18° means 18 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then the cylinder is rotated 180 degrees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后圆柱体被旋转了180度。

Sense.DEF: the level or amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 1960s Britain was characterised by a greater degree of freedom than before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代英国的显著特点是相比以前有了更大的自由度。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

Variant.LEXVAR: to some degree/to a certain degree

Sense.DEF: partly
Sense.EXAMPLE: To a degree, it is possible to educate oneself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从某种程度上讲﹐自学是可能的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re all willing to support him to some degree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都愿意给他一定的支持。

Sense.DEF:
a course of study at a university or college, or the
qualification
that is given to you when you have successfully completed the course

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a degree in Economics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济学学位
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Applicants must have a degree in Engineering.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请人必须有工程学学位。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an Honours degree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荣誉学位

Sense.DEF: very slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: By degrees, he forced himself into a sitting position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他慢慢地用力坐起来。

Sense.DEF: to treat people so badly that they lose their good human qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: War dehumanizes people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争使人们丧失人性。

Sense.DEF: to remove the liquid from a substance such as food or a chemical
Sense.EXAMPLE: The substance is dehydrated and stored as powder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该物质经脱水处理后以粉末形式储存。

Sense.DEF: to lose too much water from your body, or to make this happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alcohol dehydrates the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精会使身体脱水。

Sense.DEF:
to remove the ice from something, especially a car
windscreen
or the wings of an aircraft
Sense.TRAN: 给〔汽车挡风玻璃或飞机机翼〕除冰

Sense.DEF: to treat someone or something with extreme respect and admiration
Sense.TRAN: 崇拜﹔把…神化﹔把…奉若神明

Sense.DEF: to do something that you think you are really too important to do – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 俯就[屈尊]做某事〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Travis called after her, but she didn’t deign to answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特拉维斯在后面叫她﹐但她不肯屈尊应一声。

Sense.DEF: the belief in a God who made the world but has no influence on human lives
Sense.TRAN: 自然神论﹐理神论〔认为上帝创造世界﹐但不干涉人类的生活〕

Sense.DEF:
a god or
goddess
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deities of ancient Greece
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古希腊诸神

Sense.DEF: the feeling that what is happening now has happened before in exactly the same way
Sense.TRAN: 似曾经历的感觉﹐似曾相识的感觉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strange sense of déjà vu
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的似曾相识的感觉

Sense.DEF: unhappy, disappointed, or sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unemployed stood at street corners, dejected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业者沮丧地站在街角。

Sense.DEF: true or right because of a law
when someone or something has to wait, or the length of the waiting time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry for the delay, Mr Weaver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 韦弗先生﹐很抱歉耽搁了一些时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why was there a delay in warning the public?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不及时向公众发出警告？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a delay of about an hour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约一小时的延误

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Long delays are expected on the motorways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高速公路上估计会有长时间的耽搁。

Sense.DEF: when something does not happen or start when it should do
Sense.TRAN: 推迟〔指某事没有按时发生或开始〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They must restore normal services without delay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须马上恢复正常服务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There can be no excuse for any further delay .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有理由继续拖延。

Sense.DEF: to wait until a later time to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t delay – send off for the information now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别犹豫——即刻去函索取信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He delayed his decision on whether to call an election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在是否宣布举行选举一事上﹐他推迟作出决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The opening of this section of the road is delayed until September.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一路段推迟到9月份启用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our meeting was delayed for ten minutes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的会议推迟了十分钟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Big companies often delay paying their bills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大公司常常会拖延支付账单。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something late

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flight was badly delayed because of fog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该航班因雾而长时间延误。

Exponent.DEF: to wait until a later time to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He decided to delay his decision until he had seen the full report.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定推迟作出决定,直至看到完整的报告。

Exponent.DEF: to change an event to a later time or date
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The meeting was postponed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议推迟了。

Exponent.DEF: to delay doing something. Put off is less formal than delay or postpone , and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 推迟〔与delay和postpone相比不那么正式,常用于日常英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I used to put off making difficult decisions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我过去常常在要作困难的决定时拖拖拉拉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The game has been put off till next week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛推迟到下周举行。

Exponent.DEF: to delay doing something, especially while you are waiting for more information or for something else to happen
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤在等待更多信息或某事发生的同时〕推迟
Exponent.EXAMPLE: House buyers seem to be holding off until interest rates drop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房屋买家似乎在等利率下跌后再出手。

Exponent.DEF: to delay doing something until a later date, usually because something else needs to happen first
Exponent.TRAN: 〔通常因其他事需要先发生而〕延期,推迟〔做某事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The decision had been deferred until after a meeting of the directors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个决定被延至董事会议之后作出。

Exponent.DEF: to delay doing something that you ought to do
Exponent.TRAN: 延期,推迟〔应该做的事情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t procrastinate – make a start on your assignments as soon as you get them.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别拖延——接到任务要马上开始。

Sense.DEF: designed to work or start only after a fixed period of time has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delayed-action bomb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定时炸弹

Sense.DEF: something you do deliberately in order to delay something so that you gain an advantage for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 拖延策略〔故意拖延以便争得优势〕

Sense.DEF: extremely pleasant to taste or smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: Delectable smells rose from the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里传来诱人的香味。

Sense.DEF: used, often humorously, to describe a very attractive woman
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕妩媚动人的﹐迷人的〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if you do something for someone’s delectation, you do it to give them enjoyment, pleasure, or amusement
someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Around 350 delegates attended the conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约有350名代表参加了大会。

Sense.DEF: to give part of your power or work to someone in a lower position than you
Sense.TRAN: 授权﹐委托〔权限给下级〕﹐下放〔权力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good manager knows when to delegate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个好的经理知道何时该放权。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes experience to judge correctly how much power should be delegated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该下放多少权力需要靠经验来准确判断。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Minor tasks should be delegated to your assistant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 次要的工作应交给你的助手去做。

Sense.DEF: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc
Sense.TRAN: 委派〔某人〕做〔某项工作〕﹔委任〔某人〕为代表

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was delegated to find a suitable conference venue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受命去找一个合适的会场。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who represent a company, organization etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the head of the American delegation to the United Nations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国驻联合国代表团团长

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a delegation of government officials
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官员代表团

Sense.EXAMPLE: A trade delegation will visit Kuwait.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个贸易代表团将访问科威特。

Sense.DEF: the process of giving power or work to someone else so that they are responsible for part of what you normally do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the delegation of authority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 授权

Sense.DEF: to remove something that has been written down or stored in a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name was deleted from the list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的名字从名单上删掉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I deleted the file by mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我误删了这个文件。

Sense.DEF: damaging or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deleterious effects of smoking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟的害处

Sense.DEF: when you remove something from a piece of writing or from a computer’s memory

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the deletion of unwanted files
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对冗余文件的删除

Sense.DEF: a letter or word that has been removed from a piece of writing

a
delicatessen
intended or planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对她的故意羞辱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attack on him was quite deliberate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

Sense.DEF: deliberate speech, thought, or movement is slow and careful
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话﹑思想或行动〕沉着的﹐从容不迫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He approached her with slow, deliberate steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迈着缓慢﹑从容的步子向她走去。

Sense.DEF: to think about something very carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury deliberated for four days before acquitting him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团斟酌了四天之后裁断他无罪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was silence while she deliberated on his words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她掂量着他的话﹐四周一片沉默。

Sense.DEF: done in a way that is intended or planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: He deliberately upset her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他故意惹她不开心。

Sense.DEF: done or said in a slow careful way
Sense.TRAN: 〔做事﹑说话〕慎重地﹐从容不迫地﹐不慌不忙地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook his head slowly and deliberately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缓缓而慎重地摇摇头。

Exponent.DEF: if you do something deliberately, you do it because you want to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He upset her deliberately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他故意惹她生气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I deliberately kept the letter short.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我故意把信写得简短。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately, especially in order to annoy someone or get an advantage for yourself
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为了惹恼某人或让自己获得好处〕特意地,故意地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t push her on purpose; it was an accident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是存心推她,是无意的。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately, especially in order to have a particular result or effect
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为取得某一结果或效果〕故意地,有意地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Very few teenagers become pregnant intentionally.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年怀孕很少是盘算好的。

Exponent.DEF: done after thinking carefully about what you are doing, especially because you know what the results of your actions might be
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因知道自己行为的后果〕有意识地,故意地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parents pass their values to their children, though not always consciously.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母把自己的价值观传递给子女,虽然不一定是有意识的。

Exponent.DEF: if you knowingly do something wrong or illegal, you do it even though you know it is wrong
Exponent.TRAN: 明知地,故意地〔做错误或非法的事情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: FBI agents arrested Dillon for ‘knowingly making a false statement on a passport application’ .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦调查局探员以 “故意在护照申请表上作虚假陈述” 的罪名逮捕了狄龙。

Sense.DEF: careful consideration or discussion of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After much deliberation, first prize was awarded to Derek Murray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经仔细商议﹐一等奖颁给了德里克·默里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the deliberations of committee meetings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会会议的商议过程

Sense.DEF: if you speak or move with deliberation, you speak or move slowly and carefully
existing for the purpose of discussing or planning something
something good to eat that is expensive or rare
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snails are considered a delicacy in France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法国﹐蜗牛被认为是一种珍贵的美食。

Sense.DEF: a careful and sensitive way of speaking or behaving so that you do not upset anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He carried out his duties with great delicacy and understanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以极其持重练达的作风完成了任务。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being easy to harm or damage
needing to be dealt with carefully or sensitively in order to avoid problems or failure
Sense.TRAN: 微妙的﹐需要谨慎处理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something I have to speak to you about – it’s a delicate matter .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有件事要跟你讲——是一件需要谨慎处理的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: delicate negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微妙的谈判

Sense.DEF: easily damaged or broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: delicate hand-cut glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 易碎的手工刻花玻璃
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光很容易晒伤小孩娇嫩的皮肤。

Sense.DEF: someone who is delicate is hurt easily or easily becomes ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕娇气的﹐娇弱的﹐体弱多病的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delicate child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体娇弱的孩子

Sense.DEF: a part of the body that is delicate is attractive and graceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her wrists and ankles were slim and delicate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手腕和脚踝长得纤巧优雅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her delicate features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她娇美的五官

Sense.DEF: made skilfully and with attention to the smallest details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plate with a delicate pattern of leaves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有精致树叶图案的碟子

Sense.DEF: a taste, smell, or colour that is delicate is pleasant and not strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine has a dry delicate flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这酒没有甜味﹐且味道清淡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delicate pink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡粉红色

Sense.DEF: clothes that are made from material that needs careful treatment

a shop that sells high quality cheeses,
salad s
,cooked meats etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔出售高品质奶酪﹑色拉﹑熟肉等的〕熟食店

Sense.DEF: very pleasant to taste or smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The meal was absolutely delicious,’ she said politely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这顿饭味道好极了。” 她礼貌地说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the delicious smell of new-mown grass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新修剪的草坪的芳香

Sense.DEF: extremely pleasant or enjoyable
a feeling of great pleasure and satisfaction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids were screaming with delight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在高兴地尖叫。

GramExa.PROPFORM: to sb’s delight/to the delight of sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the delight of his proud parents, he has made a full recovery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全康复了﹐他的父母因此又高兴又自豪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave a little gasp of delight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她高兴得轻叫了一声。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you feel very happy or satisfied

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a chance to sample the delights of nearby Vienna
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去附近的维也纳体验各种乐趣的机会

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is a delight to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a delight to see him so fit and healthy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他身体这么强壮健康﹐真让人高兴。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy something very much, especially something you should not do
Sense.TRAN: 以（做）某事为乐〔尤指做不该做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris takes great delight in teasing his sister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯以取笑妹妹为乐。

Sense.DEF: to give someone great satisfaction and enjoyment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her fabulous recipes will delight anyone who loves chocolate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些绝妙的配方将使每一个爱吃巧克力的人感到愉悦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is delighting audiences with his wit and humour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在用自己的智慧和幽默娱乐观众。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy something very much, especially something that other people think is not nice
Sense.TRAN: 以…为乐﹐喜欢〔尤指他人认为不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He delights in complicating everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢把任何事情都搞复杂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She delighted in interesting conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢有趣的谈话。

Sense.DEF: very pleased and happy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sandy will be delighted to see you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑迪见到你会很高兴的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m delighted that we have settled the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴我们把这事解决了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was delighted with her new home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的新家感到满意。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am delighted by the result.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个结果很满意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her screams of delighted laughter filled the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜悦的尖叫声在空中荡漾。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘very delighted’. Say 而要说 absolutely delighted.

Sense.DEF: very pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉快的﹐讨人喜欢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a delightful little girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨人喜欢的小女孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole house is delightful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整幢房子舒适宜人。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a movie that’s full of delightfully comic moments
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部充满愉快喜剧场景的影片

Sense.DEF: to set or say exactly what the limits of something are
to describe or draw something carefully so that people can understand it
Sense.TRAN: 说明﹐阐明﹐解释﹔详细绘明
Sense.EXAMPLE: The document delineates your rights and your obligations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文件阐明了你的权利和义务。

Sense.DEF: to make the borders between two areas very clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boundaries of these areas should be clearly delineated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些地区的分界线应该清楚地标出来。

Sense.DEF: illegal or immoral behaviour or actions, especially by young people
Sense.TRAN: 违法行为﹐犯罪﹔不良行为〔尤指青少年的行为〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ever-rising statistics of delinquency and crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年违法犯罪不断增加的统计数字

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is illegal or that society does not approve of

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 违法的女孩/男孩/儿童/青少年

Sense.DEF: a delinquent debt, account etc has not been paid on time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the recovery of delinquent loans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逾期贷款的追回

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a young person, who breaks the law or behaves in ways their society does not approve of
Sense.TRAN: 违法的人〔尤指青少年〕﹔不良青少年
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deanes writes and lectures about teenage delinquents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪恩斯就不良青少年问题撰文并演讲。

Sense.DEF: talking continuously in an excited or anxious way, especially because you are ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因生病而〕神志混乱的﹐语无伦次的﹐呓语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He suffered an attack of malaria and was delirious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他染上了疟疾﹐变得神志不清。

Sense.DEF: extremely excited or happy
Sense.TRAN: 极度兴奋的﹐异常高兴的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was delirious with joy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他欣喜若狂。

Sense.DEF: a state in which someone is delirious, especially because they are very ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因重病引起的〕神志不清﹐胡言乱语﹐谵妄
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before she died she had fits of delirium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去世前她一阵阵地胡言乱语。

Sense.DEF: extreme excitement
the DT’s
to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The morning mail has just been delivered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨的邮件刚送到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you deliver on Saturdays?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六你们送货吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They set off to deliver supplies to an isolated village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出发把物资运送到一座偏僻的村庄。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m having some flowers delivered for her birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在安排人给她送花祝贺生日。

Sense.DEF: to make a speech etc to a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king delivered a televised speech to the nation on November 5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王在11月5日向全国发表了电视讲话。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say give a speech/lecture/talk rather than deliver a speech/lecture/talk .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 give a speech/lecture/talk ,而不说 deliver a speech/lecture/talk 。

Sense.DEF: to do or provide the things you are expected to, because you are responsible for them or they are part of your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: the costs of delivering adequate nursing care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供满意护理的费用
Sense.EXAMPLE: the failure of some services to deliver the goods do what they have promised
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些服务机构未能按承诺提供服务
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company will deliver on its promises .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司将兑现承诺。

Sense.DEF: to help a woman give birth to her baby, or to give birth to a baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rushed her to hospital where doctors delivered her baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们急速将她送到医院﹐让医生给她接生。

Sense.DEF: to give something such as a blow, shock, or warning to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He delivered a strong warning about the dangers facing the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就政府所面临的危险发出了强烈警告。

Sense.DEF: to officially state a formal decision or judgment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury delivered a verdict of unlawful killing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团宣布了非法杀人的裁决。

Sense.DEF: to put someone into someone else’s control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sharett had betrayed him and delivered him to the enemy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙雷特出卖了他﹐把他交给了敌人。

Sense.DEF: to get the votes or support of a particular group of people in an election
Sense.EXAMPLE: He cannot deliver the Latino vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得不到拉美裔选民的票。

Sense.DEF: to help someone escape from something bad or evil

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Deliver us from evil,’ she prayed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “救我们脱离邪恶吧。” 她祈祷道。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone else
