Sense.EXAMPLE: A bankrupt must deliver up all his books, papers and records.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破产者必须交出所有的账本﹑文件和记录。

Sense.DEF: something that a company has promised to have ready for a customer, especially parts of computer systems
Sense.TRAN: 应交付的产品〔尤指计算机部件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: software deliverables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应交付的软件

Sense.DEF: the state of being saved from harm or danger
the act of bringing goods, letters etc to a particular person or place, or the things that are brought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most Indian restaurants offer free delivery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数印度餐馆提供免费外送服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can expect delivery in a week to ten days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在一周至十天内收到货物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fresh milk deliveries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜牛奶递送

GramExa.EXAMPLE: deliveries of food and supplies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 送来的食物和补给

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The restaurant pays cash on delivery for fish, which the local fishermen like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家饭店买鱼采用货到付款的方式﹐受到当地渔民的欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to officially accept something large that you have bought
Sense.TRAN: 提取〔所购买的大型商品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We expect to take delivery of the aircraft sometime in June.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们预期6月份提取飞机。

Sense.DEF: the process of giving birth to a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Howell had an easy delivery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪厄尔太太的分娩很顺利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz was taken to the delivery room a room in a hospital for births immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹立即被送进产房。

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone speaks in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔在公共场合的〕讲话方式﹐演说风格
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to work on your delivery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还得在演说技巧上下功夫。

Sense.DEF: a man who delivers goods to people
a small valley with grass and trees

Sense.TRAN: 除去〔头发﹑衣服等〕上的虱子

Sense.DEF:
a
temple a holy building
in Delphi in ancient Greece where a
priestess
gave answers from the god Apollo to questions people asked him. The answer was often in the form of a mysterious
riddle a deliberately confusing question with a clever answer
. Someone who is a respected authority on a particular subject is sometimes called a Delphic oracle.
Sense.TRAN: 德尔斐神谕神殿﹐德尔斐阿波罗神庙〔古希腊女祭司传达阿波罗神谕的场所。有时用于称某领域的权威〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Thatcher was regarded as the Delphic oracle of modern conservatism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒切尔夫人被认为是现代保守主义的权威。

Sense.DEF: the fourth letter of the Greek alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 德尔塔〔希腊字母表的第四个字母﹐即 ∆﹐δ〕

Sense.DEF: an area of low land where a river spreads into many smaller rivers near the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Nile delta
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼罗河三角洲

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe something that is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was angry with him for trying to delude me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想骗我﹐因此我很恼火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is easy to delude yourself into believing you’re in love.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人很容易误以为自己坠入了爱河。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be deluded into thinking your house is burglarproof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要误以为你的房子是绝对防盗的。

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something such as letters or questions that someone gets at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 纷至沓来的事物〔如信件﹑问题等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Viewers sent a deluge of complaints about the show.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众对这个节目的投诉如潮水般涌来。

Sense.DEF: a large flood, or period when there is a lot of rain
to send a very large number of letters, questions etc to someone all at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 使〔大量的信件﹑问题等同时〕涌向〔某人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was deluged with phone calls from friends and colleagues, congratulating him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友和同事纷纷来电向他表示祝贺。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with a lot of water
a false belief about yourself or the situation you are in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is under the delusion that I am going to cheat him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有错觉﹐以为我要欺骗他。

Sense.DEF: the belief that you are much more important or powerful than you really are
of better quality and more expensive than other things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deluxe hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华酒店
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deluxe model costs a lot more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华型的那款要贵很多。

Sense.DEF: to try to find more information about someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: research that delves deeply into this issue
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个问题的深入研究

Sense.DEF: to search for something by putting your hand deeply into a bag, container etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔把手伸到袋子﹑容器等的深处〕搜寻﹐翻找

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He delved into his pocket and brought out a notebook.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸手在口袋里翻找﹐拿出一本笔记本来。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Democrat or 或 Democratic 〔美国〕民主党党员﹐民主党支持者﹔〔美国〕民主党的﹐支持民主党的

Sense.DEF:
to take away the
magnetic
qualities of something
Sense.TRAN: 除去〔某物〕的磁性﹐使消磁

Sense.DEF: a political leader who tries to make people feel strong emotions in order to influence their opinions – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 蛊惑民心的政客﹐煽动民众的政客〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the need or desire that people have for particular goods and services
Sense.EXAMPLE: Production is still increasing faster than demand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产仍比需求增长快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the demand for new housing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对新住房的需求

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As a speaker he was always in demand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一位演讲者﹐他始终受到欢迎。

Sense.DEF: a very firm request for something that you believe you have the right to get
Sense.EXAMPLE: demonstrations in support of the nationalists’ demands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声援民族主义者要求的示威游行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: their demand for higher salaries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们提高工资的要求

GramExa.EXAMPLE: demands that he should resign
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求他辞职的呼声

Sense.DEF: the difficult, annoying, or tiring things that you need to do, or a skill you need to have
Sense.TRAN: 要求〔指需要做的困难事情或需要掌握的技能〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the demands of modern life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代生活的种种要求

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The curriculum makes great demands on the teacher.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程对教师提出了很高的要求。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are heavy demands on people’s time these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今﹐人们的时间都很紧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the increased demands placed on police officers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对警察越来越高的要求

Sense.DEF: when a lot of people have asked for something to be done, performed etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exhibition will run for an extra week, due to popular demand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应公众要求﹐这次展览将延长一周。

Sense.DEF: whenever someone asks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Should you feed your baby on demand, or stick to a timetable?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给宝宝喂食应该按需还是按时？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of people want something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Demand for housing is higher than ever.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 住房需求比以往任何时候都要大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not many people want something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Recently the demand for new cars has been relatively low.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来,新车需求相对较少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s always a big demand for photographs of celebrities.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于名人照片的需求一直很大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a huge demand for business software and services.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业软件和服务的需求量巨大。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 增长的/正在增长的/正在增加的需求
Collocate.EXAMPLE: One of the problems is the growing demand for housing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题之一是日益增长的住房需求。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decreasing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the falling demand for coal
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤炭需求量的减少

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the desire of consumers to buy goods
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Consumer demand for new technology is strong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新技术的消费需求旺盛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: supply as much as people need or want
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are reports that the company cannot produce enough to meet demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有报道称,该公司的产量无法满足需求。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: satisfy the demand
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Public funding for higher education has not kept up with demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于高等教育的公共资金没有跟上需求。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: satisfy demand
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The existing services were not capable of coping with the demand for advice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现有的服务不能满足咨询需求。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A very hard winter boosted the demand for natural gas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 严冬推动了对天然气的需求。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Higher interest rates reduces the demand for credit.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率上调降低了信贷需求。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Demand for energy has continued to rise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 能源需求持续上升。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes lower
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Demand for the products has fallen in the last six months.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去的六个月中,这些产品的需求下降了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be wanted by a lot of people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fuel-efficient cars are now much in demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 时下低油耗汽车需求量很大。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: more is available than people need or want
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In the 1980s, the supply of grain far exceeded the demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代,粮食的供应远远超过需求。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many factories closed through lack of demand.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因需求不足,许多工厂关闭了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a sudden increase
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s often a surge in demand for the Internet at the weekend.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末时,对于因特网的需求常常会激增。

Sense.DEF: to ask for something very firmly, especially because you think you have a right to do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔坚决〕要求〔尤因认为有权这么做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Angry demonstrators demanded the resignation of two senior officials.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的示威者要求两名高级官员辞职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I demand to know what’s going on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要求知道发生了什么事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They demanded that the military government free all political prisoners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要求军政府释放所有政治犯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed that no matter what she did, more was demanded of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好像无论她做什么﹐都会有更多的要求等着她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where are you going?’ she demanded angrily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要去哪里？” 她气愤地质问道。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘demand for something’. Say 而要说 demand something: I demand my money back! 我要求退款！(NOT不说I demand for my money back!)

Sense.DEF: if one thing demands another, it needs that thing in order to happen or be done successfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Too many things demanded his attention at the same time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太多事情同时需要他的关注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a desperate situation demanding a desperate remedy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况危急﹐需要背水一战。

Sense.DEF: needing a lot of ability, effort, or skill
Sense.TRAN: 要求高的﹔需要技能的﹔费力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demanding job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高要求的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Climbing is physically demanding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爬山对身体素质要求很高。

Sense.DEF: expecting a lot of attention or expecting to have things exactly the way you want them, especially in a way that is not fair
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕要求严格的﹔〔尤指〕苛求的﹐要求过高的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother could be very demanding at times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈有时会十分苛刻。

Sense.DEF: to decide or mark the limits of an area, system etc
Sense.TRAN: 界定﹐标明〔一个地区﹑系统等〕的界线

Sense.DEF: the point at which one area of work, responsibility etc ends and another begins
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作范围﹑职责范围等的〕界限﹐分界线

GramExa.EXAMPLE: traditional lines of demarcation between medicine and surgery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 内科和外科之间的传统分界线

Sense.DEF: the process of deciding on or marking the border between two areas of land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exact demarcation of the north-south boundary
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南北分界线的精确界定

Sense.DEF: to do something that makes people lose respect for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: language that demeans women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侮辱女性的语言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t demean myself by begging him for a job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会自降身份去向他乞求一份工作。

Sense.DEF: showing less respect for someone than they deserve, or making someone feel embarrassed or ashamed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: policies demeaning to women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有损女性尊严的政策

Sense.EXAMPLE: I refuse to do demeaning work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拒绝做有失身份的工作。

Sense.DEF: the way someone behaves, dresses, speaks etc that shows what their character is like
Sense.TRAN: 〔反映某人性格特点的〕举止﹐外表﹐风度
Sense.EXAMPLE: his quiet, reserved demeanour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他少言寡语﹑含蓄的举止

Sense.DEF: crazy or behaving in a very strange way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was almost demented with grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她悲痛得几乎疯掉。

Sense.DEF: suffering from dementia
an illness that affects the brain and memory, and makes you gradually lose the ability to think and behave normally
a type of rough brown sugar
Sense.TRAN: 德麦拉拉蔗糖〔一种褐色粗蔗糖〕

Sense.DEF: to make one part of a large company into a separate company
Sense.TRAN: 分拆〔把大公司的一部分拆分为一个独立公司〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the takeover, several subsidiary companies were demerged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收购以后﹐几家子公司被拆分出去。

Sense.DEF: the action of making one part of a large company into a separate company
Sense.EXAMPLE: The demerger of the textile division is to go ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纺织部门即将拆分出去。

Sense.DEF: a bad quality or feature of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The merits and demerits the good and bad qualities of this argument have been explored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这一论点的优缺点已经作了探讨。

Sense.DEF: a mark showing that a student has behaved badly at school
Sense.TRAN: 过失〔学生在校行为不良的记录〕

Sense.DEF: in the past, a very big house and all the land that belonged to it
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时大片的〕自主地﹐庄园地产

Sense.DEF: half
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demisemiquaver very short musical note
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三十二分音符

Sense.DEF: someone who is so important and powerful that they are treated like a god
Sense.TRAN: 像神一样被崇拜的人物

Sense.DEF: a man in ancient stories, who is half god and half human
Sense.EXAMPLE: demigods such as Hercules
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如赫丘利这样的半人半神

Sense.DEF: a large bottle with a short narrow neck, used for making wine
to remove the weapons, soldiers etc from a country or area so that there can be no fighting there
Sense.EXAMPLE: the demilitarized zone between the two countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国之间的非军事化地区

Sense.DEF:
the process of removing
landmine s
from an area of land
the end of something that used to exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔曾经存在的事物的〕终止﹐结束﹐消亡

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the imminent demise happening soon of the local newspaper
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方报纸的即将停刊

Sense.DEF: death
Sense.EXAMPLE: the mystery surrounding Elena’s untimely demise when death happens sooner than is normal or expected
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃琳娜猝然早逝之谜

Sense.DEF: to remove mist from a car window, by using heat
Sense.TRAN: 除去〔汽车玻璃上〕的雾﹐给…除雾

Sense.DEF: a recording containing an example of someone’s music that is sent to a record company so that they can decide whether to produce it or not
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demo tape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录音样带

Sense.DEF: an event at which a large group of people publicly protest about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: pro-independence demos
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持独立的游行示威

Sense.DEF: an explanation of how something works

Subsense.DEF: an example of a product that is used to show what it is like or how it works
Subsense.EXAMPLE: demo homes on the new development
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新开发项目的样板房

Subsense.DEF: a computer program that shows what a new piece of software will be able to do when it is ready to be sold
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Click here to download a demo of the new version of our personal finance software.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击这里下载我们新版个人财务软件的演示版。

Sense.DEF: to show or explain how something works or is done, especially new computer equipment
Sense.TRAN: 示范﹐演示〔尤指新计算机设备〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re going to demo some of the new software at this year’s Mac convention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们打算在今年的苹果电脑大会上演示几个新的软件。

Sense.DEF: to demobilize soldiers etc
happy or behaving in a careless way because you are soon going to be leaving your job
Sense.TRAN: 因即将离职而逍遥自在的

Sense.DEF: to send home the members of an army, navy etc, especially at the end of a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: programmes to help demobilized soldiers fit into civilian life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助复员军人适应平民生活的方案

Sense.DEF: a system of government in which every citizen in the country can vote to elect its government officials
Sense.EXAMPLE: a return to democracy after 16 years of military rule
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 16年军人统治后民主制度的恢复

Sense.DEF: a country that has a government which has been elected by the people of the country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a parliamentary democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会民主制国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: Western democracies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方的民主国家

Sense.DEF: a situation or system in which everyone is equal and has the right to vote, make decisions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: democracy within the trade unions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会内部的民主

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in democracy, or works to achieve it
a member or supporter of the Democratic Party of the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕民主党党员﹐民主党支持者

Sense.DEF: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a democratic government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主政府
Sense.EXAMPLE: the role of the media in the democratic process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主进程中媒体的作用

Sense.DEF: organized according to the principle that everyone has a right to be involved in making decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a democratic management style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主的管理风格

Sense.DEF: organized according to the principle that everyone in a society is equally important, no matter how much money they have or what social class they come from
Sense.TRAN: 按民主原则组织的﹐体现民主的﹐平等的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a democratic society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主社会

Sense.DEF: belonging to or supporting the Democratic Party of the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕民主党的﹐支持民主党的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Democratic nominee for the presidency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党提名的总统候选人

Sense.DEF: to change the way in which a government, company etc is organized, so that it is more democratic
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to democratize school management structures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使学校管理体系民主化的努力

Sense.DEF: information about a group such as the people who live in a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 人口统计数据﹐人口统计资料
Sense.EXAMPLE: the demographics of a newspaper’s readership
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份报纸读者的统计数据

Sense.DEF: a part of the population that is considered as a group, especially by advertisers who want to sell things to that group
Sense.TRAN: 群体﹐人群〔尤指广告商的推销对象〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 21-40 demographic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 21至40岁的人群

Sense.DEF: the study of human populations and the ways in which they change, for example the study of how many births, marriages and deaths happen in a particular place at a particular time
to completely destroy a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: The entire east wing of the building was demolished in the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的整个东翼都被大火烧毁了。

Sense.DEF: to prove that an idea or opinion is completely wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: He demolished my argument in minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几分钟内就把我的论点驳倒了。

Sense.DEF: to end or ruin something completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: These ants can demolish large areas of forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些蚂蚁会彻底毁掉大片大片的森林。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone very easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miami demolished Texas 46-3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈阿密队以46比3大败得克萨斯队。

Sense.DEF: to eat all of something very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He demolished a second helping of pie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他狼吞虎咽地吃掉了第二份馅饼。

Sense.DEF: an act of criticizing someone severely or telling other people things about them which may be unfair or untrue, in order to harm them or to cause people to have a bad opinion of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused opposition leaders of doing a demolition job on the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责反对党领导人诋毁总统的声誉。

Sense.DEF: an event, especially a sports event, in which one person or team defeats the other one very easily

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Currie led the team with 55 points in the demolition job against Ireland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那场轻取爱尔兰队的比赛中﹐柯里得到55分﹐是全队最高的。

Sense.DEF:
an evil
spirit
or force
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was speeding down the motorway as if pursued by a demon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在高速公路上飞速行驶﹐就像有魔鬼在追赶他似的。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you anxious and causes you problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: She struggled with her husband’s demons of addiction and alcoholism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和丈夫身上吸毒﹑酗酒的恶习作斗争。

Sense.DEF: someone who is very good at something – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 好手﹐高手〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demon cook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹饪高手

Sense.DEF: alcoholic drink – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 含酒精的饮料〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: wild, uncontrolled, and evil
Sense.EXAMPLE: the demoniacal glint in his dark eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他黑色的眼睛里那邪恶的目光

Sense.DEF: wild and cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: demonic laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶魔般的笑

Sense.DEF: relating to a demon
Sense.EXAMPLE: the demonic forces in the universe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇宙中的邪恶力量

Sense.DEF: able to be shown or proved
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must provide demonstrable improvements in health services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公共医疗服务方面我们必须有实实在在的改进。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些结论可以证明是错误的。

Sense.DEF: to show or prove something clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study demonstrates the link between poverty and malnutrition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究证明了贫困与营养不良之间的联系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hitchcock’s films demonstrate that a British filmmaker could learn from Hollywood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希区柯克的影片证明﹐英国电影制作人可以向好莱坞学习。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This section will attempt to demonstrate how the Bank of England operates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一部分将试图说明英格兰银行是如何运作的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government now has an opportunity to demonstrate its commitment to reform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府现在有机会表明改革的决心了。

Sense.DEF: to show or describe how to do something or how something works

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ll be demonstrating how to handle modern, high performance cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们将演示如何操控现代化的高性能汽车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Instructors should demonstrate new movements before letting the class try them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练应该先进行示范﹐再让全班学生去做新的动作。

Sense.DEF: to protest or support something in public with a lot of other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supporters demonstrated outside the courtroom during the trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判期间﹐支持者们在法庭外示威。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are they demonstrating against?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在示威抗议什么？

Sense.DEF: to show that you have a particular ability, quality, or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 展示﹐表露出〔某种能力﹑品质或感情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has demonstrated an ability to meet deadlines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他展示了如期完成任务的能力。

Sense.DEF: an event at which a large group of people meet to protest or to support something in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supporters staged a demonstration outside the US embassy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持者在美国大使馆外举行了示威游行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police opened fire on a peaceful demonstration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察朝和平示威的人群开了枪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a demonstration against the government’s educational policies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对政府教育政策的游行示威

Sense.DEF: an act of explaining and showing how to do something or how something works

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave a practical demonstration of the boat’s military potential.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这种小艇的军事潜能作了实际操作演示。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a cookery demonstration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹饪示范

Sense.DEF: an action that proves that someone or something has a particular ability, quality, or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 〔能力﹑品质或感情的〕表示﹐表露

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The high level of calls is a clear demonstration of the need for this service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的来电明确地表示了对这种服务的需求。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a physical demonstration of affection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱的肢体表达

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: organize and take part in one
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In April, students began holding demonstrations to demand more freedom.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 四月,学生开始举行示威,要求更多自由。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A large demonstration was organized by the opposition.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对派组织了一场大规模的示威游行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As many as 400,000 people took part in the demonstration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 多达40万人参加了示威游行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take part in a demonstration
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I've never been on a demonstration before.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从没参加过示威游行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They were prevented by police from joining the demonstration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们受到警察阻拦,不能参加示威游行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: prevent it from continuing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police moved in to break up the demonstration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方出动驱散了示威人群。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: cause it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The incident sparked a demonstration of 2,000 people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该事件引发了2,000 人的示威游行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Violent street demonstrations took place in the capital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 首都发生了暴力的街头示威。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Opponents of the new law are planning a big demonstration next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法的反对者正计划下周举行大型示威游行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: a series of massive demonstrations against the war
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列大规模反战示威

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: involving a very large number of people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There have been mass demonstrations in some American cities.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的一些城市发生了大规模群众示威。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone has the right to take part in peaceful demonstrations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都有参加和平示威的权利。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nine people have been killed during violent demonstrations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 九人在暴力示威中身亡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in the streets of a city
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A street demonstration completely blocked the centre of the city.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场街头示威将市中心堵得严严实实。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: by students
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In France, student demonstrations were disrupting university teaching.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在法国,学生示威打乱了大学的教学秩序。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: by members of the public
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A series of public demonstrations have been held in cities across the country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国各地的城市举行了一连串的民众示威。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which people protest against something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The price increases were met by a series of strikes and protest demonstrations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格上涨引来一系列罢工和抗议示威。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to protest about the government or a political policy
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was arrested twice for her part in political demonstrations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她两次因参加政治示威而被捕。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 反政府/争取民主等的示威
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There have been further violent anti-government demonstrations this week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周又发生了更多的暴力反政府示威。

Collocate.COLLOC: a demonstration in support of sth/sb
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 支持某事物/某人的示威
Collocate.EXAMPLE: public demonstrations in support of the rebels
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持反叛者的民众示威游行

Collocate.COLLOC: a demonstration in protest at sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There were demonstrations in protest at the food shortages.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生了抗议食品短缺的示威活动。

Sense.DEF: willing to show that you care about someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother wasn’t demonstrative; she never hugged me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲感情内敛﹐从未拥抱过我。

Sense.DEF: one of the words ‘this’, ‘that’, ‘these’, and ‘those’
someone who takes part in a demonstration
Sense.EXAMPLE: anti-war demonstrators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反战示威者

Sense.DEF: someone who shows people how to do something or how something works
to reduce or destroy someone’s courage or confidence
Sense.TRAN: 使意志消沉﹐使情绪低落﹐打击…的信心
Sense.EXAMPLE: The illness demoralized him and recovery took several weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场病使他情绪低落﹐好几个星期才恢复。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The refugees were cold, hungry, and demoralized.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民又冷又饿﹐情绪沮丧。

Sense.DEF: to make someone’s rank or position lower or less important
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某人〕降级﹐将〔某人〕降职
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sergeant was demoted to private.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名中士被降为列兵。

Sense.DEF: used by or popular with most ordinary people
making someone less eager or willing to do their job
Sense.TRAN: 使人失去动力的﹐使人消极的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tasks that do not challenge you can be very demotivating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏挑战性的任务会使人失去干劲。

Sense.DEF: to express doubt about or opposition to a plan or suggestion
Sense.TRAN: 提出异议﹐表示反对﹐拒绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: They demurred politely, but finally agreed to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们礼貌地推却﹐但最后还是同意留下。

Sense.DEF: disagreement or disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I agreed to this without demur.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我赞同此事﹐没有异议。

Sense.DEF: quiet, serious, and well-behaved – used especially about women in the past
Sense.TRAN: 端庄娴静的〔尤指旧时妇女〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Old photos of Maggie show her young and demure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老照片上的玛吉显得年轻而又端庄娴静。

Sense.DEF: demure clothes do not show much of a woman’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demure white dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 端庄的白色连衣裙

Sense.DEF: to make a subject that seems difficult or complicated easier to understand, especially by explaining it in simpler language
Sense.TRAN: 使〔似乎困难或复杂的问题〕容易理解﹐简明地解释
Sense.EXAMPLE: This book demystifies the male worlds of plumbing and carpentry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书让水管工和木工等男性活计不再神秘。

Sense.DEF:
the home of some animals, for example lions or
fox es
a place where secret or illegal activities take place
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事秘密或非法活动的〕巢穴﹐窝点
Sense.EXAMPLE: corrupt gambling dens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 藏污纳垢的赌窟
Sense.EXAMPLE: a den of thieves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贼窝

Sense.DEF: an enclosed and secret place where children play
a room in a house where people relax, watch television etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔家中休息﹑看电视等的〕休息室

Sense.DEF: a small room in a house where people can work, read etc without being interrupted
Sense.TRAN: 〔家中的〕安静小天地﹔书房﹐书斋
Sense.EXAMPLE: Father retreated to his den.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸躲进了自己的小天地里。

Sense.DEF: a place where activities that you think are immoral or evil happen – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 罪恶之地〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother was convinced that London was a den of iniquity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈相信伦敦是个罪恶之城。

Sense.DEF: to sell a business or industry that is owned by the state, so that it is then owned privately

an illness commonly found in hot countries, caused by the bite of a
mosquito
which has been infected with a
virus
. People with the illness have a fever and pain in their head, muscles, and joints.
a statement saying that something is not true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government issued an official denial of the rumour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府发表了正式声明﹐否认谣言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: denials that border security had not been strict enough
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对边境安全措施不够严格的否认

Sense.DEF: when someone refuses to allow someone else to have or to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: protests against the denial of human rights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对剥夺人权的抗议

Sense.DEF: a condition in which you refuse to admit or believe that something bad exists or has happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔对坏事的〕拒绝承认﹐不肯相信

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His girlfriend is in denial, and refuses to admit that he will soon die.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的女友不肯接受事实﹐拒不相信他很快就要死了。

Sense.DEF:
an attempt to make a company’s website stop working. This is done by sending so much
data
to the website that the company’s computers become unable to work properly. The result is that customers of the company cannot use the online services that the company provides.
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝服务攻击〔指向某公司网站发送大量信息导致该公司的计算机无法正常工作﹐从而使客户不能使用该公司提供的在线服务〕

Sense.DEF:
a unit for measuring how thin
nylon
, silk etc thread is
Sense.TRAN: 旦尼尔﹐旦〔尼龙﹑丝等的纤度单位〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pair of 15-denier tights
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条15旦纤度的紧身裤袜

Sense.DEF: to say things to make someone or something seem less important or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who denigrate their own country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贬损自己国家的人

Sense.DEF:
a type of strong cotton cloth used especially to make
jean s
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于制作牛仔裤的〕粗斜棉布﹐劳动布

Sense.DEF: an animal, plant, or person that lives or is found in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 〔特定地区的〕动物﹐植物﹐栖息者﹐居民

Sense.DEF: to officially set the value of something according to one system or type of money
a religious group that has different beliefs from other groups within the same religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christians of all denominations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各教派的基督徒

Sense.DEF: the value shown on a coin, paper money, or a stamp
relating or belonging to a particular religious denomination

the number below the line in a
fraction
to mean something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

Sense.DEF: to represent or be a sign of something
Sense.TRAN: 表示〔是…的符号﹑标志等〕﹐代表
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crosses on the map denote villages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图上的叉号表示村庄。

Sense.DEF: the exciting last part of a story or play
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plot takes us to Paris for the denouement of the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事的情节把我们带到巴黎﹐迎来大结局。

Sense.DEF: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group denounced the failure by the authorities to take action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体谴责当局没有采取行动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He denounced the election as a farce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责这场选举是闹剧。

Sense.DEF: to give information to the police or another authority about someone’s illegal political activities
Sense.TRAN: 告发﹐检举﹐举报〔某人的非法政治活动〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She denounced him to the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向警方告发了他。

Sense.DEF: made of or containing a lot of things or people that are very close together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A narrow track wound steeply up through dense forest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条狭窄陡峭的小道穿过茂密的森林蜿蜒而上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a dense rurally-based population
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居住在乡村的密集人口

Sense.DEF: difficult to see through or breathe in
Sense.TRAN: 浓密的﹐不易看透[呼吸]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: dense black smoke
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓浓的黑烟

Sense.DEF: not able to understand things easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Am I being dense? I don’t quite understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是我太笨了吗？我不太明白。

Sense.DEF: a dense piece of writing is difficult to understand because it contains a lot of information or uses complicated language
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章等因信息量大或语言复杂而〕难懂的

Sense.DEF:
a substance that is dense has a lot of
mass
in relation to its size
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water is nearly eight hundred times denser than air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水的密度是空气的将近800倍。

Sense.DEF: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the size and density of settlements
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 定居点的规模和密度

Sense.EXAMPLE: areas of high population density
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口密度高的地区

Sense.DEF:
the relationship between the
mass
of something and its size
a hollow area in the surface of something, usually made by something hitting it
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常由于碰撞而造成的〕凹痕﹐凹坑

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a large dent in the passenger door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客门上有一大块凹陷。

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trip made a big dent in our savings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅行花掉了我们一大笔积蓄。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Eight years of effort have hardly put a dent in drug trafficking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八年的努力几乎没有减少贩毒活动。

Sense.DEF: if you dent something, or if it dents, you hit or press it so that its surface is bent inwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one was injured, but the car was scratched and dented.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人受伤﹐只是汽车被剐蹭并撞出了凹痕。

Sense.DEF: to damage or harm something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal has dented his reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻损害了他的名誉。

Sense.DEF: relating to your teeth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dental care was free in the 60s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在60年代﹐牙齿护理是免费的。

Sense.DEF: thin strong string that you use for cleaning between your teeth
someone who works with a dentist and cleans people’s teeth, or gives them advice about how to look after their teeth
someone whose job is to help a dentist
a dentist who can perform operations in the mouth
the type of bone that your teeth are made of
someone whose job is to treat people’s teeth

GramExa.GLOSS: the place where a dentist works
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to the dentist this afternoon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我要去看牙医。

Sense.DEF: the medical study of the mouth and teeth, or the work of a dentist
Sense.TRAN: 口腔医学﹐牙医学﹔牙医术﹔牙医业

Sense.DEF: a set of artificial teeth worn by someone who does not have their own teeth any longer
to remove the plants and trees that cover an area of land
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hillside denuded in a fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被一场火烧得光秃秃的山坡

Sense.DEF: to take something away from someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fact that people have left farm work has denuded many villages of their working populations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们脱离农业生产﹐使得许多村庄失去了劳动人口。

Sense.DEF: a public statement in which you criticize someone or something
to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve never denied that there is a housing problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未否认过住房问题的存在。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t deny her remarks hurt me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能否认她的话伤害了我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two men have denied murdering a woman at a remote picnic spot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子否认在一个偏僻的野餐地点谋杀一名女子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jackson vehemently denied the allegations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊断然否认这些指控。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government denied the existence of poverty among 16- and 17-year-olds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府否认十六七岁的青少年当中存在贫困问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men have denied charges of theft.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几名男子否认了盗窃指控。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to allow someone to have or do something
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝﹐不允许〔某人拥有某物或做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: landowners who deny access to the countryside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拒绝开放乡村的地主

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could deny her son nothing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对儿子有求必应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is the only country in Europe to deny cancer screening to its citizens.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是欧洲唯一不为国民提供癌症筛查的国家。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is very clear that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no denying that this is an important event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无可否认﹐这是个重要事件。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to admit that you are feeling something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emotions can become destructive if they are suppressed and denied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情绪如受到压抑和否认﹐就可能变得有害。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to have something that you would like, especially for moral or religious reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指出于道德或宗教原因〕节制﹔戒绝﹐禁绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: He denied himself all pleasures and luxuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摒弃一切享乐和奢华。

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance that you put on the skin under your arms to stop you from smelling bad
to remove a bad smell or to make it less noticeable
to leave, especially when you are starting a journey
Sense.TRAN: 离开〔尤指动身去旅行〕﹐起程﹐上路

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ocean liners arriving at and departing from the island
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到达和离开这座岛的远洋客轮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dorothy departed for Germany last week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周多萝西出发去德国了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲航空公司的航班每逢周二从盖特威克机场起飞。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say leave or go rather than depart .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 leave 或 go ,而不说 depart
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What time does the next plane leave/go ?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一班飞机什么时候起飞？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She left for Germany last week.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上周去了德国。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Flights leave from Gatwick on Tuesdays.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周二有航班从盖特威克机场起飞。

Sense.DEF: to die
to start to use new ideas or do something in a different way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s revolutionary music; it departs from the old form and structures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是革命性的音乐﹐突破了旧的形式和结构。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In his speech, the President departed from his text only once.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统讲话中只有一次脱开了讲稿。

Sense.DEF: to leave an organization or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s departing chairman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司将要离职的主席

Sense.DEF: dead – used in order to avoid saying the word ‘dead’
Sense.TRAN: 已故的﹐去世的〔“死”的委婉语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: his dear departed wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已故的爱妻

Sense.DEF: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government
Sense.TRAN: 〔医院﹑大学﹑公司﹑政府等的〕科﹐系﹐处﹐部
Sense.EXAMPLE: the personnel department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人事部
Sense.EXAMPLE: the English department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Department of the Environment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境部

Sense.DEF: an area in a large shop where a particular type of product is sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: the toy department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玩具部

Sense.DEF: if something is someone’s department, they are responsible for it or know a lot about it
Sense.TRAN: 是某人的职责﹔是某人的专长
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see what I can do, but it’s not really my department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看看能做什么﹐不过这其实不属于我的职责范围。

Sense.DEF: a particular part of someone’s character, or a particular part of a larger activity or subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔个性的〕某一方面﹔〔大型活动等的〕某一部分内容
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave was lacking in the trustworthiness department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫在讲信用这一点上是有欠缺的。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into different departments
a large shop that is divided into separate departments, each selling a different type of goods
an act of leaving a place, especially at the start of a journey

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I saw Simon shortly before his departure for Russia.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙去俄罗斯前不久我见过他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a delay in the departure of our plane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞机起飞延误了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mozart’s departure from Paris in September 1778
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1778年9月莫扎特离开巴黎

Sense.DEF: an act of leaving an organization or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He refused to discuss his departure from the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝谈论离开政府一事。

Sense.DEF: a flight, train etc that leaves at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several departures for New York every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天有好几个班次去纽约。

Sense.DEF: a way of doing something that is different from the usual, traditional, or expected way
Sense.TRAN: 〔对惯例﹑传统或人们所期望的方式的〕背离﹐违反

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their new designs represent a departure from their usual style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的新设计脱离了一贯的风格。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This would be a radical departure from the subsidy system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对津贴制度来说将是一项重大的变革。

Sense.DEF: the place at an airport where people wait until their plane is ready to leave
a big screen at an airport or station that shows the times at which planes or trains leave
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机场的〕出发航班告示板﹔〔火车站的〕出发车次告示板

Sense.DEF: used to say that you cannot give a definite answer to something because your answer will be affected by something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How long are you staying?’ ‘I don’t know; it depends.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你打算逗留多久？” “我不知道﹐得看情况。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You may take several months to reach your target weight – it depends how much you want to lose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要达到目标体重也许需要几个月时间——这取决于你想减掉多少体重。

Sense.DEF: if something depends on something else, it is directly affected or decided by that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The length of time spent exercising depends on the sport you are training for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼时间长短取决于训练的体育项目。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Choosing the right bike depends on what you want to use it for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选择哪一种自行车合适取决于你的用途。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The expenses you claim can vary enormously, depending on travel distances involved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报销的金额可能相差很大﹐要看旅程的长短。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 one thing ‘is depend on’ another. Say that 而要说 one thing depends on or 或 is dependent on another.

Sense.DEF: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country depends heavily on its tourist trade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家非常依赖旅游业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We depend entirely on donations from the public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完全依赖公众的捐助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many women have to depend on their husbands for their state pension.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多妇女不得不依靠她们的丈夫才取得政府养老金。

GramExa.PROPFORM: depend on sb/sth to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m depending on you to tell me everything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我指望你能告诉我所有的情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re depending on him finishing the job by Friday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们指望他在星期五前完成这项工作。

Sense.DEF: to trust or have confidence in someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

Sense.DEF: able to be trusted to do what you need or expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: our most dependable ally
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最可靠的盟友
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dependable source of income
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可靠的收入来源

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a child, who depends on you for food, clothes, money etc
Sense.TRAN: 被扶养人﹐依赖他人生活的人〔尤指孩子〕

Sense.DEF: when you depend on the help and support of someone or something else in order to exist or be successful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: our dependence on oil as a source of energy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对石油能源的依赖
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the financial dependency of some women on men
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些女性对男性的经济依赖

Sense.DEF:
when someone is
addicted
to drugs or alcohol
when one thing is strongly affected by another thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the mutual dependence of profit and growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润和增长的相互依存

Sense.EXAMPLE: drug dependency
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药物依赖

Sense.DEF: a country that is controlled by another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s Caribbean dependencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的加勒比海属地

Sense.DEF: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Norway’s economy is heavily dependent on natural resources.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 挪威的经济严重依赖自然资源。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any dependent children who you are still supporting financially ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

Sense.DEF:
addicted
to drugs, alcohol etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the needs of people dependent on drugs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 药物依赖者的需要

Sense.EXAMPLE: a danger of becoming alcohol dependent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产生酒精依赖的危险

Sense.DEF: to be directly affected or decided by something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your pay is dependent on how much you produce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的薪酬取决于你的产量。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
dependant

a
clause
in a sentence that gives information related to the main clause, but cannot exist alone
to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The god is depicted as a bird with a human head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个神被描绘成人首鸟身的形象。

Sense.DEF: a substance that gets rid of unwanted hair from your body
to get off a plane
to reduce the amount of something that is present or available
Sense.EXAMPLE: Salmon populations have been severely depleted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲑鱼种群大大减少了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the depletion of the ozone layer

Sense.DEF: very bad, unpleasant, and shocking
Sense.TRAN: 恶劣的﹔可悲的﹔令人震惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prisoners were held in deplorable conditions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯被关押在极其恶劣的环境里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His conduct was deplorable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为令人震惊。

Sense.DEF: to disapprove of something very strongly and criticize it severely, especially publicly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN deplored the invasion as a ‘violation of international law’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国谴责这次入侵 “违反了国际法” 。

Sense.DEF: to organize or move soldiers, military equipment etc so that they are in the right place and ready to be used
Sense.TRAN: 部署﹐调度〔士兵﹑军事装备等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: NATO’s decision to deploy cruise missiles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北约要部署巡航导弹的决定

Sense.DEF: to use something for a particular purpose, especially ideas, arguments etc
Sense.TRAN: 利用﹐调动〔尤指想法﹑论据等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job in which a variety of professional skills will be deployed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要用到多项专业技术的工作

Sense.DEF:
a way of keeping control over an area in which the police deliberately ignore small crimes by members of ethnic minorities(
ethnic minority
)so that they are not
accuse d
of
racism treating members of a particular race unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 降低执法〔警方故意忽略少数民族的轻微犯罪以免被指种族歧视的一种做法〕

Sense.DEF: to remove political influence or control from a situation
Sense.TRAN: 使非政治化﹐使不受政治影响

Sense.DEF: to greatly reduce the number of people living in a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 大大减少〔某一地区〕的人口
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disease depopulated the whole region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病使整个地区人口大量减少。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a country and return to the country they came from, especially because they do not have a legal right to stay
Sense.TRAN: 将〔尤指无合法居住权的外国人〕驱逐出境

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was deported from Ecuador when his visa expired.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 签证过期后他被驱逐出厄瓜多尔。

Sense.DEF: someone who has been deported or is going to be deported
the way that someone stands and walks
Sense.EXAMPLE: lessons in manners and deportment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 礼仪课程

Sense.DEF: the way that someone behaves in public
to remove a leader or ruler from a position of power
Sense.TRAN: 罢免﹐废黜〔领导人或统治者〕

Sense.DEF: a part of the cost of something you are buying that you pay some time before you pay the rest of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A deposit of 10% is required.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求预付10%的订金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We put down a deposit on a house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们支付了买房子的订金。

Sense.DEF: money that you pay when you rent something such as an apartment or car, which will be given back if you do not damage it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We ask for one month’s rent in advance, plus a deposit of $500.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要求预付一个月的租金﹐再加500美元的押金。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to make a deposit pay some money into my savings account.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

Sense.DEF: a layer of a mineral, metal etc that is left in soil or rocks through a natural process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rich deposits of gold in the hills
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山区丰富的金矿床

Sense.DEF: an amount or layer of a substance that gradually develops in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: fatty deposits on the heart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

Sense.DEF:
an amount of money paid by a
candidate
in a political election in Britain, that is returned to them if they get enough votes
Sense.TRAN: 竞选保证金〔英国政治选举的候选人所付的保证金﹐如果得到足够的选票﹐保证金将退回〕

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 丧失竞选保证金﹐选票不足

Sense.DEF: to put something down in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The female deposits her eggs directly into the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雌性把卵直接产在水中。

Sense.DEF: to leave a layer of a substance on the surface of something, especially gradually
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河水流速变慢时﹐一层泥土便沉积下来。

Sense.DEF: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
Sense.TRAN: 将〔钱或贵重物品〕存入〔银行或其他安全的地方〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dollars are then deposited with banks outside the USA.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些美金随后被存入了美国境外的银行。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say they put in or pay in money, rather than deposit money.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 put in 或 pay in money ,而不说 deposit money
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I paid/put $100 into his account.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我往他账户里打进 100 美元。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You should put your valuables in the hotel safe.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 贵重物品应该存放在酒店保险箱里。

Sense.DEF:
a bank account that pays
interest
on the money that you leave in it
the natural process of depositing a substance on rocks or soil
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deposition of marine sediments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洋沉积物的沉积

Sense.DEF: a statement written or recorded for a court of law, by someone who has promised to tell the truth
the act of removing someone from a position of power
someone who puts money in a bank or other financial organization
a place where something can be safely kept
a place where goods are stored until they are needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s distribution depot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的发货仓库
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fuel storage depot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燃料储存仓库

Sense.DEF: a place where buses etc are kept and repaired
Sense.TRAN: 公共汽车/有轨电车等车库[修理场]

Sense.DEF: a railway station or bus station, especially a small one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指小型的〕火车站﹐公共汽车站

Sense.DEF: to be an evil influence on someone, especially someone who is young or not very experienced
Sense.TRAN: 使〔尤指年轻人或缺乏经验者〕堕落﹐败坏

Sense.DEF: completely evil or morally unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 邪恶的﹐腐化的﹐道德败坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a killer’s depraved mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶手邪恶的内心世界

Sense.DEF: to strongly disapprove of or criticize something
expressing criticism or disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: She glanced at me in a deprecating way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她责备地瞥了我一眼。

Sense.DEF: intended to make someone feel less annoyed or disapproving
Sense.TRAN: 表示歉意的﹐请求宽恕的﹔息事宁人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deprecating smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满歉意的一笑

Sense.DEF: to decrease in value or price
Sense.EXAMPLE: New cars depreciate in value quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新车掉价很快。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the value of something over time, especially for tax purposes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Company computers are depreciated at 50% per year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司电脑每年的折旧率为50%。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: those who depreciate the importance of art in education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贬低艺术在教育中重要性的那些人

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the value or price of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the depreciation of the dollar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元的贬值

Sense.DEF: an act of taking or destroying something
to make someone feel very unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of taking the exam again depressed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要补考﹐他就心情沮丧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It depresses me that nobody seems to care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎没有人在乎﹐这让我感到很沮丧。

Sense.DEF:
to prevent an
economy
from being as active and successful as it usually is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several factors combined to depress the American economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个因素加在一起造成了美国经济的不景气。

Sense.DEF: to press something down, especially a part of a machine
Sense.TRAN: 按下﹐压下﹐推下〔尤指机器的一部分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Depress the clutch fully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把离合器踩到底。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say they push (down) or press (down) a button rather than depress it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 push (down) 或 press (down) a button ,而不说 depress a button
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Push this button for cold water.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要冷水就按这个按钮。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Push the clutch down fully.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 把离合器踩到底。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the value of prices or wages
Sense.EXAMPLE: High interest rates may depress share prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高利率可能打压股价。

Sense.DEF: a substance or drug that makes your body processes slower and makes you feel very relaxed or sleepy

Subsense.DEF: very unhappy
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She felt lonely and depressed .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到孤独和沮丧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t get depressed about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别为这事沮丧。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The divorce left him deeply depressed .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚使他变得非常消沉。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was depressed at the thought of all the hard work ahead.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到有那么多艰苦的工作要做﹐我就发愁。

Subsense.DEF: suffering from a medical condition in which you are so unhappy that you cannot live a normal life
Subsense.EXAMPLE: patients who are clinically depressed
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临床诊断患有抑郁症的病人

Sense.DEF: an area, industry etc that is depressed does not have enough economic or business activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔地区﹑产业等〕不景气的﹐萧条的﹐经济困难的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s depressed housing market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国不景气的房产市场

Sense.DEF: a depressed level or amount is lower than normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a depressed appetite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食欲不振

Sense.DEF: making you feel very sad
Sense.TRAN: 令人沮丧的﹐让人忧愁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a depressing thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个令人沮丧的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole experience was very depressing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个经历非常令人沮丧。

Subsense.DEF: a medical condition that makes you very unhappy and anxious and often prevents you from living a normal life
Subsense.EXAMPLE: women who suffer from post-natal depression that sometimes happens after the birth of a baby
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患产后抑郁症的女性

Subsense.DEF: a feeling of sadness that makes you think there is no hope for the future
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lucy’s mood was one of deep depression .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西的情绪极度消沉。

Sense.DEF: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs
a long period during which there is very little business activity and a lot of people do not have jobs
Sense.TRAN: 经济萧条期﹐不景气时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: the devastating effects of economic depression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济萧条的灾难性影响

Sense.DEF: a part of a surface that is lower than the other parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: depressions in the ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面上的坑

Sense.DEF: a mass of air under low pressure, that usually causes rain

relating to or suffering from
depression
Sense.EXAMPLE: patients with depressive symptoms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有抑郁症状的病人

Sense.DEF:
someone who suffers from
depression
the lack of something that you need in order to be healthy, comfortable, or happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sleep deprivation can result in mental disorders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏睡眠会引起精神紊乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Low birth weight is related to economic deprivation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出生体重低与经济贫困有关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the deprivations of prison life
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狱中生活的苦头

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from having something, especially something that they need or should have
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of these children have been deprived of a normal home life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子中有许多被剥夺了正常的家庭生活。

Sense.DEF: not having the things that are necessary for a comfortable or happy life
Sense.EXAMPLE: Deprived children tend to do less well at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困的孩子往往学习成绩较差。

GramExa.GLOSS: where a lot of deprived people live
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫民区
GramExa.EXAMPLE: our deprived inner cities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们贫困的老城区

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= department 〔医院﹑大学﹑公司﹑政府等的〕科﹐系﹐处﹐部

Subsense.DEF: the distance from the top surface of something such as a river or hole to the bottom of it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a sea with an average depth of 35 metres
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平均深度为35米的一片海域

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cave descends to a depth of 340 feet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩洞往下延伸达340英尺深。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plant the beans at a depth of about six inches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些豆子种在地下大约六英寸深的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a channel of two feet in depth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两英尺深的一条沟

Subsense.DEF: the distance from the front to the back of an object
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The depth of the shelves is about 35 cm.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 架子的进深约35厘米。

Sense.DEF: how strong an emotion is or how serious a situation is
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感的〕强烈程度﹔〔情况的〕严重程度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the depth of public feeling on this issue
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上民众情绪的强烈程度

Sense.EXAMPLE: People need to realize the depth of the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们必须认识到这个问题的严重程度。

Subsense.DEF: the quality of having a lot of knowledge, understanding, or experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was impressed by the depth of her knowledge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的知识深度给我留下了深刻印象。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: a man of great depth and insight
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有渊博学识和深刻洞察力的男人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s quiet, but perhaps she has hidden depths .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她沉默寡言﹐不过也有可能是深藏不露。

Subsense.DEF: when a lot of details about a subject are provided or considered
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对某一专题所提供的信息的〕深度﹐详细程度
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Network news coverage often lacks depth.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视网络上的新闻报道常常缺乏深度。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The subject was discussed in great depth .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这一话题的讨论十分深入。

Subsense.DEF: to be involved in a situation or activity that is too difficult for you to understand or deal with
Subsense.TRAN: 不能理解﹐超出本身的能力
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I felt completely out of my depth at the meeting.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在会上感到自己一点都听不懂。

Subsense.DEF: to be in water that is too deep for you to stand in

Sense.DEF: when a bad feeling or situation is at its worst level
Sense.TRAN: 〔坏情绪或坏情况〕最强烈的时刻﹐最糟糕的时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in the depths of despair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她处于绝望的深渊之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country was recovering from the depths of recession .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家正在从最严重的经济衰退中恢复过来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the depths of the ocean/countryside/forest etc
Sense.DEF: the part that is furthest away from people, and most difficult to reach
Sense.TRAN: 海洋深处/偏远的乡村/森林深处等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Astronomers may one day travel to the depths of space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天文学家也许有一天可以到太空深处去。

Sense.DEF: the middle of winter, especially when it is very cold
the deepest parts of the sea
a bomb that explodes at a particular depth under water
a small group of people who are sent to talk to someone in authority, as representatives of a larger group
Sense.TRAN: 〔代表大批人与当权者谈判的〕代表团

Sense.DEF: to tell or allow someone to do something instead of you
Sense.TRAN: 委派某人做某事﹐授权某人做某事

Sense.DEF: to do the work of someone of a higher rank than you for a short time because they are unable to do it
Sense.TRAN: 代理〔职位较高的人的〕职务﹐充当代表

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jed could deputise for Stewart, if necessary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 必要时杰德可以代理斯图尔特的职务。

Sense.DEF: to give someone below you in rank the authority to do your work for a short time, usually because you are unable to do it
Sense.TRAN: 委任〔下级〕代理工作﹐委派〔下级〕当代表

Sense.DEF: someone who is directly below another person in rank, and who is officially in charge when that person is not there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Deputy Secretary of State
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 助理国务卿

Sense.DEF:
someone whose job is to help a
sheriff
in the US
a member of parliament in some countries, for example France
if a train derails or something derails it, it goes off the tracks
to spoil or interrupt a plan, agreement etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mistake that might derail the negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能会扰乱谈判的失误

Sense.DEF: someone who is deranged behaves in a crazy or dangerous way, usually because they are mentally ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: a deranged gunman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神错乱的枪手

Sense.DEF: used in the names of some well-known horse races
Sense.TRAN: 马赛〔用于著名的马赛名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Kentucky Derby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯塔基德比赛马会

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德比马赛〔英格兰著名马赛〕

Sense.DEF: a sports match between two teams from the same area or city
Sense.TRAN: 德比大赛〔同一地区或城市的两队之间的体育比赛〕

Sense.DEF: a man’s hard round hat that is usually black
a particular type of race or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: a donkey derby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑驴大赛

Sense.DEF: a very important yearly horse race held at Epsom in England in May or June, on a day which is known as Derby Day
Sense.TRAN: 德比马赛〔每年五六月在英格兰埃普瑟姆举行的重大马赛〕

Sense.DEF: to remove government rules and controls from some types of business activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: industries that have been deregulated
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解除管制的行业

Sense.DEF: a derelict building or piece of land is in very bad condition because it has not been used for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或土地〕废弃的﹐弃置的

Sense.DEF: someone who has no money or home, lives on the streets, and is very dirty – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 无家可归者﹐社会弃儿〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: when someone fails to do what they should do as part of their job
the state of being derelict
Sense.EXAMPLE: areas of industrial dereliction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业废弃地区

Sense.DEF: to make remarks or jokes that show you think someone or something is silly or useless
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t deride their efforts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不应该嘲笑他们的努力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party was derided as totally lacking in ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们嘲笑该党了无新意。

Sense.DEF: considered to be necessary if you want to be accepted, fashionable etc – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔按照礼节﹑时尚等〕必需的〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the gleaming white teeth that are de rigueur for movie stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影星必不可少的亮白牙齿

Sense.DEF: when you show that you think someone or something is stupid or silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His speech was greeted with derision by opposition leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的演讲遭到反对党领袖的讥笑。

Sense.DEF: showing that you think someone or something is stupid or silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: derisive laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘲讽的笑

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is derisory is so small that it is not worth considering seriously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unions described the pay offer as derisory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会称资方提出的工资低得可笑。

Sense.DEF: something that is derivable can be calculated from something else
the origin of something, especially a word
something that has developed or been produced from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Heroin is a derivative of morphine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海洛因是吗啡的提取物。

Sense.DEF:
a type of financial
investment
Sense.EXAMPLE: the derivatives market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金融衍生品市场

Sense.DEF: not new or invented, but copied or taken from something else – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 非独创的﹐模仿他人的﹐抄袭的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a derivative text
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 依样画葫芦的文章

Sense.DEF: to get something, especially an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from something
Sense.TRAN: 得到﹐获得〔优势或愉快的感受〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Medically, we will derive great benefit from this technique.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从医学的角度来讲﹐这一技术将使我们受益匪浅。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many students derived enormous satisfaction from the course.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生从这门课程中得到了巨大的满足。

Sense.DEF: to develop or come from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This word is derived from Latin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该词源自拉丁语。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: patterns of behaviour that derive from basic beliefs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 源于基本信仰的行为模式

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something comes from something rather than is derived from something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般用 come from 表示“源自”的意思,而不用 be derived from
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This word comes from Latin.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 该词源自拉丁语。

Sense.DEF: to get a chemical substance from another substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The enzyme is derived from human blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种酶是从人体血液中提取的。

Sense.DEF:
to remove something from a surface, using the edge of a
scalpel
or knife etc

a type of
surgery
that removes the top layers of someone’s skin in order to make the skin below look smoother and to make new skin healthier. This is often done to repair
scar s
caused by an accident or by previous surgery.
Sense.TRAN: 皮肤磨削术〔用于修补意外事故或手术造成的伤疤〕

Sense.DEF: a disease of the skin that causes redness, swelling, and pain
the part of medical science that deals with skin diseases and their treatment
to state officially that a part of a law or agreement has ended and that it no longer has any legal authority
to make something seem less important or less good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louis XIV clearly thought it derogated from his dignity as a ruler.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易十四显然认为这有损于他作为统治者的尊严。

Sense.DEF: to ignore a responsibility or duty
derogatory remarks, attitudes etc are insulting and disapproving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their conversation contained a number of derogatory racial remarks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的谈话包含了一些带有种族偏见的侮辱性言论。

Sense.DEF: a tall machine used for lifting heavy weights, especially on ships
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指船舶上的〕吊杆式起重机﹐转臂起重机

Sense.DEF:
a tall tower built over an oil well, used to raise and lower the
drill

your
buttock s
– used humorously
very brave actions like the ones that happen in adventure stories – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 英勇事迹/行为等〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a member of an Islamic group, some of whom dance fast and spin around as part of a religious ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔伊斯兰教的〕托钵僧﹐苦行僧〔有些在宗教仪式上跳快速旋转舞〕

Sense.DEF: the process of removing salt from sea water so that people can use it

to remove the white substance that forms on the inside of pipes,
kettle s
etc
Sense.TRAN: 除去〔管道﹑水壶等内壁上的〕水垢[水锈]

Sense.DEF: a tune that is played or sung above the main tune in a piece of music
to move from a higher level to a lower one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our plane started to descend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的飞机开始下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The path continues for some way before descending to Garsdale Head.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小径延伸了一段距离后﹐向下通往加斯代尔角。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say go down or come down rather than descend .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 go down 或 come down ,而不说 descend
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They went down into the lobby.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们下楼进了大厅。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I heard his footsteps coming down the stairs.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他下楼的脚步声。

Sense.DEF: if darkness, silence, a feeling etc descends, it becomes dark etc or you start to feel something, especially suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 〔黑暗﹑寂静等突然〕降临﹔〔感情等突然〕袭来﹐来临

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Total silence descended on the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里突然一片寂静。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: An air of gloom descended over the party headquarters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片阴郁的气氛笼罩着该党总部。

Sense.DEF: numbers, choices etc that are in descending order are arranged from the highest or most important to the lowest or least important
Sense.TRAN: 按（某事物的）降序排列〔按照从高到低或从重要到次要的顺序排列〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotels are listed in descending order of price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些宾馆按价格从高到低列出。

Sense.DEF: to be related to a person or group who lived a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: She claims to be descended from Abraham Lincoln.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她声称自己是亚伯拉罕·林肯的后代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people here are descended from the Vikings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的人是维京人的后裔。

Sense.DEF: to have developed from something that existed in the past
Sense.TRAN: 从〔过去的东西〕发展而来[传下来]
Sense.EXAMPLE: ideas that descend from those of ancient philosophers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传承自古代哲学家的观点

Sense.DEF: if a large number of people descend on a person or a place, they come to visit or stay, especially when they are not very welcome
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人〕突然造访〔尤指不太受欢迎的情况下〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of tourists descend on the area every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年有数百万游客来到这个地区。

Sense.DEF: to behave or speak in an unpleasant way, which is not the way you usually behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surely he wouldn’t descend to such a mean trick?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想必他不会无耻到使用这种卑劣的诡计吧？

GramExa.GLOSS: behave or speak as badly as someone else
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低到某人的层次
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Other people may gossip, but don’t descend to their level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人可能会说闲话﹐别跟他们学。

Sense.DEF: someone who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people etc that existed in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coastal areas were occupied by the descendants of Greek colonists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿海地区居住着希腊殖民者的后裔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a direct descendant of Napoleon Bonaparte.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是拿破仑·波拿巴的嫡系后裔。

Sense.DEF: something that has developed from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Quechua is a descendant of the Inca language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克丘亚语是印加语的一种派生语。

Sense.DEF: the process of going down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The descent to Base Camp took about two days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 往下走到大本营大约要两天时间。

Sense.DEF: your family origins, especially your nationality or relationship to someone important who lived a long time ago

GramExa.EXAMPLE: young men and women of Asian descent
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚裔男女青年

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The emperor claimed descent from David.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个皇帝自称是大卫王的后代。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re Irish by descent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们祖籍爱尔兰。

Sense.DEF: a path or road that goes down a slope

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is no direct descent from the summit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有直接从山顶下来的下坡路。

Sense.DEF: a gradual change towards behaviour or a situation that is very bad

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his descent into drug abuse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他堕落到吸毒的地步

Sense.DEF: a sudden unwanted visit or attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: the descent on the town by a motorcycle gang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个飞车党突袭该镇

Sense.DEF: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police asked her to describe the man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After the operation her condition was described as comfortable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术后她的身体状况被描述为良好。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The youth is described as being 18 to 19 years old.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据描述这名青年有十八九岁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to describe how I feel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难形容我的感受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: So describe this new boyfriend to me!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么﹐和我说说这位新男友吧！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He described finding his mother lying on the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叙述说发现他妈妈躺在地板上。

Sense.DEF: to make a movement which forms the shape of a circle etc
Sense.TRAN: 画出[形成]一个圆形/一道弧线等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hand described a circle in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用手在空中画了一个圆圈。

Exponent.DEF: to talk or write about a person, place, event etc, in order to show what they are like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Could you try and describe the man you saw?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能试着描述一下你看见的那名男子？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In her book, she describes her journey across the Sahara.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在书中,她描写了她的穿越撒哈拉沙漠之旅。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police described the attack as particularly violent.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说这次袭击极其暴力。

Exponent.DEF: to describe someone or something to someone. This phrase is more commonly used than describe in everyday spoken English.
Exponent.TRAN: 告诉某人有关某人/某事物的情况〔在日常口语中比describe常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: So, tell me about your holiday!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么,给我讲讲你的假期吧！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My friends have told me all about you!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的朋友已经把你的一切都告诉给我了！

Exponent.DEF: to describe someone or something in a piece of writing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His stories depict life in Trinidad as seen through the eyes of a young boy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的小说以一个小男孩的视角描绘了特立尼达的生活。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In this new biography she is depicted as a lonely and unhappy woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这部新的传记中,她被描绘成一个孤独﹑忧郁的女人。

Exponent.DEF: to describe someone or something in a particular way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: College teachers are often represented on television shows as slightly eccentric.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学老师在电视节目里常常被刻画成有点古怪的样子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The magazine has been criticized for the way it portrays women.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志因为它描绘女性的方式而受到抨击。

Exponent.DEF: to describe someone or something by emphasizing one particular quality or feature about them
Exponent.TRAN: 把某人/某事物描绘成…〔以凸显某种特性〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He characterized himself as ‘an average American’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他形容自己是 “一个普通的美国人” 。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The successful schools were characterized as innovative and creative.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的学校被描述成富有创新精神。

Exponent.DEF: to describe someone or something, especially in a way that makes people believe something that is not true
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指误导性地〕把某人/某事物描绘成…
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Not all young people are as bad as they’re painted in the press.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是所有的年轻人都像新闻报道描绘的那样坏。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We won, yet the media is painting it as a victory for our opponents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们赢了,然而媒体却把这说成是我们对手的胜利。

Exponent.DEF: to describe a situation, so that people can get a general idea of what it is like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you paint a picture of life in Japan for us?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能为我们描述一下日本的生活吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My uncle’s letters generally painted a rosy picture of how things were.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叔叔的来信几乎都是说事事如意。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing or speech that gives details about what someone or something is like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an accurate description of the event
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对事件的准确描述

Sense.EXAMPLE: The booklet gives a brief description of each place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小册子对每一个地方都作了简短的介绍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Berlin sounds fascinating from your description.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从你的描述来看﹐柏林是个迷人的城市。

Sense.DEF: to be too good, bad, big etc to be described easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The death and destruction were beyond description.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡和破坏的惨状无法形容。

Sense.DEF: people or things of every type, some type etc
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样/某种/任何一种等
Sense.EXAMPLE: People of all descriptions came to see the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形形色色的人都来观看演出。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was unable to give the police a description of her attacker.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无法向警方描述袭击她的人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The diary provides a clear description of farming life in the 1850s.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本日记对19世纪50年代的农耕生活提供了清晰的描述。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: formally give a description of someone to the public
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police have issued a description of the two men they are looking for.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方已经发布了他们所寻找的两名男子的相貌特征。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be like the person in a police description
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The first man they arrested did not fit the description given by the victim.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们逮捕的第一名男子与受害者提供的描述不符。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a person who looks like someone in a police description
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A young girl answering this description has been seen in Spain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在西班牙看到了符合这一描述的小女孩。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her descriptions of the natural world are very good.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自然界的描写非常出色。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gave us a clear description of the situation in the city.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向我们清晰地描述了该市的情况。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Some of his descriptions of the island are very detailed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对该岛的一些描述很详细。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don’t think the hotel’s description of its facilities was very accurate.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得那家酒店对其设施的描述不是很准确。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very clear and interesting
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book contains some vivid descriptions of his childhood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中对他的童年有一些生动的描述。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have a perfect description of the man we are looking for.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对要寻找的那名男子有非常精确的描述。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: detailed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Please give a full description of your responsibilities in your present job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 请详尽介绍一下你现在的岗位职责。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn't want to hear a lengthy description of their holiday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想听他们啰啰唆唆地说他们度假的事。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There's only a brief description of the hotel on the Internet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因特网上只有这家酒店的简单介绍。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not detailed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He started by giving us a general description of the manufacturing process.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他首先向我们大致介绍了生产流程。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very clear and containing a lot of details, usually about something unpleasant
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔对令人不快之事〕详细的描述
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book has some graphic descriptions of life in the prison camp.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书对集中营生活的一些描写细致入微。

Sense.DEF: giving a description of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the descriptive passages in the novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说中的描写性段落

Sense.DEF: describing how the words of a language are actually used, rather than saying how they ought to be used
Sense.TRAN: 描述性的〔指描述词语的实际使用情况而不是规定它们该如何使用〕

Sense.DEF: to spoil or damage something holy or respected
to end a system in which people of different races are kept separate
to remove something from a list of choices on a computer

if members of a political party deselect an existing Member of Parliament, they refuse to choose him or her as a
candidate
at the next election
Sense.TRAN: 否决〔现任议员〕参加下一次竞选的资格

Sense.DEF: to make someone react less strongly to something by making them become used to it
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过使某人习惯于某事物〕使麻木

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Does TV desensitize people to violence?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视是否会让人对暴力变得麻木？

Sense.DEF: a large area of land where it is always very dry, and there is a lot of sand
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Sahara Desert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒哈拉沙漠
Sense.EXAMPLE: This area of the country is mostly desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的这一地区大部分是沙漠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane crash-landed in the desert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机迫降在沙漠中。

Sense.DEF: a place where there is no activity or where nothing interesting happens
Sense.TRAN: 冷清的地方﹔无趣的地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: The railroad yard was a desert now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路调车场现在冷冷清清。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with dessert the sweet part of a meal . 不要与 dessert（甜点）混淆。

Sense.DEF: to leave someone or something and no longer help or support them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen was deserted by her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦被丈夫遗弃了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the party’s traditional voters deserted it at the last election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多长期支持该党的选民在上一次选举中抛弃了它。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price rise caused many readers to desert the magazine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格上涨导致许多读者放弃了这本杂志。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He deserted her for another woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为了另一个女人而抛弃了她。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place so that it is completely empty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds have deserted their nest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸟舍弃了它们的窝。

Sense.DEF: to leave the army, navy etc without permission
