Sense.EXAMPLE: Several hundred soldiers have deserted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几百名士兵开了小差。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, quality, or skill deserts you, you no longer have it, especially at a time when you need it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike’s confidence seemed to have deserted him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克的信心似乎已经离他而去。

Sense.DEF: empty and quiet because no people are there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The streets were deserted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上空无一人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old mine now stands completely deserted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座旧矿现在完全废弃了。

Sense.DEF: a wife etc who has been left by her husband etc
Sense.TRAN: 被遗弃的妻子/丈夫/孩子等

Sense.DEF: a soldier who leaves the army, navy etc without permission
the process by which useful land, especially farmland, changes into desert
Sense.TRAN: 〔土地﹐尤指农田的〕荒漠化﹐沙漠化

Sense.DEF: the act of leaving the army, navy etc without permission
the act of leaving your wife or husband because you do not want to live with them any longer
a small tropical island that is far away from other places and has no people living on it
to be punished in a way that you deserve
Sense.TRAN: 得到应有的惩罚﹐罪有应得
Sense.EXAMPLE: Offenders should receive their just deserts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违法者应该受到应有的惩罚。

Sense.DEF: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 应得﹐应受到〔奖赏或惩罚〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What have I done to deserve this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我做了什么事﹐要得到这样的报应？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We didn’t deserve to win.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不应该赢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the success he so richly deserves
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全应得的成功

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better deserve to be treated in a better way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为这些孩子感到难过﹐他们应该过得更好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think we deserve a rest after all that hard work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛苦了那么久﹐我想我们应该休息一下了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该特别提一下葆拉﹐她给了我们许多帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不会打人﹐哪怕他欠揍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了什么﹐竟会受到这样的惩罚？

GramExa.GLOSS: deserve any bad things that happen to you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He deserves all he gets for being so dishonest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这么不诚实﹐真是罪有应得。

Sense.EXAMPLE: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

Sense.DEF: if a suggestion, idea, or plan deserves consideration, attention etc, it is good enough to be considered, paid attention to etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔建议﹑观点或计划〕值得考虑/注意等
Sense.EXAMPLE: This proposal deserves serious consideration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个建议值得认真考虑。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you admire the way someone dealt with a situation or problem
Sense.TRAN: 某人该得一枚勋章〔表示欣赏某人应付某种局面或处理某个问题的方式〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You deserve a medal for putting up with Ian’s constant demands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能忍耐伊恩一个又一个的要求﹐真该得一枚勋章。

Sense.DEF: earned because of good or bad behaviour, skill, work etc
Sense.TRAN: 应得的﹐理所当然的﹔该受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a well-deserved reputation as a reliable worker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都说他干活儿可靠﹐这是名副其实的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Larsson’s goal gave Celtic a deserved victory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔森的进球使凯尔特人队赢得了一场应有的胜利。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is right or deserved
Sense.TRAN: 正当地﹐应得地﹐理所当然地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bistro Roti is a deservedly popular restaurant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗蒂餐厅不愧是一家很受欢迎的餐厅。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Arsenal were deservedly beaten 2-1 by Leeds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿森纳队被利兹队以 2 比 1 击败﹐这结果理所应当。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree that something is right and deserved
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is widely respected in the music world, and deservedly so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在音乐界广受尊敬﹐这也是实至名归的。

Sense.DEF: needing help and support, especially financial support
Sense.TRAN: 需要帮助的﹐需要赞助的〔尤指经济上的支持〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The National Lottery provides extra money for deserving causes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国博彩向需要扶持的事业提供额外资金。

Sense.DEF: to deserve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some criminals are more deserving of their punishment than others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些罪犯比起其他罪犯更应该受到惩罚。

Sense.DEF: desiccated food has been dried in order to preserve it
completely dry
Sense.EXAMPLE: desiccated soil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干旱的土地

Sense.DEF: the process of becoming completely dry
something that is wanted or needed
Sense.TRAN: 想得到的东西﹔需要的东西

Sense.DEF: the art or process of making a drawing of something to show how you will make it or what it will look like
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new plane is in its final design stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新型飞机正处于最后的设计阶段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the design process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计过程
Sense.EXAMPLE: the design team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计团队
Sense.EXAMPLE: a course in graphic design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平面设计课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: computer-aided design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机辅助设计

Sense.DEF: the way that something has been planned and made, including its appearance, how it works etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s design has been greatly improved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种汽车的设计已有很大的改进。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the design of the new building
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新大楼的设计

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some changes have been made to the computer’s basic design.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款计算机的基本设计作了一些修改。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a design fault
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计缺陷
Sense.EXAMPLE: The electric windows are an important design feature of this model.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电动窗是这种型号一个重要的设计特点。

Sense.DEF: a pattern for decorating something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a floral design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花卉图案
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vinyl flooring is available in a wide range of designs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乙烯基塑胶地板有很多种图案可供选择。

Sense.DEF: a drawing that shows how something will be made or what it will look like

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the design for the new sports centre
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新体育中心的设计图

Sense.DEF: a plan that someone has in their mind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We shall never know whether this happened by accident or by design.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们永远也不会知道这件事是个意外还是事先安排的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He has some grand designs for the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对公司发展有一些宏图大计。

Sense.DEF: to want something for yourself, especially because it will bring you money
Sense.TRAN: 企图拥有某物〔尤指可以带来钱财的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several developers have designs on the property.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几个开发商都在觊觎这块地产。

Sense.DEF: to want a sexual relationship with someone
Sense.TRAN: 对某人居心不良〔指想和某人发生性关系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had designs on her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在打她的主意。

Sense.DEF: to make a drawing or plan of something that will be made or built
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tower was designed by Gilbert Scott.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座塔楼是吉尔伯特·斯科特设计的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She designed a new logo for the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为公司设计了一个新的标志。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a badly designed office
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计得很糟的办公室

GramExa.EXAMPLE: software
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专门设计的软件

Sense.DEF: to plan or develop something for a specific purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These exercises are designed to strengthen muscles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些运动是为了增强肌肉力量而设计的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course is designed for beginners.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程是为初学者设计的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is designed as a reference manual.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书是作为参考手册设计的。

Sense.DEF: to choose someone or something for a particular job or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔为特定工作或目的〕任命﹐选定﹐指派

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lake was recently designated a conservation area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个湖最近被指定为保护区。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Funds were designated for projects in low-income areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低收入地区的工程有指定资金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has been designated to take over the position of treasurer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已被指派接任财务主管的职位。

Sense.DEF: to represent or refer to something using a particular sign, name etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用特殊符号﹑名称等〕标明﹐表示
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

Sense.DEF: used after the name of an official job to show that someone has been chosen for that job but has not yet officially started work
Sense.EXAMPLE: the director designate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候任董事

Sense.DEF: someone who agrees not to drink alcohol when a group of friends go out together to a party, bar etc so that he or she can drive the others safely home
Sense.TRAN: 指定的司机〔指外出聚会﹑去酒吧等时因说好开车送朋友而不饮酒的人〕

Sense.DEF:
a baseball player who replaces the
pitcher
when it is the pitcher’s turn to hit the ball
Sense.TRAN: 指定击球手〔指轮到投球手击球时代替其击球的棒球运动员〕

Sense.DEF: the act of choosing someone or something for a particular purpose, or of giving them a particular description
Sense.TRAN: 任命﹐选定﹐指派﹔标明﹐表示

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the designation of Stansted as the third London airport
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将斯坦斯特德指定为伦敦的第三座机场

Sense.DEF: a name or title
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her official designation is Systems Manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的正式头衔是系统经理。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to make plans or patterns for clothes, furniture, equipment etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔服装﹑家具﹑设备等的〕设计师﹐设计者
Sense.EXAMPLE: an interior designer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 室内装潢设计师
Sense.EXAMPLE: a software designer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件设计师

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服装/时装设计师

Sense.DEF: made by a well-known and fashionable designer
Sense.TRAN: 由著名设计师设计的﹔名牌的﹐品牌的

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 名牌服装/牛仔裤/套装等

GramExa.GLOSS: an expensive brand from a well-known designer

Sense.DEF:
a baby whose
gene s
have been selected by
genetic engineering
, because its parents want to be able to choose things like the colour of its eyes or hair, or to be sure what sex the baby will be – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 基因筛选婴儿﹐定制婴儿〔含贬义﹐指基因经基因工程技术筛选后出生的婴儿﹐其父母可选择孩子的性别﹑眼睛颜色﹑头发颜色等〕

Sense.DEF: an illegal drug that has an exciting or relaxing effect, and is taken for pleasure
something that is desirable is worth having or doing
Sense.TRAN: 理想的﹐值得拥有的﹔值得做的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ability to speak a foreign language is highly desirable .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能说一门外语是非常理想的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a desirable neighborhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理想的社区
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is desirable that you should have some familiarity with computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该对电脑有所熟悉﹐这是很有益处的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is desirable to keep the cost as low as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把成本控制得越低越好。

Sense.DEF: sexually attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a desirable young woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个性感的年轻女人

Sense.DEF: a strong hope or wish

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strong desire to win
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强烈的求胜欲望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a desire for knowledge
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对知识的渴望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was Harold’s desire that he should be buried next to his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈罗德的愿望是被安葬在妻子旁边。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She expressed a desire to visit us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表示想要拜访我们。

GramExa.PROPFORM: have no desire to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you do not want to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no desire to cause any trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想惹任何麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul had a burning desire to visit India.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗热切地希望去印度。

Sense.DEF: a strong wish to have sex with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: female sexual desire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性的性欲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He tried to hide his desire for her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图掩饰自己对她的情欲。

Sense.DEF: to want something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has everything you could possibly desire .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店里你想要的东西应有尽有。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He desired to return to Mexico.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他渴望回墨西哥去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Add lemon juice if desired .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要的话加点柠檬汁。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say want rather than desire , although the meaning of desire is stronger than want .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 want ,而不说 desire ,不过 desire 的语气较强
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You can have anything you want .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想要什么都可以。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I want to meet her.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想见她。

Sense.DEF: to want to have sex with someone

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His remarks had the desired effect .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话达到了想要的效果。

Sense.DEF: wanting something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He became restless and desirous of change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他变得不安分起来﹐渴望变化。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope that the military regime will desist from its acts of violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望军人政权停止暴力行为。

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture like a table, usually with drawers in it, that you sit at to write and work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marie was sitting at her desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽正坐在书桌前。

Sense.DEF: a place where you can get information or use a particular service in a hotel, airport etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑机场等的〕服务台﹐问讯台
Sense.EXAMPLE: the reception desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接待处
Sense.EXAMPLE: the check-in desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登记处

Sense.DEF: an office that deals with a particular subject, especially in newspapers or television
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指报社或电视台负责某题材的〕部﹐司﹐组﹐室

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻/体育部

Sense.DEF: someone who works at the main desk in a hotel
to remove or reduce the need for skill in a job, usually by changing to machinery
Sense.TRAN: 降低…的技术要求〔通常指转为机器操作〕

Sense.DEF: a job that involves working mostly at a desk in an office
someone who works in an office, sitting at a desk all or most of the day – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 整天伏案工作的人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a container for putting pens, pencils etc in, that you keep on your desk

the main area on a computer where you can find the
icon s
that represent programs, and where you can do things to manage the information on the computer
the top surface of a desk
a computer that is small enough to be used on a desk
the work of arranging the writing and pictures for a magazine, small book etc, using a computer and special software
Sense.TRAN: 桌面出版〔用计算机和专门软件为书刊等排版〕

Sense.DEF: a place that is desolate is empty and looks sad because there are no people there
Sense.TRAN: 荒凉的﹐荒芜的﹐无人烟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a desolate landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荒凉的景色

Sense.DEF: someone who is desolate feels very sad and lonely
to make someone feel very sad and lonely
Sense.EXAMPLE: David was desolated by his wife’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子的死使戴维悲痛万分。

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you have no hope at all

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She killed herself in despair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在绝望中自杀了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The noise from the neighbours used to drive him to despair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去﹐邻居的噪音常常吵得他心烦意乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the despair of the workers, the company announced the closure of the factory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令工人们感到绝望的是﹐公司宣布关闭工厂了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very worried, upset, or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 让某人感到担忧[心烦﹐痛苦]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is the despair of her teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是老师们最不省心的学生。

Sense.DEF: to feel that there is no hope at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite his illness, Ron never despaired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管疾病缠身﹐罗恩却从不绝望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He despaired of ever finding her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对找到她已经不抱任何希望了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My teachers began to despair of me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的老师开始对我绝望了。

Sense.DEF: showing a feeling that you have no hope at all

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave me a last despairing look.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她绝望地看了我最后一眼。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
dispatch
a violent criminal who is not afraid of danger
willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了改变糟糕境遇而〕不惜冒险的﹐拼命的﹐绝望的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no money left and was desperate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身无分文﹐已经走投无路了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间越来越少﹐我们越来越感到绝望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失踪少年绝望的父母

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was desperate with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因恐惧而感到绝望。

Sense.DEF: needing or wanting something very much
Sense.TRAN: 非常需要…的﹐极其需要…的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team is desperate for a win.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队急需一场胜利。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was desperate for a cigarette.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想抽支烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was desperate to get a job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他急于找到一份工作。

Sense.DEF: a desperate situation is very bad or serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: a desperate shortage of doctors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生极度缺乏
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re in desperate need of help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们亟待帮助。

Sense.DEF: a desperate action is something that you only do because you are in a very bad situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a desperate attempt to escape
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孤注一掷企图逃跑

Sense.EXAMPLE: We resorted to desperate measures .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们采取了破釜沉舟的做法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a desperate struggle to rescue the men
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不惜一切营救那些人的努力

Sense.DEF: in a desperate way
Sense.TRAN: 绝望地﹔拼命地﹐不顾一切地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors tried desperately to save her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们不惜一切挽救她的生命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked round desperately for someone to help him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝望地四处张望﹐希望有人来帮他。

Sense.DEF: very or very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crops desperately need rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些作物急需雨水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was desperately ill with a fever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发高烧﹐病得很严重。
极为悲伤/孤独/担心等

Sense.DEF: the state of being desperate
Sense.EXAMPLE: a look of desperation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝望的眼神

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She resorted to stealing food out of desperation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走投无路﹐只好偷东西吃。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In desperation, we had to borrow the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝望之际﹐我们只得去借这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: extremely bad, immoral, or cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s despicable the way he treats those kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那样对待那些孩子﹐真卑鄙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a despicable act of terrorism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑劣的恐怖主义行径
Sense.EXAMPLE: a despicable crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑鄙的罪行

Sense.DEF: to dislike and have a low opinion of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She despised her neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看不起她的邻居。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens or is true even though something else might have prevented it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite all our efforts to save the school, the authorities decided to close it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我们竭力想保住这所学校﹐当局还是决定把它关闭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She went to Spain despite the fact that her doctor had told her to rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管医生叫她休息﹐她还是去了西班牙。

Sense.DEF: if you do something despite yourself, you do it although you did not intend to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz realized that, despite herself, she cared about Edward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利兹发现自己不由自主地在乎爱德华。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use despite to introduce a clause. Instead, use despite with a present participle, despite the fact that, or a clause beginning with although .
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要用 despite 引导从句,但可以后接现在分词﹐或者用 despite the fact that 或 although 来引导从句
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Despite neglecting his studies, he got his degree (NOT 不说 Despite he neglected his studies ...).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管荒疏学业,但他还是取得了学位。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She seemed no happier, despite the fact that her physical condition had improved.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管她的身体状况已有好转,但她的心情似乎没有好起来。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Although I learned a great deal, I thought the course was too narrowly based.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我学到了很多,但还是觉得这门课程的范围太狭窄。
F2NBox.EXPL: Despite is not followed by ‘of’, although it means the same as ‘in spite of’.
F2NBox.TRAN: despite 意思与 in spite of 一样 ﹐但 despite 后面不能跟 of 。

Sense.DEF: to make a place much less attractive by removing or damaging things
to steal from a place or people using force, especially in a war
extremely unhappy and without hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gill had been out of work for a year and was getting very despondent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔失业一年了﹐开始变得非常消沉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was becoming increasingly despondent about the way things were going.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对事态的发展感到越来越绝望。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially a ruler, who uses power in a cruel and unfair way
rule by a despot
a house that a lot of people admire and would like to live in – often used humorously. Des res is short for ‘desirable residence’.
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人向往的〕理想住宅〔desirable residence的缩略语﹐常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: sweet food served after the main part of a meal

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are we having for dessert?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吃什么甜点？

PIC.HEADING: DESSERTS 甜点
PIC.PICCONTENT: apple pie 苹果派；chocolate cake/gâteau BrE【英】巧克力奶油大蛋糕；ice cream sundae 圣代冰激凌；strawberry tart 草莓馅饼

Sense.DEF:
a spoon that is larger than a
teaspoon
but smaller than a
tablespoon
the amount that a dessertspoon can hold, used as a unit for measuring food or liquid in cooking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add a dessertspoonful of dry mustard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加一中匙的干芥末。

Sense.DEF: a sweet wine served with dessert

to make something such as a government or
economy
become less successful or powerful, or less able to control events
Sense.TRAN: 使〔政府﹑经济体等〕不稳定﹐破坏…的稳定
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to destabilize the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏政府稳定的企图

Sense.DEF: the place that someone or something is going to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Allow plenty of time to get to your destination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要留出充裕的时间前往目的地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maui is a popular tourist destination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毛伊岛是很受欢迎的旅游目的地。

Sense.DEF: seeming certain to happen at some time in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She seemed destined for a successful career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎注定能够事业成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were destined never to meet again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们注定无缘再见。

Sense.DEF: to be travelling to a particular place, or intended to go there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flight was destined for Cairo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本次航班飞往开罗。

Sense.DEF: a destined person or thing is one that you will have in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: the King’s destined bride
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王命中注定的新娘

Sense.DEF: the things that will happen to someone in the future, especially those that cannot be changed or controlled

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nancy wondered whether it was her destiny to live in England and marry Melvyn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希想知道她生活在英格兰又嫁给梅尔文是不是命运的安排。

Sense.DEF: the power that some people believe decides what will happen to them in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always had a strong sense of destiny .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向来很相信天意。

Sense.DEF: having no money, no food, no home etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floods left many people destitute .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场洪水使许多人变得一无所有。

Sense.DEF: to be completely without something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man who is destitute of mercy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无同情心的人

Sense.DEF: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists or cannot be used or repaired

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school was completely destroyed by fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校被大火彻底烧毁了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: companies that are polluting and destroying the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染和破坏环境的公司

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摧毁某人的信心/希望/信仰等

Sense.DEF: if something destroys someone, it ruins their life completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal destroyed Simmons and ended his political career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻毁了西蒙斯﹐终结了他的政治生涯。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opponent easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Bears destroyed the Detroit Lions 35-3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊队以35比3轻取底特律雄狮队。

Sense.DEF: to kill an animal, especially because it is ill or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 杀死〔动物﹐尤因其生病或构成危险〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the bulls had to be destroyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一头公牛必须杀掉。

Exponent.DEF: to damage something so badly that it no longer exists or cannot be used or repaired
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The earthquake almost completely destroyed the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震几乎彻底毁了这座城市。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The twin towers were destroyed in a terrorist attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 双子大厦毁于恐怖袭击。

Exponent.DEF: to damage a large area very badly and destroy many things in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Allied bombings in 1943 devastated the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 1943年,盟军的轰炸摧毁了这座城市。

Exponent.DEF: to completely destroy a building, either deliberately or by accident
Exponent.TRAN: 拆毁,拆除﹔完全毁坏〔建筑物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The original 15th century house was demolished in Victorian times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来那幢15世纪的房屋在维多利亚时代被拆除了。

Exponent.DEF: to destroy a building or town by knocking it down, bombing it etc, so that nothing is left standing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town centre was flattened by a 500 lb bomb.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇中心被一枚500磅的炸弹夷为平地。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately damage something very badly, especially a room or building
Exponent.TRAN: 〔故意〕毁坏〔尤指房间或建筑物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The toilets had been wrecked by vandals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厕所遭到蓄意破坏。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately destroy a lot of the things in a room, house etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔故意〕捣毁〔房间﹑房屋等中的物品〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Apparently, he trashed his hotel room while on drugs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他是在吸毒后把酒店的客房糟蹋得不成样子。

Exponent.DEF: to destroy a place so completely that nothing remains
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The nuclear blast obliterated most of Hiroshima.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 核爆炸摧毁了广岛的大部分地区。

Exponent.DEF: to destroy a building or town completely
Exponent.TRAN: 使某地变成废墟/瓦砾/灰烬
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town was reduced to rubble in the First World War.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座小镇在第一次世界大战中变成了废墟。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil something completely, so that it cannot be used or enjoyed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fungus may ruin the crop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真菌可能会毁坏庄稼。

Sense.DEF: a small fast military ship with guns
someone or something that destroys things or people
the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the destruction of the rainforest
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对雨林的破坏

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大规模杀伤性武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: the environmental destruction caused by the road building programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 筑路工程造成的环境破坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floods brought death and destruction to the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水给该地区带来了死亡和破坏。

Sense.DEF: causing damage to people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the destructive power of modern weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代武器的破坏力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What is good for the individual can be destructive to the family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人的利益对于家庭来说有可能是破坏性的。

Sense.DEF: done without any particular plan or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 漫无目的的﹐毫无计划的﹐散漫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They talked briefly in a desultory manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们随意地谈了一小会儿。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= detective 侦探﹐警探
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= determiner 限定词

Sense.DEF: if you detach something, or if it detaches, it becomes separated from the thing it was attached to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can detach the hood from the jacket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把风帽从夹克上拆下来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Please detach and fill out the application form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请撕下申请表并填好。

Sense.DEF: to try to be less involved in or less concerned about a situation
Sense.TRAN: 使自己摆脱某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors have to detach themselves from their feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生必须抛开个人的感情。

Sense.DEF: able to be removed and put back
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coat has a detachable lining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件外套的衬里可拆卸。

Sense.DEF: not reacting to or becoming involved in something in an emotional way
Sense.TRAN: 冷静的﹐不动感情的﹐客观的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to take a more detached view .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量采取更为客观的态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He appeared totally detached from the horrific nature of his crimes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像对自己可怕的罪行完全无动于衷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She described what had happened in a cold and detached manner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冷静客观地叙述了发生的事情。

Sense.DEF: a detached house or garage is not joined to another building
the state of not reacting to or being involved in something in an emotional way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt a sense of detachment from what was happening around him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对周围发生的一切有一种超然的感觉。

Sense.DEF: a group of soldiers who are sent away from a larger group to do a special job
when something becomes separated from something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: detachment of the retina
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 视网膜脱落

Sense.DEF: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She told me every detail of her trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把旅行的所有细节都告诉了我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Todd had planned the journey down to the smallest detail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托德把这次旅行的细枝末节都安排好了。

Sense.DEF: all the separate features and pieces of information about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He described the process in detail using a lot of details .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他详细描述了这一过程。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。
Sense.EXAMPLE: McDougal was reluctant to go into detail give a lot of details about the new deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克杜格尔对新协议不愿详谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Editing requires great attention to detail .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做编辑工作需要极其细心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fine detail of the plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划的微小细节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Photographers need to have an eye for detail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影师要善于捕捉细节。

Sense.DEF: information that helps to complete what you know about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Full details of the incident were recently revealed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事件的详情最近被披露了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She refused to give any details about what had happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝对发生的事透露任何消息。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Details of the course can be found on our website.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程的详细介绍可以在我们的网站上找到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For further details, contact the personnel department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欲知详情﹐请与人事部联系。

Sense.DEF: a specific duty in the army, or the person or group with that duty
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队中的〕任务﹔特遣队﹐小分队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the security detail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安保小分队

Sense.DEF: to list things or give all the facts or information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report details the progress we have made over the last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告详述了去年我们取得的进展。

Sense.DEF: to officially order someone, especially soldiers, to do a particular job
Sense.TRAN: 指派某人〔尤指士兵〕做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Four soldiers were detailed to guard duty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四名士兵被派去站岗。

Sense.DEF: to clean a car very thoroughly, inside and out
containing or including a lot of information or details

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a detailed study of crime in Seattle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对西雅图犯罪情况的详细研究
GramExa.EXAMPLE: More detailed information is available on request.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 详情请联系索取。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of decorations or small features that are difficult to produce
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautifully detailed carving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮精致的雕刻

Sense.DEF: decorations that are added to something such as a car or piece of clothing
the process of cleaning a car very thoroughly, inside and out
to officially prevent someone from leaving a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two suspects have been detained by the police for questioning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名嫌疑人被警方拘留审问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was detained in hospital with a suspected broken leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因腿部疑似骨折而被留医。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from leaving as soon as they expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was detained in Washington on urgent business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因紧急事务耽搁在了华盛顿。

Sense.DEF: someone who is officially kept in a prison, usually because of their political views
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常由于所持政治观点〕被拘留者

Sense.DEF: to notice or discover something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear etc
Sense.TRAN: 发现﹐察觉〔尤指不易觉察到的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many forms of cancer can be cured if detected early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果发现得早﹐许多种癌症都可以治愈。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难/不可能/容易/可能等被发现

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan detected a change in her mood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹觉察出她的情绪有变化。

GramExa.PROPFORM: detect a note of sarcasm/irony/excitement etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do I detect a note of sarcasm in your voice?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么听出来你语气里带有讽刺意味呢？

Sense.DEF: when something is found that is not easy to see, hear etc, or the process of looking for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Early detection of the disease is vital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病关键在于及早发现。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By flying low, the plane avoided detection by enemy radar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在低空飞行﹐躲过了敌人雷达的探测。

Sense.DEF: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals
someone who is paid to discover information about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

Sense.DEF: efforts to discover information, find out how something works, answer a difficult question etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took a lot of detective work to discover the cause of the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过大量的调查研究工作才发现问题的原因。

Sense.DEF: a story etc about a crime, often a murder, and a detective who tries to find out who did it
a machine or piece of equipment that finds or measures something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smoke detector
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟雾探测器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a metal detector
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属探测器

Sense.DEF: a time or situation in which two countries that are not friendly towards each other agree to behave in a more friendly way
the state of being kept in prison

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Willis was held in detention for five years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威利斯被监禁了五年。

Sense.DEF: a punishment in which children who have behaved badly are forced to stay at school for a short time after the others have gone home

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was always getting put in detention .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是被留堂。

Sense.DEF: a place where people are kept and prevented from escaping, especially people who have entered the country illegally, or young people who have committed crimes
Sense.TRAN: 〔关押非法入境者的〕拘留中心﹔〔关押少年犯的〕感化中心﹐青少年管教所

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过让对方意识到做某事会有困难或坏结果而〕制止﹐吓住〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The security camera was installed to deter people from stealing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安装监控摄像机来防止偷窃。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say put someone off rather than deter someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 put someone off ,而不说 deter someone
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Don’t let a few problems put you off .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要让几个问题吓倒你。

Sense.DEF: a liquid or powder used for washing clothes, dishes etc
Sense.TRAN: 洗涤剂﹔洗衣粉﹔洗洁精﹐去污剂

Sense.DEF: to become worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ethel’s health has deteriorated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃塞尔的健康状况恶化了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s deteriorating economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国日渐恶化的经济

Sense.DEF: to develop into a bad or worse situation
Sense.TRAN: 演变成某事﹐恶化成某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The argument deteriorated into a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争论演变成一场斗殴。

Sense.DEF: something that strongly influences what you do or how you behave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Social class is a major determinant of consumer spending patterns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会阶层是决定消费者消费模式的主要因素。

Sense.DEF: definite or with an exact limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a determinate prison sentence of five years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年有期徒刑

Sense.DEF: the quality of trying to do something even when it is difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Yuri shows great determination to learn English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尤里表现出很大的决心要学好英语。

Sense.EXAMPLE: his dogged determination very strong determination to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想要成功的坚定决心

Sense.DEF: the act of deciding something officially

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the determination of government policy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府政策的制定

Sense.DEF: the act of finding the exact level, amount, or cause of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔对水平﹑数量或原因的〕测定﹐确定

GramExa.EXAMPLE: accurate determination of the temperature
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度的精确测定

Sense.DEF: to find out the facts about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investigators are still trying to determine the cause of the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查人员仍在设法弄清失火的原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The aim of the inquiry was to determine what had caused the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查的目的是要找出事故的原因。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Experts have determined that the signature was forged.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家确定签名是伪造的。

Sense.DEF: if something determines something else, it directly influences or decides it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The amount of available water determines the number of houses that can be built.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可用的水量决定可以建造多少房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The age of a wine is a determining factor as to how it tastes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒的年份对于酒的味道是个决定性因素。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How hard the swimmers work now will determine how they perform in the Olympics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳运动员现在训练的努力程度将决定他们在奥运会上的表现。

Sense.DEF: to officially decide something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The date of the court case has not yet been determined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庭审日期尚未确定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tests will help the doctors determine what treatment to use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些检查有助于医生决定采用什么治疗方法。

Sense.DEF: to decide to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We determined to leave at once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定立即离开。

Sense.DEF: having a strong desire to do something, so that you will not let anyone stop you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gwen is a very determined woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格温是个意志很坚定的女性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was determined to win.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她决意要获胜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was determined that the same mistakes would not be repeated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决心不重蹈覆辙。

Sense.DEF: showing determination, especially in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在困境中〕坚决的﹐坚定的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was making a determined effort to give up smoking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在下决心努力戒烟。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The library was closed down despite determined opposition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管遭到坚决的反对﹐图书馆还是被关闭了。

Exponent.DEF: if you are determined to do something, you have decided that you are definitely going to do it, and you will not let anything stop you. Determined is also used about someone’s character, when they usually behave in this way.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was determined to be a doctor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决心当医生。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s a very determined woman.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个意志很坚定的女性。

Exponent.DEF: determined not to change what you are doing, especially when other people think you are behaving in an unreasonable way. Stubborn is often used when you disapprove of someone. It is also sometimes used when you admire them.
Exponent.TRAN: 固执的,顽固的,倔强的 〔常含贬义,但有时也含褒义〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wish you would stop being so stubborn!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别那么倔了！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Churchill’s stubborn refusal to surrender
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丘吉尔誓死不降

Exponent.DEF: someone who is single-minded works very hard in order to achieve one particular thing, and thinks that everything else is much less important
Exponent.TRAN: 一心一意的,专心致志的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: During a war, a leader must be single-minded and, if necessary, ruthless.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战时,领导者必须一心一意,必要时还要心狠手辣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: her single-minded pursuit of power
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对权力的一意追求

Exponent.DEF: determined to succeed, even if a situation is difficult or frightening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In competitive sports, it is as important to be mentally tough as it is to be physically fit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在竞技体育中,意志坚强与体格强壮同样重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gorelick is known as a tough manager.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都知道戈雷利克是个强硬的经理。

Exponent.DEF: showing by your behaviour that you are determined not to change your mind, especially when you are telling someone what to do
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在指示某人怎么做时〕坚决的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What this country needs is firm leadership.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家需要的是坚强的领导。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You have to be firm with young children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对待小孩子态度要坚决。

Exponent.DEF: determined and full of energy, and not afraid to say what you think and argue with people – used especially when you admire this person. Feisty is often used about women.
Exponent.TRAN: 果敢的,顽强自信的〔尤用于表示对某人的钦佩,常指女性〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the film she plays a feisty young woman who is smarter than all the men put together.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中,她饰演一名刚强﹑智慧过人的年轻女性,所有男人加在一起都不如她。

Exponent.DEF: determined to do what you want, without listening to other people’s advice or thinking about the results of your actions – used especially about young people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her sister was headstrong and impulsive, and made a point of going out whenever and wherever she liked.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妹妹又任性又冲动,不管何时何地,她想出去就一定要出去。

Exponent.DEF: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为有坚强的信念﹑明确的目标等而〕坚决的,不屈不挠的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the soldiers’ resolute defence of the town
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵对小镇的顽强防御

Exponent.DEF: determined and refusing to give up
Exponent.EXAMPLE: McTaggart was seen by many in the environment movement as a tenacious hero.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克塔格特在许多环保人士眼中是个不屈不挠的英雄。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his tenacious grip on power
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对权力的牢牢控制

Exponent.DEF: dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined and that you will not give up – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 顽强的〔尤用于下列短语〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team played with dogged determination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全队顽强拼搏。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: his dogged refusal to admit defeat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒不认输

Exponent.DEF: someone who is ruthless is so determined to get what they want, that they do not care if they harm other people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a ruthless dictator
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无情的独裁者
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was ruthless in his ambition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为了实现自己的野心不择手段。

Sense.DEF: a word that is used before a noun in order to show which thing you mean. In the phrases ‘the car’ and ‘some cars’, ‘the’ and ‘some’ are determiners.
Sense.TRAN: 限定词〔如the和some﹐用于被限定的名词前〕

Sense.DEF: the belief that what you do and what happens to you are caused by things that you cannot control
Sense.TRAN: 决定论〔认为人的行为以及所遇到的事均由无法控制的因素所决定〕

Sense.DEF: something that makes someone less likely to do something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results
Sense.TRAN: 制止物﹐威慑物﹐威慑力量
Sense.EXAMPLE: The small fines for this type of crime do not act as much of a deterrent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于这种罪行﹐小额罚金起不到多大的威慑作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Window locks are an effective deterrent against burglars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗锁可以有效地阻止窃贼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the deterrent effect of prison sentences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监禁的威慑作用

Sense.DEF:
the
nuclear
weapons that a country has in order to prevent other countries from attacking it
to hate something or someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men detested each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人互相厌恶。

Sense.DEF: very bad, and deserving to be criticized or hated
Sense.TRAN: 令人憎恨的﹐可恶的﹐讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a detestable little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个讨厌的小个子男人

Sense.DEF: to remove a king or queen from power
to remove someone from a position of authority or importance
Sense.TRAN: 撵〔某人〕下台﹐使〔某人〕失去重要地位
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to dethrone the senator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把参议员撵下台的企图
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dethroned Tyson in a fight that shook the boxing world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一场震惊拳坛的比赛中把泰森赶下了拳王宝座。

Sense.DEF: to explode or to make something explode
a piece of equipment used to make a bomb etc explode
a way of going from one place to another that is longer than the usual way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We took a detour to avoid the town centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们绕道避开镇中心。

Sense.DEF: a different road for traffic when the usual road cannot be used
to make a detour
special treatment to help people stop drinking alcohol or taking drugs
Sense.TRAN: 脱瘾﹔戒酒（治疗）﹔戒毒（治疗）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She spent a month in detox.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接受了一个月的戒毒治疗。

Sense.DEF: when you do not eat solid food or only drink special liquids for a period of time, which is thought to remove harmful substances from your body
Sense.TRAN: 排毒（疗法）〔一段时间内不吃固体食物或只喝特别的流质﹐据称可将体内的有害物质排出〕

Sense.DEF: if someone detoxes, they are given special treatment at a hospital to help them stop drinking alcohol or taking drugs
to not eat solid food or only drink special liquids for a period of time, which is thought to remove harmful substances from your body
the process of removing harmful chemicals or poison from something
detox
Sense.TRAN: 脱瘾﹔戒酒﹔戒毒﹔排毒（疗法）

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less good
Sense.EXAMPLE: One mistake is not going to detract from your achievement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个失误无损于你的成就。

Sense.DEF: someone who says bad things about someone or something, in order to make them seem less good than they really are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even the President’s detractors admit that the decision was the right one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 连那些抨击总统的人也承认这项决定是正确的。

Sense.DEF: harm or damage

GramExa.GLOSS: resulting in harm or damage to something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He worked very long hours, to the detriment of his marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作时间很长﹐不利于他的婚姻。

Sense.DEF: causing harm or damage

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoking is detrimental to your health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟有害健康。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the detrimental effect of pollution on the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染对环境的不利影响

Sense.DEF: pieces of waste that remain after something has been broken up or used
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物打碎或用过后留下的〕碎块﹐碎屑

Sense.DEF: the situation in tennis when both players have 40 points, after which one of the players must win two more points to win the game
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球比赛中的〕局末平分〔之后一方须连得两分方可获胜〕

Sense.DEF: a playing card with the number two on it
used to add force to a question
Sense.TRAN: 到底是什么/怎样…？〔用于加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What the deuce is going on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 究竟发生了什么事？

Sense.DEF:
the standard unit of money used in Germany before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 马克〔欧元使用前德国的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: to reduce the value of one country’s money when it is exchanged for another country’s money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nigeria has just devalued its currency .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼日利亚刚刚令自己的货币贬值。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something seem less important or valuable
Sense.EXAMPLE: History has tended to devalue the contributions of women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史往往贬低女性的贡献。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel extremely shocked and sad
Sense.TRAN: 令〔某人〕极度震惊﹔使〔某人〕伤心欲绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob was devastated by the news of her death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布听到她死去的消息悲痛欲绝。

Sense.DEF: to damage something very badly or completely
Sense.TRAN: 严重破坏﹐彻底破坏﹐摧毁
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city centre was devastated by the bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心被这枚炸弹摧毁了。

Sense.DEF: feeling extremely shocked and sad
Sense.TRAN: 极度震惊的﹔悲痛欲绝的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was left feeling totally devastated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因此感到极度悲痛。

Sense.DEF: badly damaging or destroying something
Sense.TRAN: 毁灭性的﹐破坏力极强的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Acid rain has a devastating effect on the forest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸雨对森林的破坏力极大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The oil spill had devastating consequences for wildlife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次石油泄漏事故对野生生物造成了毁灭性的后果。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be a devastating blow for the town if the factory closes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果工厂关闭﹐对该镇来说将是沉重的打击。

Sense.DEF: making someone feel extremely sad or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 令人悲痛的﹔令人震惊的﹐骇人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in Nice when he heard the devastating news .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是在尼斯听到这个令人震惊的消息的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long-term unemployment can be devastating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期失业对人的打击很大。

Sense.DEF: very impressive or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a devastating display of military muscle, soldiers seized the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵以摧枯拉朽之势占领了这座城镇。

Sense.DEF: extremely attractive
Sense.TRAN: 极富吸引力的﹐极漂亮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devastating smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Sense.DEF: to grow or change into something bigger, stronger, or more advanced, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chicago developed into a big city in the late 1800s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 19世纪末﹐芝加哥发展成了一个大城市。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to believe that a tree can develop from a small seed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难相信一棵树是由一粒小小的种子长成的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: exercises to develop muscle strength
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

Sense.DEF: to design or make a new idea, product, system etc over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 形成〔观点〕﹔研制〔产品〕﹔制订〔规划〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists are developing new drugs to treat arthritis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家正在研制治疗关节炎的新药。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She should have developed her own style instead of copying him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她应该塑造自己的风格﹐而不是去照搬他的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Researchers are developing technology for the US military.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员在为美国军方开发技术。

Sense.DEF: to start to have a feeling or quality that then becomes stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had developed a certain affection for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我产生了一些好感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children are beginning to develop a sense of responsibility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们渐渐开始有了责任感。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was in college that he developed a taste for started to like rugby football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是在大学里喜欢上橄榄球的。

Sense.DEF: if you develop a skill or ability, or if it develops, it becomes stronger or more advanced
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course is designed to help students develop their speaking skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程旨在帮助学生提高口头表达能力。

Sense.DEF: if you develop a disease or illness, or if it develops, you start to have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some alcoholics develop liver disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些酗酒者会患上肝病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pneumonia can develop very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肺炎发病可能会很快。

Sense.DEF: to begin to have a physical fault
Sense.EXAMPLE: The oil tank had developed a small crack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油箱出现了一条细小的裂缝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane developed engine trouble and was forced to land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机发生引擎故障﹐被迫降落。

Sense.DEF: if a problem or difficult situation develops, it begins to happen or exist, or it gets worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trouble is developing in the cities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市里骚乱正在上演。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Regional clashes could develop into larger quarrels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地区性冲突可能演变为更大的纷争。

Sense.DEF: to make an argument or idea clearer, by studying it more or by speaking or writing about it in more detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will develop a few of these points in the seminar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在研讨会上我们将详细阐述其中的一些观点。

Sense.DEF: to use land for the things that people need, for example by taking minerals out of it or by building on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

Sense.DEF: to make a photograph out of a photographic film, using chemicals
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you ever get the pictures developed ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底有没有把照片冲洗出来？

Sense.DEF: a developed country is one of the rich countries of the world with many industries, comfortable living for most people, and usually an elected government
Sense.EXAMPLE: energy consumption in the developed world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界发达地区的能源消耗

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发达国家

Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity works with children in less developed countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家慈善机构帮助欠发达国家的儿童。

Sense.DEF: a developed sense, system etc, is better, larger, or more advanced than others
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dogs have a highly developed sense of smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗的嗅觉高度发达。
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants with well developed root systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根系非常发达的植物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labour has a more fully developed programme for the unemployed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党为失业者做了更为完善的规划。

Sense.DEF: a person or company that makes money by buying land and then building houses, factories etc on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Florida property developer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗里达州的一家房地产开发公司

Sense.DEF: a person or an organization that works on a new idea, product etc to make it successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔新办法﹑新产品等的〕开发者﹐研制者
Sense.EXAMPLE: software developers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件开发人员

Sense.DEF: a chemical substance used for making images appear on film or photographic paper
a developing country is a poor country that is trying to increase its industry and trade and improve life for its people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: aid to developing countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对发展中国家的援助

Sense.EXAMPLE: poverty and hunger in the developing world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展中国家存在的贫困和饥饿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the developing economies in Eastern Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧发展中的经济体

Sense.DEF: growing or changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the growth of the developing embryo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发育中胚胎的生长
Sense.EXAMPLE: a developing crisis in Washington
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华盛顿日益加深的危机

Sense.DEF: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced
Sense.EXAMPLE: child development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童发育

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a course on the development of Greek thought
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于古希腊思想发展的课程

GramExa.EXAMPLE: opportunities for professional development
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业发展的机会

Sense.DEF: the process of increasing business, trade, and industrial activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: economic development in Russia
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯的经济发展

Sense.DEF: a new event or piece of news that changes a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: recent political developments in the Middle East
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中东的政治近况
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will keep you informed of developments .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会把最新动态告诉你。

Sense.DEF: the process of working on a new product, plan, idea etc to make it successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The funds will be used for marketing and product development .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spielberg has several interesting projects under development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯皮尔伯格有几个引人注目的项目正在开发中。

Sense.DEF: a change that makes a product, plan, idea etc better
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been significant computer developments during the last decade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去十年里计算机有了显著的发展。

Sense.DEF: the process of planning and building new houses, streets etc on land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land was sold for development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地被出售用于开发。

Sense.DEF: a group of new buildings that have all been planned and built together on the same piece of land
Sense.TRAN: 〔在同一块土地上建造的〕新开发的房产﹐新建楼群
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new housing development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建住宅区

Sense.DEF: relating to the development of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the developmental stages of childhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童时期的各个发育阶段
Sense.EXAMPLE: Higher education is a continuing developmental process .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高等教育是一个持续的发展过程。

Sense.DEF: when something is different, especially in a bad way, from what is considered normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: sexual deviance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性变态

Sense.DEF: different, in a bad way, from what is considered normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: deviant behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变态的行为

Sense.DEF: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The plane had to deviate from its normal flight path.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机不得不偏离正常的航线。

Sense.DEF: a noticeable difference from what is expected or acceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: deviation from the normal procedure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 背离正常的程序

Sense.DEF:
the difference between a number or measurement in a
set
and the average of all the numbers or measurements in that set
a machine or tool that does a special job
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern labour-saving devices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 省力的现代设备

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a device for separating metal from garbage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将金属与垃圾分开的设备

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company makes devices to detect carbon monoxide.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司生产一氧化碳检测设备。

Sense.DEF: a special way of doing something that makes it easier to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔使做某事更容易的〕特殊方法﹐手段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Testing yourself with information on cards is a useful device for studying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用卡片上的信息做自我测试是一种有效的学习方法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a memory device
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种记忆方法

Sense.DEF: a plan or trick, especially for a dishonest purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their proposal was only a device to confuse the opposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的提议只是迷惑反对派的一个花招。

Sense.DEF: a bomb or other explosive weapon

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸弹/核弹/燃烧弹等

Sense.DEF: the special use of words in literature, or of words, lights etc in a play, to achieve an effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔文学作品中的〕手法﹐修辞手段﹔〔戏剧中灯光使用的〕技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Metaphor is a common literary device.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐喻是一种常见的文学手法。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: leave sb to their own devices

Sense.DEF: the most powerful evil spiritin some religions, especially in Christianity

an evil
spirit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The villagers believed a devil had taken control of his body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村民们认为他被邪魔附身了。

Sense.DEF: used when someone you have just been talking about walks into the room where you are
Sense.TRAN: 正说到某人他就来了﹔说曹操﹐曹操到

Sense.DEF: used to talk about someone who you feel sorry for, who is lucky etc
Sense.TRAN: 可怜/幸运/漂亮等的家伙
Sense.EXAMPLE: What on earth is wrong with the poor devil?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可怜的家伙到底怎么了？

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a child or an older man who behaves badly, but who you like
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a naughty little devil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个顽皮的小鬼头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really miss the old devil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常想念这老鬼头。

Sense.DEF: used to persuade someone to do something they are not sure they should do
Sense.TRAN: 别怕﹐勇敢些〔用来说服某人做犹豫不决的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on, be a devil, have another gin and tonic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐怕什么﹐再来一杯金汤力。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised or annoyed
Sense.TRAN: 究竟是什么鬼名堂/哪个鬼家伙/为什么？〔表示惊讶或恼怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How the devil should I know what she’s thinking?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么会知道她到底在想些什么？

Sense.LEXUNIT: a devil of a time/job etc
Sense.DEF: a difficult or unpleasant time, job etc
Sense.TRAN: 难熬的时光/费力的工作等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a devil of a job trying to get the carpet clean again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们费了死劲想重新把地毯清洗干净。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely to go away or stop annoying you
to do something very fast or using a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 拼命地做某事﹐使劲地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rang the bell and ran like the devil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们按了门铃﹐然后就飞快地跑开了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: better the devil you know (than the devil you don’t)
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to deal with someone or something you know, even if you do not like them, than to deal with someone or something new that might be worse
Sense.TRAN: 宁跟认识的魔鬼打交道（也比跟不认识的魔鬼打交道好）﹐两害相权取其轻

Sense.LEXUNIT: between the devil and the deep blue sea
Sense.DEF: in a difficult situation because there are only two choices you can make and both of them are unpleasant

Sense.LEXUNIT: ... and the devil take the hindmost
Sense.DEF: used to say that everyone in a situation only cares about what happens to themselves and does not care about other people
Sense.TRAN: 要鬼捉不到﹐抢在人前逃〔形容人人只顾自己而不管别人〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: the devil makes/finds work for idle hands
Sense.DEF: used to say that people who do not have enough to do will start to do bad things
Sense.TRAN: 人闲魔鬼找〔指人有空闲就会做坏事〕

Sense.DEF: very bad, difficult, or unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: devilish schemes to cheat people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骗人的阴谋诡计

Sense.DEF: seeming likely to cause trouble, but in a way that is amusing or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 淘气的﹐恶作剧的〔以好笑或吸引人的方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dalton looked at her with a devilish grin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多尔顿一脸坏笑地看着她。

Sense.DEF: very – used to show that you think something is annoying or bad
Sense.TRAN: 非常﹐极其〔表示某物讨厌或糟糕〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devilishly difficult task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常困难的任务

Sense.DEF: devilled food is cooked with very hot pepper
Sense.EXAMPLE: deviled eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辣鸡蛋

Sense.DEF: happy and willing to take risks
Sense.TRAN: 无忧无虑的﹐满不在乎的﹐不顾一切的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devil-may-care attitude to life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天塌了也无所谓的生活态度

Sense.DEF: wild or bad behaviour that causes trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: eyes blazing with devilment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪着狡黠的眼睛

Sense.DEF: someone who pretends to disagree with you in order to have a good discussion about something
Sense.TRAN: 故意唱反调〔以加深讨论〕者﹐故意持不同意见的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would play devil’s advocate with anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管是谁﹐他都会跟人家唱反调。

Sense.DEF: a type of chocolate cake
Sense.TRAN: 恶魔蛋糕〔一种巧克力蛋糕〕

Sense.DEF: using dishonest tricks and deceiving people in order to get what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devious politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名不诚实的政客

Sense.DEF: not going in the most direct way to get to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devious route
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迂回的路线

Sense.DEF: to plan or invent a new way of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 想出﹐设计﹐发明〔新的方法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She devised a method for quicker communications between offices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想出一种加快办公室之间通信联络的方法。

Sense.DEF: to be completely lacking in something
Sense.TRAN: 毫无某物﹐完全没有某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was devoid of any warmth or humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸冷若冰霜﹐没有一丝幽默的表情。

Sense.DEF: when a national government gives power to a group or organization at a lower or more local level
Sense.TRAN: 〔中央政府向地方政府或下级机关的〕权力下放

Sense.DEF: if you devolve responsibility, power etc to a person or group at a lower level, or if it devolves on them, it is given to them
Sense.TRAN: （将）〔责任﹑权力等〕下放[转交﹐委派]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The federal government has devolved responsibility for welfare to the states.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦政府已将福利方面的职责下放给各州政府。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Half of the cost of the study will devolve upon the firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究的一半费用将派给这家公司承担。

Sense.DEF: if land, money etc devolves to someone, it becomes their property when someone else dies
Sense.TRAN: （将）〔土地﹑钱等在某人死后〕转移﹐转让〔给某人〕

Sense.DEF: to use all or most of your time, effort etc in order to do something or help someone

GramExa.PROPFORM: devote your time/energy/attention etc to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He devoted his energies to writing films.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他致力于电影剧本的创作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She devoted herself full-time to her business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把全部时间都倾注在生意上。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say put time/energy etc into something rather than devote time/energy etc to something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 put time/energy etc into something ,而不说 devote time/energy etc to something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He put a lot of time into the project.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这个项目上投入了大量时间。

Sense.DEF: to use a particular area, period of time, or amount of space for a specific purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting will be devoted to health and safety issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次会议将专门讨论健康和安全问题。

Sense.DEF: giving someone or something a lot of love and attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devoted father
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽职的父亲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Isabella was devoted to her brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莎贝拉对弟弟尽心尽力。

Sense.DEF: dealing with, containing, or being used for only one thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a museum devoted to photography
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影博物馆

Sense.DEF: strongly supporting someone or something because you admire or enjoy them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beckham’s devoted fans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝克汉姆的忠实球迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journal had a devoted following of around 1,000 subscribers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份刊物有大约1,000名忠实的订户。

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys or admires someone or something very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a devotee of 1930s films
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪30年代电影的爱好者

Sense.DEF: a very religious person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Sikh devotee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个虔诚的锡克教信徒

Sense.DEF: the strong love that you show when you pay a lot of attention to someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alanna has always shown intense devotion to her children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿兰娜对她的孩子一直都表现出深切的爱。

Sense.DEF: the loyalty that you show towards a person, job etc, especially by working hard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the soldier’s courage and devotion to duty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名士兵的勇气和忠于职守
GramExa.EXAMPLE: his integrity and devotion to his patients
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的正直及对病人的奉献精神

Sense.DEF: strong religious feeling
prayers and other religious acts
relating to or used in religious services
Sense.TRAN: 和宗教仪式有关的﹔用于宗教仪式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: devotional music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教音乐

Sense.DEF: to eat something quickly because you are very hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boys devoured their pancakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩子们狼吞虎咽地把薄煎饼吃了。

Sense.DEF: to read something quickly and eagerly, or watch something with great interest
Sense.TRAN: 如饥似渴地阅读﹔津津有味地看
Sense.EXAMPLE: He devoured science fiction books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他如饥似渴地读科幻小说。

Sense.DEF: to be filled with a strong feeling that seems to control you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cindy felt devoured by jealousy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪妒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: to destroy someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her body had been almost entirely devoured by the disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的身体几乎完全被疾病摧毁。

Sense.DEF: to use up all of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job that devours all my energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耗尽我全部精力的工作

Sense.DEF: someone who is devout has a very strong belief in a religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a devout Catholic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虔诚的天主徒

Sense.DEF: a devout hope or wish is one that you feel very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔希望或愿望〕真诚的﹐衷心的﹐诚挚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is my devout hope that we can work together in peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衷心希望我们能一起和睦地工作。

Sense.DEF: the small drops of water that form on outdoor surfaces during the night
a single drop of dew
Sense.EXAMPLE: dewdrops sparkling in the morning sunlight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晨曦中闪烁的露珠

Sense.DEF: the forming of dew or the time when dew begins to appear

wet with drops of
dew
Sense.TRAN: 被露水所湿的﹐带露水的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dewy woodland was solitary and still.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被露水沾湿的林地一片寂静冷清。

Sense.DEF: having eyes that are slightly wet with tears
Sense.TRAN: 眼睛微湿的﹐泪湿眼眶的

Sense.DEF: skill and speed in doing something with your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer games can improve children’s manual dexterity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑游戏可以提高儿童手的灵活性。

Sense.DEF: skill in using words or your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: his charm and verbal dexterity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迷人的魅力和能说会道的本领

Sense.DEF: skilful and quick when using your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: dextrous use of the needle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵巧的针法

Sense.DEF: skilful in using words or your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: his dexterous accounting abilities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他熟练的会计技能

Sense.DEF: a type of sugar that is in many sweet fruits

another spelling of
dexterous
a piece of clothing worn by some Hindu men, consisting of a piece of cloth that is wrapped around the waist and between the legs
Sense.TRAN: 〔印度教某些男教徒的〕缠腰布

Sense.DEF: two, twice, or double
Sense.EXAMPLE: A diphthong is a vowel made up of two sounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双元音是由两个音组成的元音。

Sense.DEF: a type of diabetes that is caused by being very fat
Sense.TRAN: 糖胖症﹐糖尿肥胖病〔由肥胖造成的一种糖〕

Sense.DEF: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood
having diabetes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah is diabetic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉患有糖尿病。

Sense.DEF: caused by diabetes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diabetic coma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖尿病昏迷

Sense.DEF: produced for people who have diabetes
Sense.TRAN: 为糖尿病患者专门制作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: diabetic chocolate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供糖尿病患者食用的巧克力

Sense.DEF: someone who has diabetes
evil or cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: diabolical abuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 残酷的虐待

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: The toilets were in a diabolical state.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厕所的情况糟透了。

Sense.DEF: a mark placed over, under, or through a letter in some languages, to show that the letter should be pronounced differently from the same letter without a mark
Sense.TRAN: 变音符﹐附加符号〔置于字母上下方或横贯字母的符号﹐表示该字母与无此符号的字母发音不同〕

Sense.DEF: a circle of jewels that a queen, princess etc wears on her head
to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe struggled in school before he was diagnosed as dyslexic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔在学校里学习很吃力﹐后来被诊断出患有诵读困难症。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The illness was diagnosed as mumps.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这病经诊断是流行性腮腺炎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was diagnosed with breast cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被诊断出患有乳腺癌。

Sense.DEF: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: diagnosis of kidney disease
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肾病的诊断

Sense.EXAMPLE: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

Sense.DEF: relating to or used for discovering what is wrong with someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors depend on accurate diagnostic tools.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生依靠精确的诊断工具。

Sense.DEF: a diagonal line is straight and joins two opposite corners of a flat shape, usually a square
following a sloping angle
Sense.EXAMPLE: diagonal parking spaces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斜线停车位

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The path goes diagonally across the field.

Sense.DEF: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a diagram of the heating system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 供热系统示意图

Sense.DEF: to show or represent something in a diagram
the round part of a clock, watch, machine etc that has numbers that show you the time or a measurement
Sense.TRAN: 钟面﹐表盘﹔仪表盘﹐刻度盘
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lighted dial of her watch said 1.20.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手表上的夜光表面显示时间为1点20分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at the dial to check her speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看了看仪表盘﹐以确认自己的速度。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a piece of equipment such as a radio or
thermostat
that you turn around to do something, such as find a different station or change the temperature
Sense.TRAN: 〔收音机﹑恒温器等上的〕调节盘﹐控制盘
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dial on the heater was set to ‘HOT’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加热器上的调节盘被调到 “热” 挡。

Sense.DEF: the wheel on an older telephone with numbered holes for your fingers that you move around in order to make a call
to press the buttons or turn the dial on a telephone in order to make a telephone call
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I dialed the wrong number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我拨错号码了。

Sense.DEF: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The people up there speak a Tibetan dialect .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里的人讲的是一种藏语方言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the local dialect
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地方言

Sense.DEF: a method of examining and discussing ideas in order to find the truth, in which two opposing ideas are compared in order to find a solution that includes them both
Sense.TRAN: 辩证法〔通过对两种对立的观点进行研究和讨论来达到统一的方法〕

Sense.DEF: the numbers at the beginning of a telephone number that represent a specific area of a city or country
the sound you hear when you pick up the telephone that lets you know that you can make a call
a conversation in a book, play, or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑戏剧或电影中的〕对话﹐对白
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boring movie full of bad dialog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

Sense.DEF: a discussion between two groups, countries etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个群体﹑国家等之间的〕讨论﹐对话﹐意见交换

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a need for constructive dialogue between leaders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导人之间需要进行建设性的对话。

Sense.DEF:
a box that appears on your computer screen when the program you are using needs to ask you a question before it can continue to do something. You
click
on one part of the box to give your answer.
Sense.TRAN: 对话框〔计算机屏幕上要求用户提供信息的框〕

Sense.DEF: the sound you hear when you pick up the telephone that lets you know that you can make a call
relating to a telephone line that is used to send information from one computer to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dial-up connection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拨号连接

Sense.DEF:
the process of taking harmful substances out of someone’s blood using a special machine, because their
kidney s
do not work properly
Sense.TRAN: 透析〔使用一种特殊仪器为肾功能不正常的病人除去血液中的有害物质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dialysis machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 透析机

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has been on dialysis for the past three years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年来他一直在做透析。

Sense.DEF:
decorated with artificial
diamond s
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diamanté necklace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造钻石项链

Sense.DEF: a straight line from one side of a circle to the other side, passing through the centre of the circle, or the length of this line

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Draw a circle six centimetres in diameter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 画一个直径为六厘米的圆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The diameter of the Earth is about 13,000 km.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的直径约为13,000公里。

Sense.DEF: completely different and opposite
Sense.TRAN: 截然对立的/截然相反的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two ideas are diametrically opposed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个观点截然对立。

Sense.DEF: a clear, very hard valuable stone, used in jewellery and in industry
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diamond engagement ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 订婚钻戒

Sense.DEF: a shape with four straight but sloping sides of equal length, with one point facing directly up and the other directly down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut the cookie dough into diamonds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把做曲奇饼干的面团切成菱形。

Subsense.DEF:
one of the four
suit s types of cards
in a set of playing cards, which has the design of a red diamond shape on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ace of diamonds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 方块A

Subsense.DEF: a card from this suit
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You have to play a diamond.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要出一张方块。

Subsense.DEF:
the area in a baseball field that is within the diamond shape formed by the four
base s
the whole playing field used in baseball

Sense.DEF: the date that is exactly 60 years after the date when two people were married or after some other important date
Sense.TRAN: 钻石婚〔结婚六十周年纪念日〕﹔〔重要日子的〕六十周年纪念日

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a slightly rude way, but is really kind and generous
the date that is exactly 60 years after the date of an important event, especially of someone becoming a king or queen
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指国王或女王加冕的〕六十周年纪念日﹐六十周年庆典

Sense.DEF:
a special
lane
on a road or street that is marked with a diamond shape and can be used only by buses, taxis etc and sometimes private cars with more than one passenger
Sense.TRAN: 菱形车道﹐共乘车道〔有菱形标志的车道﹐只有公共汽车﹑出租车等才可使用﹐有时也允许载有两个及以上乘客的私人汽车行驶〕

Sense.DEF: the date that is exactly 60 years after the date when two people were married
Sense.TRAN: 钻石婚〔结婚六十周年纪念日〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of soft cloth or soft paper that is put between a baby’s legs and fastened around its waist to hold liquid and solid waste
Sense.EXAMPLE: I changed her diaper .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给她换了尿布。

Sense.DEF:
sore skin between a baby’s legs and on its
buttock s
, caused by a wet diaper
diaphanous cloth is so thin that you can almost see through it
the muscle that is between your lungs and your stomach, and that you use when you breathe

a round rubber object that a woman can put inside her
vagina
to stop her from getting
pregnant

a thin round object, especially in a telephone or
loudspeaker
, that is moved by sound or that moves when it produces sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指电话机或扩音器的〕振动膜﹐膜片

Sense.DEF: a round flat part inside a camera that controls the amount of light that enters the camera
someone who writes a diary, especially one that is later sold
Sense.TRAN: 日记作者〔尤指日后发表日记的作者〕

Sense.DEF:
an illness in which waste from the
bowel s
is watery and comes out often
a book in which you write down the things that happen to you each day
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inge kept a diary wrote in a diary during the war years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英奇在战争年代里一直写日记。

GramExa.GLOSS: what you have written for a particular day

Sense.DEF: a book with separate spaces for each day of the year, in which you write down the meetings, events etc that are planned for each day
Sense.TRAN: 〔记录工作日程的〕日程簿﹐记事簿
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you put the meeting date in your diary ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把开会日期写在工作日程簿上了吗？

Sense.DEF: the movement of the Jewish people away from ancient Palestine, to settle in other countries
Sense.TRAN: 大流散〔犹太人离开古巴勒斯坦到其他国家定居的迁移〕

Sense.DEF: the spreading of people from a national group or culture to other areas
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一民族或文化人群的〕大移居
Sense.EXAMPLE: the African diaspora
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲人的大移居

Sense.DEF: a set of eight musical notes that uses a particular pattern of spaces between the notes
a long speech or piece of writing that criticizes someone or something very severely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a diatribe against contemporary American civilization
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对当代美国文明的猛烈抨击

Sense.DEF: the right to have, use, or do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔拥有﹑使用某物或做某事的〕权利
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freshmen have first dibs on dormitory rooms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学一年级学生有宿舍分配的优先权。

Sense.DEF: a small block of wood, plastic etc that has six sides with a different number of spots on each side, used in games

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s your turn to roll the dice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到你掷骰子了。

Sense.DEF: any game of chance that is played with dice
the situation is arranged so that a particular person will win or gain an advantage
Sense.TRAN: 成败已安排好﹔用手段使某人占便宜

Sense.DEF: used to refuse to do something or to say that something is not possible
Sense.TRAN: 不行﹐没办法﹐没门儿〔表示拒绝做某事﹐或说某事是不可能的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I borrow some cash?’ ‘Sorry, no dice.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能借些钱吗？” “抱歉﹐不行。”

Sense.DEF: something you do that you hope will have an effect on a situation, but is not certain to do so
Sense.EXAMPLE: a last desperate throw of the dice to try and win his wife back
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不顾一切挽回妻子的最后努力

Sense.DEF: to cut food into small square pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: diced carrots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切成丁的胡萝卜

Sense.DEF: to put yourself in a very dangerous situation
slightly dangerous and uncertain
Sense.TRAN: 稍有危险的﹔不确定的﹔无法预计的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The future looks pretty dicey for small businesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小型企业的前途看来不妙。

Sense.DEF: the difference between two things or ideas that are completely opposite

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dichotomy between his public and private lives
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他公众生活和私生活的两面性

Sense.DEF:
a
penis
an offensive word for a stupid annoying person, especially a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s acting like a complete dick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表现得就像个大傻瓜。

Sense.DEF:
a
private detective
to cause a lot of problems for someone, especially by changing your mind a lot or preventing them from getting what they want
Sense.TRAN: 给…制造麻烦﹐对…出尔反尔﹐刁难
Sense.EXAMPLE: The phone company’s been dicking me around for three months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话公司折腾了我三个月。

Sense.DEF: used when asking a question to show that you are very surprised or angry
Sense.TRAN: 到底是什么/谁/在哪儿…？〔表示非常惊讶或愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What the dickens is the matter with her?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她到底怎么回事？

Sense.LEXUNIT: as pretty/smart etc as the dickens
Sense.DEF: very pretty, clever etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isn’t she as cute as the dickens!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她多么可爱啊！

Sense.DEF: Dickensian buildings, living conditions etc are poor, dirty, and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 像狄更斯笔下的〔指建筑物﹑生活条件等脏乱差〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a single mother living in a Dickensian block of flats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在狄更斯小说中那种肮脏公寓楼里的单身母亲

Sense.DEF: to argue about or discuss the details of a sale, agreement etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Politicians in Washington are still dickering over the budget.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 华盛顿的政客们还在为预算争执不下。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
dicky 2
an offensive word for a stupid annoying person, especially a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a dickhead!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别跟白痴似的！

Sense.DEF: weak, and likely to break or not work properly

GramExa.GLOSS: a heart that is weak and not very healthy

Sense.DEF: a false shirt front or collar worn under a suit or dress
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿在套装或连衣裙里面﹑只有前襟或领子的〕假衬衫

Sense.DEF: a small bird – used by or when speaking to children
to not hear any news about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you heard from them since they moved?’ ‘No, not a dickybird.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们搬走后你听到过他们的消息吗？” “没有﹐一点也没有。”

Sense.DEF:
a plural of
dictum

an office machine on which you can record speech so that someone can listen to it and
type
it later
Sense.TRAN: 口述录音机〔可录下讲话﹑供别人听着打出讲话内容的机器〕

Sense.DEF: to say words for someone else to write down

GramExa.PROPFORM: dictate a letter/memo etc to sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s dictating a letter to her secretary right now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在正在给秘书口授一封信。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The media cannot be allowed to dictate to the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能让媒体对政府发号施令。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can they dictate how the money will be spent?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可以规定这些钱如何使用吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Islamic custom dictates that women should be fully covered.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊斯兰习俗规定妇女应遮住全身。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
