Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

Sense.DEF: to control or influence something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Funds dictate what we can do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资金的多少决定我们能做些什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The laws of physics dictate that what goes up must come down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 物理定律决定了上升的物体一定会落下。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The massive publicity dictated a response from the city government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的媒体报道迫使市政府作出反应。

Sense.DEF: an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

GramExa.EXAMPLE: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赶时髦的青少年

Sense.DEF: when you say words for someone to write down
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were no secretaries available to take dictation write down what someone is saying .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身边没有秘书记录口授内容。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing that a teacher reads out to test your ability to hear and write the words correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate doing French dictations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌做法语听写。

Sense.DEF: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force
Sense.EXAMPLE: the downfall of the hated dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭人痛恨的独裁者的垮台

Sense.DEF: someone who tells other people what they should do, in a way that seems unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real little dictator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个十足的小霸王

Sense.DEF: a dictatorial government or ruler has complete power over a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: dictatorial regimes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独裁政权

Sense.DEF: a dictatorial person tells other people what to do in an unreasonable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Professor Clement’s dictatorial attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱门特教授专横的态度

Sense.DEF: government by a ruler who has complete power
a country that is ruled by one person who has complete power
the way in which someone pronounces words

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had perfect diction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的发音字正腔圆。

Sense.DEF: the choice and use of words and phrases to express meaning, especially in literature
Sense.TRAN: 措辞﹐〔尤指文学中的〕遣词

Sense.DEF: a book that gives a list of words in alphabetical order and explains their meanings in the same language, or another language
Sense.EXAMPLE: a German-English dictionary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本德英词典

Sense.DEF: a book that explains the words and phrases used in a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: a science dictionary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部科学词典

Sense.DEF: a formal statement of opinion by someone who is respected or has authority
Sense.TRAN: 〔由受人尊敬者或权威人士发表的〕权威意见﹐宣言

Sense.DEF: a short phrase that expresses a general rule or truth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Descartes’ famous dictum: ‘I think; therefore, I am’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笛卡尔的名言 “我思故我在”

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
do
speech or writing that is didactic is intended to teach people a moral lesson
Sense.EXAMPLE: His novel has a didactic tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的小说有一种道德说教的口吻。

Sense.DEF: someone who is didactic is too eager to teach people things or give instructions
to get money from someone by deceiving them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ll diddle you out of your last penny if you let them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你给他们机会﹐他们会把你的钱骗得分文不剩。

Sense.DEF: to know or mean nothing at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brad? He doesn’t know diddly about baseball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德？他对棒球一无所知。

Sense.DEF: a long wooden musical instrument, played especially in Australia
Sense.TRAN: 迪吉里杜管〔尤见于澳大利亚的一种长木管乐器〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘did not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You saw him, didn’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到他了﹐不是吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想去。

Sense.DEF: =you did
to stop living and become dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died in 1985 at the age of 76.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他1985年去世﹐终年76岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father died suddenly in an accident when she was only ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她年仅10岁时父亲突然死于一场意外事故。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The animals died of starvation in the snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些动物在雪中饿死了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: patients who are dying from cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂危的癌症病人

Sense.EXAMPLE: She died peacefully in her sleep at the age of 98.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在睡眠中安然辞世﹐享年98岁。

GramExa.GLOSS: be killed while fighting to defend something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you believe in anything enough to die for it?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有足以让你为之献出生命的信仰吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She died young, at the age of 27.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她27岁英年早逝。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bullet went straight through his head, and he died instantly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹穿过他的头部﹐他当场死亡。

GramExa.PROPFORM: to your dying day/until the day you die
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It must remain a secret until the day I die.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事我到死也不能说。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人最后一口气/临终遗愿
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was his dying wish that the house be opened to the public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这幢房子向公众开放是他的临终遗愿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My uncle died a hero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叔叔死得很英勇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did she die a natural death? did she die naturally, or did someone kill her?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是自然死亡吗？

Sense.DEF: to disappear or stop existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our love will never die.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的爱始终不渝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family name will die with him disappear when he dies .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去世后﹐家族的姓氏也将随之消失。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s one of a dying breed a type of person that is no longer common .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这样的人已经快要绝种了。

Sense.DEF: to stop working
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine spluttered and died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎噼啪响了几声就熄火了。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop working while they are using it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在某人用着的时候坏了
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mower just died on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用着用着割草机就坏了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be dying for sth/to do sth
Sense.DEF: to want something very much
Sense.TRAN: 极想要某物/渴望做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m dying for a cup of tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想喝杯茶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was dying to ask where he’d got it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很想问他是从哪里弄到的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m dying to see what it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很想看看这究竟是什么。

Sense.DEF: to be very hungry, thirsty, bored etc
Sense.TRAN: 都快要饿死/渴死/厌烦死了
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you fancy a cup of tea? I’m dying of thirst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想喝杯茶吗？我都快渴死了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I nearly died/I could have died
Sense.DEF: used to say that you felt very surprised or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 我太惊讶了﹐我尴尬死了
Sense.EXAMPLE: I nearly died when I saw it was my ex-husband!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当看清楚那原来是我前夫时﹐我尴尬死了！

Sense.DEF: to be very embarrassed or ashamed
Sense.TRAN: 尴尬得要命/羞愧得要死
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was such a mess, I just died of embarrassment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里这么乱﹐我真是尴尬得要命。

Sense.DEF: used to say very strongly that you do not want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 我死也不﹐我宁愿死〔用来强烈表示不想做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather die than work for him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我死也不替他工作！

Sense.DEF: during the last minutes or seconds before the end of something
Sense.TRAN: 在（某事的）最后几分钟/最后几秒钟/结束前的一刻
Sense.EXAMPLE: United scored an equaliser in the dying minutes of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队在比赛的最后时刻射入一球﹐将比分扳平。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it takes a long time to change to a new way of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 旧的习惯/传统/习俗很难改变

Sense.DEF: used to encourage someone to continue doing something that is difficult
Sense.TRAN: 别放弃〔用于鼓励某人继续做困难的事〕

Sense.DEF: to gradually fail or be forgotten
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rumour gradually died a death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谣言慢慢平息了。

Sense.DEF: to laugh a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: We nearly died laughing when he told us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跟我们说的时候我们都快笑死了。

Sense.DEF: extremely nice, attractive, or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had hair to die for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发好看极了。

Exponent.DEF: to stop being alive, as a result of old age or illness
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I want to see Ireland again before I die.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想在死之前再去爱尔兰看看。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: No wonder your plants always die – you don’t water them enough.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 难怪你种的植物总会死掉——你水浇得不够。

Exponent.DEF: to die – used when you want to avoid using the word ‘die’, in order to show respect or to avoid upsetting someone
Exponent.TRAN: 去世〔委婉语,为表示尊敬或避免引起某人不快〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My wife had just passed away, and I didn’t want to be around people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妻子刚去世,我想一个人静一静。

Exponent.DEF: to be killed in a terrible event
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of people lost their lives when the ship overturned in a storm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮船在暴风雨中倾覆,数百人失去了生命。

Exponent.DEF: to die in a terrible event – used especially in literature and news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在不幸事件中〕死亡,罹难〔尤用于文学作品和新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Five children perished before firefighters could put out the blaze.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 五名儿童在消防员扑灭大火之前遇难。

Exponent.EXP: give your life/lay down your life
Exponent.DEF: to die in order to save someone, or because of something that you believe in
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为了拯救别人或为了某种信仰〕献出自己的生命,牺牲
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We honor the men and women who have given their lives in service of their country.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向为国捐躯的英雄儿女致敬。

Exponent.DEF: to suddenly die, when people do not expect you to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One day, he came home from work and dropped dead of a heart attack.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天,他下班回到家,因心脏病发作而猝然死去。

Sense.DEF: if sound, wind, or light dies away, it becomes gradually weaker until you cannot hear, feel, or see it
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音﹑风或光〕慢慢变弱﹐渐渐消失
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice died away as she saw the look on David’s face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到戴维脸上的表情﹐她越说声音越小﹐最后没音儿了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waited until the footsteps had died away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直等到脚步声渐渐消失。

Sense.DEF: if a plant dies back, it dies above the ground but remains alive at its roots
Sense.TRAN: 〔植物〕顶梢枯死﹐回枯〔地面以上部分枯死﹐根部却仍活着〕

Sense.DEF: if something dies down, it becomes less strong, active, or violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, the gossip will soon die down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐流言蜚语不久就会平息的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: when the excitement had died down
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当兴奋过去后

Sense.DEF: if a group of people or animals die off, they die one by one until there are no more of them
Sense.TRAN: 相继死去﹐先后死去〔直至死光〕

Sense.DEF: to disappear or stop existing completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wild population of koalas is in danger of dying out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野生树袋熊濒临灭绝的危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be outbreaks of rain, gradually dying out later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先是有阵雨﹐稍后会逐渐停止。

Sense.DEF: a metal block used to press or cut something into a particular shape

a
dice
used to say that a decision has been taken and cannot now be changed
Sense.TRAN: 事情已成定局﹐覆水难收

Sense.DEF: the process of making metal objects by forcing liquid metal into a hollow container with a particular shape, and then allowing it to become hard
someone who opposes change and refuses to accept new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 顽固分子﹐死硬派〔反对变化﹑拒绝新思想的人〕

Sense.DEF: a type of heavy oil used instead of petrol in engines, especially in trucks, buses, and trains
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 1.9 litre diesel engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1.9升柴油发动机

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 柴油汽车/卡车等

Sense.DEF: a vehicle that uses diesel
a way of eating in which you only eat certain foods, in order to lose weight, or to improve your health
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lyn always seems to be on a diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳恩似乎一直在节食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salt-free diet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无盐饮食
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not all diets are good for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是所有的节食方法都适合你。

Sense.DEF: the kind of food that a person or animal eats each day
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t eat a very healthy diet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的饮食不是很健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to have a balanced diet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食均衡很重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the effects of poor diet and lack of exercise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不良饮食和缺乏锻炼的后果
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rice is the staple diet the main food that a group of people usually eat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大米是主食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Studies have shown the benefits of a vegetarian diet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究表明素食有好处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They exist on a diet of fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的食物主要是鱼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of vitamins and minerals in your diet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮食中维生素和矿物质的重要性

Sense.DEF: too much of an activity that you think is boring or has bad effects
Sense.TRAN: 多得令人生厌[对人有害]的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids today are raised on a constant diet of pop music and television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的孩子是伴随着泛滥的流行音乐和电视长大的。

Sense.DEF: an official meeting to discuss political or church matters
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨论政治或教会问题的〕会议

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: to only eat certain foods in order to lose weight
Collocate.EXAMPLE: No cake, thanks – I’m on a diet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要蛋糕,谢谢——我在节食。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start eating less or only some types of food
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I really ought to go on a diet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的应该节食了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: only eat certain types of food
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You will feel better if you follow a low-fat diet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果采用低脂食谱会感觉好些。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: continue to follow a diet
in which you eat a very limited amount or range of food
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She followed a strict diet for several weeks.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她按严格的规定进食,持续了好几周。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very sudden and strict attempt to lose weight
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s better to lose weight gradually than to go on a crash diet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 慢慢减肥比速效减肥好。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘she’s doing a diet’. Say 而要说 she’s on a diet .
Do not say 不要说 ‘keep a diet’. Say 而要说 stick to a diet .

Sense.DEF: to limit the amount and type of food that you eat, in order to become thinner
Sense.TRAN: 〔为减肥而〕节食﹐限制饮食﹐按规定进食

Sense.DEF: diet drinks or foods contain less sugar or fat than ordinary ones

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 低糖汽水

Sense.DEF: related to the food someone eats
Sense.EXAMPLE: special dietary requirements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特殊的饮食要求

Sense.DEF: someone who is trying to become thinner by controlling what they eat
Sense.TRAN: 节食减肥者﹐节制饮食的人

Sense.DEF: the science that is concerned with what people eat and drink and how this affects their health
someone who is trained to give people advice about what it is healthy for them to eat and drink
to be different from something in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two systems differ in many respects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个系统在许多方面不同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People differ from one another in their ability to handle stress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各人应对压力的能力有所不同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The symptoms did not differ between the two groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两组的症状没有区别。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We soon found that prices differed enormously.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很快就发现价格相差很大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Experts have differing views on the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上专家们意见不同。

Sense.DEF: if two people or groups differ about something, they have opposite opinions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two lawyers differed about how to present the case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于如何陈述案情﹐两名律师意见不同。

Sense.DEF: to stop arguing with someone and accept that you will never agree
Sense.TRAN: 承认意见分歧﹐同意保留不同意见

Sense.DEF: used to say that you disagree with someone
Sense.TRAN: 恕我不同意﹔抱歉﹐我不赞同

Sense.DEF: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确﹐这之间有很大的不同。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is very little difference between the parties on green issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各党派在环保问题上分歧很少。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do children know the difference between right and wrong?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童知道对和错的区别吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Researchers found a number of important differences in the way boys and girls learn.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员发现男孩和女孩的学习方法有一些重大差异。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a world of difference there’s a very big difference between us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们之间有着天壤之别。

Sense.DEF: the amount by which one thing is greater or smaller than another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s not much difference in price.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格上没有多少差别。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a five-hour time difference between London and New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦与纽约有五小时的时差。

Sense.DEF: to have an important effect or influence on something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever she did, it made no difference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管她做什么都没有用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One more person wouldn’t make any difference to the arrangements.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多一个人对安排不会有影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It could make the difference between missing your train and getting to work on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能关系到你是赶不上火车﹐还是能够准时上班。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Having a good teacher has made all the difference for Alex had an important influence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个好老师对亚历克斯来说影响很大。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it makes no difference to sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that it does not matter to someone which thing happens, is chosen etc
Sense.TRAN: 对某人来说没有关系﹐对某人而言没什么差别
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morning or afternoon. It makes no difference to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上午或下午都行﹐我无所谓。

Sense.DEF: disagreements
Sense.TRAN: 我们的/你们的/他们的分歧[不和]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had our differences in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去我们也有过分歧。

GramExa.GLOSS: agree not to argue any more

Sense.DEF: a slight disagreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been some differences of opinion as to exactly how the money should be spent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家对这笔钱究竟该怎么花意见有些分歧。

Sense.DEF: used to describe something which is interesting or unusual, especially in a good way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an adventure holiday with a difference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非同一般的历险度假

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 大的/主要的/巨大的差异
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think you’ll notice a big difference.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你会注意到一个很大的区别。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 重要的/显著的/关键的差异
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A study of the two groups of students showed a significant difference.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对两组学生进行的研究表明了一个显著的差异。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 微小的/小的/较小的差异
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s only a slight difference between the male and the female bird.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 雄鸟和雌鸟只有微小的区别。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very noticeable
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a marked difference between the two sets of results.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两组结果存在显著差异。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not obvious
a very basic one
between different classes of society
between men and women
between one person and another

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our data showed considerable national differences.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的数据反映出很大的国家差异。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: know how two things are different
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you don’t know the difference between two words, your dictionary can help.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不知道两个单词的区别,词典可以帮助你。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: can recognize how two things are different
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t really see the difference between these two colours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的看不出这两种颜色的差别。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: see the difference

Sense.DEF: not like something or someone else, or not like before
Sense.TRAN: 不同的﹐不一样的﹐相异的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our sons are very different from each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们家几个儿子大不相同。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her jacket’s different to mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的上衣和我的不一样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seemed different than he did in New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和在纽约时好像不一样了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The place looks completely different now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方现在完全变了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They decided to try a radically different approach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定尝试一种全然不同的办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found women had significantly different political views from men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现女性的政治观点与男性大不相同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a slightly different way of doing things
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍有区别的做事方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: What actually happened was subtly different from the PR people’s version.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实际情况与公关部那些人的说法有细微的差别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show is refreshingly different from most exhibitions of modern art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次展览与大多数现代艺术展不一样﹐令人耳目一新。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The publishing business is no different from any other business in this respect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这一点来讲﹐出版业和其他任何行业没有什么差别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a different world here in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦这儿的情况完全不同。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In spoken British English, different from and different to are both common. Different than is also used in American English and occasionally in British English, especially when it is followed by a clause.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英国英语口语中, different from 和 different to 都很常用。美国英语中还使用 different than﹐ 英国英语中偶尔也会用 ,尤其是在后面接从句时
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He looks no different than when he was 20.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去和20岁的时候没什么两样。
F2NBox.EXPL: Teachers prefer different from , so from is the preposition to use in writing.
F2NBox.TRAN: 老师们更喜欢用 different from,因此写作时 different 后的介词一般用 from
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Their homes are completely different from ours.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的家与我们的完全不一样。
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘different of’.

Sense.DEF: used to talk about two or more separate things of the same basic kind
Sense.TRAN: 〔同一大类事物之间〕不同的﹐有差异的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Different people reacted in different ways .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的人有不同的反应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are many different types of fabric.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多种不同的布料。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I looked in lots of different books but couldn’t find anything about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我查看了许多不同的书﹐但找不到任何有关它的内容。

Sense.DEF: another
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think she’s moved to a different job now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她现在已经换别的工作了。

Sense.DEF: unusual, often in a way that you do not like
Sense.TRAN: 与众不同的〔常指自己不喜欢的那一种〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you think of the film?’ ‘Well, it was certainly different.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你觉得这部影片怎么样？” “唔﹐确实与众不同。”

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I didn’t expect to be treated any differently from anyone else.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有想过得到任何特殊待遇。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: Things could have turned out quite differently.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情的结果原本可能完全不一样。

Exponent.DEF: if something or someone is different, they are not like something or someone else, or they are not like they were before
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look different. Have you had your hair cut?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你变样了。剪头发了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve painted the door a different colour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把门漆成了另一种颜色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cultures of the two countries are very different.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国的文化差异很大。

Exponent.DEF: very different, special, or unusual and the only one of its kind. Don’t use words such as very before unique .
Exponent.TRAN: 独特的,唯一的〔前面不用very等词〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book is certainly very rare, and possibly unique.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书无疑非常稀有,说不定是孤本。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the unique wildlife of the Galapagos Islands
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拉帕戈斯群岛上独特的野生动植物

Exponent.DEF: having a special feature or appearance that makes something different from other things, and makes it easy to recognize
Exponent.TRAN: 〔特征或外表〕独特的,特别的,特有的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Male birds have distinctive blue and yellow markings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 雄鸟有独特的蓝色和黄色斑纹。

Exponent.DEF: completely different from a particular person or thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In Britain, unlike the United States, the government provides health care.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和美国不一样,英国是由政府提供医疗保健服务。

Exponent.DEF: if two people have nothing in common, they do not have the same interests or opinions and therefore cannot form a friendly relationship
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Apart from the fact that we went to the same school, we have absolutely nothing in common.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了上过同一所学校之外,我们毫无共同点。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that two people or things seem very different
Exponent.TRAN: 没有/几乎没有相似之处
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no resemblance between the two sisters at all.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两姐妹一点也不像。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The final product bore no resemblance to the original proposal it was very different .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终产品与最初的提议大相径庭。

Exponent.DEF: not the same as something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These four politically dissimilar states have all signed a treaty of friendship and cooperation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这四个政治形态不同的国家共同签署了一份友好合作协定。

Exponent.DEF: if two people are like chalk and cheese, they are completely different
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to believe that they’re brothers – they’re like chalk and cheese!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难相信他们是兄弟俩——他们一点都不像！

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that two people or things are very different
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can’t compare residential and commercial real estate markets. It’s apples and oranges.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宅房地产市场与商业房地产市场无法比较,两者截然不同。

Sense.DEF: a difference between things, especially between the wages of people doing different types of jobs in the same industry or profession
Sense.TRAN: 差别﹔〔尤指同行业不同工作之间的〕工资级差

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资差别

Sense.DEF: a differential gear
based on or depending on a difference
Sense.TRAN: 基于差别的﹐依差别而定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: differential rates of pay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资级差
Sense.EXAMPLE: differential treatment of part-time and full-time staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对兼职员工和全职员工的区别对待

Sense.DEF: a way of measuring the speed at which an object is moving at a particular moment

an arrangement of
gear s
that allows one back wheel of a car to turn faster than the other when the car goes around a corner
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆转弯时使车的一个后轮转动得比另一个后轮快的〕差速器﹐差动齿轮

Sense.DEF: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s important to differentiate between fact and opinion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把事实和观点加以区别很重要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s sometimes hard to differentiate one sample from another.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候很难把样品区分开来。

Sense.DEF: to be the quality, feature etc that makes one thing or person clearly different from another
Sense.EXAMPLE: What differentiates these two periods of history?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Its unusual nesting habits differentiate this bird from others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鸟独特的筑巢习惯使它不同于其他的鸟。

Sense.DEF: to behave differently towards someone or something, especially in an unfair way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a policy which differentiates between men and women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把男人和女人区别对待的政策

Sense.DEF: hard to do, understand, or deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: a difficult question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难解的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: an immensely difficult task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为艰巨的任务
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was the exam very difficult?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次考试很难吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to see how more savings can be made.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想要进一步节约看来是很难了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s rather difficult for me to explain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很难作出解释。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s finding it difficult to get a job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现找工作很难。

Exponent.DEF: not easy to do, understand, or deal with
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a difficult question
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 难题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The homework was really difficult.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭作业真的很难。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to see how peace can be achieved in the region.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区要想实现和平看来很难。

Exponent.DEF: difficult. Hard is less formal than difficult and is very common in spoken English.
Exponent.TRAN: 困难的〔不如difficult正式,常见于英语口语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The test was really hard.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 测验真的很难。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hard decision
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰难的决定
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was hard to forgive him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难原谅他。

Exponent.DEF: very difficult, because you have to use a lot of effort, or because it affects you emotionally
Exponent.TRAN: 艰难的〔因需要很大的努力,或因情感上受影响〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tough race
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰苦的竞赛
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors have to make tough decisions about who to treat first.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生必须作出先治疗谁的艰难决定。

Exponent.DEF: difficult because it is complicated and full of problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had helped him out of a tricky situation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她帮助他脱离了困境。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Merging the two companies was bound to be tricky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 合并两家公司肯定不好办。

Exponent.DEF: rather difficult to deal with -used especially when something could be embarrassing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’ve put me in a very awkward position.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让我处于一个非常尴尬的境地。

Exponent.DEF: difficult in an interesting or enjoyable way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wanted a job that was more challenging.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要一份更具挑战性的工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a challenging piece of music
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首有挑战性的乐曲

Exponent.DEF: difficult and tiring, because it takes a lot of effort
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Being a nurse in a busy hospital is a demanding job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在忙碌的医院当护士是很累人的工作。

Exponent.DEF: if something seems daunting, you think that it will be difficult and you do not feel confident about being able to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a daunting challenge
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项令人生畏的挑战
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The task seemed a little daunting at first.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 任务一开始似乎有点令人望而却步。

Exponent.DEF: needing to be dealt with carefully or sensitively, especially in order to avoid offending people or causing problems
Exponent.TRAN: 微妙的,需要谨慎处理的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This is a very delicate subject, and it can be difficult to talk about it with your parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个很微妙的话题,很难和父母讲。

Sense.DEF: involving a lot of problems and causing a lot of trouble or worry
Sense.TRAN: 有困难的﹐有问题的﹐有麻烦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难办的局面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Things are a bit difficult at home at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前家里的事情有点麻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There could be difficult times ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往后可能会遇到困难的时候。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使某人日子难过﹔刁难某人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s doing everything she can to make life difficult for him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想方设法让他日子难过。

Sense.DEF: someone who is difficult never seems pleased or satisfied
Sense.TRAN: 难以取悦的﹐不易相处的﹐不易满足的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so difficult!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么挑剔！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a difficult customer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苛刻的顾客

Sense.DEF: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had great difficulty in finding a replacement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们找接替的人费了很大劲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got to his feet with difficulty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他费劲地站了起来。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 someone ‘has difficulty to do something’. Say that 而要说 someone has difficulty doing something or has difficulty in doing something.

Sense.DEF: a problem or something that causes trouble

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are several difficulties with this theory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一理论有几处难点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you have any difficulties, give me a call.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你遇到困难﹐就给我打电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project soon ran into difficulties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目很快就遇到了困难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Difficulties can arise when there is more than one defendant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果被告不止一个﹐可能就会产生难题。

Sense.DEF: if you are in difficulty, you are in a situation in which you have problems

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The business is in financial difficulty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家企业财务上遇到了困难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She soon got into difficulty with debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快就因债务陷入了困境。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being difficult to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the difficulty of solving such problems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决这类问题的难

Sense.DEF: how difficult something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tests vary in difficulty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 测试的难度有所不同。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By the age of eight, Robbie was having difficulties at school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了八岁,罗比在学业上遇到了困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: find yourself in a difficult situation
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Three people were rescued from a boat that had got into difficulties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 三人从遇险船只上获救。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have difficulties
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Graduates often experience considerable difficulties in getting their first job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕业生找第一份工作常常会遭遇很多困难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The hotel’s owners were facing financial difficulties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店的老板正面临财务困境。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: deal with them successfully
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are confident that we can overcome these difficulties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有信心克服这些困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be something that is difficult to deal with
Collocate.EXAMPLE: English spelling may present some difficulties for learners.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语拼写可能会对学习者造成一些困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: involve a lot of them
cause them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The stormy weather gave rise to difficulties for many of the competitors in the yacht race.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨天气给帆船赛的许多选手造成了困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: happen

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By then, we were having serious financial difficulties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时,我们财务方面非常困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of problems
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They had considerable difficulties in getting funding for their research.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在争取研究经费时遇到了不少困难。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The flight was delayed due to technical difficulties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 航班由于技术问题延误了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: problems with doing something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is facing serious financial difficulties.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正面临严重的财务困境。

Sense.DEF: shy and not wanting to make people notice you or talk about you

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 羞怯的举止/微笑/声音等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was diffident about his own success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的成功很谦卑。

Sense.DEF: to bend light or sound waves as they pass around something or through a hole
Sense.TRAN: 使〔光或声波〕衍射〔即绕过某物或穿过小孔时发生弯曲〕

Sense.DEF: to make heat, light, liquid etc spread through something, or to spread like this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pollutants diffuse into the soil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染物渗进了土壤。

Sense.DEF: to spread ideas or information among a lot of people, or to spread like this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their ideas diffused quickly across Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的观点很快在欧洲传播开来。

Sense.DEF: to make a bad feeling or situation less strong or serious
Sense.TRAN: 减弱﹐平息〔不良情绪或局面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to diffuse his anger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平息他怒气的尝试

Sense.DEF: spread over a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization is large and diffuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组织规模大﹑分布广。

Sense.DEF: using a lot of words and not explaining things clearly and directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: His writing is diffuse and difficult to understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写的东西冗长难懂。

Sense.DEF:
to move earth, snow etc, or to make a hole in the ground, using a
spade
or your hands

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They dig a small hole in the sand to bury their eggs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 它们在沙地里掘一个小洞﹐把蛋掩埋在里面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dig down about 6 inches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 往下挖大约六英寸深。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: birds digging for worms
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刨土找虫吃的鸟

Sense.DEF:
to remove something, especially vegetables, from the ground using a
spade
Sense.EXAMPLE: freshly dug carrots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚挖出来的胡萝卜

Sense.DEF: to put your hand into something, especially in order to search for something
Sense.TRAN: 把手伸入﹔〔尤指〕翻找﹐搜寻
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dug around in her bag for a pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在包里翻找钢笔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dug his hands deep into his pockets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把双手深深插进口袋里。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to do something in spite of other people’s efforts to persuade you
to use something which you have, especially money or effort, which you would not normally need
Sense.TRAN: 花大力气﹐动用〔一般不用的〕金钱或精力
Sense.EXAMPLE: With one man sent off, the team had to dig deep and hang on for a draw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名队员被罚下场后﹐球队只好费九牛二虎之力保个平局。

Sense.DEF: to get yourself into a difficult situation by doing or saying the wrong thing

Sense.LEXUNIT: dig sb out of trouble/a mess/a hole etc
Sense.DEF: to help a person or organization get out of trouble
to do something that will cause serious problems for you in the future
Sense.TRAN: 自掘坟墓﹐自取灭亡﹐自讨苦吃

Sense.DEF: to like something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dig that hat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢那顶帽子！

Exponent.DEF: to make a hole in the ground using your hands, a tool, or a machine
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some workmen were digging a trench at the side of the road.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些工人在路边开沟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In Africa, the people know where to dig for water.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在非洲,人们知道在哪里掘井取水。

Exponent.DEF: to dig a hole in the ground, using your hands or a tool
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make a hole just big enough for the plant’s roots.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 挖一个正好能容下植物根部的坑。

Exponent.DEF: if an animal burrows, it makes a hole or a passage in the ground by digging the earth with its feet, nose etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The rabbits had burrowed a hole under the fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 兔子在篱笆底下打了个洞。

Exponent.DEF: to turn over the soil using a machine or a tool pulled by animals, to prepare the soil for planting seeds
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The farmers here still plough their fields using buffaloes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的农民依然用水牛犁地。

Exponent.DEF: to dig a large hole in the ground, especially as a preparation for building something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The men began excavating the hole for the pool.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人开始开挖池塘。

Exponent.DEF: to make a deep round hole in the ground using a special machine, especially in order to look for oil or water
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Companies need a special licence to bore for oil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司钻探石油需要特别许可证。

Sense.DEF: to mix something into soil by digging
Sense.TRAN: 把…翻进〔土壤〕﹐翻土掺入某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dig some fertiliser into the soil first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先在土中翻入一些肥料。

Sense.DEF: to push a hard or pointed object into something, especially someone’s body, or to press into something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dug her finger nails into his arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手指甲抠进他胳膊的肉里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dug his spurs in and urged his horse on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用靴刺戳了戳马﹐催它快跑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I could feel one of the hooks digging in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能感觉到有一个钩子扎进去了。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people, especially soldiers, dig in, they make a protected place for themselves or prepare for a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔士兵〕掘壕防守﹔为应付困难做准备
Sense.EXAMPLE: The troops dug in along the defensive line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队沿着防线布防。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We just have to dig in and hope we can turn things around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只有严阵以待﹐希望能够扭转局面。

Sense.DEF: to start eating food that is in front of you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on – dig in!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐开始吃！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was already digging into his pie and chips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经开始吃馅饼和薯条了。

Sense.DEF: to start using a supply of something, especially money
Sense.TRAN: 开始使用〔储备的东西﹐尤指钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to have to dig into my savings again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又得动用储蓄了。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out about something unknown or secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had been digging into her past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在探查她的过去。

Sense.DEF:
to get something out of earth, snow etc using a
spade
or your hands

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had to dig the car out of a snow drift.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得把汽车从雪堆里挖出来。

Sense.DEF: to find something you have not seen for a long time, or that is not easy to find
Sense.TRAN: 找出﹐翻出〔很久没看到或很难找到的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must remember to dig out that book for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我必须记着把那本书给你找出来。

Sense.DEF:
to remove something from the earth using a
spade
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll dig up that plant and move it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要把那棵植物挖出来﹐挪个地方。

Sense.DEF: to remove the surface of an area of ground, road etc, or to make holes in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re digging up the road just outside my flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们就在我的公寓外面把路掘开了。

Sense.DEF: to find hidden or forgotten information by careful searching
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried to dig up something from his past to spoil his chances of being elected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图从他的过去挖出些东西来破坏他当选的可能性。

Sense.DEF: a joke or remark that you make to annoy or criticize someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t resist a dig at the referee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他忍不住嘲讽了裁判。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Here was a chance to have a dig at trade unionists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在有了机会挖苦一下工会分子。

Sense.DEF: to push someone quickly and lightly with your finger or elbow
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手指或肘部〕触某人﹐碰某人﹐戳某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ginnie gave her sister a dig in the ribs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金尼戳了一下她妹妹的肋部。

Sense.DEF: an organized process of digging in order to find ancient objects for study
Sense.EXAMPLE: an archaeological dig
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考古发掘

Sense.DEF: a room that you pay rent to live in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s 42 and still living in digs .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他42岁了﹐还住在租来的房间里。

Sense.DEF: to change food that you have just eaten into substances that your body can use
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most babies can digest a wide range of food easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数婴儿能轻易地消化很多种食物。

Sense.DEF: to understand new information, especially when there is a lot of it or it is difficult to understand
Sense.TRAN: 理解﹐领悟﹐消化〔尤指大量新信息或难以理解的信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I struggled to digest the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我费力地琢磨着那条新闻。

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing that gives the most important facts from a book, report etc
food that is digestible can be easily digested

PronCodes.PRON: daɪ'dʒestʃ ə n, dɪ- daɪ'dʒestʃ ə n, də-

Sense.DEF: the process of digesting food
your ability to digest food easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Too much tea is bad for your digestion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝太多茶会影响消化。

Sense.DEF: connected with the process of digestion

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消化系统/器官/液等

Sense.DEF:
a type of plain slightly sweet
biscuit
that is popular in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 消化饼干〔一种味道微甜的饼干﹐在英国很受欢迎〕

Sense.DEF: a large machine that digs and moves earth
a place where people are digging holes in the ground

a piece of electronic equipment which people in Britain put on top of their televisions if they want to receive
digital
programmes broadcast by the
satellite TV
company BSkyB. A Digibox can also connect a television to the Internet.
Sense.TRAN: 〔在英国装在电视机上接收英国天空广播公司的数字电视节目的〕数字机顶盒

Sense.DEF:
a type of camera that can store pictures in a
digital
form which can be put into a computer, rather than on film

a
cardboard
container for a CD which folds out from the centre
one of the written signs that represent the numbers 0 to 9

GramExa.EXAMPLE: number 4305 is a four-digit number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 4305是个四位数。

Sense.DEF: a finger or toe
using a system in which information is recorded or sent out electronically in the form of numbers, usually ones and zeros
Sense.EXAMPLE: digital TV
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字电视
Sense.EXAMPLE: a digital signal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字信号
Sense.EXAMPLE: a digital camera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数码照相机
Sense.EXAMPLE: digital recording
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字录音

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a recording on digital audiotape
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字音频磁带上的录音

Sense.DEF: giving information in the form of numbers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a digital watch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子表

Sense.DEF: relating to the fingers and toes
the differences of opportunity that exist between people who can regularly and easily use the Internet and email, and people who cannot do this
Sense.TRAN: 数字鸿沟〔指因使用因特网和电子邮件的条件不同而造成的机遇不平等〕

Sense.DEF: information on an electronic message that proves who the person sending the message is
Sense.TRAN: 〔表明电子信息发送人身份的〕数字签名

Sense.DEF: a system of broadcasting using digital signals
a television which can receive digital broadcasts
to put information into a digital form
Sense.TRAN: 把〔信息〕转变成数字形式﹐使〔信息〕数字化

Sense.DEF: behaving in a calm and serious way, even in a difficult situation, which makes people respect you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dignified old lady
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庄重的老太太
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a dignified departure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不失尊严地离去。

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone seem better or more important than they really are, especially by using a particular word to describe them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过使用某个词〕抬高…的身价﹐抬举

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I cannot dignify him with the name ‘physician’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能用 “医生” 这个称呼来高抬他。

Sense.DEF: someone who has an important official position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flowers were presented to visiting dignitaries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到访的各位要员收到了献上的鲜花。

Sense.DEF: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family faced their ordeal with dignity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一家人在磨难面前不失尊严。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an appearance of quiet dignity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肃穆的神态

Sense.DEF: your sense of your own value or importance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Old people need to retain their dignity and independence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年人需要保持自尊和独立。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Arguing was beneath her dignity was something she thought she was too important to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得争吵有失体面。

Sense.DEF: the fact of being respected or deserving respect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Patients should be allowed to die with dignity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该允许病人死得有尊严。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Prisoners should be treated with regard for human dignity .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对待囚犯应该考虑到人的尊严。

Sense.DEF: a calm and serious quality

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the dignity of the occasion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一场合的庄严

Sense.DEF: to demand to be treated with proper respect
to talk or write about something that is not your main subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔说话或写作时〕偏离主题﹐转移话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you mind if I digress for a moment?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说些题外话你不介意吧？

RunOn.EXAMPLE: After several long digressions he finally reached the interesting part of the story.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 说了好几大段题外话之后﹐他终于讲到了故事的精彩部分。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
dyke
an order that is forced on people by a ruler or government
Sense.TRAN: 〔统治者或政府强加在人民身上的〕强制命令﹐勒令
Sense.EXAMPLE: government by diktat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专制统治

Sense.DEF: a dilapidated building, vehicle etc is old and in very bad condition
if a hollow part of your body dilates or if something dilates it, it becomes wider
Sense.EXAMPLE: dilated pupils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩大的瞳孔

Sense.DEF: to speak or write a lot about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dilated upon their heroism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他详述了他们的英勇行为。

Sense.DEF: slow in doing something
an object shaped like a male sex organ that a woman can use for sexual pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 〔女性用于自慰的〕假阴茎﹐人造男性生殖器

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moral dilemma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道德上进退两难的窘境

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m in a dilemma about this job offer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于是否接受这个工作﹐我左右为难。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This placed Robert Kennedy in a dilemma.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让罗伯特·肯尼迪陷入了两难的境地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many women are faced with the dilemma of choosing between work and family commitments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女性面临着出去工作还是照顾家庭的两难境地。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be on the horns of a dilemma

Sense.DEF: someone who is not serious about what they are doing or does not study a subject thoroughly
someone who is diligent works hard and is careful and thorough
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diligent student
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勤勉的学生

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们卖力地干了一上午。

Sense.DEF: a type of herb

a whole
cucumber
which has been preserved in
vinegar
to waste time, because you cannot decide about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于对某事犹豫不决而〕浪费时间﹐磨蹭
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t dilly-dally, just get on with it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别磨磨蹭蹭的﹐尽管继续做吧！

Sense.DEF: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: diluted fruit juice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀释的果汁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dilute the paint with a little oil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用少量油把颜料稀释一下。

Sense.DEF: to make a quality, belief etc weaker or less effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to dilute the proposals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想使这些建议的影响打折扣的企图

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Any dilution of standards must be resisted.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何降低标准的行为都必须加以抵制。

Sense.DEF: a dilute liquid has been made weaker by the addition of water or another liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: dilute hydrochloric acid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀盐酸

Sense.DEF: fairly dark or not giving much light, so that you cannot see well
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the dim light of the early dawn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在微弱的晨曦里
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dim glow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昏暗的微光

Sense.DEF: a dim shape is one which is not easy to see because it is too far away, or there is not enough light
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dim outline of a building loomed up out of the mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座建筑物巨大而朦胧的轮廓在雾霭中隐现。

Sense.LEXUNIT: take a dim view of sth
Sense.DEF: to disapprove of something
Sense.TRAN: 不赞同某事﹐对某事持否定态度
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miss Watson took a dim view of Paul’s behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃森小姐对保罗的行为颇为不齿。

Sense.DEF: a memory or understanding of something that is not clear in your mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura had a dim recollection of someone telling her this before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉隐约记得以前曾有人告诉过她这件事。

Sense.DEF: dim eyes are weak and cannot see well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isaac was old and his eyes were dim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以撒年老﹐眼睛昏花。

Sense.DEF: if your chances of success in the future are dim, they are not good
Sense.TRAN: 〔未来成功的机会〕暗淡的﹐渺茫的﹐不乐观的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prospects for an early settlement of the dispute are dim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早日解决争端的希望比较渺茫。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the dim and distant past
Sense.DEF: a very long time ago – used humorously
not intelligent
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can be really dim sometimes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候你可真笨啊！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was only dimly aware of the risk.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是隐约意识到危险。

Sense.DEF: if a light dims, or if you dim it, it becomes less bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lights in the theatre began to dim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧院里的灯光开始暗下来。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, quality etc dims or is dimmed, it grows weaker or less
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even the rain could not dim their enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至下雨都未能减弱他们的热情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes of a peaceful settlement have dimmed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平解决的希望变得渺茫了。

Sense.DEF: to lower the angle of the front lights of your car, especially when someone is driving towards you
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤其当对面有车开来的时候〕把汽车前灯调为近光

Sense.DEF: a coin of the US and Canada, worth one tenth of a dollar
very common and not valuable
Sense.TRAN: 平常的﹐不稀罕的﹐不值钱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: PhDs are a dime a dozen nowadays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今哲学博士学位不值钱了。

Sense.DEF: a cheap book with a story that contains a lot of exciting events
Sense.TRAN: 廉价小说〔其中包含许多惊险刺激的情节〕

PronCodes.PRON: daɪ'menʃ ə n, dɪ- daɪ'menʃ ə n, də-

Sense.DEF: a part of a situation or a quality involved in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the moral dimension of world politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界政治的道德方面

GramExa.PROPFORM: add a new/an extra/another etc dimension (to sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His coaching has added another dimension to my game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的指导使我的技巧更进了一层。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is important to keep in mind the historical dimension to these issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要考虑到这些问题的历史背景。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can have a spiritual dimension to your life without being religious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使你不信宗教﹐也可以在生命中拥有精神层面的内容。

Sense.DEF:
the length, height, width, depth, or
diameter
of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rectangle with the dimensions 5cm × 2cm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长五厘米﹑宽两厘米的长方形

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll need to know the exact dimensions of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要知道这个房间的确切大小。

Sense.DEF: a direction in space that is at an angle of 90 degrees to two other directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: A diagram represents things in only two dimensions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 示意图只能二维地呈现物体。

PIC.HEADING: DIMENSION 维度
PIC.PICCONTENT: depth 纵深；length 长度；height 高度；depth 纵深；depth 深度；width 宽度

Sense.DEF: how great or serious a problem is
Sense.EXAMPLE: a catastrophe of enormous dimensions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的灾难

Sense.DEF: a shop that sells many different kinds of cheap goods, especially for the house
to become or make something become smaller or less
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make someone or something appear less important or valuable than they really are
Sense.TRAN: 削弱﹐贬低〔重要性或价值〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him diminish your achievements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他贬低你的成就。
Sense.EXAMPLE: But that’s not to diminish the importance of his discoveries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过﹐这也不是要贬低他的发现的重要性。

Sense.DEF: when the profits or advantages you are getting from something stop increasing in relation to the effort you are making
when someone is not considered to be responsible for their actions because they are mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于某人精神失常而〕减轻的罪责

Sense.DEF: a part in a piece of music where it becomes gradually quieter
a reduction in the size, number, or amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔大小﹑数目或数量的〕变小﹐缩小﹐减少

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a diminution in value
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价值的减少

Sense.DEF: small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shy diminutive man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个腼腆的矮个子男人

Sense.DEF: a word formed by adding a diminutive suffix
Sense.TRAN: 指小词〔由表示 “小” 的后缀构成的词〕

Sense.DEF: an ending that is added to a word to express smallness, for example ‘ling’ added to ‘duck’ to make ‘duckling’
Sense.TRAN: 指小后缀〔如ling﹐它加在duck（鸭子）后面便变成了duckling（小鸭子）〕

Sense.DEF: an electric light switch that can change the brightness of the light
a small hollow place on your skin, especially one on your cheek or chin when you smile
Sense.TRAN: 〔脸颊上的〕酒窝﹔〔下巴上的〕凹痕

Sense.DEF: a small hollow place in a surface
a stupid person
a loud unpleasant noise that continues for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The din of the engines was deafening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎的噪声震耳欲聋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ged was trying to make himself heard above the din.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格德试图让人们在嘈杂的声音中听到他说的话。

Sense.DEF: to make someone learn and remember something by saying it to them many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: Respect for our elders was dinned into us at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里我们被反复教导要尊敬长者。

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Macedonia, Serbia and some North African and Middle Eastern countries
Sense.TRAN: 第纳尔〔马其顿﹑塞尔维亚及北非和中东一些国家的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: to eat dinner
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was dining with friends at the Ritz.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和朋友在里茨饭店一起进餐。

Sense.DEF: to eat a particular kind of food for dinner, especially expensive food
Sense.TRAN: 以〔尤指昂贵的食物〕当正餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: We dined on lobster and strawberries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正餐吃的是龙虾和草莓。

Sense.DEF: to eat dinner in a restaurant or in someone else’s house
Sense.TRAN: 外出用餐〔指在餐厅或别人家吃饭〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They would dine out together once a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每月一次一起外出用餐。

Sense.DEF: to keep using a story about something that has happened to you, in order to entertain people at meals
Sense.TRAN: 总是把〔自己的〕某件事作为饭桌上的笑谈

Sense.DEF: someone who is eating in a restaurant
a small restaurant that serves cheap meals
a small area, usually in or near the kitchen, where people eat meals
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常在厨房内或旁边的〕小饭厅

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some ding-a-ling parked too close to us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个傻瓜把车停得离我们的车太近了。

Sense.DEF: the noise made by a bell
a noisy argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were having a real ding-dong in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在厨房吵得正凶。

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
a small open boat used for pleasure, or for taking people between a ship and the shore
Sense.TRAN: 〔玩乐用的〕小游艇﹔〔载人往返于大船与岸边的〕小艇

Sense.DEF: an Australian wild dog
dark, dirty, and in bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 阴暗而肮脏的﹐阴暗而邋遢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dingy room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴暗邋遢的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dingy side-street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昏暗肮脏的小街

Sense.DEF: a carriage on a train where meals are served
a room where you eat meals in a house or hotel
a table at which you eat meals
fair or honest – used in Australian English
Sense.TRAN: 正大光明的﹐诚实的〔用于澳大利亚英语〕

Sense.DEF: small and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dinky little bag
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精致的小包

Sense.DEF: too small and often not very nice
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a really dinky hotel room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一间非常狭小的酒店客房。

Sense.DEF: the main meal of the day, eaten in the middle of the day or the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time do you usually have dinner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你通常什么时候吃饭？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having fish for dinner tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今天晚饭吃鱼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s for dinner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭吃什么？

Sense.DEF: a formal occasion when an evening meal is eaten, often to celebrate something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了庆祝某事而举行的〕晚宴
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Club’s annual dinner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部的年度晚宴

Crossrefto.REFLEX: more sth than you’ve had hot dinners

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you come and have dinner with us?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么不来和我们一起吃晚饭呢？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I offered to cook dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我主动要求做晚饭。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I thought we might have pasta for dinner tonight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们今天晚饭可以吃意大利面。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’re having a few friends round to dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们请了几位朋友过来吃晚餐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let’s ask Kate and Mike to dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们请凯特和迈克来吃晚饭吧。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go and eat in a restaurant
start giving people food

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 三道菜/四道菜等的晚餐
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cost of the hotel includes a three-course dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店费用包括一顿三道菜的晚餐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a special meal eaten on Sunday etc
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We usually have a walk after Christmas dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞大餐后我们一般出去走走。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for two people in a romantic relationship
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Clive and Denise were enjoying a romantic dinner for two in a quiet French restaurant.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫和丹尼丝正在一家安静的法国餐厅享用浪漫的两人晚餐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with only candles for lighting
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Chris treated his girlfriend to a candle-lit dinner.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯请女朋友吃了顿烛光晚餐。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: where people wear special formal clothes
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was invited to a black-tie dinner at one of the Oxford colleges.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获邀参加牛津一所学院的正式晚宴。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: meals provided at school in the middle of the day
Collocate.EXAMPLE: School dinners are served in the canteen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校午餐在食堂供应。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: meals that you eat while watching TV
Collocate.EXAMPLE: TV dinners in aluminium containers can be found in the freezer departments of many supermarkets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 铝盒装的电视便餐在许多超市的冷冻食品区有售。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone’s friends are invited for a special evening meal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are having a dinner party on Saturday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们周六要请客吃饭。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The dinner guests began arriving at about seven o’clock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 7点左右,晚宴嘉宾陆续到来。

Sense.DEF: a social event in the evening, that includes a formal meal and music for dancing

a black or white jacket worn by men on very formal occasions, usually with a
bow tie
Sense.TRAN: 男子晚礼服〔正式场合穿着﹐黑色或白色﹐通常打蝶形领结〕

Sense.DEF: a woman who serves meals to children at school
Sense.TRAN: 〔在学校为孩子们端饭菜的〕女服务员

Sense.DEF: a social event when people are invited to someone’s house for an evening meal
a complete set of plates, dishes etc, used for serving a meal

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when people are eating dinner together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t a very suitable conversation for the dinner table.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种谈话不太适合在用餐时进行。

Subsense.DEF: the table at which people eat dinner

Sense.DEF: a restaurant in which you see a play after your meal, or this type of entertainment
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐后演出戏剧的〕戏剧餐厅﹔餐厅戏剧

Sense.DEF: the time when you usually have dinner, especially in the middle of the day
Sense.TRAN: 用餐时间〔尤指午餐时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to go for a drink at dinnertime?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午餐时你想不想去喝一杯？

Sense.DEF:
one of a group of
reptile s
that lived millions of years ago
someone or something that is old-fashioned and no longer effective or suitable for modern times
Sense.TRAN: 守旧落伍的人﹔过时落后的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: lengthy speeches by some of the party’s dinosaurs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党那些老古董冗长的发言

Sense.DEF: by using a particular method
Sense.TRAN: 凭借某事物﹐通过（做）某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: By dint of hard work and persistence, she had got the job of manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠着勤奋和毅力﹐她得到了经理的职位。

Sense.DEF:
the area under the control of a
bishop
in some Christian churches

PronCodes.PRON: daɪ'ɒsɪs ə n daɪ'ɒsəs ə n

Sense.DEF: a piece of electrical equipment that makes an electrical current flow in one direction

a chemical
compound
that contains two atoms of oxygen and one atom of another chemical
element
a very poisonous chemical used in industry and farming
Sense.TRAN: 二英〔一种剧毒的化学物质〕

Sense.DEF: to put something into a liquid and lift it out again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dipped his hand in the water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把手在水中浸了一下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dip the strawberries into melted chocolate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把草莓在熔化的巧克力中蘸一蘸。

Sense.DEF: to move down, or to make something move down, usually for just a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We watched the sun dip below the horizon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着太阳沉到地平线以下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dipped her head and spoke into the microphone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她低下头对着麦克风讲话。

Sense.DEF: if an amount or level dips, it becomes less, usually for just a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Profits dipped slightly last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年利润略有降低。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Temperatures dipped to -10˚C last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚气温降到了零下10摄氏度。

Sense.DEF: if land or a road or path dips, it slopes down and then goes up again
to lower the angle of the front lights of your car when someone is driving towards you
Sense.TRAN: 〔当对面有车开来时〕把汽车前灯调为近光

Sense.DEF: to put animals in a chemical that kills insects on their skin
to read short parts of a book, magazine etc, but not the whole thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the kind of book you can dip into now and again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是那种可以不时翻翻的书。

Sense.DEF: to use some of an amount of money that you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: Medical bills forced her to dip into her savings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不得不动用积蓄支付医疗费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents are being asked to dip into their pockets for new school books use their own money to pay for them .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长被要求自掏腰包买新课本。

Sense.DEF: to put your hand into a bag or box in order to take out one of the things inside
Sense.TRAN: 把手伸进〔袋子或盒子中把里面的东西掏出来〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: On her lap was a bag of candy which she kept dipping into.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不停地从腿上放着的一袋糖果里摸出糖来吃。

Sense.DEF: a quick swim
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you coming in for a dip?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你游一会儿吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s take a dip in the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到湖里游一小会儿泳吧。

Sense.DEF: a slight decrease in the amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔某物数量上略微的〕减少﹐下降

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an unexpected dip in profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出乎意料的利润下降

Sense.DEF: a thick mixture that you can dip food into before you eat it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来蘸食物吃的〕调味酱汁﹐蘸料
Sense.EXAMPLE: sour cream and onion dip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸奶油洋葱蘸料

Sense.DEF: a place where the surface of something goes down suddenly, then goes up again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dip in the road
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上的凹陷

Sense.DEF: a chemical that kills insects on sheep and other animals
Sense.TRAN: 〔给羊或其他动物杀虫用的〕药浴液

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗羊液

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
a quick look at information, a book, magazine etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: People interested in history would enjoy a dip into this book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对历史感兴趣的人会乐意翻阅一下这本书。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= diploma 结业证书﹐考试证书

Sense.DEF: a serious infectious throat disease that makes breathing difficult
a vowel sound made by pronouncing two vowels quickly one after the other. For example, the vowel sound in ‘main’ is a diphthong.
Sense.TRAN: 复合元音﹐双元音〔如main中的元音〕

Sense.DEF: a document showing that someone has successfully completed a course of study or passed an examination
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m hoping to get my teaching diploma this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望今年能拿到教师证书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a diploma in catering
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐饮业资格证书

Sense.DEF:
a document showing that a student has successfully completed their
high school
or university education

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高中/大学毕业文凭

Sense.DEF: the job or activity of managing the relationships between countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: international diplomacy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际外交

Sense.DEF: skill in dealing with people without upsetting them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job requires tact and diplomacy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作需要有圆通练达的处事能力。

Sense.DEF: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country
Sense.EXAMPLE: French diplomats
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国外交官

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at dealing with people without upsetting them
Sense.TRAN: 有手腕的人﹐善交际的人

Sense.DEF: relating to or involving the work of diplomats
Sense.TRAN: 外交的﹐从事外交工作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Diplomatic efforts to end the fighting began on October 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停战的外交努力于10月25日开始。

Sense.DEF:
the arrangement between two countries that each should keep representatives at an
embassy
in the other’s country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two countries established diplomatic relations last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年两国建立了外交关系。

Sense.DEF: dealing with people politely and skilfully without upsetting them
Sense.TRAN: 讲究手腕的﹐灵活变通的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were always very diplomatic with awkward clients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们与难缠的客户打交道一向很有策略。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diplomatic answer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八面玲珑的回答

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Maria handled the situation very diplomatically.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚很圆熟地处理了这一情况。

Sense.DEF: a bag or container used for sending official government documents to diplomats working abroad
all the diplomats working in a particular country

a diplomat’s special rights in the country where they are working, which protect them from local taxes and
prosecution
the British government department that sends people to represent Britain in other countries

a
diplomat
a small bird that finds its food in streams
Sense.TRAN: 河乌〔在小溪中觅食的一种小鸟〕

Sense.DEF: a large spoon with a long handle, used for taking liquid out of a container
silly or crazy
an offensive word for a stupid person
someone who has a very strong desire for alcohol, which they cannot control
a stick for measuring the amount of liquid in a container, especially the amount of oil in a car’s engine
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指测量汽车引擎中油量的〕浸量尺﹐测深尺﹐量油尺

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
a picture made in two parts which can be closed like a book
extremely serious or terrible
Sense.EXAMPLE: warnings of dire consequences that often don’t come true
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对严重后果的警告﹐尽管这些后果常常不会出现
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country is in dire need of food aid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家急需食品援助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The situation looked dire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况看来非常严重。

Sense.DEF: to be in an extremely difficult or serious situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone agrees the sport is in dire straits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都认为这个体育项目已处于岌岌可危的境地。

Sense.DEF: a warning about something terrible that will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last night there were dire warnings of civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚传来关于内战的可怕警告。

Sense.DEF: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between
Sense.EXAMPLE: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not in direct contact with them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他们没有直接的联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Educational level has a sizeable direct effect on income.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育程度对收入有很大的直接影响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a direct link between poverty and ill-health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困与健康不佳有着直接的关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision to close the hospital is a direct result of Government health policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关闭这所医院的决定是政府医疗保健政策导致的直接结果。

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 从一个地方到另一个地方
Sense.DEF: going straight from one place to another without stopping or changing direction
Sense.TRAN: 笔直的﹐径直的〔中途不停的﹐不改变方向的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which is the most direct route to London?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪条是到伦敦最直接的路线？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a direct flight to New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直飞纽约的航班

Sense.DEF: exact or total
Sense.EXAMPLE: Weight increases in direct proportion to mass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重量的增加与质量成正比。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For Lawrence, in direct contrast to Adam, everything seemed to come so easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与亚当恰恰相反﹐对劳伦斯来说一切都好像来得那么容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a direct quote exact words from the book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引自该书的一段原话

Sense.DEF: saying exactly what you mean in an honest clear way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人常常觉得男人太直率﹐不够体贴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, let me ask you a direct question , and I expect a direct answer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我要问你一个坦率的问题﹐希望你能坦率地回答。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is related to someone else through their parents and grandparents, not through their
aunt s
,
uncle s
etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She claimed to be a direct descendant of Wordsworth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自称是华兹华斯的嫡系后裔。

Sense.DEF: an occasion on which something such as a bomb hits a place exactly, causing a lot of damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the war, the cathedral suffered many direct hits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间﹐这座大教堂多次被炸弹直接击中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the bombers scored a direct hit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有一架轰炸机直接命中目标。

Sense.DEF: strong heat or light that someone or something is not protected from
Sense.TRAN: 〔没有任何防护的〕直接受热/日照
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never change the film in direct sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万不要在阳光照射下更换胶卷。

Sense.DEF: to aim something in a particular direction or at a particular person, group etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The machine directs an X-ray beam at the patient’s body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器把X射线对准病人的身体。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The new route directs lorries away from the town centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的道路使得卡车可以绕开镇中心行驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to direct your attention to paragraph four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想请你们留意第四段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to direct my efforts more towards my own projects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想把精力更多地投入到自己的项目中去。

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of something or control it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Turner was directing the investigation from a very early stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特纳先生从很早开始就在负责这项调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The choir was directed by Sir David Willcocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合唱团由戴维·威尔科克斯爵士指挥。

Sense.DEF: to give the actors in a play, film, or television programme instructions about what they should do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play was directed by Frank Hauser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏剧由弗兰克·豪泽导演。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone how to get to a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you direct me to Trafalgar Square, please?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我去特拉法尔加广场怎么走吗？

Sense.DEF: to tell someone what they should do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge directed the jury to find Mr Baggs not guilty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官指示陪审团判巴格斯先生无罪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He directed that his body should be buried in Upton.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要求将他的遗体安葬在阿普顿。

Sense.DEF: without stopping or changing direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we fly direct to Chicago, or do we stop in Salt Lake City first?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能否直飞芝加哥﹐还是要先在盐湖城停一下？

Sense.DEF: without dealing with anyone else first
Sense.EXAMPLE: Esther decided to contact the manager direct.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃斯特决定直接和经理联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is usually cheaper to buy the goods direct from the wholesaler.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直接向批发商购货一般比较便宜。

Sense.DEF:
the ability to obtain
data
directly from a computer
file
without starting from the beginning
Sense.TRAN: 直接存取﹐随机访问〔从计算机文档中直接获取资料﹐不必从头开始搜寻〕

Sense.DEF:
an action such as a
strike
or a protest that is intended to make a government or company change something immediately
Sense.TRAN: 直接行动〔用罢工或抗议等行动来迫使政府或公司改变某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peaceful direct action by pressure groups has a powerful effect on public opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压力集团和平的直接行动对舆论具有很大的影响。

Sense.DEF: a flow of electricity that moves in one direction only
an instruction you give your bank to pay money directly out of your account regularly to a particular person or organization
a method of paying someone’s wages directly into their bank account
Sense.TRAN: 直接存款付薪〔把某人的工资直接存入此人的账户〕

Sense.DEF: the way something or someone moves, faces, or is aimed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which direction did they go in ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们朝哪个方向走了？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The suspects were last seen heading in the direction of Miami.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一次有人看见嫌疑犯时﹐他们正向迈阿密方向逃跑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tony glanced in her direction and their eyes met.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼朝她的方向瞥了一眼﹐他们的目光相遇了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The girls pointed in the opposite direction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩子们指了相反的方向。
Sense.EXAMPLE: On seeing me, Maurice changed direction and went along the wharf instead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯一看见我便改变方向﹐沿着码头走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As shots rang out, the crowd ran screaming in all directions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枪声响起﹐人群尖叫着四散奔逃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a loud scream from the direction of the children’s pool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童游泳池那边传来一声很响的尖叫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Continue in a southerly direction until you reach the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 继续往南走﹐一直走到大路上。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say which way ...? when asking where something is rather than using the noun direction .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,询问方向一般说 which way ...? ,而不用名词 direction
F2NBox.BADEXA: Which direction did they go in?
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ Which way did they go in?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们往哪里走了？
哪个方向是北？

Subsense.DEF: instructions about how to get from one place to another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A very helpful woman gave me directions to the police station.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个很热心的妇女给我指了去警察局的路。

Subsense.DEF: instructions about what to do
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Be sure you read the directions before using any piece of equipment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用任何设备之前一定要先阅读操作指南。

Sense.DEF: the general way in which someone or something changes or develops
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are happy with the direction the club is taking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对俱乐部的发展方向很满意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I believe that things are heading in the right direction in South Africa.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信南非正朝着正确的方向发展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is hoping to extend its operations in new directions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司希望朝新的方向扩大经营。

Sense.DEF: control, management, or advice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under Thompson’s direction, the college has developed an international reputation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在汤普森的管理下﹐这所大学已经建立了国际声望。

Sense.DEF: where something comes from or where something leads

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The evidence all points in this direction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有证据都指向这个方向。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Help came from a wholly unexpected direction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 援助来自一个完全没有预料到的地方。

Sense.DEF: a general purpose or aim
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother felt that Rachel’s life lacked direction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔的母亲觉得她的生活缺乏目标。

Sense.DEF: the instructions given to the actors and other people working on a film, play etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧等导演的〕指导﹐指示

Crossrefto.REFLEX: a step in the right direction

Sense.DEF: relating to the direction in which something is pointing or moving
a directional piece of equipment receives or gives out radio signals from some directions more strongly than others
Sense.TRAN: 定向的〔定向仪器接收或发出的无线电信号在某些方向上比其他方向强〕

Sense.DEF: lacking a clear direction or aim
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt directionless and lost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到缺乏目标﹐心中迷茫。

Sense.DEF: an official order or instruction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: proposals for implementing the EU directive on paternity leave
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实施欧盟关于陪产假规定的提议

Sense.DEF: giving instructions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team leader will have a less directive role.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 队长的指导作用将会减少。

Sense.DEF: with no other person, action, process etc between
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Application for admission to this course should be made directly to the University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想加入这门课程应该直接向大学申请。

Sense.DEF: exactly in a particular position or direction

GramExa.PROPFORM: directly in front of/behind/under etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a small house, directly behind the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一所小房子﹐在教堂的正后面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl was sitting directly opposite him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女孩坐在他正对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you noticed how he never looks directly at you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有注意到他从未直视过你？

Sense.DEF: to say exactly what you mean without trying to hide anything
Sense.TRAN: 坦率地[直截了当地]说/问/回答等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff has a job in mind, but refuses to say directly what it is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于工作杰夫心里已经有了目标﹐只是不肯直接说出来是什么。

Sense.DEF: very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should be here directly, if you don’t mind waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不介意等一会儿﹐他应该很快就会到的。

Sense.DEF: immediately
as soon as
Sense.EXAMPLE: I came directly I got your message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我收到你的口信就立刻来了。

Sense.DEF: advertisements that are sent by post to many people
the business of selling things directly to people by post or telephone rather than in shops
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过邮寄或打电话的〕直接推销﹐直接营销

Sense.DEF: a method of teaching a foreign language without using the student’s own language
Sense.TRAN: 外语直接教学法〔不使用学生本国语的外语教学法〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of being clear, plain, or easy to understand
Sense.TRAN: 直接﹔率直﹐坦率﹔清楚﹐明确
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a childlike enthusiasm and directness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有孩子般的热情和坦率。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The directness of the question startled me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题问得直截了当﹐让我大吃一惊。

Sense.DEF:
in grammar, the person or thing that is affected by the action of a
transitive
verb, for example ‘Mary’ in the statement ‘I saw Mary’
Sense.TRAN: 直接宾语〔如I saw Mary 中的 Mary〕

Sense.DEF: someone who controls or manages a company

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a former director of Gartmore Pensions Ltd
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加特莫尔退休基金有限公司的前任董事

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is run by a board of directors a group of directors .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司由董事会管理。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a particular activity or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the director of education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育局局长

GramExa.GLOSS: the person in charge of the financial department etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 财务部/市场部/销售部等主管

Sense.DEF: the person who gives instructions to the actors and other people working on a film or play
the group of directors who run a company
a department of a government or large organization in charge of a particular area or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the regional directorate of education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方教育部门

Sense.DEF: the person in charge of a large public organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔大型公共机构的〕主管﹐总裁﹐局长
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Director-General of Fair Trading
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平贸易部主管

Sense.DEF: relating to the work of a film or theatre director
Sense.EXAMPLE: De Niro’s directorial debut
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德尼罗的首次执导

Sense.DEF: a teacher in a British university or language school who is in charge of organizing the students’ programmes of study
Sense.TRAN: 教务长〔英国大学或语言学校负责安排学生学习计划的老师〕

Sense.DEF: a folding wooden chair with arms, which has pieces of cloth as the seat and the back
a film containing all the parts that the director wanted to include, that usually appears after the film has been shown in cinemas without those parts
the position of being a director of a company or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Institute was established under the directorship of Professor Gray.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究所是在格雷教授主持下创建的。

Sense.DEF: a book or list of names, facts etc, usually arranged in alphabetical order
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常按字母顺序排列的〕姓名地址录﹐名录﹐电话簿
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t find your number in the telephone directory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在电话簿上找不到你的电话号码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new business directory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的商业名录

Sense.DEF:
a place in a computer where
file s
or programs are organized
a service on the telephone network that you can use to find out someone’s telephone number
speech reported using the actual words spoken, as in ‘ ‘I don’t want to go,’ said Julie.’
Sense.TRAN: 直接引语〔指直接引用某人说的原话﹐如‘I don’t want to go,’ said Julie. 这里 I don’t want to go即为直接引语〕

Sense.DEF: a tax, such as income tax, which is collected from the person who pays it, rather than a tax on goods or services
Sense.TRAN: 直接税〔直接向纳税人征收的税种﹐不同于商品税﹑服务税等间接税〕

Sense.DEF: direct-to-consumer advertising is aimed at the customer who will buy the product rather than the shops where it will be sold
a slow sad song sung at a funeral
a song or piece of music that is too slow and boring

an
airship
a heavy pointed knife used as a weapon in Scotland in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时苏格兰人用作武器的〕尖刀﹐短剑﹐匕首

Sense.DEF: any substance that makes things dirty, such as mud or dust
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should have seen the dirt on that car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没看见那车上沾了多少泥！
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face and hands were black with dirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸和手黑乎乎的﹐全是泥。
