Sense.EXAMPLE: a patch of grass, covered in dog dirt waste from a dog’s bowels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满是狗屎的一小片草地

Sense.DEF: earth or soil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael threw his handful of dirt onto the coffin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔往棺材上撒了一把土。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children had been sitting in the dirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子一直在泥地里坐着。

Sense.DEF: information about someone’s private life or activities which could give people a bad opinion of them if it became known
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspapers had been digging up dirt on the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸一直在挖掘总统的丑事。

Sense.DEF: talk, writing, a film etc that is considered bad or immoral because it is about sex
Sense.TRAN: 下流话﹔下流文章﹔色情电影

Sense.DEF: someone who is very unpleasant and immoral

a small
motorcycle
for young people, usually ridden on rough paths or fields
extremely cheap or cheaply
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么便宜的商品显然是依靠极廉价的劳动力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got these shoes dirt cheap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋我买得便宜极了。

Sense.DEF:
a
disher
Sense.TRAN: 爱散布流言蜚语的人﹐爱说三道四的人

Sense.DEF: a poor farmer who works to feed himself and his family, without paying anyone else to help
extremely poor
a road made of hard earth
a road or path made of hard earth

a track used for
motorcycle
races
covered in or marked by an unwanted substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stack of dirty dishes in the sink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗涤槽里的一堆脏碟子
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you get so dirty?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么会弄得这么脏？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She circled the bedroom, picking up dirty clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在卧室里转了一圈﹐把脏衣服收拾起来。

Sense.DEF: relating to sex, in a way that is considered immoral or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 下流的﹐黄色的﹐色情的﹐猥亵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids telling dirty jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲着下流笑话的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dirty magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色情杂志
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at me as if I had said a dirty word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看我的样子﹐就像我说了句脏话似的。

GramExa.GLOSS: a weekend when a man and woman who are not married to each other go away to have sex
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 风流周末〔指非夫妻关系的男女周末外出厮混〕

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you think someone or something is bad, dishonest, or immoral
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re a dirty liar!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个下贱的骗子！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dirty fighter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑鄙的拳手
Sense.EXAMPLE: you and your dirty little deals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和你那些肮脏的交易

GramExa.GLOSS: treat someone in a way that is unfair or dishonest

Sense.EXAMPLE: What a dirty trick!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么卑鄙的伎俩！

Sense.DEF: if something is a dirty word, people believe it is a bad thing even if they do not know or think much about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Liberal’ has somehow become a dirty word in America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “自由” 一词不知怎么的在美国变成了犯忌的字眼。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone in a very disapproving way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susan gave her brother a dirty look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊狠狠地瞪了弟弟一眼。

Sense.DEF: a dishonest or unfair action, especially done by a government, company or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: political dirty tricks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑鄙的政治伎俩

Sense.DEF: to discuss something embarrassing or bad about yourself where everyone can see, know, or hear
Sense.TRAN: 把丑事外扬﹐使丑事公开
Sense.EXAMPLE: The divorce has meant airing their dirty laundry in court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚意味着要在法庭上公开他们的家丑。

Sense.DEF: to do an unpleasant or dishonest action for someone, so that they do not have to do it themselves
Sense.TRAN: 替某人干他不愿干的工作[卑鄙的事]
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not talking to him; you do your own dirty work!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不去跟他说﹐这种烂事你自己去做！

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s a dirty job, but someone has to do it
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is unpleasant to do, but that it is necessary – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 事情是很讨厌﹐但总得有人去干〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: containing or possessing illegal drugs

a bomb that contains a
radioactive
substance which makes the bomb more dangerous than bombs containing only traditional explosives
Sense.TRAN: 脏弹〔含放射性物质的炸弹〕

Sense.DEF: a dirty sports event is one in which people competing in the event have illegally used drugs to improve their performance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people think that the race has been a dirty event for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人认为多年来这项比赛中的运动员都使用禁药。

Exponent.DEF: not clean
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His clothes were untidy and he had dirty hands.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着邋遢,两只手很脏。

Exponent.DEF: very dirty
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Each year filthy water causes millions of cases of illness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年,不洁净的水引发数百万人生病。

Exponent.DEF: covered with mud
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It had been raining hard and the path was muddy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下了很大的雨,小路很泥泞。

Exponent.DEF: covered with dust
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the dusty shelves in the attic
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 阁楼上布满灰尘的搁架

Exponent.DEF: covered with oil or grease
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Greasy food is bad for your health.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 油腻的食物有害健康。

Exponent.DEF: fairly dirty and needing to be cleaned or washed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was wearing a grubby white T-shirt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着一件邋遢的白T恤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: mucky fingers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 满是污垢的手指

Exponent.DEF: covered with thick dirt or dirt that has been there a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t see much out of the grimy windows of the train.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车车窗上积满灰尘,我看不清楚外面。

Exponent.DEF: looking dark, dirty, and unpleasant - used about rooms, houses, and buildings
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We worked in a dingy little office behind the station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在车站后面一间又暗又脏的小办公室里上班。

Exponent.DEF: used about land, water, or air that has been made dirty
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 85% of city dwellers breathe heavily polluted air. 85%
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 的城市居民呼吸着严重污染的空气。

Exponent.DEF: made dirty by a dangerous substance or bacteria
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The virus is mainly spread through contaminated food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒主要通过受污染的食物传播。

Exponent.DEF: extremely dirty and unpleasant - used about the place or conditions in which someone lives
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某人居住的地方或环境〕非常肮脏的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are living in squalid conditions, with little water and no sanitation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们住在肮脏的环境里,没有足够的水,也没有卫生设备。

Exponent.DEF: used about dirty conditions that are likely to cause disease, especially conditions in kitchens, restaurants, and hospitals
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指厨房﹑餐厅和医院的环境〕不卫生的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The food was prepared under unhygienic conditions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些食物是在不卫生的环境下制成的。

Exponent.DEF: used about dirty conditions that are likely to cause disease, especially because there is not a good system for getting rid of waste
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因废物处理不善而〕不卫生的,卫生条件差的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People’s health is being threatened by overcrowded and insanitary homes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 住房过度拥挤,卫生条件恶劣,民众的健康正在遭受威胁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They work for long hours in unsanitary conditions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在脏乱的环境里长时间工作。

Exponent.DEF: made dirty, especially by waste from your body
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指被排泄物弄脏而〕污秽的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Soiled nappies should be changed as quickly as possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尿布脏了要尽快更换。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a very unfair and dishonest way, especially in a competition or game
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在比赛或游戏时〕耍花招﹐使用卑鄙手段
Sense.EXAMPLE: a team that plays dirty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛不老实的球队

Sense.DEF: to talk about sex using offensive words
extremely big
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dirty great snake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条巨蛇

Sense.DEF: to make something dirty
to make someone feel or seem bad, dishonest, or immoral
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army’s actions dirtied its reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支军队的行为败坏了自己的名声。

Sense.DEF: to do hard physical work, in which your hands become dirty
Sense.TRAN: 干体力活﹐干粗活﹐干重活

Sense.DEF: an older man who is too sexually interested in younger women – used to show disapproval

another spelling of
diss
shows an opposite or negative
Sense.EXAMPLE: I disapprove do not approve .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞成。
Sense.EXAMPLE: dishonesty lack of honesty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不诚实

Sense.DEF: shows the stopping or removing of a condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disconnect the machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切断机器的电源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disinfect the wound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给伤口消毒。

Sense.DEF: a physical or mental condition that makes it difficult for someone to use a part of their body properly, or to learn normally

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Public places are becoming more accessible to people with disabilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共场所越来越方便残障人士出入了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: children with severe learning disabilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有严重学习障碍的儿童

Sense.DEF: when you have a physical or mental disability
Sense.EXAMPLE: learning to cope with disability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学会应付生理缺陷

Sense.DEF: money that is given by the government to people who have physical disabilities
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府发给残障人士的〕残障福利金

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Evans lives on disability because of an accident that left her paralyzed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯因为一次意外事故导致身体瘫痪﹐靠残障福利金生活。

Sense.DEF: to make someone unable to use a part of their body properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carter was permanently disabled in the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特在那场战争中成了终生残废。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make a machine or piece of equipment impossible to use
Sense.TRAN: 破坏〔机器或设备〕﹐使瘫痪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The virus will disable your computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒会使你的电脑瘫痪。

Sense.DEF: someone who is disabled cannot use a part of their body properly, or cannot learn easily
Sense.TRAN: 残障的﹐残疾的﹐有学习障碍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a support group for parents of disabled children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助残障儿童父母的援助团
Sense.EXAMPLE: a severely disabled polio patient
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重残疾的小儿麻痺症病人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you are elderly or physically disabled, massage can be beneficial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按摩对老年人或有残疾的人很有好处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: teachers who work with learning disabled children children who have problems learning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教有学习障碍的儿童的教师

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 残疾人停车位/厕所/通道等

Sense.DEF: people who are disabled
Sense.EXAMPLE: The theatre has good access for the disabled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家剧院里的残障人士出入通道很便捷。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone that what they believe is not true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to disabuse him of that notion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图让他改变那种观念。

Sense.DEF: something that causes problems, or that makes someone or something less likely to be successful or effective

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The disadvantage of the material is that it fades in strong sunlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种材料的缺点是在强烈的阳光下会褪色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are some big disadvantages to marriage – you do lose a lot of your freedom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结婚有一些大的不利方面——你的确会失去许多自由。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Criminal behaviour can be linked to economic disadvantage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪行为可能会与经济困难有关。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The main disadvantage of iron as a material is its weight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁这种材料的主要缺点是太重。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This method has one major disadvantage: its cost.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种方法有一个很大的缺点: 成本太高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Public transport is very bad here, which is a serious disadvantage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的公共交通很糟糕,这是一个严重的弊端。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 社会/经济/教育方面的劣势

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Cheap air travel has considerable environmental disadvantages.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 廉价航空对于环境有诸多不利。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Working-class boys suffer disadvantages in the educational system.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出身工人阶级的男孩子在教育体系中处于不利地位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed in spite of a disadvantage
someone has a disadvantage
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company was at a disadvantage compared with its competitors.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 与竞争对手相比,这家公司处于不利地位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone less likely to be successful than others
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Not speaking English might put you at a disadvantage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会说英语可能会让你吃亏。

Collocate.COLLOC: be/work to the disadvantage of sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone unlikely to be successful
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This system works to the disadvantage of women.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种制度对女性不利。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the good and bad features of something
there are more advantages than disadvantages

Exponent.DEF: a bad feature that something has, which makes it less good or less useful than other things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What do you think are the disadvantages of nuclear energy?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为核能有哪些缺点？

Exponent.DEF: a bad feature that something has, although it has advantages that are usually more important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the main drawbacks is the price.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要的劣势之一是价格。

Exponent.DEF: a bad feature that something has
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All of these designs have both their good points and bad points.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些设计都有各自的优点和缺点。

Exponent.DEF: the disadvantage of a situation that in most other ways seems good or enjoyable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a great job. The only downside is that I don’t get much free time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作很棒,唯一的缺点是我没有多少自由时间。

Sense.DEF: to make someone less likely to be successful or to put them in a worse situation than others
having social problems, such as a lack of money or education, which make it difficult for you to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 社会地位低下的﹐处于弱势地位的〔如贫穷或教育程度低下等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: disadvantaged areas of the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市贫困地区

Sense.DEF: people who are disadvantaged
Sense.TRAN: 社会地位低下者﹐弱势群体
Sense.EXAMPLE: health programs for the disadvantaged
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对弱势群体的医疗保健计划

Sense.DEF: unfavourable and likely to cause problems for you
Sense.TRAN: 不利的﹐可能引发问题的

Sense.DEF: not satisfied with your government, leader etc, and therefore no longer loyal to them or no longer believing they can help you
Sense.TRAN: 〔对政府﹑领导等〕不满的﹐不忠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disaffected youth from poor neighborhoods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫民区那些心存不满的年轻人

Sense.DEF: if an organization disaffiliates from another organization or is disaffiliated from it, it breaks the official connection it has with it
Sense.TRAN: 脱离﹐正式退出〔某个组织〕﹐割断关系

Sense.DEF: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is tolerant of those who disagree with him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对与自己有分歧的人持宽容态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Experts disagree on how much the program will cost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家们对该项目会花费多少意见不一。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

Sense.DEF: if statements, numbers, or reports about the same event or situation disagree, they are different from each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔有关同一事件或形势的陈述﹑数字或报道〕不一致﹐不相符
Sense.EXAMPLE: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名证人的证词不一致。

Exponent.DEF: to have a different opinion from someone else about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Scholars disagree about the meaning of the poem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学者们对于这首诗的含义存在不同意见。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t agree with a word of what she says.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说的话我一个字也不同意。

Exponent.DEF: if a group of people is divided or split on something, some of them have one opinion and others have a completely different opinion
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The party is divided on this issue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党成员在这一问题上看法不一。

Exponent.DEF: if two or more people differ about something, they have different opinions from each other about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two men differed on how to handle the crisis.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个男人对于如何处理危机持不同意见。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that two people have different opinions and ideas so that it is difficult for them to be friends or work together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some of the teachers don’t see eye to eye with the principal of the school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 部分教师与校长意见不合。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that you disagree with someone’s opinion and that you think they are wrong
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are mistaken if they think that this problem will go away on its own.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们要是认为这个问题会自行消失,那就错了。

Exponent.DEF: to express strong disagreement with an idea or with what someone has said or done
Exponent.TRAN: 不同意某人/某事,对某人/某事提出异议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A number of people took issue with the mayor’s decision.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些民众对于市长的决定提出异议。

Exponent.DEF: to say publicly that you disagree with an official opinion or one that most people accept
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对官方意见或公认观点〕持异议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two members of the jury dissented from the majority verdict.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团的两名成员对多数人的裁定持有异议。

Sense.DEF: if something such as food or weather disagrees with you, it has a bad effect on you or makes you ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物或天气〕对〔某人〕有不良影响﹐使〔某人〕身体不适
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seafood always disagrees with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃海鲜总是感到不舒服。

Sense.DEF: not at all enjoyable or pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹐不合意的﹐讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disagreeable job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不称心的工作

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conversation was disagreeable to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这番交谈令他不快。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say someone or something is not very nice rather than disagreeable .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,表示某人或某事不好一般说 not very nice ,而不说 disagreeable
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It’s not a very nice job.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是一份很好的工作。

Sense.DEF: unfriendly and bad-tempered
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rude, disagreeable woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗鲁﹑坏脾气的女人

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people express different opinions about something and sometimes argue
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had a few disagreements , but we’re still good friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然有过一些分歧﹐但我们仍是好朋友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: disagreements about who will be allowed to vote
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于谁可以参加投票的分歧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were disagreements among doctors about the best way to treat the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病用什么方法治疗最好﹐医生的意见有分歧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Connor’s disagreements with school administrators
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 康纳和学校管理人员的意见分歧

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 尖锐/根本/深刻等的分歧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists are in disagreement about the significance of the data.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于此数据的意义﹐科学家们意见不一。

Sense.DEF: differences between two statements, reports, numbers etc that ought to be similar
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个本该相似的陈述﹑报道﹑数字等的〕不相符﹐不一致

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is disagreement between these two estimates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两种估算不符。

Sense.DEF: to officially refuse to accept something, because a rule has been broken
Sense.TRAN: 不承认﹐不接受﹐驳回〔违反规则的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United had a goal disallowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队的一个入球被判无效。

Sense.DEF: to become impossible to see any longer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sun had disappeared behind a cloud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳躲到云后面不见了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: David watched her car until it disappeared from view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维一直望着她的车﹐直到它从视线中消失。

Sense.EXAMPLE: At this point the path seemed to disappear altogether disappear completely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路到这里好像完全消失了。

Sense.DEF: to be lost, or to become impossible to find
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two girls disappeared while walking home from school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两名女孩在放学回家的路上失踪了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My keys have disappeared again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钥匙又不见了。

GramExa.GLOSS: without any way of finding them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: 75,000 soldiers simply disappeared without trace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 75,000名士兵竟然消失得无影无踪。

Sense.DEF: to stop existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain forest may disappear forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片雨林可能会永远消失。

Exponent.DEF: if something disappears, you cannot see it any longer, or it does not exist any longer
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The sun slowly disappeared over the horizon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳慢慢地从地平线上消失了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Millions of people saw their savings disappear.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万人眼看着自己的储蓄没有了。

Exponent.DEF: to completely disappear, especially suddenly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boat vanished without trace off the coast of Australia.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船在澳大利亚海岸不远处消失得无影无踪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All hopes of finding the boy alive have vanished.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩生还的希望全部破灭。

Exponent.DEF: to stop existing – used about something bad such as a pain or a problem
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wish this headache would go away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望头痛会好起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid the problem won’t just go away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕这个问题不会自行消失。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually become less clear, strong, or bright, and finally disappear
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her voice began to fade away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音变得越来越轻。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His anger slowly faded away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的怒气渐渐消退。

Exponent.DEF: to disappear, especially gradually – used about feelings or groups of people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔情感〕逐渐消失﹔〔人群〕逐渐散去
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The crowd began to melt away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群开始散去。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His initial excitement had melted away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最初的兴奋感觉逐渐减退了。

Exponent.DEF: to stop existing after gradually becoming more and more rare – used about a type of animal or plant, a disease, or a custom
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某种动植物﹑疾病或习俗〕逐渐灭绝,消失
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wolves had died out in much of Europe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲的许多地方狼已经灭绝。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many of the old childhood diseases have almost died out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去的许多儿童疾病几乎都消失了。

Exponent.DEF: if a type of animal or plant becomes extinct, it stops existing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dinosaurs became extinct millions of years ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐龙在数百万年前就绝种了。

Sense.DEF: when someone or something becomes impossible to see or find
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are investigating the woman’s disappearance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在调查这名女子的失踪。

Sense.DEF: when something stops existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disappearance of ancient forests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古森林的消失

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hated to disappoint her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿意让她失望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Great things were expected of this band, and they didn’t disappoint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家对这支乐队的期望很高﹐而他们也不负众望。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from happening that someone hoped for or expected
Sense.TRAN: 让某人的希望/期望/计划破灭
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Berlin settlement of 1878 disappointed Russian hopes in the Balkans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1878年的柏林条约使俄国在巴尔干的希望破灭了。

Sense.DEF: unhappy because something you hoped for did not happen, or because someone or something was not as good as you expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad seemed more disappointed than angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与其说爸爸生气﹐倒不如说他失望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: disappointed customers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失望的顾客

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local residents were disappointed with the decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的居民对这个决定很失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was disappointed that we played so well yet still lost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打得这么好可还是输了﹐我很沮丧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m very disappointed in you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对你非常失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl’s parents were bitterly disappointed at the jury’s verdict.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩的父母对陪审团的裁定感到非常失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Visitors were disappointed to find the museum closed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客看到博物馆闭馆感到很失望。

Exponent.DEF: unhappy because something you hoped for did not happen, or because something was not as good as you expected
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因希望未实现或某事低于期望而〕失望的,沮丧的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of disappointed fans were unable to get tickets for the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百名失望的球迷没能买到比赛门票。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was disappointed with the grade I got in my Maths exam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对自己的数学考试成绩感到失望。

Exponent.DEF: to feel disappointed because something was not as good as you expected, or someone did not do what you expected them to do for you – a rather informal use
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因某事低于期望或某人未能做到预期的事而〕感到失望〔较不正式的用法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt let down when I saw the film.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 看了这部电影,我感到失望。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nurses feel badly let down – they were promised a pay increase months ago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士们感到相当失望——几个月前她们明明得到过加薪的承诺。

Exponent.DEF: disappointed because you have lost your belief that an idea is right, or that something or someone is good
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their leaders are deeply disillusioned with the peace process.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的领导人对和平进程深感失望。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Disillusioned voters are turning against the government.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 心灰意冷的选民转而反对政府。

Exponent.DEF: no longer feeling enthusiastic, especially so that you do not think you should be involved in something, or give someone your support
Exponent.TRAN: 不再热心的,不再抱有幻想的〔尤指从而不想再参与某事或给予某人支持〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Americans have grown increasingly disenchanted with politics.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人对政治越来越不热心。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a disenchanted workforce
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失望的劳动力大军

Exponent.DEF: used when telling someone that you feel disappointed and wish that the situation was different
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry you can’t come to the party.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能来参加聚会,我很遗憾。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always felt sorry that she hadn’t got to know him better.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直后悔没有更好地了解他。

Exponent.DEF: extremely disappointed, especially because you were unsuccessful
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因没有成功而〕非常失望的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was gutted when we lost the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们输了比赛,我失望极了。

Exponent.DEF: looking very disappointed and sad, especially when you suddenly realise that something you want cannot happen
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因突然意识到所希望的事不会发生而〕沮丧的,垂头丧气的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gary looked crestfallen as they calculated how much money they would need.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在计算需要多少钱,加里看上去很沮丧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a crestfallen look
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 沮丧的神情

Sense.DEF: not as good as you hoped or expected
Sense.TRAN: 令人失望的﹐令人沮丧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: disappointing profit figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人失望的盈利数字
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Lakers’ loss in the playoffs was very disappointing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖人队在季后赛中的失利令人十分失望。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of unhappiness because something is not as good as you expected, or has not happened in the way you hoped
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could see the disappointment in her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到了她眼中的失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To Edward’s disappointment, Gina never turned up at the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让爱德华感到扫兴的是﹐吉娜始终没在聚会上出现。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the managers’ disappointment with the results
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理对此结果的失望

Sense.EXAMPLE: Several people expressed disappointment at the delay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有好几个人对这次延误表示失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her disappointment that she hadn’t been picked
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对落选感到的失望

Sense.EXAMPLE: She hid her bitter disappointment .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把深深的沮丧掩饰起来。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is not as good as you hoped or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie was kind of a disappointment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部电影有些让人失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The loss was a bitter disappointment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次失利让人非常失望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt she was a disappointment to her family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己让家人失望了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team’s performance has been a disappointment for the fans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队的表现让球迷感到失望。

Sense.DEF: disapproval of someone or something because you think they are morally wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔对不道德的人或事的〕反对﹐不赞成

Sense.DEF: an attitude that shows you think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or not suitable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: strong disapproval of the country’s human rights record
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该国人权记录的强烈不满

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Baxter eyed our clothes with obvious disapproval.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克斯特打量我们的衣着﹐显然不满意。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clarissa shook her head in disapproval.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉丽莎摇摇头表示反对。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew my parents would disapprove, but I went anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道父母会反对﹐但我还是去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I disapprove of diets; it’s better to eat sensibly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞成节食﹐最好还是合理饮食。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的家人极不赞同她的行为。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say they don’t agree with an idea rather than disapprove of it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 don’t agree with ,而不说 disapprove of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don’t agree with capital punishment.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我反对死刑。

Sense.DEF: to not agree to something that has been suggested
Sense.EXAMPLE: The board of directors disapproved the sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会不同意这一出售计划。

Sense.DEF: showing that you think someone or something is bad or wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disapproving frown
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不以为然的皱眉

Sense.DEF: to reduce the size of your army, navy etc, and the number of your weapons
Sense.TRAN: 裁军﹐裁减军备﹐解除武装
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting the rebels to disarm will not be easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要让叛乱分子解除武装并非易事。

Sense.DEF: to take away someone’s weapons
Sense.TRAN: 缴〔某人〕的械﹐解除〔某人〕的武装
Sense.EXAMPLE: Captured soldiers were disarmed and put into camps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俘获的士兵被缴械后关进了战俘营。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel less angry or disapproving of you, and more friendly
Sense.TRAN: 使消解怒气﹐使消除敌意
Sense.EXAMPLE: His tact and political skills disarmed his critics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他凭借自己的机敏圆通和政治手腕平息了批评者的怒气。

Sense.DEF:
to take the explosives out of a bomb,
missile
etc
Sense.TRAN: 拆除﹐取出〔炸弹﹑导弹等〕的起爆药

Sense.DEF: when a country reduces the number of weapons it has, or the size of its army, navy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a commitment to worldwide nuclear disarmament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在全球范围内裁减核军备的承诺

Sense.DEF: making you feel less angry or disapproving towards someone, and more friendly
Sense.TRAN: 使人消气的﹐消除敌意的﹐使人不存戒心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disarming sense of humor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人放下戒备的幽默感

Sense.DEF: to make something untidy
the state of being untidy or not organized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This left the Liberal Party in total disarray .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让自由党陷入一片混乱。

GramExa.PROPFORM: throw sth into disarray/fall into disarray
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The delay threw the entire timetable into disarray.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一延误打乱了整个时间安排。

Sense.DEF:
another form of
dissociate
a sudden event such as a flood, storm, or accident which causes great damage or suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: One hundred and twenty people died in China’s worst air disaster .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有120人在中国这起最惨烈的空难事故中丧生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the economic consequences of the Chernobyl nuclear disaster
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切尔诺贝利核灾难给经济带来的后果

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The oil spill was a disaster for Alaskan sea animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油泄漏对阿拉斯加的海洋动物是一场灾难。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The 1987 hurricane was the worst natural disaster to hit England for decades.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1987年的飓风是英格兰数十年来遭遇的最为严重的自然灾害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their expedition nearly ended in disaster , when one of the climbers slid off the mountain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名登山者从山上滑落﹐他们的探险活动险些以灾难告终。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drought could spell disaster for wildlife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干旱可能会对野生生物造成灾难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disaster struckwhen two men were killed during their parachute jumps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灾难突然降临﹐两名男子在跳伞过程中丧生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The peace process was on the brink of disaster .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平进程到了灾难的边缘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily the pilot saw the other plane just in time, and a disaster was narrowly averted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好驾驶员及时看到了另一架飞机﹐侥幸避免了一场灾难。

Sense.DEF: something that is very bad or a failure, especially when this is very annoying or disappointing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Because of the weather, the parade was a total disaster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气不好﹐游行活动彻底搞砸了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The evening was an unmitigated disaster a complete failure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一晚完全是一场灾难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cuts in funding will be a disaster for the schools.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 削减经费对学校来说将是灾难性的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Five small boys on skis is a recipe for disaster is very likely to end badly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五个小男孩一起玩滑雪迟早要出事。

Sense.DEF: a place where a flood, storm, fire etc has happened and caused a lot of damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town was declared a disaster area officially called a disaster area after the floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水灾发生后﹐该镇被宣布为灾区。

Sense.DEF: a place that is very untidy or dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen is a disaster area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里脏乱不堪。

Sense.DEF:
a system or process that a company has and which it will use if something goes seriously wrong, for example if it loses large amounts of
data
from its computer system
Sense.TRAN: 灾难复原〔应对计算机中大量数据遗失等重大事故的系统或程序〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to increase the budget allocation for disaster recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要增加用于灾难复原的预算拨款。

Sense.DEF: very bad, or ending in failure
Sense.TRAN: 灾难性的﹐以失败告终的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disastrous first marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以失败告终的第一次婚姻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Climate change could have disastrous effects on Earth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候变化可能给地球带来灾难性的影响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The move proved disastrous was disastrous for the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一行动对公司来说是一场灾难。

Sense.DEF: to say that you are not responsible for something, that you do not know about it, or that you are not involved with it
to stop existing as an organization, or to make something do this
to make a lawyer leave the legal profession
Sense.TRAN: 取消〔某人〕的律师资格﹐使〔某人〕退出律师行业

Sense.DEF: a feeling that something is not true or does not exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reaction to the murders was one of shock and disbelief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对这些谋杀事件的反应是震惊和不敢相信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rosie stared in disbelief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗茜疑惑地瞪大了眼睛。

Sense.DEF: to not believe something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 不相信﹐怀疑〔某人或某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I see no reason to disbelieve him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有理由不相信他。

Sense.DEF: to pay out money, especially from a large sum that is available for a special purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指从一大笔专用资金中拿出钱来〕支付﹐支出

Sense.DEF: a round flat shape or object
Sense.EXAMPLE: three keys attached to a metal disc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿在金属圆盘上的三把钥匙

Sense.DEF:
a
compact disc

a record that you play on a
record player

a computer
disk

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report form is available on disc from Personnel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人事部有该报表的磁盘。

Sense.DEF:
a flat piece of
cartilage
between the bones of your back
Sense.EXAMPLE: He retired early because of a slipped disc one that has moved out of its correct place .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因椎间盘突出提早退休了。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Discard any old cleaning materials.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把所有旧清洁用品都扔掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: discarded paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丢弃的纸张

Sense.DEF: to put down unwanted cards in a card game
Sense.TRAN: 〔在牌戏中〕打出（不想要的牌）﹐垫（牌）

Sense.DEF: an unwanted card that is put down in a card game
Sense.TRAN: 〔在牌戏中〕因不要而打出的牌﹐垫出的牌

Sense.DEF:
brake s
that work by two hard surfaces pressing against a
disc
in the centre of a car wheel
to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully
Sense.TRAN: 〔仔细思考之后〕觉察出﹐弄清楚﹐辨明

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officials were keen to discern how much public support there was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们急切地想了解公众的支持率有多高。

Sense.DEF: to be able to see something by looking carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could just discern a town in the distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

Sense.DEF: showing the ability to make good judgments, especially about art, music, style etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对艺术﹑音乐﹑时尚等〕有鉴赏力的﹐有眼光的﹐鉴别力强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ideal tour for the discerning traveller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对具鉴赏品位的游客而言一次理想之旅

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who can make good judgments about art or music

Sense.DEF: the ability to make good judgments about people or about art, music, style etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对人﹑艺术﹑音乐﹑时尚等的〕鉴赏力﹐识别能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: the woman’s taste and discernment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这女人的品位和鉴赏力

Sense.DEF: when you notice or understand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the discernment of opportunities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机会的发现

Sense.DEF: to officially allow someone to leave somewhere, especially the hospital or the army, navy etc, or to tell them that they must leave
Sense.TRAN: 正式准许〔某人〕离开〔尤指让病人出院或让军人退伍等〕﹔通知〔病人〕出院﹔开除〔士兵〕军籍
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hospitals now tend to discharge patients earlier than in the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与过去相比﹐现在医院更趋向于让病人早些出院。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge discharged the jury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官解散了陪审团。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several of the recruits were discharged from the Army due to medical problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名新兵因健康问题而被命令退伍了。

GramExa.GLOSS: leave hospital before your treatment is complete
let someone leave prison if they obey particular rules
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dunning was conditionally discharged for two years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 邓宁被有条件释放两年。

Sense.DEF: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 污水被直接排放到海里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rainwater collects here and then discharges into the river Kennett.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水在这里汇集﹐然后排放到肯尼特河中。

Sense.DEF:
to fire a gun or shoot an
arrow
etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A soldier accidentally discharged his weapon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名士兵不小心枪走了火。

Sense.DEF: to do or pay what you have a duty to do or pay
Sense.TRAN: 完成﹐履行〔职责〕﹔偿还〔债务〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trustees failed to discharge their duties properly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受托人未能切实地履行职责。

Sense.DEF: if a piece of electrical equipment discharges, or if it is discharged, it sends out electricity

if a wound or body part discharges a substance such as
pus infected liquid
, the substance slowly comes out of it
to take goods or passengers off a ship, plane etc
Sense.TRAN: 卸〔货〕﹔让〔乘客〕下船[下飞机]

Sense.DEF: when you officially allow someone to leave somewhere, especially the hospital or their job in the army, navy etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nurses visit the mother and baby for two weeks after their discharge from the hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 母婴出院后护士将随访两周。

Sense.DEF: when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out
Sense.TRAN: 〔气体﹑液体﹑烟等的〕排放﹔排放物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒废物向海里的排放

Sense.DEF: when a substance slowly comes out of a wound or part of your body, or the substance that comes out
Sense.TRAN: 〔伤口或身体液体的〕排出﹐流出﹔排出物﹐流出物

Sense.DEF: electricity that is sent out by a piece of equipment, a storm etc
when someone performs a duty or pays a debt

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the discharge of the college’s legal responsibilities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院法律责任的履行

Sense.DEF: when someone shoots a gun
someone who believes in the ideas of a great teacher or leader, especially a religious one
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指宗教导师的〕追随者﹐门徒﹐信徒

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was also an avid reader and a disciple of Tolstoy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他也是托尔斯泰的热心读者和信徒。

Sense.DEF: one of the first 12 men to follow Christ
someone who believes people should obey orders and rules, and who makes them do this
Sense.TRAN: 严格信奉纪律者﹔严格执行纪律者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad was a strict disciplinarian .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸是一个纪律严明的人。

Sense.DEF: relating to the punishment of someone who has not obeyed rules, or to trying to make people obey rules
Sense.TRAN: 有关纪律的﹐执行纪律的﹐惩处的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The investigation led to disciplinary action things you do to punish someone against two officers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查使两名军官受到了纪律处分。

GramExa.GLOSS: a meeting or group that decides if someone should be punished
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 纪律处罚聆讯会/委员会

Sense.DEF: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book gives parents advice on discipline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书指导父母如何管教孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: serious discipline problems in the police force
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察队伍内严重的纪律问题

Sense.DEF: the ability to control your own behaviour, so that you do what you are expected to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working from home requires a good deal of discipline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家上班要有很强的自制力。

Sense.DEF: a way of training your mind or learning to control your behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武术能教人尊重他人﹑遵守纪律并且相互合作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

Sense.DEF: an area of knowledge or teaching, especially one such as history, chemistry, mathematics etc that is studied at a university
to punish someone in order to keep order and control
Sense.EXAMPLE: The officers were later disciplined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些官员后来受到了处罚。

Sense.DEF: to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

Sense.DEF: to control the way you work, how regularly you do something etc, because you know it is good for you
Sense.TRAN: 严格要求自己﹐约束自己（去做某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to discipline yourself to write every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想办法约束自己每天写作。

Sense.DEF: obeying rules and controlling your behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: skilled and disciplined workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术熟练﹑遵守纪律的工人

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to play the music on a radio show or in a club where you can dance
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台〕音乐唱片节目主持人﹔〔夜总会〕舞曲唱片播放员

Sense.DEF: to state, especially officially, that you are not responsible for something, that you do not know about it, or that you are not involved with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Martin disclaimed any responsibility for his son’s actions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁否认对儿子的行为负有任何责任。

Sense.DEF: a statement that you are not responsible for or involved with something, or that you do not know about it – used especially in advertising or legal agreements
Sense.TRAN: 免责声明〔尤用于广告或法律合同〕

Sense.DEF: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在被隐瞒后〕透露﹐揭露﹐泄露﹐公开〔某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was disclosed that £3.5 million was needed to modernize the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据透露﹐那幢建筑的现代化改造需要350万英镑。

Sense.DEF: to show something by removing the thing that covers it
a secret that someone tells people, or the act of telling this secret
Sense.TRAN: 透露的信息﹔公开﹐透露﹐披露
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disclosure of private medical information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 私人医疗信息的泄露

Sense.DEF: a place or social event at which people dance to recorded popular music
Sense.TRAN: 迪斯科舞厅﹐迪斯科舞会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school disco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的迪斯科舞会

Sense.DEF: a type of dance music that was first popular in the 1970s

the American spelling of
discolour
the process of becoming discoloured
a place on the surface of something where it has become discoloured
to change colour, or to make something change colour, so that it looks unattractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once cut, apples quickly discolour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果切开后很快就会变色。

Sense.DEF: completely confused – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 极其困惑的﹐摸不着头脑的〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel slightly uncomfortable, annoyed, or embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕窘迫﹐使〔某人〕尴尬
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was discomfited by her silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的沉默使他感到窘迫。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of slight pain or of being physically uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the exercise causes discomfort, stop immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果这项锻炼引起不适﹐就立即停止。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of embarrassment, shame, or worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: To her discomfort, he laughed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他笑了起来﹐让她很不自在。

Sense.DEF: something that makes you feel uncomfortable or gives you a slight pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: the discomforts of air travel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乘飞机旅行的不适

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel worried and no longer calm
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕焦虑﹐使〔某人〕不安

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel slightly confused, embarrassed, or worried
making you feel slightly confused, embarrassed, or worried
Sense.TRAN: 令人困惑的﹔令人尴尬的﹔令人不安的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disconcerting question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人困惑的问题

Sense.DEF: to remove the supply of power, gas, water etc from a machine or piece of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 切断〔机器或设备〕的电力[煤气﹐水]等供应

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Always disconnect the machine from the mains first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要先切断机器的电源。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The family agreed to disconnect her life support system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家人同意切断她的生命维持系统。

Sense.DEF: to separate something from the thing it is connected to, or to become separated

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two freight cars disconnected from the train engine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两节货车车厢与火车头脱开了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Disconnect part A from part D.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把A部分与D部分分开。

Sense.DEF: to officially stop supplying a service, such as water, telephone, electricity, or gas, to a house or other building
Sense.TRAN: 停止〔住宅等〕的水[电话﹐电﹐煤气]等供应
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eleven percent of households were disconnected for non-payment of bills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分之十一的住户因为未付账单被切断了服务。

Sense.DEF: if you disconnect or become disconnected from your feelings, family, society etc, you no longer feel as though you belong or have a relationship with them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Divorced men can too easily become disconnected from their children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离异男士很容易和子女断了联系。

Sense.DEF: to break the telephone connection between two people
when two people or groups no longer understand or have a relationship with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disconnect between the ordinary public and the concerns of politicians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通民众与政治家关心的问题之间的脱节

Sense.DEF: dis-connected thoughts or ideas do not seem to be related to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔思想或想法〕不连贯的﹐无关联的

Sense.DEF: extremely sad and hopeless
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was disconsolate after his divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离婚后郁郁寡欢。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being unhappy and not satisfied with the situation you are in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Discontent with the current government is strong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对现任政府的不满情绪很强烈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is widespread discontent at the quality of education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教育质量的不满情绪普遍存在。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps she sensed my growing discontent .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许她感觉到了我越来越不满。

Sense.DEF: unhappy or not satisfied with the situation you are in
Sense.TRAN: 不满的﹐不满足的﹐不愉快的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She became increasingly discontented with her work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的工作越来越不满了。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing, producing, or providing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bus route 51 is being discontinued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 51 路公共汽车目前停止运营。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a discontinued china pattern
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不再使用的瓷器图案

Sense.DEF: a sudden change or pause in a process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the policy discontinuities between the present and previous governments
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现任政府与前几届政府在政策上的不连贯之处

Sense.DEF: when a process is not continuous
Sense.EXAMPLE: discontinuity in economic development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济发展的间断性

Sense.DEF: not continuous
disagreement or arguing between people
Sense.EXAMPLE: marital discord
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻不和
Sense.EXAMPLE: discord within NATO
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北约内部的纷争

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant sound made by a group of musical notes that do not go together well
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐中的〕不协和﹐不协和和弦

Sense.DEF: a discord-ant sound is unpleasant because it is made up of musical notes that do not go together well
strange, wrong, or unsuitable in relation to everything around
Sense.TRAN: 〔与周围事物〕不和谐的﹐不协调的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The modern decor strikes a discordant note in this old building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代化的装潢与这座古老的建筑本身很不协调。

Sense.DEF: not in agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: discordant results from the experiment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一致的实验结果

Sense.DEF:
a
disco
Sense.TRAN: 迪斯科舞厅﹔迪斯科舞会

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the usual price of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Members get a 15% discount .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会员可享受八五折优惠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees can buy books at a discount.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工购书可享受折扣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Young Persons Railcard gives you a discount on rail travel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 持青年人卡乘火车可以享受折扣。
向某人提供折扣

GramExa.EXAMPLE: discount airfares to Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到欧洲的折扣机票价格

GramExa.GLOSS: a place where you can buy goods cheaply

Sense.DEF: to regard something as unlikely to be true or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Experts discounted the accuracy of the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专家对这次民意调查的准确性不以为然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: General Hausken had not discounted the possibility of an aerial attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪斯肯将军没有忽视空袭的可能。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the price of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Games were discounted to as little as $5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏减价到只要5美元。

Sense.DEF: a shop or person that sells goods cheaply
Sense.TRAN: 廉价商店﹔卖便宜货的人

Sense.DEF:
the interest rate that a country’s
central bank
charges to other banks
Sense.TRAN: 贴现率〔中央银行向其他银行收取的利率〕

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone not to do something, especially by making it seem difficult or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: attempts to discourage illegal immigration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻止非法移民的努力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father is a lawyer, and he discouraged me from entering the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲是一名律师﹐他劝我别干这一行。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说‘discourage someone to do something’. Say 而要说 discourage someone from doing something.

Sense.DEF: to make someone less confident or less willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should not let one failure discourage you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该失败一次就灰心丧气。

Sense.DEF: to make something less likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

Sense.DEF: no longer having the confidence you need to continue doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of players get discouraged and quit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多选手失去信心﹐放弃了。

Sense.DEF: when you no longer feel confident or willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: In research, times of discouragement alternate with times of great achievement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做研究有灰心丧气的时候﹐也有取得巨大成就的时候。

Sense.DEF: when you try to persuade someone not to do something, especially by making it seem difficult or bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: the discouragement of smoking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对吸烟的劝阻

Sense.DEF: something that discourages you
making you lose the confidence or determination you need to continue doing something
Sense.TRAN: 令人失去信心的﹐使人气馁的﹐使人泄气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results were discouraging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果让人泄气。

Sense.DEF: a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于某个主题的〕演讲﹐论述﹐著述

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a discourse on art
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关艺术的演讲

Sense.DEF: serious conversation or discussion between people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Candidates should engage in serious political discourse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人应该参加严肃的政治对话。

Sense.DEF: the language used in particular types of speech or writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔在特定类型的讲话或论著中使用的〕话语﹐语篇
Sense.EXAMPLE: a study of spoken discourse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口语语篇研究

Sense.DEF: to make a long formal speech about something, or to discuss something seriously
not polite, and not showing respect for other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be discourteous to ignore his request.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忽视他的请求是失礼的。

Sense.DEF: an action or behaviour that is not polite or does not show respect
to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The body was discovered in a field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

Sense.DEF: to find out something that you did not know about before
Sense.TRAN: 发现﹐发觉〔以前不知道的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exercises let students discover math concepts on their own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些练习让学生自己发现数学概念。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She discovered that she was pregnant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发觉自己怀孕了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His friends were shocked to discover how ill he was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友们发现他病得这么厉害都惊愕不已。

Sense.DEF: if someone discovers a new place, fact, substance etc, they are the first person to find it or know that it exists
Sense.TRAN: 发现﹐找到〔新的地方﹑事实﹑物质等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Curies are best known for discovering radium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居里夫妇以发现镭而最为知名。

Sense.DEF: to notice or try something for the first time and start to enjoy it
Sense.EXAMPLE: At fourteen, Louise discovered boys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 14岁时路易丝开始对男孩子有了兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to notice someone who is very good at something and help them to become successful and well-known
Sense.EXAMPLE: a band that’s waiting to be discovered
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚待发掘的一支乐队

Sense.DEF: a fact or thing that someone finds out about, when it was not known about before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Hubble Telescope allowed astronomers to make significant discoveries about our galaxy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈勃望远镜使天文学家对我们的银河系有了重大发现。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the discovery that bees can communicate with each other
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜蜂能够相互交流的发现

Sense.DEF: when someone discovers something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the discovery of oil in Alaska
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在阿拉斯加发现石油

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By making new discoveries we expand our understanding of the natural world.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的发现使我们增进对自然界的了解。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was pure chance that led to the discovery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全是偶然的机会促成了这一发现。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: New discoveries are being made all the time.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 时时刻刻都有新发现。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the recent discovery of frozen water on the moon
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球上有冰的近期发现

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 伟大的/重大的/重要的发现
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The archaeologists had made an important discovery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 考古学家获得了一项重要的发现。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book covers the major scientific discoveries of the last century.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书包含了上世纪重大的科学发现。

Sense.DEF: to make people stop respecting or trusting someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 损坏 〔某人或某物〕的名声[可信度]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s lawyers tried to discredit her testimony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的律师试图质疑她的证词。

Sense.DEF: to make people stop believing in a particular idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: His theories have now been discredited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论人们现在已经不相信了。

Sense.DEF: the loss of other people’s respect or trust

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To his discredit, he knew about the problem but said nothing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道那个问题但什么也没说﹐这使他名誉扫地。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The behaviour of fans has brought discredit on English football.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷的行为败坏了英格兰足球的名誉。

Sense.DEF: bad or wrong, and making people lose respect for you or trust in you
Sense.EXAMPLE: discreditable dealings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可耻的交易

Sense.DEF: careful about what you say or do, so that you do not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell secrets
Sense.EXAMPLE: He assured her that he would be discreet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向她保证会谨慎行事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stood back at a discreet distance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我谨慎地保持一段距离站在后面。

Sense.DEF: small and showing good taste or judgment – use this to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: discreet jewelry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雅致的珠宝

Sense.DEF: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个本该一样的数量﹑细节﹑报告等的〕不一致﹐不符﹐差异﹐出入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police found discrepancies in the two men’s reports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方发现两名男子的叙述不一致。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a large discrepancy between the ideal image of motherhood and the reality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理想的母亲形象与现实之间有很大的差异。

Sense.DEF: clearly separate
Sense.EXAMPLE: The change happens in a series of discrete steps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个变化在一系列分离的步骤中发生。

Sense.DEF: the ability and right to decide exactly what should be done in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 决断能力﹔处理权﹔酌情决定权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The awards are made at the discretion of the committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖者由委员会决定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Promotions are left to the discretion of the supervisor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晋升由主管决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People want to have more discretion over their working hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们要求对工作时间有更多的自主权。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge exercised his discretion rightly to admit the evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官正确地行使了决定权﹐接受了该项证据。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee has the absolute discretion to refuse applications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会拥有绝对的权力拒绝申请。

Sense.DEF: the ability to deal with situations in a way that does not offend, upset, or embarrass people or tell any of their secrets
Sense.EXAMPLE: British newspapers no longer feel they must treat the royal family with discretion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国报界不再觉得他们非得审慎对待王室不可了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: discretion is the better part of valour
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to be careful than to take unnecessary risks
Sense.TRAN: 知进退方可言大勇﹐知慎近乎勇

Sense.DEF: not controlled by strict rules, but decided on by someone in a position of authority
Sense.TRAN: 自由决定的﹐酌情决定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the court’s discretionary powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭的酌情决定权

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行决定的奖赏/酌情拨款/自主资金等

Sense.DEF: the money remaining from your income after your bills have been paid, which can be spent on entertainment, holidays etc
Sense.TRAN: 可自由支配收入〔支付生活基本需求后余下的收入部分﹐可用于娱乐﹑度假等〕

Sense.DEF: to treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way
Sense.TRAN: 不公正地区别对待﹐歧视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under federal law, it is illegal to discriminate against minorities and women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦法律规定﹐歧视少数民族和妇女是违法的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: discriminate on the grounds/basis of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was found that the company still discriminated on the basis of race in promotions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据发现﹐这家公司在晋升方面仍然存在种族歧视。

Sense.DEF: to recognize a difference between things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Newborn babies can discriminate between a man’s and a woman’s voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生儿能辨别男人和女人的声音。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the process of learning to discriminate fact from opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学会区别事实和观点的过程

Sense.DEF: able to judge what is of good quality and what is not
Sense.TRAN: 有鉴别能力的﹐有鉴赏力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: discriminating readers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精明的读者

Sense.DEF: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws to prevent discrimination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防止歧视的法律

GramExa.EXAMPLE: widespread discrimination against older people in the job market
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就业市场上普遍存在的对年长求职者的歧视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: discrimination in favour of university graduates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大学毕业生的优待

GramExa.GLOSS: treating someone unfairly because of their race, sex etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 种族/性别/宗教信仰等歧视

Sense.DEF: the ability to recognize the difference between two or more things, especially the difference in their quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: shape discrimination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 形状识别力

Sense.DEF: treating a person or a group of people differently from other people, in an unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: discriminatory hiring practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歧视性的雇用行为

Sense.DEF: discussing many different ideas, facts etc, without always having a clear purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long, discursive article
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇冗长且不着边际的文章

Sense.DEF: a heavy flat circular object which is thrown as far as possible as a sport
the sport of throwing this object
to talk about something with another person or a group in order to exchange ideas or decide something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Littman refused to discuss the case publicly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利特曼拒绝公开讨论此案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you would like to discuss the matter further, please call me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想进一步讨论此事﹐请打电话给我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pupils should be given time to discuss the book with their classmates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该给学生时间与同学讨论书中的内容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your accountant will discuss with you how to complete these forms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的会计师会和你商量怎样填这些表格。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say talk about rather than discuss .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 talk about ,而不说 discuss
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It’s good to be able to talk about these things.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 能够谈谈这些事真好。

Sense.DEF: to talk or write about something in detail and consider different ideas or opinions about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: This topic will be discussed in Chapter 4.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该主题将在第四章进行详述。

Sense.DEF: when you discuss something
Sense.EXAMPLE: class discussions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 课堂讨论
Sense.EXAMPLE: the topics suggested for discussion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建议讨论的话题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the discussion of important issues
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 重要问题的讨论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: high-level discussions about trade and commerce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关贸易和商务的高层会谈

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The embassy will continue discussions with the Chinese government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大使馆将继续与中国政府进行商讨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We have had discussions about her legal situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就她的法律状况已进行了讨论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The project is under discussion as a possible joint venture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前正在讨论这个项目是否有可能办成合资企业。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing about a subject that considers different ideas or opinions about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the report’s discussion of the legislation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报告对立法的论述

Sense.DEF: a place on the Internet where people can write and receive messages in order to share ideas and information about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: （网上）专题论坛〔因特网上对某一专题进行讨论以分享观点和信息的论坛〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mercedes-Benz discussion list
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奔驰车专题论坛

Sense.DEF: a complete lack of respect that you show for someone or something because you think they are not important or good enough

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She watched me with disdain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她鄙视地看着我。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a look of complete disdain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为鄙视的样子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his disdain for capitalism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对资本主义的蔑视

Sense.DEF: to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Childcare was seen as women’s work, and men disdained it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照看儿童被视为女人做的工作﹐男人对此很不屑。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to do something because you are too proud to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Butler disdained to reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴特勒不屑回答。

Sense.DEF: showing that you do not respect someone or something, because you think that they are not important or good enough
Sense.TRAN: 鄙视的﹐轻视的﹐藐视的﹐不屑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disdainful look
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 藐视的眼神

GramExa.EXAMPLE: professors who are disdainful of popular entertainment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大众娱乐不屑的教授们

Sense.DEF: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She suffers from a rare disease of the brain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患上了一种罕见的脑病。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His father died of heart disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲死于心脏病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

Sense.DEF: something that is seriously wrong with society or with someone’s mind, behaviour etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔社会的〕严重弊病﹔〔某人精神﹑行为等的〕病态﹐恶疾
Sense.EXAMPLE: Loneliness is a disease of our urban communities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孤独是我们都市人群的一种通病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: How long have you had the disease?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得这个病多久了？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: About three million people suffer from the disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约300万人患有这种病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He caught the disease while travelling in Africa.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在非洲旅行时染上了此病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A few years ago, she developed a serious lung disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年前,她患上了严重的肺病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They may pass the disease on to their children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可能会把病传给自己的孩子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Smoking is probably the major factor causing heart disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟很可能是诱发心脏病的主要因素。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: try to stop it continuing

Collocate.EXAMPLE: common childhood diseases
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 常见的儿童疾病

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She suffers from a rare bone disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患有一种罕见的骨病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: vaccines against serious diseases like hepatitis and meningitis
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 预防肝炎﹑脑膜炎等严重疾病的疫苗

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that causes death
Collocate.EXAMPLE: If left untreated, the disease can be fatal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不治疗的话,这种疾病会致命。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that cannot be cured
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Diseases that were once thought incurable can be treated with antibiotics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾被认为无法治愈的疾病可以用抗生素治疗。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that spreads quickly from one person to another
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The disease is highly contagious.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病的传染性很强。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The fumes have caused skin diseases among the villagers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟气导致村民患上皮肤病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is being treated for kidney disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在接受肾病治疗。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: that is passed from parent to child
that is spread by having sex

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is no known cure for this disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病还没有已知的疗法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when a disease appears in a number of people or animals
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There has been an outbreak of the disease in Wales.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病已在威尔士爆发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Knowing the facts about AIDS can prevent the spread of the disease.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 了解艾滋病可以防止其蔓延。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: physical signs that someone has a disease

Sense.DEF: to get off a ship or aircraft
to put people or goods onto the shore from a ship
existing without a body or separated from a body
Sense.TRAN: 无躯体而存在的﹐脱离躯体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: disembodied spirits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游魂

Sense.DEF: a disembodied sound or voice comes from someone who cannot be seen

to remove someone’s
bowel s
disappointed with someone or something, and no longer believing that they are good
Sense.TRAN: 失望的﹐灰心的﹐不再抱有幻想的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By that time I was becoming disenchanted with the whole idea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到那个时候﹐我对那种想法灰心了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Voters expressed growing disenchantment with the government.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民对政府表达了越来越强烈的失望情绪。

Sense.DEF: to take away someone’s rights, especially their right to vote
Sense.TRAN: 剥夺〔某人〕的权利〔尤指选举权〕

Sense.DEF: not having any rights, especially the right to vote, and not feeling part of society
Sense.TRAN: 无权的﹐〔尤指〕无选举权的﹔无社会归属感的

Sense.DEF: to move so that you are not touching or holding someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sally found it difficult to disengage herself from his embrace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉感到很难挣脱他的拥抱。

Sense.DEF: if you disengage something, especially a part of a machine, or if it disengages, you make it move away from another part that it was connected to
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔机器的某一部分与另一相连部分〕分离﹐移开﹐松开
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disengage the gears when you park the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车时要松开排挡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tapped in the code and the lock disengaged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他输入密码﹐锁就开了。

Sense.DEF: to stop being involved or interested in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Too many young people disengage from learning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太多的年轻人对学习不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: if two armies disengage, they stop fighting
not involved with or interested in something or someone, and feeling separate from them
Sense.TRAN: 不介入的﹔不在意的﹔脱离的
Sense.EXAMPLE: teenagers who are depressed or disengaged from their families
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感到沮丧或与家人有隔阂的青少年

Sense.DEF: to separate different ideas or pieces of information that have become confused together
Sense.TRAN: 理顺﹐分清〔混杂的不同观念或信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very difficult to disentangle fact from fiction in what she’s saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难分清她说的话哪些是真﹑哪些是假。

Sense.DEF: to escape from a difficult situation that you are involved in
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had just disentangled herself from a long relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚从一段长久的感情中解脱出来。

Sense.DEF: to remove knots from ropes, strings etc that have become twisted or tied together
to separate something from the things that are twisted around it
a lack of balance in something
to officially decide that a particular church is no longer the official church of your country
a feeling of dislike and disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不喜欢﹐不赞同﹔冷淡﹐疏远

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The job creation programme is looked upon with disfavour by the local community.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地社区不赞同那个创造就业机会的计划。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Coal fell into disfavour because burning it caused pollution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤不再受到欢迎﹐因为烧煤会造成污染。

Sense.DEF: to spoil the appearance that something naturally has
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face had been disfigured in an accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一次意外事故中他毁了容。

Sense.DEF:
to
disenfranchise
someone
if a vehicle or building disgorges people, they come out of it in a large group
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆〕下〔客〕﹔〔建筑物内〕涌出〔人流〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cars drew up to disgorge a wedding party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆辆轿车开过来﹐下来的都是参加婚宴的人。

Sense.DEF: if something disgorges what was inside it, it lets it pour out
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕大量流出﹐冒出﹐吐出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chimneys were disgorging smoke into the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟囱正往空中喷吐烟雾。

Sense.DEF: if a river disgorges, it flows into the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Mississippi disgorges its waters into the Gulf of Mexico.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密西西比河水汇入墨西哥湾。

Sense.DEF: to give back something that you have taken illegally
Sense.TRAN: 交还﹐交出﹐吐出〔非法所得〕

Sense.DEF: to bring food back up from your stomach through your mouth
the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事情发生之后﹐史密斯声名狼藉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Toranaga sent us away in disgrace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 寅寿把我们灰溜溜地打发走了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为让家人蒙羞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no disgrace in finishing fourth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得了个第四名没什么丢脸的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something or someone is so bad or unacceptable that the people involved with them should feel ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UK rail system is a national disgrace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的铁路系统是国人的耻辱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are a disgrace to the medical profession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是医学界的耻辱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s an absolute disgrace , the way he treats his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那样对待妻子﹐简直太可耻了。

Sense.DEF: to do something so bad that you make other people feel ashamed
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could you disgrace us all like that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么能这样丢我们大家的脸呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not the one who disgraced herself at the wedding!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在婚礼上丢脸的人是她﹐又不是我！

GramExa.GLOSS: be made to feel ashamed, especially in public

Sense.DEF: bad, embarrassing, or unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 可耻的﹐丢脸的﹔很差劲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a disgraceful waste of taxpayers’ money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样浪费纳税人的钱真是可耻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their behaviour was absolutely disgraceful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的行为极其可耻。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is disgraceful that anyone should have to live in such conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟有人在这种条件下生活﹐真是太不像话了。

Sense.DEF: annoyed or disappointed, especially because things have not happened in the way that you wanted
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因事情未如所愿发生而〕恼火的﹐不高兴的﹐失望的﹐不满的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disgruntled client
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不满的客户

Sense.DEF: to change someone’s appearance so that people cannot recognize them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maybe you could disguise yourself as a waiter and sneak in there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 或许你可以假扮成一个侍者混进去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He escaped across the border disguised as a priest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他装扮成神父越境逃走了。

Sense.DEF: to change the appearance, sound, taste etc of something so that people do not recognize it
Sense.TRAN: 掩盖﹐掩饰〔某物的外表﹑声音﹑味道等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no way you can disguise that southern accent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是无法掩盖那南方口音的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a letter bomb disguised as a musical greetings card
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伪装成音乐贺卡的信件炸弹

Sense.DEF: to hide a fact or feeling so that people will not notice it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try as he might, Dan couldn’t disguise his feelings for Katie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不论怎么努力﹐丹还是掩饰不住对凯蒂的感情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no disguising the fact that business is bad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意不好﹐这是无法隐瞒的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The speech was seen by many as a thinly disguised attack on the president.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认为这场演说是对总统几乎不加掩饰的攻击。

Sense.DEF: something that you wear to change your appearance and hide who you are, or the act of wearing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: His disguise didn’t fool anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的伪装没能骗过任何人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore dark glasses in an absurd attempt at disguise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她戴了副墨镜企图伪装﹐样子很可笑。

Subsense.DEF: wearing a disguise
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The woman in the park turned out to be a police officer in disguise.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园里的那个女人原来是一个乔装的警察。

Subsense.DEF: made to seem like something else that is better
Subsense.TRAN: 变相的〔使看起来似乎更好〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Tax reform’ is just a tax increase in disguise.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “税务改革” 只不过是变相的增税。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joan looked at him with disgust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼厌恶地看着他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam threw his books down in disgust and stormed out of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆气愤地扔下书﹐冲出房间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Much to my disgust , I found that there were no toilets for the disabled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我非常气愤的是﹐我发现竟然没有供残疾人使用的厕所。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nelson’s disgust with US politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳尔逊对美国政治的反感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fans didn’t hide their disgust at the umpire’s decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们没有掩饰对裁判这次判罚的不满。

Sense.DEF: a very strong feeling of dislike that almost makes you sick, caused by something unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reached into the bin with a look of disgust on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把手伸进垃圾箱﹐脸上带着厌恶的表情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Edward tasted the thin, sour wines with disgust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华厌恶地尝着那又淡又酸的酒。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very annoyed or upset about something that is not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many parents claimed to be disgusted by the amount of violence in the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多家长称他们对电影里大量的暴力内容很反感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dear Sir, I was disgusted to see the picture on page one of Sunday’s feature section.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的先生: 看到周日报纸专题报道首页里的照片﹐我感到很气愤。

Sense.DEF: to be so unpleasant that it makes you feel almost sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of dissecting a frog disgusts me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想起解剖青蛙我就恶心。

Sense.DEF: very annoyed or upset by something that is not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disgusted onlookers claimed the driver was more concerned about his car than about the victim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气愤的旁观者说﹐那名司机更担心的是他的汽车而不是受害人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most locals are disgusted by the anti-foreigner violence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数当地人对反外国人的暴力行为很反感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Animal welfare workers were disgusted that anyone could do this to a puppy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物福利工作者对有人竟然这么对待小狗深感愤慨。

Sense.DEF:
a humorous name for a typical old-fashioned
middle-class
person living in the town of Tunbridge Wells in southeast England, who writes letters to newspapers strongly criticizing things about modern behaviour or modern life which they find shocking
Sense.TRAN: 愤慨的坦布里奇韦尔斯人〔对英格兰东南部坦布里奇韦尔斯镇保守的中产阶级的戏称〕

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant and making you feel sick
Sense.TRAN: 令人恶心的﹐使人极其反感的﹐令人厌恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rubbish was piled everywhere – it was disgusting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾堆得到处都是﹐很恶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking is a really disgusting habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟是一种十分令人讨厌的习惯。

Sense.DEF: shocking and unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 令人吃惊的﹔让人无法接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sixty pounds for a thirty-minute consultation. I think that’s disgusting!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咨询30分钟要收费60英镑﹐我看这也太离谱了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a disgusting thing to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这话说不出口。

Sense.DEF: a flat container with low sides, for serving food from or cooking food in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a serving dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上菜用的盘子
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ovenproof dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耐热盘

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a large dish of spaghetti
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大盘意大利面

Sense.DEF: all the plates, cups, bowls etc that have been used to eat a meal and need to be washed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll just do the dishes before we go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把碗洗好我们就走。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often use the expression do the washing-up (BrE) or do the dishes (AmE), rather than wash the dishes .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们常说 do the washing-up【英】,或 do the dishes【美】,而不说 wash the dishes。

Sense.DEF: food cooked or prepared in a particular way as a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wonderful pasta dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很棒的意大利面食
Sense.EXAMPLE: The menu includes a wide selection of vegetarian dishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菜单上有品种丰富的素食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This soup is substantial enough to serve as a main dish the biggest part of a meal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道汤材料十足﹐可以当主菜了。

Sense.DEF: something that is shaped like a dish
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soap dish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皂碟

Sense.DEF: someone who is sexually attractive
to give a lot of information about something or someone, especially something that would usually be secret or private

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s ready to dish on boys, beauty, and break-ups in her new column.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她准备在新开的栏目里大谈有关男人﹑美容和感情破裂方面的事。

GramExa.GLOSS: tell people shocking things about someone’s private life

Sense.DEF: to give something to various people in a careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We dished out some leaflets there too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在那里也分发了一些传单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul tends to dish out unwanted advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗总爱说些没人想听的建议。

Sense.DEF: to serve food to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam’s dishing out sandwiches if you want one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想要三明治﹐萨姆正在分呢。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can dish it out but they can’t take it
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone often criticizes other people, but does not like being criticized
Sense.TRAN: 某人很会批评别人﹐但自己却不能接受批评

Sense.DEF: to put food for a meal into dishes, ready to be eaten
Sense.TRAN: 把〔食物〕盛到盘里〔准备让人食用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you dish up the vegetables?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把蔬菜盛到盘子里﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: disagreement about important things which makes people be unfriendly to each other
a cloth used for washing dishes
disappointed, so that you lose hope and the determination to continue doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If young children don’t see quick results they grow disheartened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果小孩子不能很快地看到成果﹐他们会变得灰心。

Sense.DEF: making you lose hope and determination
Sense.TRAN: 令人灰心的﹐令人气馁的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is disheartening to hear/see etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s disheartening to see what little progress has been made.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到没取得什么进展令人感到灰心丧气。

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys telling people a lot of information about other people’s behaviour and private lives
Sense.TRAN: 爱散布流言蜚语的人﹐爱说三道四的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the movie role of the light-hearted Hollywood disher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻松的好莱坞谣言散布者的电影角色

Sense.DEF: if someone’s appearance or their clothes, hair etc is dishevelled, they look very untidy
Sense.TRAN: 〔外表或衣服﹑头发等〕不整齐的﹐凌乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pam arrived late, dishevelled and out of breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕姆迟到了﹐衣冠不整﹐上气不接下气。

Sense.DEF: not honest, and so deceiving or cheating people
Sense.EXAMPLE: dishonest traders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奸商
Sense.EXAMPLE: People on welfare are wrongly seen as lazy or dishonest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠福利救济的人被误以为懒惰或不老实。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A person is guilty of theft if he or she dishonestly obtains property.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人如果以不诚实的手段获取财物﹐那就是犯了偷盗罪。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that is intended to deceive people, for example by lying, cheating, or stealing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Are you accusing me of being dishonest?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在指责我不诚实吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The money was acquired through dishonest means.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱是通过不正当的手段取得的。

Exponent.DEF: using your power in a dishonest way for your own advantage – used about people in official positions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: corrupt politicians
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 腐败的政客
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Law and order has broken down, and most government officials are corrupt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 治安已经崩溃,大部分政府官员贪污腐败。

Exponent.DEF: good at secretly thinking of clever plans to trick people in order to get what you want
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You have a very devious mind!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你脑子里尽是些狡诈的念头！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They use all kinds of devious methods to find out your personal details.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不择手段地获取你的个人信息。

Exponent.DEF: underhand methods involve secretly deceiving people in order to get what you want
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In a series of underhand moves, Browne managed to gain control of the company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗通过一连串秘密活动获得了公司的控制权。

Exponent.DEF: doing or saying things secretly, in a way that seems wrong because it is slightly dishonest or unfair
Exponent.TRAN: 偷偷摸摸的,鬼鬼祟祟的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was pretty sneaky when the bank charged me interest on my account without telling me.
