Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行没有通知就从我的账户里扣取利息,这种做法很不光明正大。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately behaving in a way that hides what you are really thinking or doing, in a way that is slightly dishonest
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Lucy decided not to tell him where she was going. She was often a bit sly like that.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西决定不告诉他自己要去哪里。 她经常这样有点诡秘。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a sly old fox.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个狡猾的老狐狸。

Exponent.DEF: using dishonest and unfair methods to get what you want, without caring if you harm other people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some unscrupulous companies try to persuade people to borrow huge sums of money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些无耻的公司试图劝说人们大量借款。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately deceiving people in an illegal way in order to gain money or power
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You will be prosecuted if you make a fraudulent claim on your insurance policy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 企图骗取保险金会遭起诉。

Sense.DEF: behaviour in which you deceive or cheat people
loss of respect from other people, because you have behaved in a morally unacceptable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve brought enough dishonour on your family already without causing any more trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你惹的麻烦已经让你的家人够丢脸的了﹐不用再添乱了。

Sense.DEF: to make your family, country, profession etc lose the respect of other people
Sense.TRAN: 败坏〔家庭﹑国家﹑行业等〕的名誉
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dishonored the uniform and did not deserve to be a marine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他玷污了这身军服﹐不配当一名海军陆战队士兵。

Sense.DEF: if a bank dishonours a cheque, it refuses to pay out money for it
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行〕拒付﹐拒绝承兑〔支票〕﹐使〔票据〕退票

Sense.DEF: to refuse to keep an agreement or promise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Union leaders accused management of dishonouring existing pay agreements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会领导人指责资方违反了现有的工资协议。

Sense.DEF: not morally correct or acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 不名誉的﹐不光彩的﹐可耻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surrender was seen as dishonourable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投降被认为是可耻的。

Sense.DEF: an order to someone to leave the army, navy etc, because they have behaved in a morally unacceptable way
a large bowl in which you wash dishes, plates etc

a
dishcloth
a cloth used for drying dishes
a machine that washes dishes
someone whose job is to wash dirty dishes, plates etc, especially in a restaurant
liquid soap used to wash dishes
dirty water that dishes have been washed in
if you say that tea or coffee tastes like dishwater, you mean that it tastes unpleasantly weak
sexually attractive
to make someone realize that something which they thought was true or good is not really true or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate to disillusion you, but I don’t think she’s coming back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不愿意让你失望﹐但我想她是不会回来了。

Sense.DEF: disappointed because you have lost your belief that someone is good, or that an idea is right
Sense.TRAN: 不抱幻想的﹐失望的﹐幻灭的﹐理想破灭的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As she grew older, Laura became increasingly disillusioned with politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着年龄的增长﹐劳拉对政治越来越不抱幻想了。

Sense.DEF: something that makes people less willing to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: High interest rates can be a disincentive to expanding a business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高利率对企业扩张会是个抑制因素。

Sense.DEF: a lack of willingness to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the increasing disinclination of farm workers’ children to consider a job in farming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农场工人的子女越来越不愿意务农的趋势

Sense.DEF: to be unwilling to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was disinclined to talk to Sam about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不愿与萨姆谈这件事。

Sense.DEF:
to clean something with a chemical that destroys
bacteria
Sense.EXAMPLE: First use some iodine to disinfect the wound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先用碘酒给伤口消毒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disinfect the area thoroughly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这个区域彻底消毒。

Sense.DEF:
to run a special computer program to get rid of a computer
virus

a chemical or a cleaning product that destroys
bacteria
false information which is given deliberately in order to hide the truth or confuse people, especially in political situations
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政治上故意透露的〕假消息﹐假情报
Sense.EXAMPLE: government disinformation about the effects of nuclear testing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府散布的关于核试验影响的不实信息

Sense.DEF: not sincere and slightly dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 不真诚的﹐不诚实的﹐不坦率的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keeping the details of the tax changes vague is disingenuous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对税收变革的细节含糊其词并不光明正大。

Sense.DEF: to take away from someone, especially your son or daughter, their legal right to receive your money or property after your death
Sense.TRAN: 剥夺〔尤指子女〕的继承权

Sense.DEF: to break up, or make something break up, into very small pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane just disintegrated in mid-air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机就在半空中解体了。

Sense.DEF: to become weaker or less united and be gradually destroyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a society disintegrating under economic pressures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在经济压力下崩溃的社会

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the disintegration of the empire into separate republics
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 该帝国解体成一个个独立的共和国

Sense.DEF:
to dig and remove a dead body from a
grave
to find or use something that has been lost or not used for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 发现〔已丢失的东西〕﹔使用〔很久未使用的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She disinterred two frozen TV dinners from the freezer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从冰柜里找出两份放了很久的冷冻电视便餐。

Sense.DEF: a lack of interest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exception to Balfour’s disinterest in social issues was education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔福对社会问题不感兴趣﹐教育则是例外。

Sense.DEF: when you are able to judge a situation fairly because you are not involved in it
able to judge a situation fairly because you are not concerned with gaining any personal advantage from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lawyer should provide disinterested advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 律师应该提供客观公正的建议。

Sense.DEF: not interested. Many teachers think that this is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 无兴趣的﹐不关心的〔许多教师认为此用法不正确〕

Sense.DEF: the practice of selling a product directly to customers using the Internet, rather than first selling the product to a shop

the process of taking your money out of a company by selling your
share s
in it
something, especially a speech or piece of writing, that is disjointed has parts that do not seem well connected or are not arranged well
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指讲话或文章〕不连贯的﹐表达混乱的﹐支离破碎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: disjointed fragments of information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂乱的信息片段

Sense.DEF: a disjointed activity or system is one in which the different parts do not work well together
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或系统〕不连贯的﹐不协调的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Burley was critical of his team’s disjointed performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯利批评他的队员各自为战。

Sense.DEF: a difference between two things that you would expect to be in agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disjunction between the skills taught in schools and the skills demanded by employers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校里教的技能与雇主要求的技能之间的差异

Sense.DEF:
a disjunctive
conjunction
expresses a choice or opposition between two ideas. For example, ‘or’ is a disjunctive conjunction.
a small flat piece of plastic or metal which is used for storing computer or electronic information

the usual American spelling of
disc
a piece of equipment in a computer system that is used to get information from a disk or to store information on it

a
floppy disk
to think someone or something is unpleasant and not like them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do you dislike her so much?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么那么讨厌她？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I dislike being the centre of attention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢成为注目的焦点。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say don’t like rather than dislike .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 don’t like ,而不说 dislike
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you like her?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不喜欢她？
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t like being criticized.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不喜欢受人批评。

Exponent.DEF: to not like someone or something. Dislike is stronger than not like , and is used especially in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 不喜欢,讨厌〔语气较not like强,尤用于书面英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She disliked him as soon as she met him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一见到他就讨厌他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Chemistry was the only subject he disliked at school.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 化学是他上学时唯一讨厌的科目。

Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why did you invite Claire? You know I don’t like her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么邀请克莱尔？你知道我不喜欢她。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t like getting up early in the morning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢早上早起。

Exponent.EXP: not be very keen on sth

Variant.LEXVAR: not be very fond of sth

Exponent.DEF: used to say that you do not like something, but in a polite or gentle way
Exponent.TRAN: 不是很喜欢某物〔礼貌或委婉的说法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m not very keen on Chinese food.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是很喜欢中国菜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s never been very fond of his books.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来都不太喜欢他的书。

Exponent.DEF: to not like someone or something because you do not have a good opinion of them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ve tried that restaurant twice and we don’t think much of it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去过那家餐厅两次,不是很喜欢。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I worked with him for years and I didn’t think much of him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我与他共事多年,并不喜欢他。

Exponent.EXP: not be sb’s kind of thing

Variant.LEXVAR: not be sb’s cup of tea

Exponent.DEF: to not be the kind of thing you enjoy – used about activities, films, books etc
Exponent.TRAN: 不是某人喜欢的东西〔指活动﹑影片﹑书等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Detective stories aren’t really my kind of thing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探小说不是很对我胃口。

Exponent.DEF: to stop liking someone or something that you used to like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dan and I went out together for six months and then I just went off him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和丹谈了六个月恋爱,然后便对他没了兴趣。

Exponent.DEF: to make you stop liking someone or something
Exponent.TRAN: 使某人不再喜欢某人/某物
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was terrible at sport at school and it totally put me off doing any kind of exercise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上学时体育很差,所以我对任何一种运动都没有兴趣。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of not liking someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She shared her mother’s dislike of housework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和她妈妈一样不爱做家务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Truman had a strong dislike for communism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜鲁门极为厌恶共产主义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His colleagues regarded him with intense dislike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的同事们非常讨厌他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They took an instant dislike to each other they disliked each other immediately .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩立刻就互相讨厌对方了。

Sense.DEF: the things that you do not like
Sense.EXAMPLE: A good hotel manager should know his regular guests’ likes and dislikes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 称职的酒店经理应该知道老主顾的好恶。

Sense.DEF: to move a bone out of its normal position in a joint, usually in an accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dislocated my shoulder playing football.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 踢足球时我的肩膀脱了臼。

Sense.DEF: to spoil the way in which a plan, system, or service is arranged, so that it cannot work normally
Sense.TRAN: 扰乱﹐破坏〔计划﹑制度或服务的正常安排〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Communications were temporarily dislocated by the bad weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因天气恶劣通信暂时不畅。

Sense.DEF: to force or knock something out of its position
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某物〕强行去除[移开﹐取出]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian dislodged a few stones as he climbed up the rock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩攀岩的时候敲掉了几块石头。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place or lose a position of power
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某人〕逐出﹔使〔某人〕失去权势
Sense.EXAMPLE: the revolution that failed to dislodge the British in 1919
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未能推翻英国统治的1919年革命

Sense.DEF: doing or saying things that do not support your friends, your country, or the group you belong to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt he had been disloyal to his friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得自己对朋友不忠诚。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or a place is dismal, it is so bad that it makes you feel very unhappy and hopeless
Sense.EXAMPLE: The future looks pretty dismal right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前前景似乎相当暗淡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dismal, grey afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个阴沉灰暗的下午

Sense.DEF: bad and unsuccessful
Sense.TRAN: 差劲的﹐不成功的﹐糟糕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team’s record so far is pretty dismal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队到目前为止的成绩很糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her scheme was a dismal failure .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的计划彻底失败。

Sense.DEF: to take a machine or piece of equipment apart so that it is in separate pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris dismantled the bike in five minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯五分钟内就把自行车拆掉了。

Sense.DEF: to gradually get rid of a system or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔逐渐地〕废除〔某种制度或组织〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an election promise to dismantle the existing tax legislation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将废除现有税收法规的竞选承诺

Sense.DEF: the worry, disappoint-ment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They stared at each other in dismay.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们忧虑地望着对方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found to my dismay that I had left my notes behind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我沮丧地发现自己忘了拿笔记了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要离开﹐他心里充满了忧伤。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel worried, disappointed, and upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor election turnout dismayed politicians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票人数少﹐政治家们感到失望。

Sense.DEF: worried, disappointed, and upset when something unpleasant happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ruth was dismayed to see how thin he had grown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝看到他变得如此消瘦很担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were dismayed at the cost of the repairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维修所需的费用让他们感到忧虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are dismayed that the demonstration was allowed to take place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行得到批准让我们感到担忧。

Sense.DEF: to cut a body into pieces or tear it apart
to divide a country, area, or organization into smaller parts
Sense.TRAN: 瓜分﹐分割〔国家﹑地区或组织〕

Sense.DEF: to refuse to consider someone’s idea, opinion etc, because you think it is not serious, true, or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has dismissed criticisms that the country’s health policy is a mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人认为国家医疗政策一塌糊涂﹐政府对这种批评持否认态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He just laughed and dismissed my proposal as unrealistic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是笑了笑﹐认为我的建议不切实际﹐拒绝考虑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an idea that shouldn’t be dismissed out of hand dismissed immediately and completely .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法不该马上被全盘否定。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from their job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bryant was unfairly dismissed from his post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩特被无理免职了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees can be dismissed for sending obscene emails.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工发送淫秽电子邮件会遭到解雇。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, people usually say sack someone, and in everyday American English, people usually say fire someone, rather than use dismiss .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英国英语中,说 “开除” 人们一般用 sack ,在日常美国英语中一般用 fire ,而不用 dismiss
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He was sacked (BrE【英】)/ fired (AmE【美】) for being late all the time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因一直迟到遭解雇。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that they are allowed to go, or are no longer needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The class was dismissed early today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天这个班级提早放学。

Sense.DEF: if a judge dismisses a court case, he or she stops it from continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case was dismissed owing to lack of evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于证据不足﹐该案被驳回了。

Sense.DEF:
to end the
innings
of a player or team in the game of
cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球比赛中〕使〔对方击球员或球队〕出局

Sense.DEF: when someone is removed from their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilson was claiming compensation for unfair dismissal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊正在就无理解雇要求赔偿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No dismissals have been announced yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尚未宣布有人被解雇。

Sense.DEF: when someone decides or says that something is not important, serious, or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gill’s dismissal of the book as ‘386 pages of rubbish’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔将这本书斥为 “386页的垃圾”

Sense.DEF: a decision by a judge to stop a court case
refusing to consider someone or something seriously
Sense.TRAN: 不加考虑的﹐轻蔑的﹐鄙视的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some historians have been dismissive of this argument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些历史学家对这个论点不屑一顾。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cath spread both hands in a dismissive gesture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯思摊开双手做了个轻蔑的手势。

Sense.DEF:
to get off a horse, bicycle, or
motorcycle
Sense.TRAN: 〔从马背﹑自行车或摩托车上〕下来

Sense.DEF: to take something, especially a gun, out of its base or support
Sense.TRAN: 把〔枪炮等从底座或支架上〕取下﹐卸下

Sense.DEF: deliberately not doing what you are told to do by your parents, teacher, etc
Sense.TRAN: 不顺从的﹐不服从的﹐违抗的

Sense.DEF: to refuse to do what someone with authority tells you to do, or refuse to obey a rule or law
Sense.TRAN: 不服从〔上级的命令〕﹐不遵守〔规定或法律〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You disobeyed my orders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你违抗我的命令。

Exponent.DEF: to not obey a person, order, rule, or law
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the army, it is a crime to disobey a superior officer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在军队里,不服从上级军官即有罪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had disobeyed the school rules.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他违反了校规。

Exponent.DEF: to not obey a law or rule
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Anyone who breaks the law must expect to be punished.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 违法者不能心存侥幸。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately refuse to obey a rule or law, or what someone in authority tells you to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police arrested the youth for defying a court order.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方以违抗法庭指令的罪名逮捕了那名年轻人。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately disobey a rule or law in a very public way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Timber companies are continuing to flout environmental laws.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 木材公司继续公然无视环境法。

Exponent.DEF: to disobey a law, or do something that is against an agreement or principle
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Both countries have accused each other of violating the treaty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国互相指责对方违反条约。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Technically he had violated the law.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格来说,他犯法了。

Exponent.DEF: to be against a law, rule, or agreement, or to do something that is against a law, rule, or agreement
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The British government’s actions contravened the European Convention on Human Rights.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国政府的行为违反了《欧洲人权公约》。

Sense.DEF: a mental or physical illness which prevents part of your body from working properly

GramExa.PROPFORM: a disorder of the brain/liver/digestive system etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suffers from a rare disorder of the liver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他患有一种罕见的肝病。
胃部/肺部/心脏等疾病

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people with mental disorders
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 患有精神病的人

Sense.EXAMPLE: severe eating disorders such as bulimia and anorexia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像贪食症和厌食症这类严重的进食障碍

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a lot of people behave in an uncontrolled, noisy, or violent way in public

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A number of stadiums were closed because of crowd disorder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因发生群众骚乱﹐一些体育场被关闭了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which things or people are very untidy or disorganized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything was in disorder, but nothing seemed to be missing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都凌乱不堪﹐但好像没有少什么东西。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His whole system was thrown into disorder .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的全套系统被搞得乱七八糟。

Sense.DEF: not tidy, planned, or arranged in order
Sense.TRAN: 不整洁的﹐杂乱的﹐无秩序的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her grey, disordered hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她蓬乱的灰白头发

Sense.DEF: if someone is mentally disordered, their mind is not working in a normal and healthy way
Sense.TRAN: 精神失常的﹐精神错乱的

Sense.DEF: untidy or without any order
Sense.EXAMPLE: clothes left in a disorderly heap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱七八糟堆在一起的衣服

Sense.DEF: behaving in a noisy violent way and causing trouble in a public place
Sense.TRAN: 喧闹粗暴的﹐扰乱治安的﹐破坏公共秩序的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was arrested for disorderly conduct.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因扰乱社会治安被逮捕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bell denied being drunk and disorderly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔否认醉酒闹事。

Sense.DEF: not arranged or planned in a clear order, or lacking any kind of plan or system
Sense.TRAN: 杂乱无章的﹐组织不善的﹐计划不周的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conference was completely disorganized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议的安排一片混乱。

Sense.DEF: someone who is disorganized is very bad at arranging or planning things
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕缺乏条理的﹐不善于计划的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an extremely disorganized person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个极为缺乏条理的人。

Sense.DEF: confused and not understanding what is happening around you
confused about where you are or which direction you should go
Sense.EXAMPLE: When he emerged into the street, he was completely disoriented.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走到街上就完全迷失了方向。

Sense.DEF: making someone not know where they are or which direction they should go
Sense.TRAN: 使人迷失方向的﹐让人晕头转向的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disorientating maze of corridors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷宫一般让人晕头转向的走廊

Sense.DEF: confusing you and making you not certain about what is happening around you
Sense.TRAN: 迷惑人的﹐令人思路混乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of sleep can be disorienting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏睡眠会让人头昏脑胀。

Sense.DEF: to say that you no longer want to be connected with someone or something, especially a member of your family or something that you are responsible for
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某人〕断绝关系﹔否认与〔某物〕有关
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frankly, I’m not surprised her family disowned her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦率地讲﹐她家里人和她断绝关系我并不感到奇怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since 1960, Kubrick has virtually disowned the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自1960年起﹐库布里克实际上已经与这部影片划清界线了。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or something in a way that shows you do not think they are very good or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matcham’s theatres were widely disparaged by architects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马彻姆设计的剧院遭到了建筑师的普遍抨击。

Sense.DEF: criticizing someone or something, and showing that you do not think they are very good or important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She made some disparaging remarks about the royal family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说了些贬低王室的话。

Sense.DEF: consisting of things or people that are very different and not related to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting covering many disparate subjects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 涉及许多不同议题的会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: the difficulties of dealing with disparate groups of people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和不同的人群打交道的难处

Sense.DEF: a difference between two or more things, especially an unfair one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a disparity between the rates of pay for men and women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性与女性在工资水平上的差异

Sense.DEF: not influenced by personal emotions and therefore able to make fair decisions
Sense.TRAN: 不动感情的﹐不带偏见的﹐公正的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dispassionate view of the situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对形势的客观看法

Sense.DEF: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A reporter was dispatched to Naples to cover the riot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名记者被派往那不勒斯报道这场骚乱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Goods are normally dispatched within 24 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货物一般在24小时内派送。

Sense.DEF: to deal with someone or to finish a job quickly and effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dispatched beat her opponent 6-2, 6-1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以6比2﹑6比1的比分迅速拿下了对手。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately kill a person or animal
a message sent between military or government officials
Sense.TRAN: 〔军官或政府官员之间来往的〕公文﹐信件
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dispatch from headquarters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从总部发来的信件

Sense.DEF: a report sent to a newspaper from one of its writers who is in another town or country
Sense.TRAN: 〔由身在外地的记者发给报纸的〕报道﹐电讯

Sense.DEF: the act of sending people or things to a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dispatch of warships to the region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派遣军舰到该地区

Sense.DEF: if you do something with dispatch, you do it well and quickly
a box on a central table in the British Parliament, which important members of parliament stand next to when they make speeches
Sense.TRAN: 英国议会公文箱〔重要议员在发言时站在其旁〕

Sense.DEF: a box for holding official papers

someone whose job is to send out vehicles such as taxis or
ambulance s
to places where they are needed

someone whose job is to take messages or packages by
motorcycle
to make something go away, especially a belief, idea, or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 驱散﹐消除〔尤指信仰﹑观念或感觉〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to dispel the myth that you cannot eat well in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要消除在英国吃不好的误解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Light poured into the hall, dispelling the shadows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光洒进大厅﹐驱散了阴影。

Sense.DEF: not necessary or important and so easy to get rid of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Part-time workers are considered dispensable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兼职工作人员被认为是可有可无的。

Sense.DEF: a place where medicines are prepared and given out, especially in a hospital
special permission from someone in authority, especially a religious leader, to do something that is not usually allowed
Sense.TRAN: 〔当权者﹐尤其是宗教领袖给予的〕特许
Sense.EXAMPLE: Caroline’s marriage was annulled by special dispensation from the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡罗琳的婚姻是在教会的特许之下解除的。

Sense.DEF: the act of providing people with something as part of an official process

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the dispensation of justice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伸张正义

Sense.DEF: a religious or political system that has control over people’s lives at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一时期控制人们生活的〕宗教[政治]制度

Sense.DEF: to give something to people, especially in fixed amounts
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指以固定数额〕分发﹐分配〔某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Villagers dispensed tea to visitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 村民们给来客送茶。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a machine for dispensing cash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 取款机

Sense.DEF: to officially provide something for people

GramExa.GLOSS: decide whether or not someone is guilty of a crime and what punishment they should receive

Sense.DEF: to officially prepare and give medicines to people
to not use or do something that people usually use or do, because it is not necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann suggested that they dispense with speeches altogether at the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安建议省去婚礼上的所有致辞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s dispense with the formalities speak openly and directly , shall we?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就免去客套吧﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: a machine which provides a particular amount of a product or substance when you press a button or put money into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a paper towel dispenser
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸巾自动售卖机

Sense.DEF:
a
chemist
or
pharmacist
the process of spreading things over a wide area or in different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the role of birds in the dispersal of seeds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟类对传播种子的作用

Sense.DEF: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

Sense.DEF: if something disperses or is dispersed, it spreads in different directions over a wide area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The clouds dispersed as quickly as they had gathered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 云聚集得快﹐散得也快。

Sense.DEF: someone who is dispirited does not feel as hopeful, eager, or interested in something as they were in the past
Sense.TRAN: 灰心的﹐沮丧的﹐意兴阑珊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last, dispirited and weary, they gave up the search.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又灰心又疲惫﹐最后放弃了搜寻。

Sense.DEF: to take the place or position of something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coal has been displaced by natural gas as a major source of energy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种主要能源﹐煤的地位已为天然气所取代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: immigrants who displace US workers in the job market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在就业市场上取代美国工人的移民

Sense.DEF: to make a group of people or animals have to leave the place where they normally live
Sense.TRAN: 使〔人群或兽群〕离开家园
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fifty thousand people have been displaced by the fighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五万人因为战争背井离乡。

Sense.DEF: to force something out of its usual place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water displaced by the landslides created a tidal wave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 崩塌的泥石排出的水形成一股巨浪。

Sense.DEF: someone who has been forced to leave their country because of war or cruel treatment
when a group of people or animals are forced to leave the place where they usually live

the weight or
volume
of liquid that something replaces when it floats in that liquid – used especially to describe how heavy something such as a ship is
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指表示船舶等重量的〕排水量

Sense.DEF: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a superb display of African masks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲面具的精彩展览

Sense.EXAMPLE: a dazzling display very good display of flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window display caught her eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: containing old photographs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆放着老照片的陈列柜

Sense.DEF: a public performance of something that is intended to entertain people
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fireworks display
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟火表演

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a display of juggling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂耍表演

Subsense.DEF: something that is on display is in a public place where people can look at it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mapplethorpe’s photographs were first put on display in New York.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅普尔索普的摄影作品首先在纽约展出。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the world’s oldest cars has gone on display in Brighton today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天在布赖顿展出了世界上最古老的汽车中的一辆。

Subsense.DEF: if a quality, feeling, or skill is on display, it is very clear and easy to notice
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The musical talent on display is extremely impressive.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表现出来的音乐天赋让人印象极为深刻。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone clearly shows a particular feeling, attitude, or quality
Sense.TRAN: 爱意/情绪/攻击性等的流露
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unprovoked displays of aggression cannot be tolerated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无缘无故的挑衅行为是不可容忍的。

Sense.DEF: a part of a piece of equipment that shows information, for example a computer screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: This time the display flashed a red warning signal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次显示器上闪烁着红色的警报信号。

Sense.DEF: to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the exam results will be displayed on the noticeboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的考试成绩将在布告板上公布。

Sense.DEF: to clearly show a feeling, attitude, or quality by what you do or say
Sense.TRAN: 显示﹐显露〔某种情感﹑态度或特质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She displayed no emotion on the witness stand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在证人席上面无表情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ten piano pieces, each written to display the talents of individual players
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十首钢琴曲﹐每一首都为了展示演奏者的才华而作

Sense.DEF: if a computer or something similar displays infor-mation, it shows it on its screen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I pressed ‘return’ and an error message was displayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我按了 “回车” 键就出现一条错误信息。

Sense.DEF: if a male bird or animal displays, it behaves in a particular way as a signal to other birds or animals, especially to attract a female
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指雄性动物为吸引雌性而〕炫耀﹐夸示

Sense.DEF: annoyed or not satisfied
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked extremely displeased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去很不开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: City officials are displeased with the lack of progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为没有取得进展﹐市政官员很不满意。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being annoyed or not satisfied with someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their displeasure at being kept waiting was clear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们明显很恼火﹐因为让他们久等了。

Sense.DEF: to amuse yourself by doing things that are active and enjoyable – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 自娱﹐嬉戏﹐玩乐〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: intended to be used once or for a short time and then thrown away
Sense.TRAN: 一次性的﹐用完即丢弃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: disposable nappies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次性尿布

Sense.DEF: available to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: disposable resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可支配的资源

Sense.DEF: the amount of money you have left to spend after you have paid your taxes, bills etc
Sense.TRAN: 可支配收入〔完税并付清各种账款等之后所剩的钱〕

Sense.DEF: when you get rid of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the safe disposal of radioactive waste
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放射性废料的安全处理

Sense.EXAMPLE: bomb disposal experts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拆弹专家

Sense.DEF: available for someone to use
Sense.TRAN: 供某人使用﹐供某人支配
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tanner had a lot of cash at his disposal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦纳手头有很多现金可以动用。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone is ready to help you in any way

Sense.DEF:
a small machine under the kitchen
sink
which breaks vegetable waste into small pieces
Sense.TRAN: 垃圾处理器〔装在厨房洗涤槽下面粉碎菜叶果皮等废弃物的机器〕

Sense.DEF: the sale of something you own such as a house, a business, or land
Sense.TRAN: 〔房产﹑企业或土地的〕处置﹐变卖﹐转让
Sense.EXAMPLE: The profit or loss on the disposal of an asset must be accounted for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资产处置的盈亏情况必须说明。

Sense.DEF: the way in which an amount of money is used
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had complete control over the disposal of the funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对这笔资金的使用拥有完全的自主权。

Sense.DEF: to arrange things or put them in their places
Sense.TRAN: 安排﹐编排﹐处理﹐支配〔事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chinese vases are disposed around the gallery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国花瓶摆放在展馆四周。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something, especially something that is difficult to get rid of
Sense.TRAN: 丢弃﹐处理〔尤指难以清除的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an incinerator built to dispose of toxic waste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为处理有毒废料建造的一座焚化炉

Sense.DEF: to sell something, especially part of a business
Sense.TRAN: 转让﹐变卖〔尤指企业资产的一部分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am still not sure how best to dispose of the shares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍然不能确定这些股份怎样处置最好。

Sense.DEF: to deal with something such as a problem or question successfully
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your idea at least disposes of the immediate problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的主意至少解决了最紧迫的问题。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opponent
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two goals by Raúl disposed of Barcelona.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳尔的两粒入球击败了巴塞罗那队。

Sense.DEF: to make someone more likely to have particular feelings or thoughts
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕较倾向于〔某种感觉或想法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The body releases a chemical that disposes you towards sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体内释放出一种使人昏昏欲睡的化学物质。

Sense.DEF: to like or approve of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: （对某人）有好感﹐很赞成（某人/某物）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Management is favourably disposed to the idea of job-sharing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层很赞成 “一工分做” 的主张。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be/feel/seem etc disposed to do sth
Sense.DEF: to want or be willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jon disagreed, but did not feel disposed to argue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔恩不赞成﹐但他并不想争辩。

Sense.DEF: to have a tendency towards something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man disposed to depression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有抑郁倾向的人

Sense.DEF: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 性格焦虑/合群/敏感等的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film is not suitable for people of a nervous disposition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片不适合神经质的人观看。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 具有乐观/开朗等的性格

Sense.DEF: a tendency or willingness to behave in a particular way

GramExa.PROPFORM: have/show a disposition to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most children have a disposition towards obedience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分儿童都有服从的倾向。

Sense.DEF: the position or arrangement of something in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a map showing the disposition of American forces
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显示美军部署的地图

Sense.DEF: the way in which something is dealt with or used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A solicitor advised him as to the disposition of the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事务律师建议他如何处置这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: the act of formally giving property to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disposition of assets on death
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身后财产的处置

Sense.DEF: to take property or land away from someone
Sense.TRAN: 剥夺〔某人的财产或土地〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many black South Africans had been dispossessed of their homes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多南非黑人被撵出了家园。

Sense.DEF: people who have had property or land taken away
a situation in which two or more things are not equal in amount, level etc
Sense.TRAN: 不均衡﹐不相称﹐不成比例
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dangerous disproportion between production and consumption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产和消费之间比例失衡的危险状况

Sense.DEF: too much or too little in relation to something else
Sense.TRAN: 不均衡的﹐不相称的﹐不成比例的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the disproportionate amount of money being spent on defence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比例失衡的国防开支

Sense.DEF: to show that something is wrong or not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: These figures disproved Smith’s argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据证明史密斯的论点是错误的。

Sense.DEF: something that is disputable is not definitely true or right, and therefore is something that you can argue about
Sense.TRAN: 有争议的﹐可商榷的﹐有争辩余地的

Sense.DEF: a discussion about a subject which people cannot agree on
tending to argue
a serious argument or disagreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm is involved in a legal dispute with a rival company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司与一家竞争对手公司发生了法律纠纷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got into a dispute over a taxi fare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因出租车费和人发生了争执。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the bitter border dispute between the countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间激烈的边界争端

Sense.DEF: if something is beyond dispute, everyone agrees that it is true or that it really happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿﹐这是无可置疑的。

Sense.DEF: if something is open to dispute, it is not completely certain and not everyone agrees about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His interpretation of the poem is open to dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对这首诗的诠释有可商榷的地方。

Sense.DEF: if something is in dispute, people are arguing about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The facts of the case are still in dispute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 案情的真相仍有争议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: end it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is hoped that the dispute can be resolved peacefully.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们希望争端可以和平解决。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The US government became involved in a dispute with China.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国政府与中国发生了争端。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: become involved
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We don’t want to get into a dispute with them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不想与他们起纠纷。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was in dispute with the company about his contract.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和公司发生了合同纠纷。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be involved in one that is difficult to resolve
starts
very angry
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It caused a bitter dispute between the neighbouring republics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这引起相邻共和国间激烈的纷争。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: continuing for a long time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: India’s long-running dispute with Pakistan
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 印巴之间长期的争端

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: between workers and employers
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of working days are lost through industrial disputes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳资纠纷耗费了大量工作时间。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: about how much money employees are paid
between people who live together
about where the border between two countries is
about which country land belongs to

Sense.DEF: to say that something such as a fact or idea is not correct or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main facts of the book have never been disputed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中的主要事实从未遭到质疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Few would dispute that travel broadens the mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行开阔人们的视野﹐对此几乎没有人有异议。

Sense.DEF: to argue or disagree with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hazlitt, though much younger, was soon disputing with Wordsworth on equal terms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然黑兹利特年纪要小得多﹐但他不久就和华兹华斯平等地争论问题了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What happened next is hotly disputed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于后来发生了什么﹐争论很激烈。

Sense.DEF: to try to get control of something or win something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soviet forces disputed every inch of ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏军寸土必争。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from taking part in an activity because they have broken a rule

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was disqualified from driving .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被取消了驾驶资格。

Sense.DEF: to unfairly prevent someone from doing a job or taking part in an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a system which disqualifies the poor from education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剥夺穷人受教育权利的制度

Sense.DEF: anxiety or unhappiness about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: public disquiet over deaths in police custody
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对警方拘留期间发生的被拘留人死亡事件的不满

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His appointment caused disquiet among members.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的任命在成员中引起了不满。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The union has voiced its disquiet about the way the protest was handled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会对抗议的处理方式表示了不满。

Sense.DEF: causing anxiety
Sense.TRAN: 令人不安的﹐使人忧虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found Jean’s manner disquieting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得琼的举止让人忧虑。

Sense.DEF: a long speech or written report
to ignore something or treat it as unimportant
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ordered the jury to disregard the witness’s last statement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指示陪审团忽略证人的最后一句话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark totally disregarded my advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克完全不听我的建议。

Sense.DEF: when someone ignores something that they should not ignore

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his disregard for her feelings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她情感的忽略

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Local councillors accused the terrorists of showing a complete disregard for human life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方议员谴责恐怖分子全然罔顾人命。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He said the bombing was in complete disregard of the Geneva Convention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说此次轰炸完全无视《日内瓦公约》。

Sense.DEF: buildings, roads etc that are in disrepair are in bad condition because they have not been cared for
Sense.EXAMPLE: buildings allowed to fall into disrepair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任由其破败的建筑物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The castle is in a state of disrepair .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城堡破败不堪。

Sense.DEF: considered to be dishonest, bad, illegal etc
Sense.TRAN: 名声不好的﹐不名誉的﹐不光彩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: disreputable behavior
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不名誉的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disreputable neighbourhood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名声不好的街区

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people no longer admire or trust someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He faces six charges of bringing the game into disrepute .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面临六项破坏这项运动声誉的指控。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This theory fell into disrepute in the fifties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一理论在50年代时声誉尽失。

Sense.DEF: lack of respect for someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: disrespect for the law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目无法纪

Sense.EXAMPLE: Damien has always had a healthy disrespect that you think is good for media opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达米安对媒体的观点从来都持合理的不以为然的态度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was said on the spur of the moment and I meant no disrespect to anybody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一时冲口而出﹐无意冒犯任何人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No disrespect to Phil, but the team has performed better since he left used to show you are not criticizing someone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无意对菲尔不敬﹐不过自从他离开后球队表现更好了。

Sense.DEF: to say or do things that show a lack of respect for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hicks accused Williams of disrespecting him at a record company party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希克斯指责威廉斯在唱片公司的派对上对他无礼。

Sense.DEF: to remove your clothes
to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人虚报有炸弹﹐造成了交通混乱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is prevented from continuing in its usual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The strike caused widespread disruption .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工造成了大规模的混乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There will be some disruption to traffic while the work is in progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 施工期间会对交通造成一些混乱。

Sense.DEF: causing problems and preventing something from continuing in its usual way
Sense.TRAN: 引起混乱的﹐扰乱性的﹐捣乱的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Night work can be very disruptive to home life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间工作会给家庭生活带来很大的麻烦。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike’s parents thought I was a disruptive influence a person who causes disruption .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克的父母认为我是个捣蛋分子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ways to handle disruptive pupils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对付捣乱学生的办法

Sense.DEF: to say unkind things about someone you know
a feeling of not being satisfied

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 30% of customers expressed dissatisfaction with the service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 30%的顾客对服务表示不满意。

Sense.DEF: not satisfied because something is not as good as you had expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: dissatisfied clients
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感到不满意的客户

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you are dissatisfied with this product, please return it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果您对此产品不满意﹐敬请退货。

Sense.DEF: to cut up the body of a dead animal or person in order to study it
to examine something carefully in order to understand it
Sense.EXAMPLE: books in which the lives of famous people are dissected
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剖析名人生平的书籍

Sense.DEF: to divide an area of land into several smaller pieces
Sense.EXAMPLE: fields dissected by small streams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被小溪分成小块的田地

Sense.DEF: to hide your true feelings, thoughts etc
Sense.TRAN: 掩饰﹐掩藏〔真实的情感﹑想法等〕

Sense.DEF: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible
Sense.TRAN: 散布﹐广泛传播〔信息或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的发现已广为传播。

Sense.DEF: disagreement among a group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一团体内部的〕意见分歧﹐纷争﹐不和

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This move sowed dissension within the party ranks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一举动在党内成员中间播下了不和的种子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Labour Party was torn by internal dissensions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党因内部纷争产生分裂。

Sense.DEF: refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion
Sense.TRAN: 〔对官方决定或公认观点的〕异议﹐意见分歧
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ruthless suppression of political dissent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政治异见的无情压制
Sense.EXAMPLE: These voices of dissent grew louder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些反对的呼声日益高涨。

Sense.DEF: a statement by a judge giving their reasons for disagreeing with the other judges in a law case
Sense.TRAN: 〔讼案中某法官对其他法官的判决所提出的〕异议﹐不同意见

Sense.DEF: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
Sense.TRAN: 〔对官方决定或公认观点〕持异议﹐不同意

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Few historians would dissent from this view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有历史学家对此观点持异议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are some dissenting voices people who do not agree among the undergraduates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学生中有一些反对的呼声。

Sense.DEF: if a judge dissents, they say formally that they do not agree with the other judges in a law case
Sense.TRAN: 〔讼案中某法官对其他法官的判决〕持异议﹐不同意

Sense.DEF: a person or organization that disagrees with an official decision or accepted opinion
Sense.TRAN: 〔对官方决定或公认观点〕持异议者﹐持不同意见者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Political dissenters were imprisoned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持不同政见者遭到监禁。

Sense.DEF: someone in the past who did not accept the beliefs of the established Protestant church in Western Europe
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时西欧的〕不信奉新教者﹐不顺从新教者

Sense.DEF: a long piece of writing on a particular subject, especially one written for a university degree
Sense.TRAN: 专题论文〔尤指大学学位论文〕

Sense.DEF: to do something that gives other people a bad opinion of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 损害[破坏]某人/某物的声誉[形象]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fans have done the game a great disservice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们的行为大大损害了这项运动的名声。

Sense.DEF: to do something that gives other people a bad opinion of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 损害﹐破坏〔某人或某物的声誉﹑形象等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hart’s poems are disserviced by the decision to squeeze three or even four short pieces onto one page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把三首甚至四首短诗挤在同一页上的决定损害了哈特的诗作。

Sense.DEF: someone who publicly criticizes the government in a country where this is punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political dissident
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持不同政见者

Sense.DEF: not the same

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Madonna’s career is not dissimilar to is quite similar to Cher’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦当娜的艺术生涯与雪儿不无类似。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: dissimilarities between the US and Britain
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国和英国的不同之处

Sense.DEF: to hide your true feelings or intentions, especially by lying
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过撒谎〕隐藏﹐掩饰〔真实的情感或意图〕

Sense.DEF: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想明白后﹐怒气就渐渐消了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

Sense.DEF: to waste something valuable such as time, money, or energy
Sense.TRAN: 浪费〔时间〕﹔挥霍〔金钱〕﹔耗费 〔精力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His savings were soon dissipated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的积蓄很快就花完了。

Sense.DEF: spending too much time enjoying physical pleasures such as drinking alcohol in a way that is harmful
Sense.TRAN: 放荡的﹐无节制的﹐花天酒地的

Sense.DEF: the process of making something gradually weaker or less until it disappears
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dissipation of heat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热量的散失

Sense.DEF: the enjoyment of physical pleasures in a way that is harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a life of dissipation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放荡的生活

Sense.DEF: the act of wasting money, time, energy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dissipation of resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资源的浪费

Sense.DEF: to do or say something to show that you do not agree with the views or actions of someone with whom you had a connection
Sense.TRAN: 表示不同意…﹔表明与…无关

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish to dissociate myself from Mr Irvine’s remarks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想说明我不同意欧文先生的话。

Sense.DEF: to regard two things or people as separate and not connected to each other
having an immoral way of life, for example drinking too much alcohol or having sex with many people
the act of formally ending a parliament, business, or marriage
Sense.TRAN: 〔议会的〕解散﹔〔企业的〕停业﹔〔婚姻的〕解除
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president announced the dissolution of the National Assembly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统宣布解散国民议会。

Sense.DEF: the act of breaking up an organization, institution etc so that it no longer exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dissolution of the monasteries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修道院的解散

Sense.DEF: the process by which something gradually becomes weaker and disappears
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eventual dissolution of class barriers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阶级壁垒的最终消失

Sense.DEF: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直搅拌到糖溶解掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sugar dissolves in water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖溶解于水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dissolve the tablet in water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把药片溶于水中。

Sense.DEF: to formally end a parliament, business arrangement, marriage etc
Sense.TRAN: 解散〔议会〕﹔解除〔商业协定﹑婚姻关系等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The monarch had the power to dissolve parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 君主有权解散议会。

Sense.DEF: to start laughing or crying
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dissolved into fits of laughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一阵阵大笑起来。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become smaller or weaker before disappearing, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her enthusiasm dissolved his shyness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的热情消除了他的羞怯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few clouds formed briefly before dissolving again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天上聚积了几朵云﹐一会儿又消散了。

Sense.DEF:
a combination of notes that sound strange because they are not in
harmony
lack of agreement
to persuade someone not to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a campaign to dissuade young people from smoking
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劝阻青年人吸烟的宣传活动

Sense.DEF: a stick, used in the past for spinning wool
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时纺羊毛纱用的〕纺纱杆﹐绕线杆

Sense.DEF: the amount of space between two places or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the distance from Chicago to Detroit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥到底特律的距离

Sense.EXAMPLE: Measure the distance between the two points.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 量出两点之间的距离。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cottage is some distance quite a long distance from the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at a distance of 2 feet/10 metres etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A shark can smell blood at a distance of half a kilometer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲨鱼能在半公里外闻到血腥味。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, when talking about how far something is, people often use an expression such as how far or a long/short way rather than the noun distance .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,谈论距离时,人们常用 how far 或 a long/short way 等,而不用名词 distance
F2NBox.BADEXA: What is the distance from Chicago to Detroit?
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔ How far is it from Chicago to Detroit?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥离底特律有多远？
F2NBox.BADEXA: The cottage is some distance from the road.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔The cottage is a long way from the road.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 小屋到大路有些距离。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a situation when something is far away from you in space or time
Sense.TRAN: 〔距离的〕遥远﹔〔时间的〕久远﹐间隔

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Church bells rang in the distance they were far away .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We watched from a distance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从远处观看。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people do not have a close friendly relationship

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was still a distance between me and my father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和父亲之间仍然有些疏远。

Subsense.DEF: to stay far enough away from someone or something to be safe
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A lighthouse on the cliff warns ships to keep their distance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬崖上的灯塔警告船只保持距离。

Subsense.DEF: to avoid becoming too friendly with someone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The neighbours tend to keep their distance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居们往往会有意识地保持距离。

Sense.DEF: to finish something you have started
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think Greg will go the distance this time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得格雷格这次会坚持到底吗？

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 长长的/很长的/相当长的距离
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sound of guns seemed a long distance away.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 炮声似乎非常遥远。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I quickly walked the short distance to the car.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我快步走到不远的车子跟前。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: enough space to be safe
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You should keep a safe distance from the car in front.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应当与前面的车保持安全距离。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite a long distance
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He heard a scream some distance away.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到远处传来一声尖叫。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: how far you travel in a car after pressing the brakes

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In some countries children must travel great distances to school each day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一些国家,小孩子每天必须走很远的路去上学。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Now we are able to measure the distances between the planets.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我们能够测出行星间的距离。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: judge how much space there is between things
near enough to walk to easily
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are lots of restaurants within walking distance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多餐厅步行即可到达。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: near enough to make travel to or from a place possible
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 与某物的距离在出行/上下班乘车/开车方便的距离之内
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The job was not within travelling distance of my home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作离我家路程太远。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not far from something, especially something you are going to attack
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 在离某物不远的距离内〔尤指可攻击的范围内〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very near something

Sense.DEF: to say that you are not involved with someone or something, especially to avoid being connected with them
Sense.TRAN: 使自己（与…）保持距离﹐撇清自己（和…）的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UNO has firmly distanced itself from the anti-government movement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合邻里组织坚决撇清和这场反政府运动的关系。

Sense.DEF: a method of study that involves working at home and sending your work to your teacher
far away in space or time
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sound of distant gunfire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远处的炮火声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her honeymoon seemed a distant memory .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的蜜月似乎成了遥远的记忆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That affair was in the dim and distant past a long time ago .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事已成为遥远的过去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President hopes to visit Ireland in the not too distant future quite soon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统希望在不久的将来访问爱尔兰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: stars that are distant from our galaxy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与我们星系距离遥远的恒星

Sense.DEF: unfriendly
Sense.TRAN: 不友好的﹐冷淡的﹐疏远的
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the quarrel Sue remained cold and distant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次争吵之后﹐休一直冷淡疏远。

Sense.DEF: thinking deeply about something private, rather than about what is happening around you
Sense.TRAN: 心不在焉的﹐恍惚的﹐出神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Geri had a distant look in her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里眼神恍惚。

Sense.DEF: not closely related to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distant cousin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位远房表亲

Sense.DEF: different from something or not closely connected with it
Sense.TRAN: 与某事物不同﹐与某事物关系不密切
Sense.EXAMPLE: The reality of independence was distant from the hopes they had had.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立后的现实情况与他们原先所希望的大不一样。

Sense.DEF: a feeling that something or someone is unpleasant or morally offensive

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her distaste for any form of compromise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对任何形式的妥协的反感

Sense.DEF: unpleasant or morally offensive
Sense.TRAN: 令人生厌的﹐令人反感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: What follows is John’s story. Parts of it may seem distasteful, even shocking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来是约翰的叙述﹐其中有些部分也许令人不快﹐甚至令人震惊。

Sense.DEF: feeling or showing distaste
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked distastefully at the overflowing bin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她厌恶地看着垃圾塞得满出来了的垃圾箱。

Sense.DEF: a serious infectious disease that affects animals, especially dogs
Sense.TRAN: 瘟热〔主要侵袭狗等动物的一种恶性传染病〕

Sense.DEF: a type of paint that you mix with water to paint walls
to swell or make something swell because of pressure from inside
Sense.TRAN: 〔因来自内部的压力〕（使）膨胀﹐（使）肿胀

Sense.DEF:
to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as
whisky
are made this way.
Sense.EXAMPLE: distilled water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸馏水

Sense.DEF: to remove a chemical substance from a plant, for example by heating or pressing it
to get the main ideas or facts from a much larger amount of information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The notes I had brought back were waiting to be distilled into a book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我带回来的笔记尚待整理成书。

Sense.DEF:
a person or company that makes strong alcoholic drinks such as
whisky

a factory where strong alcoholic drink such as
whisky
is produced
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用蒸馏法生产烈酒的〕酿酒厂

Sense.DEF: clearly different or belonging to a different type
Sense.TRAN: 明显不同的﹐截然不同的﹐不同种类的
Sense.EXAMPLE: two entirely distinct languages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两种完全不同的语言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are four distinct types.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有四种完全不同的类型。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The learning needs of the two groups are quite distinct from each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个组的学习需求区别很大。

Sense.DEF: used to make it clear that you are not referring to a particular kind of thing, but to something else
Sense.TRAN: 完全不同于某事物﹐与某事物不同〔用于强调所谈论的是另一事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a movie star, as distinct from an actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个电影明星﹐和演员是两回事

Sense.DEF: something that is distinct can clearly be seen, heard, smelled etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The outline of the ship became more distinct.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船的轮廓变得更加清晰了。

Sense.DEF: a distinct possibility, feeling, quality etc definitely exists and cannot be ignored
Sense.TRAN: 〔可能性﹑感觉﹑特征等〕确实存在的﹐确实的﹐不容忽视的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got the distinct impression he was trying to make me angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很清楚地感觉到他是想惹我生气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a distinct possibility that this will eventually be needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这东西最后的确有可能用得到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distinct lack of enthusiasm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显而易见的缺乏热情

Sense.DEF: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the distinction between formal and informal language
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正式与非正式语言之间的差别

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is often no clear distinction between an allergy and food intolerance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过敏和食物不耐受之间往往没有明显的区别。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Act makes no distinction between children and adults it treats them as if they were the same .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法令对儿童和成年人同等对待。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often use draw a distinction rather than make a distinction , because it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们常用 draw a distinction ,而不用 make a distinction ,因为前者听上去更加正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The law draws a distinction between temporary and permanent employees.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条法律把临时雇员和长期雇员区别开来。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being excellent and important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eliot’s distinction as a poet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾略特作为诗人的杰出才能

Sense.DEF: the quality of being special in some way

GramExa.PROPFORM: have/earn/achieve etc the distinction of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: At that time, it had the distinction of being the largest bridge in the UK.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候它的独特之处在于﹐它是英国最大的桥梁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The US enjoys the dubious distinction of being the lawsuit capital of the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国享有世界诉讼之都的 “美名”。

Sense.DEF: a special mark given to a student whose work is excellent
Sense.TRAN: 〔授予优秀学生的〕优等评分﹐荣誉分数

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He obtained a law doctorate with distinction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以优异的成绩取得了法律博士学位。

Sense.DEF: having a special quality, character, or appearance that is different and easy to recognize
Sense.TRAN: 〔特征﹑性格或外表〕独特的﹐特别的﹐与众不同的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rock band with a distinctive sound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音色独特的摇滚乐队

Sense.DEF: clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Speak clearly and distinctly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说话要清楚明白。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He distinctly remembered the day his father left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他清晰地记得父亲离开的那一天。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul was left feeling distinctly foolish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗觉得自己太傻了。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常不舒服/不自在/不开心等

Sense.DEF: used to say that something has a particular quality or character that is easy to recognize
Sense.TRAN: 明显地〔用于表示某物具有某种易辨认的特征或特点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: dishes with a distinctly Jewish flavor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有明显犹太风味的菜肴

Sense.DEF: to recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His attorney argued that Cope could not distinguish between right and wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的辩护律师辩称科普无法分辨是非。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a method of distinguishing cancer cells from normal tissue
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 辨别癌细胞和正常组织的一种方法

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use the phrases tell the difference between sb/sth or tell sb/sth from sb/sth , rather than distinguish .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般使用短语 tell the difference between sb/sth 或 tell sb/sth from sb/sth,而不用 distinguish
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He can’t tell the difference between right and wrong.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法分辨是非。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: How do you tell cancer cells from healthy cells?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么区分癌细胞和健康细胞？

Sense.DEF: to be the thing that makes someone or something different or special

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The factor that distinguishes this company from the competition is customer service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 使这家公司在竞争中脱颖而出的是其客户服务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main distinguishing feature of this species is the leaf shape.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一品种的主要特征是叶子的形状。

Sense.DEF: to be able to see the shape of something or hear a particular sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: The light was too dim for me to distinguish anything clearly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光线太暗﹐我什么也看不清。

Sense.DEF: to do something so well that people notice and remember you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He distinguished himself on several occasions in the civil war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在内战中屡次表现突出。

Sense.DEF: easy to recognize as being different from something else
Sense.TRAN: 能分辨出来的﹐区别得出的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fake was barely distinguishable from the original painting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅赝品与原画几乎无法区别。
难以区别的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cheese is easily distinguishable by its colour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种奶酪从颜色上很容易辨认。

Sense.DEF: successful, respected, and admired
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long and distinguished career
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漫长而卓越的职业生涯

Sense.DEF: dressed in neat and attractive clothes that are worn by adults, not looking like a young person
Sense.TRAN: 衣着高雅的﹐气度不凡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall distinguished figure in a dark suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿深色套装﹑气度非凡的高大身影

Sense.DEF: to change the appearance, sound, or shape of something so that it is strange or unclear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tall buildings can distort radio signals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高大的建筑物会使无线电信号失真。

Sense.DEF: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: His account was badly distorted by the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

Sense.DEF: to change a situation from the way it would naturally be
Sense.EXAMPLE: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His face was distorted in anger.
a gross distortion of the facts

Sense.DEF: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try not to distract the other students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Coverage of the war was used to distract attention from other matters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对战争的报道被用来分散对其他事情的注意力。

Sense.DEF: anxious and unable to think clearly
Sense.TRAN: 心神不定的﹐心烦意乱的﹐精神无法集中的

Sense.DEF: something that stops you paying attention to what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I study in the library as there are too many distractions at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在图书馆学习﹐家里分心的事太多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Demands for equality were seen as a distraction from more serious issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求平等被视为分散了人们对更严重问题的注意力。

Sense.DEF: to continue annoying or upsetting someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 让某人烦得要命﹐把某人逼疯
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby’s constant crying drove me to distraction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿不停地哭﹐真要把我逼疯了。

Sense.DEF: a pleasant activity
so upset and worried that you cannot think clearly
Sense.TRAN: 忧心如焚的﹐心烦意乱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relatives are tonight comforting the distraught parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲戚们今晚都在安慰这对忧心如焚的父母。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of extreme unhappiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luke’s behaviour caused his parents great distress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克的行为使他的父母深感忧虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girl was crying and clearly in distress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女孩哭着﹐显然很悲伤。

Sense.DEF: suffering and problems caused by a lack of money, food etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: acute financial distress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的财务困难

GramExa.EXAMPLE: charities that aid families in distress
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 救助贫困家庭的慈善机构

Sense.DEF: great physical pain
a situation when a ship, aircraft etc is in danger and needs help
Sense.EXAMPLE: We picked up a distress signal 6 km away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到六公里外发出的遇难信号。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship is in distress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船遇险了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dream had distressed her greatly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场梦使她深感不安。

Sense.DEF: very upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hannah was deeply distressed by the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜为这消息深感苦恼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My client is very distressed at the treatment she received from your officers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的委托人因受到你方官员如此对待而极为烦闷。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was distressed to see he was crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他在哭﹐她感到很难过。

Sense.DEF: in a lot of pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The animal was clearly distressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那动物显然很痛。

Sense.DEF: distressed furniture or clothes have been made to look older than they really are
Sense.TRAN: 〔家具或衣服〕刻意做旧的﹐仿古的

Sense.DEF: having very little money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a family living in distressed circumstances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活在贫困中的一家人

Sense.DEF: making you feel very upset
Sense.TRAN: 令人不安的﹐使人忧虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distressing experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次痛苦的经历

Sense.DEF: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指有计划地〕分发﹐分配﹐分送

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clothes and blankets have been distributed among the refugees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经向难民分发了衣物和毯子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

Sense.DEF: to supply goods to shops and companies so that they can sell them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Milk is distributed to the local shops by Herald’s Dairies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶由赫勒尔德乳品公司分销给当地商店。

Sense.DEF: to spread something over a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the weight of the load is evenly distributed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 务必使负载的重量分布均匀。

Sense.DEF: to exist in different parts of an area or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This species of dolphin is widely distributed throughout the world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种海豚广泛分布在世界各地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The population is distributed in a very uneven pattern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口分布很不均匀。

Sense.DEF: the act of sharing things among a large group of people in a planned way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the distribution of aid supplies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 救济物资的分发

Sense.DEF: when goods are supplied to shops and companies for them to sell
Sense.EXAMPLE: a distribution centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经销中心

Sense.DEF: the way in which something exists in different amounts in different parts of an area or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: population distribution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口分布

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the highly unequal distribution of economic power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济实力分布的高度不均衡

Sense.DEF: connected with distribution
Sense.TRAN: 分发的﹐分配的﹔分销的﹔分布的
Sense.EXAMPLE: distributive costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经销成本

Sense.DEF: a company or person that supplies shops and companies with goods

the part of an engine that sends an electric current to the
spark plug s
a company that has an arrangement to sell the products of another company
Sense.EXAMPLE: the UK distributorship for Sol lighting products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: Sol牌照明产品的英国分销商

Sense.DEF: an area of a town or the countryside, especially one with particular features

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a house in a pleasant suburban district
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地处宜人郊区的一幢房屋

Sense.DEF: an area of a country, city etc that has official borders
Sense.EXAMPLE: a postal district
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邮政区

Sense.DEF: a lawyer in the US who works for the government in a particular area and who is responsible for bringing people who may be criminals to court
a group of people elected to organize local services such as education, health services etc in a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 区议会〔负责组织教育﹑保健服务等地方事务〕

Sense.DEF: a US court of law which deals with cases involving national rather than state law
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕联邦地区法院〔审理涉及联邦法律而非州法律的案子〕

Sense.DEF: a nurse who visits people in their own homes
Sense.TRAN: 社区护士〔上门护理病人的护士〕

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you cannot trust someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people regard the police with suspicion and distrust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人对警察持怀疑﹑不信任的态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dylan’s deep distrust of journalists made him difficult to interview.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迪伦对记者的极度不信任使他们很难采访他。

Sense.DEF: to not trust someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had every reason to distrust him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全有理由不信任他。

Sense.DEF: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to disturb you, but I have an urgent message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起打扰一下﹐我有个紧急消息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thieves fled when they were disturbed by a neighbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼们被一名邻居惊动后逃跑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do not disturb a sign you put on a door so that people will not interrupt you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请勿打扰。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel worried or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: What disturbs you most about this latest development?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新的事态发展中让你最担心的是什么？

Sense.DEF: to move something or change its position
Sense.TRAN: 挪动﹐移动﹐改变〔某物的〕位置
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you find a bird’s nest, never disturb the eggs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你发现鸟巢﹐千万别去动鸟蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promise not to disturb anything .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应什么都不动。

Sense.DEF: to change a normal situation in a way that causes problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: My hormone balance is disturbed by my pregnancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀孕打乱了我的荷尔蒙平衡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: New procedures often disturb the comfortable habits of the workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的程序常常会打乱职工习以为常的习惯。

Sense.DEF: law to behave in a noisy and unpleasant way in public
a situation in which people behave violently in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were disturbances in the crowd as fans left the stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷离开体育场时﹐人群中发生了骚乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 引起骚乱

Sense.EXAMPLE: army training on controlling civil disturbance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制平民骚乱的军事训练

Sense.DEF: something that interrupts what you are doing, or the act of making this happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrange the work so there’s as little disturbance as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把工作安排得尽量不引起干扰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When a helicopter lands, it can cause a disturbance to local residents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直升机降落会惊扰当地居民。

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which someone is mentally ill and does not behave normally
Sense.EXAMPLE: a history of mental disturbance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神失常病史

Sense.DEF: not behaving normally because of a mental condition
Sense.TRAN: 精神失常的﹐有精神病的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the care of emotionally disturbed children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对情绪失常儿童的照料

Sense.EXAMPLE: while the balance of his mind was disturbed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当他心智失常时

Sense.DEF: worried or upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police are very disturbed about the latest trend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对最近的动向深感忧虑。
非常/深感/极其等不安的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was disturbed to learn he had bought a motorbike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得知他买了一辆摩托车﹐她很担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m disturbed that so many of the students appear to be illiterate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有这么多学生似乎都不识字﹐这让我担心。

Sense.DEF: sleep that is interrupted
worrying or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 令人不安的﹐使人震惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disturbing increase in the crime rate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人不安的犯罪率增幅

Sense.DEF: people who are disunited are in the same organization, country, or group but cannot agree or work with each other
Sense.TRAN: 分裂的﹐不团结的﹐不和的

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a group of people cannot agree or work with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Disunity destroyed the Republicans at the polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内部分裂使共和党在选举中落败。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is no longer used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building eventually fell into disuse .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该建筑物最终被废弃不用了。

Sense.DEF: a disused building, railway, mine etc is no longer used
a long narrow hole dug at the side of a field, road etc to hold or remove unwanted water
to stop having something because you no longer want it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has ditched plans to privatise the prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府放弃了监狱私有化的计划。

Sense.DEF: to end a romantic relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meg and Neil were due to marry, but she ditched him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格与尼尔本来是要结婚的﹐可她把他给甩了。

Sense.DEF: to not go to school, a class etc when you should
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you ditch class today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天逃课了？

Sense.DEF: to leave someone you are with in a place without telling them you are going
to land an aircraft in a controlled crash into water
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔飞机〕在水上紧急降落﹔（使）迫降于水域
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two balloonists had to ditch during the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名乘气球飞行者在比赛中被迫在水上紧急降落。

Sense.DEF: very boring
to keep being unable to make a final decision about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He accused the government of dithering over the deal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责政府在这件事上犹豫不决。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop dithering, girl, and get on with it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别犹豫了﹐姑娘﹐快点！

Sense.DEF:
a ditransitive verb has an
indirect object
and a
direct object
. ‘Give’ in the sentence ‘Give me the book’ is ditransitive.
Sense.TRAN: 〔动词〕带双宾语的〔即带直接宾语和间接宾语﹐如句子 Give me the book 中的give〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
ditzy
used to say that you have exactly the same opinion as someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hated school.’ ‘Ditto.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我讨厌上学。” “我也一样。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that what is true of one thing is also true of another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where should she go? Mississippi? Too hot. Ditto Alabama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她应该去哪里呢？密西西比州？太热了。亚拉巴马州也一样。

Sense.DEF: a mark (") that you write immediately under a word in a list to show that the same word is repeated
a short simple poem or song – used humorously
silly or stupid, and likely to forget things easily

a substance that increases the flow of
urine
happening or active in the daytime
happening every day

Sense.TRAN: written abbreviation of 书面缩写= division 部﹐部门

Sense.DEF: a very successful and famous female singer
Sense.EXAMPLE: opera diva Jessye Norman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名歌剧女歌唱家杰茜·诺曼

Sense.DEF: a bed with a thick base
a long low soft seat without a back or arms
to jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dived into a pool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一头扎进水池里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Diving off the cliffs is dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从悬崖上跳水是很危险的。

Sense.DEF: to swim under water using special equipment to help you breathe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first time you dive on a coral reef is an experience you will never forget.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一次在珊瑚礁潜水是毕生难忘的经历。

Sense.DEF: to travel down through the air or through water to a lower level
Sense.EXAMPLE: The submarine began to dive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜水艇开始下潜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aircraft appeared to dive vertically towards the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机似乎垂直朝着人群俯冲下来。

Sense.DEF: to move or jump quickly in a particular direction or into a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackson dived after the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊扑过去追球。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We dived into a shop to avoid the rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们冲进一家商店避雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were diving for cover to protect themselves behind something .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们飞快地跑着找掩护。

Sense.DEF: to put your hand quickly in your bag, pocket etc in order to get something out
Sense.TRAN: 迅速将手伸入提包/衣袋等〔取东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dived into his pocket and produced a packet of cigarettes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地把手伸进衣袋里掏出一包烟。

Sense.DEF: if numbers, prices etc dive, they suddenly become much lower than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar dived against the yen in Tokyo today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天﹐东京美元对日元比价暴跌。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something eagerly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harvey dived in with several questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈维急切地问了几个问题。

Sense.DEF: a sudden movement in a particular direction or into a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a dive for the bathroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冲向洗手间。

Sense.DEF: a sudden fall in the amount, value, or success of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量﹑价值或运气的〕突降﹐暴跌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news put shares in a dive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条新闻使得股票大跌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team’s fortunes have taken a dive this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年这支球队时运不济。

Sense.DEF: when something moves down through the air or water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thankfully, the pilot managed to pull out of the dive and regain control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸亏驾驶员设法将俯冲的飞机拉起﹐恢复了对飞机的控制。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 垂直俯冲

Sense.DEF: a jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first
the act of going under water to swim, using special equipment to help you breathe
a bar, club etc that is cheap and dirty

the act of falling down deliberately in order to unfairly win a
free kick
or a
penalty
if an aircraft dive-bombs a place, it drops bombs on it
someone who swims or works under water using special equipment to help them breathe
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用水肺等的〕潜水员﹐潜水者

Sense.DEF: someone who jumps into water with their head and arms first
if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

Sense.DEF: if opinions, interests etc diverge, they are different from each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here his views diverged from hers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此处他的看法与她有分歧。

Sense.DEF: if two lines or paths diverge, they separate and go in different directions

RunOn.EXAMPLE: divergence between the US and Europe

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有分歧的观点

Sense.DEF: very different from each other
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样的﹐形形色色的﹐相异的
Sense.EXAMPLE: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

Sense.DEF: if a business, company, country etc diversifies, it increases the range of goods or services it produces
Sense.TRAN: （使）产品品种多样化﹐（使）扩大经营范围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: farmers forced to diversify away from their core business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被迫在核心农业外扩大经营范围的农民

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is planning to diversify into other mining activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司打算将经营范围扩大到其他采矿业务。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to diversify the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要使经济多元化。

Sense.DEF: to change something or to make it change so that there is more variety
Sense.EXAMPLE: User requirements have diversified over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几年来﹐用户需求已经多样化。

Sense.DEF:
to put money into several different types of
investment
instead of only one or two
Sense.TRAN: 投资多元化﹐进行多种投资

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spread the risk by diversifying into dollar bonds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买美元债券进行多种投资﹐以分散风险。

Sense.DEF: a change in the direction or use of something, or the act of changing it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the diversion of the river
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河流改道
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the diversion of funds into the military budget
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将资金转用于军费预算

Sense.DEF: an enjoyable activity that you do to stop yourself from becoming bored
something that stops you from paying attention to what you are doing or what is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two prisoners created a diversion to give the men time to escape.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名囚犯想办法分散了大家的注意力﹐使那些人有时间逃跑。

Sense.DEF: a different way that traffic is sent when the usual roads are closed
Sense.TRAN: 〔常用道路被封闭后使用的〕绕行路﹐支路

Sense.DEF: intended to take someone’s attention away from something
Sense.TRAN: 转移注意力的﹐声东击西的
