Sense.EXAMPLE: Most children are skilled in diversionary tactics .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数儿童都很会使用转移注意力的小花招。

Sense.DEF: the fact of including many different types of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The curriculum will take account of the ethnic diversity of the population.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程编排将考虑到人口中民族的多元化。

Sense.DEF: a range of different people, things, or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样的人[事物﹐思想]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a diversity of opinions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 繁杂纷纭的观点

Sense.DEF: to change the use of something such as time or money

GramExa.PROPFORM: divert sth into/to/(away) from etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company should divert more resources into research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司应该把更多的资源用于研究。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officials diverted revenue from arms sales to the rebels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们将军火销售的收益转到了叛乱分子手中。

Sense.DEF: to change the direction in which something travels

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Canals divert water from the Truckee River into the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运河使特拉基河的河水改道流入这座湖中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The high street is closed and traffic is being diverted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大街封闭﹐车辆正改道而行。

Sense.DEF: if you divert your telephone calls, you arrange for them to go directly to another number, for example because you are not able to answer them yourself for some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember to divert your phone when you are out of the office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不在办公室的时候要记得设定电话转移。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately take someone’s attention from something by making them think about or notice other things
Sense.TRAN: 〔故意〕转移﹐分散〔别人的注意力〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crime crackdown is an attempt to divert attention from social problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次打击犯罪是为了转移人们对社会问题的关注。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d been trying to divert suspicion away from himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直试图转移别人对他的怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to amuse or entertain someone
entertaining and amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mildly diverting film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部有点搞笑的影片

Sense.DEF:
if a company divests, it sells some of its
asset s
,
investment s
etc
Sense.TRAN: 转让﹐出售〔公司部分资产﹑投资等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: pressure on hospitals to divest tobacco-related stocks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求医院转让烟草类股票的压力

Sense.DEF: to sell or give away something you own
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad had long since divested himself of anything valuable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸早就把所有值钱的东西都卖光了。

Sense.DEF: to remove something you are wearing or carrying
Sense.TRAN: 脱下〔所穿的衣服〕﹔放下〔所拿的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pedro divested himself of his overcoat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩德罗脱下大衣。

Sense.DEF: to take something away from someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The king was divested of all his wealth and power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王被剥夺了一切财富与权力。

Sense.DEF:
another word for
disinvestment
if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists traditionally divide the oceans into zones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家传统上都把海洋划分成区。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is divided into six sections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书分为六部分。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here, the river divides into three channels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这里开始﹐这条河分为三条河道。

Sense.DEF: to keep two areas separate from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Wall used to divide East and West Berlin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去这堵墙把东﹑西柏林隔开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only a thin curtain divided her cabin from his.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和他的小间只隔着一层薄薄的帘子。

Sense.DEF: to separate something into parts and share them between people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

Sense.DEF: if you divide your time, energy etc between different activities or places, you spend part of your time doing each activity or in each place
Sense.TRAN: 把〔时间﹑精力等〕分别用于[分散使用于]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She divides her time between New York and Paris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一部分时间在纽约﹐一部分时间在巴黎。

Subsense.DEF: to calculate how many times one number contains a smaller number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you divide 21 by 3, you get 7.
‘What’s six divided by three?’ ‘Two’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “6除以3 等于几？” “等于2。”

Subsense.DEF: to be contained exactly in a number one or more times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 8 divides into 64.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 8能除尽64。

Sense.DEF: to make people disagree so that they form groups with different opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issue of cloning has sharply divided voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克隆问题使选民分化成截然对立的阵营。

Sense.DEF: to defeat or control people by making them argue with each other instead of opposing you
a feeling you have when two people you like have argued and you are not sure which person you should support
Sense.TRAN: 两难的忠诚﹐左右为难的忠心
Sense.EXAMPLE: Divorce is an agony of divided loyalties for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母离婚使孩子面临左右为难的痛苦。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The committee was divided over the proposal.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会在这一提议上意见有分歧。

Sense.DEF: a strong difference between the beliefs or way of life of groups of people, that may make them hate each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔不同群体在信仰或生活方式上的〕差异﹐差别
Sense.EXAMPLE: The North/South divide is characteristic of Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南北差异是英国的典型特征。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people on both sides of the political divide
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治分歧的双方

Sense.DEF: a line of high ground between two river systems
a main road with two lines of traffic travelling in each direction, separated by a piece of land
Sense.TRAN: 〔中央有分隔带的〕双向公路﹐对向车道

Sense.DEF:
a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with
share s
in the company

prize money offered in a national competition called the
football pool s
which people can win by correctly guessing the results of football games
a number that is to be divided by another number
to be very useful and bring a lot of advantages, especially later in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good eating habits will pay dividends later on in life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持良好的饮食习惯﹐将来会受益的。

Sense.DEF: something that divides something else into parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔把某物分成几部分的〕分隔物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a room divider
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间隔板
Sense.EXAMPLE: alphabetical file dividers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按字母顺序排列的文件夹隔板

Sense.DEF: a piece of land that separates traffic travelling in opposite directions on a main road
Sense.TRAN: 〔主干道中间隔离对向车流的〕分隔带
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police saw his Mercedes speeding along the center divider.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察看到他的梅赛德斯牌汽车沿中央分隔带飞速行驶。

Sense.DEF: an instrument used for measuring or marking lines or angles, consisting of two pointed pieces of metal joined together at the top
the difference between two similar things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the dividing line between normal drinking and addiction?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正常喝酒和酗酒的界限如何划分？

Sense.DEF: the ability to say what will happen in the future, or the act of doing this
coming from or relating to God or a god

GramExa.EXAMPLE: faith in divine providence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对神意的信赖

Sense.EXAMPLE: divine power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神的力量
Sense.EXAMPLE: divine love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上帝的慈爱

Sense.DEF: very pleasant or good
to discover or guess something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somehow, the children had divined that he was lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知怎的﹐孩子们猜出了他在说谎。

Sense.DEF: to search for underground water or minerals using a Y-shaped stick
Sense.TRAN: 〔用Y形探测杆〕探测地下水[矿物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a divining rod the stick used for this
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔地下水﹑矿物等的〕探测杆

Sense.DEF: the right given to a king or queen by God to rule a country, that in former times could not be opposed
Sense.TRAN: 神授王权﹐君权神授〔旧时的观念﹐认为君主治国的权力来自神〕

Sense.DEF: the right to do what you want without having to ask permission
Sense.TRAN: 天经地义的权力〔按自己的意愿行事而不必经人允许〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being my wife doesn’t give you the divine right to read my mail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是我的老婆不等于你就有权擅自看我的邮件。

Sense.DEF: the sport of swimming under water using special equipment to help you breathe
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went diving on the coral reef.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到珊瑚礁去潜水了。

Sense.DEF: the activity of jumping into water with your head and arms first
a metal container that is open at the bottom and filled with air under pressure, in which people can work under water
Sense.TRAN: 潜水钟〔钟形金属罩﹐人在其中可进行水下工作〕

Sense.DEF:
a board above the edge of a
swimming pool
which people
dive
from
the study of God and religious beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a graduate of Harvard divinity school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈佛大学神学院的毕业生

Sense.DEF: the quality or state of being a god
a god
able to be divided, for example by a number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 6 is divisible by 3.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 6 可被 3 除尽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The story is divisible into three parts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这故事可分为三部分。

Sense.DEF: the act of separating something into two or more different parts, or the way these parts are separated or shared

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the division of words into syllables
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 单词的音节划分

Sense.EXAMPLE: the traditional division of labour the way that particular tasks are shared between husband and wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妻之间传统的分工

Sense.DEF: disagreement among the members of a group that makes them form smaller opposing groups

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can he heal the deep divisions among Republican ranks?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能够弥合共和党党员之间严重的分歧吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old class divisions had begun to break down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老的阶级分化开始消失了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The Army was plagued by internal divisions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队被内部分歧所困扰。

Sense.DEF: the process of finding out how many times one number is contained in another
a group that does a particular job within a large organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Computer Services Division
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑维修部

Sense.DEF: a large military group
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tank division
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦克师

Sense.DEF: one of the groups of teams that a sports competition is divided into, often based on the number of games they have won
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛中常按成绩划分的〕级

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a second-division club
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乙级俱乐部

Sense.DEF: a process in which members of the British parliament vote for something by dividing into groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国议会议员进行的〕分组表决
Sense.EXAMPLE: MPs forced a division on the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下院议员强行对该议案进行分组表决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some members supported the opposition in the division lobbies the rooms where the vote takes place .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些议员在分组投票室内倒戈支持反对党。

Sense.DEF: relating to one of the parts into which a large organization, group etc is divided
Sense.EXAMPLE: divisional headquarters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 师指挥部

Sense.DEF: causing a lot of disagreement between people
Sense.TRAN: 造成不和的﹐导致分裂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The strike was a divisive issue in the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场罢工导致社区内部分歧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: socially divisive policies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 造成社会分裂的政策

Sense.DEF: the number by which another number is to be divided
the legal ending of a marriage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why doesn’t she get a divorce ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为什么不离婚呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: One in three marriages ends in divorce .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三分之一的婚姻以离婚告终。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife has started divorce proceedings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子开始了离婚诉讼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rise in the divorce rate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚率的上升
Sense.EXAMPLE: She received the house as part of the divorce settlement the amount of money, property etc each person receives in a divorce case .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据离婚协议她获得了这幢房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Act extended the grounds legal reasons for divorce .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《法案》放宽了离婚条件。

Sense.DEF: the fact of separating two related things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the divorce between theory and method
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论与方法的脱节

Sense.DEF: if someone divorces their husband or wife, or if two people divorce, they legally end their marriage
Sense.EXAMPLE: David’s parents divorced when he was six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维的父母在他六岁时离婚了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father threatened to divorce her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲威胁说要和她离婚。

Sense.DEF: to separate two ideas, subjects etc completely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is difficult to divorce sport from politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难把体育与政治完全分开。

Sense.DEF: to stop being involved in an activity, organization, situation etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our society has divorced itself from religion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的社会已经脱离了宗教。

Sense.DEF: no longer married to your wife or husband
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you married, single, or divorced?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是已婚﹑单身﹐还是离异？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a divorced woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚女人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anne is divorced from Simon’s father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮和西蒙的父亲离婚了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents are getting divorced .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母正在办离婚。

Sense.DEF: separate from and not connected in any way to an idea, subject etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His ideas are completely divorced from reality .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的想法完全脱离现实。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is divorced
a man or woman who is divorced

a small piece of earth and grass that you dig out accidentally while playing a sport such as
golf
or
polo
Sense.TRAN: 〔打高尔夫球或马球时无意间〕削起的一块草皮

Sense.DEF: to give someone information that should be secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not company policy to divulge personal details of employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 透露员工的私人资料不合公司的规定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clare divulged that she was recovering from a nervous breakdown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔透露说她曾经精神崩溃﹐正在康复之中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Pentagon refused to divulge what type of plane it was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五角大楼拒绝透露飞机机型。

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
to share something between several people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can divvy up the profits between us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以分享利润。

Sense.DEF:
a Hindu
festival
that is celebrated in the autumn
Sense.TRAN: 排灯节〔印度教秋季节日〕

Sense.DEF: the southern states of the US that fought against the northern states in the Civil War

a type of traditional
jazz
music
the activity of making or repairing things yourself instead of buying them or paying someone else to do it
Sense.TRAN: 自己动手〔do-it-yourself的缩写﹐指自己动手做东西或修理东西〕

Sense.DEF: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heat and the champagne made him feel dizzy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高温和香槟酒使他感到眩晕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She started to suffer from dizzy spells a short period when you feel dizzy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始感到一阵阵的眩晕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ruth felt dizzy with relief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝如释重负﹐感到晕乎乎的。

Sense.DEF: an important position – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 令人眩晕的高处〔指重要的职位﹐幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Naomi had reached the dizzy heights of manageress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 娜奥米已经晋升至经理这一令人眩晕的高位。

Sense.DEF: stupid and forgetful
Sense.TRAN: 粗心大意的﹐糊里糊涂的﹐健忘的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dizzy blonde
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个金发傻妞

Sense.DEF: very busy and exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong buzzes from dawn to dusk at a dizzy pace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香港生活节奏很快﹐从早到晚繁忙熙攘。

Sense.DEF: making you feel dizzy
Sense.TRAN: 使人眩晕的﹐让人头昏眼花的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The riverbank rushed towards her with dizzying speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河岸以使人眩晕的速度向她迎面扑来。

Sense.DEF: someone who plays records on a radio show or in a club where you can dance
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台〕音乐唱片节目主持人﹔〔夜总会〕舞曲唱片播放员

Sense.DEF: an invisible creature in Islamic stories who has special powers

a substance that carries
genetic
information in the cells of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: A DNA test showed that he was not the baby’s father. DNA
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检测显示﹐他并非婴儿的父亲。

Sense.DEF: the act of examining the DNA found where a crime has happened and the DNA of people who may have committed the crime, in order to find out who is responsible
Sense.TRAN: DNA测定﹐基因鉴定〔对犯罪现场的DNA样本与嫌犯进行比对以找出罪犯〕

Sense.DEF:
the act of finding out the order of the
molecule s
that some DNA consists of

the practice of putting a particular
domain name name used as part of an Internet address
on the official list of domain names, but then not using it in an Internet address until some time in the future. This is done in order to stop the domain name being used by anyone else.
Sense.TRAN: 域名抢注〔为以后使用而抢先在因特网上注册域名的做法〕

Subsense.DEF: used with another verb to form questions or negatives
Subsense.TRAN: 〔与另一动词连用﹐构成疑问句或否定句〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you like bananas?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢吃香蕉吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t feel like going out tonight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今天晚上不想出门。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ian didn’t answer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩没有回答。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where do you live?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你住在哪儿？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Doesn’t Rosie look wonderful?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗茜看上去不是很精神吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t listen to her!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别听她的！

Subsense.DEF:
used to form
question tag s short questions that you add to the end of statements
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You know Tony, don’t you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认识托尼﹐是不是？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t understand, did she?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不明白﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: used instead of repeating a verb that has already been used
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will Kay come?’ ‘She may do.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “凯来吗？” “或许吧。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: So now you know as much as I do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么现在你知道的和我一样多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You forgot all about it.’ ‘No, I didn’t.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你把这事忘记得一干二净。” “没有﹐我没忘记。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I want to go home.’ ‘So do I.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我想回家。” “我也是。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t believe the story and neither did he.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不相信这个故事﹐他也不信。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the main verb in a sentence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do be careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要小心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You do look nice in that hat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你戴那顶帽子确实不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do think she’s behaved badly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的确认为她的行为很糟糕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You should have warned me.’ ‘But I did warn you.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你应该提醒我。” “可我的确提醒过你的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He owns, or did own emphasizing past tense , a yacht.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有——或者说曾经拥有——一艘游艇。

Sense.DEF: used when politely offering someone something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于给某人某物时表示礼貌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do have another sandwich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请再来一块三明治。

Sense.DEF: to perform an action or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you done your homework yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做完家庭作业了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to do more exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要多锻炼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a pleasure doing business with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高兴跟你做生意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道该做什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All he does is sit in front of the television all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就整天坐在电视机前看电视。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should do something to help him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该做点什么来帮助他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It all happened so quickly that I couldn’t do anything about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切发生得那么快﹐我都来不及做什么。

Sense.EXAMPLE: bored teenagers with nothing to do
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无所事事的无聊少年

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s your turn to do the dishes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮到你洗碗碟了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often use the verb act rather than the phrase do something , as it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们常用动词 act ,而不用短语 do something ,因为前者听上去更正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The government needs to act to help these people.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府需要采取行动帮助这些人。

Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about how successful someone is at something
Sense.TRAN: 进展﹐进行〔用于表示进行得如何〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students are under considerable pressure to do well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生要取得优异成绩的压力很大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should get promoted after about a year, depending on how you’re doing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约一年后你应该可以得到提升﹐这得看你表现如何。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How’s he doing in trying to give up smoking?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他戒烟戒得怎么样了？

Sense.DEF: to have a particular effect on something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal will do serious damage to his reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一丑闻将对他的声誉造成很大的损害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This will do nothing for will not improve Jamie’s confidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这无益于增强杰米的自信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The colour does nothing for her does not improve her appearance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种颜色并没有让她好看一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting the job has done a lot for had a good effect on her self-esteem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得到这份工作增强了她的自尊心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A week in the countryside will do you good make you feel better .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在乡下待一个星期对你有好处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise can do wonders for have a very good effect on body, mind, and spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼对身心和精神大有好处。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you want to do after you leave school?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你毕业后想干什么工作？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you do for a living as your job ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从事什么职业？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s very good at what she does.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她精通业务。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something will be enough or be acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have a lot of wine for the party, but it should just about do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有很多的酒供派对上用﹐但应该也差不多够了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t find my black shoes so these will have to do .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到我那双黑鞋子﹐所以只能穿这双了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few sandwiches will do me for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我午饭吃几块三明治就行了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It won’t do it is not acceptable to say that the situation couldn’t have been avoided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说这种情况无法避免让人不能接受。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what sb will do for sth
Sense.DEF: used to talk about what arrangements someone has made to get something they need
Sense.EXAMPLE: What will you do for money if you leave your job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你辞职的话靠什么赚钱呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure what we’ll do for transport yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还不知道我们乘坐什么交通工具呢。

Sense.DEF: used to ask why someone or something is in a particular place or doing a particular thing, especially when you are surprised or annoyed by this
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某物这是在干什么？某人/某物怎么会在这里？〔尤表示惊讶或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s my coat doing on the floor?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的外套怎么会在地板上的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you doing walking around at this time of night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么晚了你还在到处逛什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What on earth do you think you’re doing ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你到底在干些什么？

Sense.DEF: to do something that improves your appearance or someone else’s appearance
Sense.TRAN: 给你自己/某人理发/修指甲/化妆等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It must take her ages to do her make-up in the mornings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她早晨一定要花很长时间来化妆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who does your hair?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁给你理发？

Sense.DEF: to spend a period of time doing something
Sense.TRAN: 花﹐用﹐度过〔一段时间做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She did a year backpacking around the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用了一年时间在世界各地背包旅行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh yes, I certainly did my time in the army spent time in the army .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐没错﹐我当然在军队里待过。

Sense.DEF: to study a particular subject in a school or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔在学校或大学里〕学习﹐攻读〔某门课程〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did French for five years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我学了五年法语。

Sense.DEF: to cook a particular type of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was thinking of doing a casserole tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在考虑今天晚上做一个砂锅菜。

Sense.DEF: to achieve a particular distance, speed etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did 300 kilometres on the first day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一天我们走了300公里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car can do 120 mph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车能跑到120英里的时速。

Sense.DEF: to provide a particular service or sell a particular product
Sense.TRAN: 提供〔某种服务〕﹔出售〔某种商品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They do interior and exterior design.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们做室内室外设计。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t do food after two o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两点以后我们就不供应食物了。

Sense.DEF: to perform a particular play, show etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did ‘Guys and Dolls’ last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年我们上演了《红男绿女》。

Sense.DEF: to paint or decorate a room, house etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are you going to do your living room?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算怎样装饰客厅？

Sense.DEF: to behave in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the evenings students are free to do as they please do what they want .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上学生可以自由活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d do as you’re told do what you are told to do !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能够按照要求去做！

Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone cannot or does not behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 某人可不会那么好心/有趣/理智等〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sensible? I don’t do sensible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理智？我可不懂什么理智。

Sense.DEF: to copy someone’s behaviour or the way they talk, especially in order to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 模仿〔某人的举止言谈来逗乐〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does a brilliant George Bush copies him in a very funny way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他模仿乔治·布什惟妙惟肖。

Sense.DEF: to have lunch, go to see a film etc with someone
Sense.TRAN: 一起吃午餐/一起看电影等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s do lunch next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周我们一起吃顿午饭吧。

Sense.DEF: to use an illegal drug
Sense.EXAMPLE: He says he’s never done hard drugs in his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他从来没有吸过烈性毒品。

Sense.DEF: to visit a particular place, especially as a tourist
Sense.TRAN: 参观﹐游览〔尤指作为游客〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s do the Eiffel Tower today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们今天去参观埃菲尔铁塔吧。

Sense.DEF: used to tell a child to stop behaving badly
Sense.TRAN: 行了！够了！〔用于命令孩子停止不良行为〕

Sense.DEF: used to say angrily that you will not accept a situation any more
Sense.TRAN: 够了！〔用于表示受不了某情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, that does it! I’m not going to listen to any more of this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐够了！这件事我不想再听了！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will have finished doing something if you just do one more thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just got to prepare the dessert and that should do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再做个甜点就好了。

Sense.DEF: to have sex – used humorously or when you want to avoid saying the word ‘sex’

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb would do well to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to advise someone that they should do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人最好做某事〔用于建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people would do well to reduce the amount of salt in their diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人最好减少饮食中盐的摄入量。

Sense.DEF: to punish or attack someone
to deceive or trick someone
used to ask what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 在发生什么事？要发生什么事？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s doing at your place tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚你家有什么活动？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is determined to do something very brave or dangerous even if they die attempting it
Sense.TRAN: 豁出性命一拼﹐不成功毋宁死

Sense.DEF: used when you meet someone to ask them if they are well, happy etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi Bob, how you doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐鲍勃﹐你好吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: what can I do you for?
Sense.DEF: used humorously to ask someone how you can help them, especially when you are trying to sell them something
Sense.TRAN: 需要我帮忙吗？〔幽默用法﹐尤用于向别人推销东西〕

Sense.DEF: to treat someone well
Sense.EXAMPLE: His relations always did pretty well by him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的亲戚一直对他很好。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone who is making you feel upset or angry to go away
Sense.TRAN: 走开〔对让你心烦或气恼的人所说〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, just go and do one!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐快给我走开吧！

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something or stop using it
Sense.EXAMPLE: People thought that the use of robots would do away with boring low-paid factory jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们本以为使用机器人就能摆脱工厂里乏味的低收入工作。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone
to criticize someone, especially in an unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know you don’t like him, but there’s no need to keep doing him down in front of the boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你不喜欢他﹐可也没必要一直在老板面前说他的不是。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone or harm something or someone very badly
Sense.TRAN: 杀死﹔严重伤害〔某人〕﹔严重损坏〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working 100 hours a week nearly did for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周工作100小时几乎要了我的命。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was planning to do himself in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打算自杀。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: That walk really did me in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走了那么多路真是把我累坏了。

Sense.DEF: to make a room look nice by decorating it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was beautifully done out in pastel colours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间用柔和的色彩装饰﹐很漂亮。

Sense.DEF: to clean a room or cupboard thoroughly
Sense.TRAN: 彻底清扫﹐清理〔房间或橱柜〕

Sense.DEF: to dishonestly stop someone from getting or keeping something, especially something they have a right to have
Sense.TRAN: 〔用不正当手段〕阻止〔某人〕拥有
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you trying to do me out of a job?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是要让我丢掉工作吗？

Sense.DEF: to make a place look attractive by decorating it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole apartment had been done over in an Art Deco style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个公寓都以装饰派艺术风格装潢过了。

Sense.DEF: to do something again, especially because you did it wrong the first time
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某事〕重新做一遍〔尤因第一次做错〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you make too many mistakes, you’ll have to do it over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你出错太多就得重做一遍。

Sense.DEF: to steal things from a building
to attack and injure someone
to fasten something, or to be fastened in a particular way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do up your coat or you’ll get cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把外套扣好﹐不然你会着凉的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a skirt which does up at the back
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条从后面系扣的女裙

Sense.DEF: to repair an old building or car, or to improve its appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: They did up an old cottage in the Scottish Highlands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们修缮了在苏格兰高地的一间老旧的小屋。

Sense.DEF: to decorate something in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apartment was done up in Viennese style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套公寓是以维也纳风格装饰的。

Sense.DEF: to wrap something in paper
to make yourself look neat and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue spent ages doing herself up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休花了好长时间梳妆打扮。

Sense.DEF: to need or want something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could have done with some help this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我本需要人来帮一下忙。

Sense.DEF: to be about something, be related to something, or be involved with something
Sense.TRAN: 与某人/某事物有关﹐与某人/某事物有联系
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their conversation had been largely to do with work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的谈话大部分是有关工作的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry about the accident, but it’s nothing to do with me I am not involved in any way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这次意外事故感到很抱歉﹐但此事与我毫无关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This question doesn’t have anything to do with the main topic of the survey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题与调查的主题毫无关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure her problems have something to do with what happened when she was a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定她的问题和她儿时的经历有一定关系。

Sense.DEF: how to spend your time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t know what to do with herself after she retired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不知道退休后该如何打发时间。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what sb should do with sth/what to do with sth etc
Sense.DEF: used to ask or talk about how someone should deal with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What shall I do with these papers?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些报纸我该怎么处理？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t know what to do with a newborn baby.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我又不懂怎么带新生儿。

Sense.LEXUNIT: what has sb done with sth?
Sense.DEF: used to ask where someone has put something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What have you done with the remote for the TV?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把电视机遥控器放哪儿了？

Sense.LEXUNIT: what is sb doing with sth?
Sense.DEF: used to ask why someone has something
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you doing with my diary?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你拿我的日记本干什么？

Sense.LEXUNIT: I can’t be doing with sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that you are annoyed by something and do not want to have to think about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t be doing with all this right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些事我现在不想去考虑。

Sense.DEF: to live or do something without a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have any sugar so you’ll have to do without.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有糖了﹐所以你只好将就一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can do without a carpet but you’ve got to have somewhere to sit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有地毯可以﹐但你总得有地方坐吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is annoying you or causing you problems
Sense.TRAN: 用不着某物﹐希望没有某物〔用于表示某事物令人讨厌或带来麻烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can do without all that hassle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你省点事吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those are the type of stupid remarks I can do without.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想听那些愚蠢的言论。

Sense.DEF: a party or other social event
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having a do to celebrate his 30th birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要办个聚会庆祝他的30岁生日。

Sense.DEF: things that you should and should not do in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 该做的和不该做的事情﹐注意事项
Sense.EXAMPLE: The booklet lists the dos and don’ts of caring for dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小册子列出了养狗的注意事项。

Sense.DEF:
a
hairdo

another spelling of
doh
used when someone is said by a doctor to be dead when they are brought to a hospital
able to be done or completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got to think first whether this plan is doable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得先考虑一下这计划是否可行。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= date of birth 出生日期

Sense.DEF: a doctor

someone who guides visitors through a
museum
, church etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔博物馆﹑教堂等的〕向导﹐讲解员

Sense.DEF: quiet and easily controlled
Sense.TRAN: 驯服的﹐容易控制的﹐温顺的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Labradors are gentle, docile dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉布拉多犬温和驯服。

Sense.DEF: a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd was waiting at the dock to greet them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群人在码头等着迎接他们。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ship is in dock for repairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船进坞修理了。

Sense.DEF: the area of a port where there are docks
Sense.EXAMPLE: James arrived at the docks expecting to see a luxury liner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯来到码头区﹐希望看到豪华邮轮。

Sense.DEF:
a
jetty
the part of a law court where the person who is charged with a crime stands

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three defendants stood in the dock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名被告站在被告席上。

Sense.DEF: thought to have done something dishonest, harmful, or wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: These chemicals remain in the dock until we have more scientific evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们找到更多的科学证据之前﹐这些化学物仍要受怀疑。

Sense.DEF: a plant with thick green leaves that grows wild in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 酸模〔英国的一种野生植物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dock leaf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片酸模叶

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that connects a
portable media player
to a computer, television etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔便携式多媒体播放器连接计算机﹑电视机等的〕连接装置﹐插接站

Sense.DEF: if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We docked at Rangoon the next morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早晨我们在仰光停靠码头。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the amount of money you pay someone as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has threatened to dock the officers’ pay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司威胁说要给那几名高级职员降薪。

Sense.DEF: to connect two computers using an electrical wire
Sense.TRAN: 把〔两台计算机〕连接﹐对接

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Users can dock a laptop to their desktop setup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用户可以把笔记本电脑与台式机系统连接。

Sense.DEF: if two spacecraft dock, they join together in space
to cut an animal’s tail short
someone whose job is loading and unloading ships
a short document giving details of goods that are delivered
a list of legal cases that will be heard in a particular court
a list of things that are to be discussed or done
Sense.TRAN: 议程﹔〔需完成的〕事项清单
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s on the docket for tomorrow’s meeting?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天的会议议程上有哪些事？

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment that is used to connect a
laptop
computer or a
portable media player
to other pieces of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于连接笔记本电脑或便携式多媒体播放器与其他设备的〕扩展坞

Sense.DEF: the area of a port where there are docks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dockland development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 码头开发区

Sense.DEF: the edge of the land that is next to the water in a port
someone whose job is loading and unloading ships
a place where ships are repaired or built
someone who is trained to treat people who are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was treated by her local doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她由她的本区医生治疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to make an appointment to see Dr Pugh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想预约看皮尤医生。

GramExa.GLOSS: the place where your doctor works
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s Sandy today?’ ‘I think she’s at the doctor’s.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “桑迪今天到哪儿去了？” “我想她是去看病了。”

Sense.DEF: someone who holds the highest level of degree given by a university
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Doctor of Law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法学博士

Sense.LEXUNIT: be just what the doctor ordered
Sense.DEF: to be exactly what someone needs or wants
Sense.EXAMPLE: A 2-0 victory is just what the doctor ordered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场2比0的胜利来得正是时候。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d been having bad headaches so I went to the doctor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我头痛得厉害,于是去看病了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go to the doctor
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you seen a doctor about it yet?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你找医生看过了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you have any of these symptoms, you should consult a doctor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果出现任何这些症状,应该咨询医生。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: telephone one, especially to ask them to come to you
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His mother was very worried and called the doctor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲很担心,于是打电话叫医生来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: arrange for one to come to you
writes an order for medicine for someone
who treats all the members of a family
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ve had the same family doctor for fifteen years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们15年一直看同一个家庭医生。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: working near where you live
working in a hospital

Exponent.DEF: someone who treats people who are ill, who has completed a long course of study at medical school
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you have bad chest pains, you should see a doctor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是胸口痛得厉害,应该去看医生。

Exponent.DEF: a doctor who is trained in general medicine and who treats the people who live in a local area
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在某一地区行医的〕全科医生
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My GP told me that I must lose weight.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的医生对我说我必须减肥。

Exponent.DEF: a doctor
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the American physician, Dr James Tyler Kent
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国医生,詹姆斯·泰勒·肯特

Exponent.DEF: doctors and nurses considered as a group
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This view is widely accepted among the medical profession.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种观点在医学界被广泛接受。

Exponent.DEF: a doctor who does operations in a hospital
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the world’s top heart surgeons performed the operation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位世界顶级心脏外科医生为这次手术主刀。

Exponent.DEF: a doctor with special knowledge about a particular illness, part of the body, or type of treatment
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The new drug is being tested by cancer specialists.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种新药癌症专家正在试验。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an eye specialist
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼科医生

Exponent.DEF: a very senior doctor in a hospital, with a lot of knowledge about a particular area of medicine
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The consultant said that he did not think it was cancer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 会诊医师说他认为不是癌。

Exponent.DEF: someone who has been trained to treat sick or injured people, especially at the scene of an accident
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在事故现场施救的〕医务辅助人员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Paramedics treated him for shock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医务辅助人员针对他的休克进行了急救处理。

Exponent.DEF: a doctor who treats animals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We took the cat to the vet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们带猫去看兽医。

Section.SECHEADING: A DOCTOR WHO TREATS MENTAL ILLNESS 精神科医生

Exponent.DEF: a doctor who is trained to treat people with mental illnesses
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In order to become a psychiatrist, you first need a medical degree.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 要成为精神科医生,首先要取得医学学位。

Exponent.DEF: a scientist who studies and is trained in psychologythe study of the mind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many psychologists believe that aggression is a learned behaviour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多心理学家认为攻击性行为是后天习得的。

Exponent.DEF: a trained person whose job is to help people with their emotional problems, especially by talking to them and asking them to talk about their feelings

Section.SECHEADING: SOMEONE WHO IS STUDYING TO BE A DOCTOR医科学生

Exponent.DEF: a student who is studying medicine in order to be a doctor
Exponent.EXAMPLE: James is a medical student at Edinburgh University.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯是爱丁堡大学的一名医科学生。

Exponent.DEF: a student who has almost finished studying to be a doctor, and who is working in a hospital

Sense.DEF: to dishonestly change something in order to gain an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had doctored his passport to pass her off as his daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他窜改了护照﹐谎称她是他的女儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are concerns that some players have been doctoring the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心说一些选手在球上做手脚。

Sense.DEF: to add something harmful to food or drink
Sense.TRAN: 在〔食物或饮料中〕添加有害物质
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul suspected that his drink had been doctored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗怀疑他的饮料被人加了东西。

Sense.DEF: to remove part of the sex organs of an animal to prevent it from having babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should have your cat doctored .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该把你家的猫阉割了。

Sense.DEF: to give someone medical treatment, especially when you are not a doctor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill doctored the horses with a strong-smelling ointment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔用一种气味强烈的膏药给那些马治病。

Sense.DEF: done as part of work for the university degree of doctor
Sense.EXAMPLE: a doctoral thesis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博士论文

Sense.DEF: a university degree of the highest level

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She received her doctorate in history in 1998.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她于1998年获得历史学博士学位。

Sense.DEF:
a
PHD
certain that your beliefs or opinions are correct and unwilling to change them
Sense.TRAN: 教条主义的﹐思想僵化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party followed an increasingly doctrinaire course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党走的是一条越来越教条的路线。

Sense.DEF: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: traditional doctrines of divine power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神力的传统教义
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marxist doctrine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思主义学说

Sense.DEF: a formal statement by a government about its future plans
Sense.EXAMPLE: the announcement of the Truman Doctrine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜鲁门主义的宣言

Sense.DEF: a film on television which shows real events in the form of a story
a piece of paper that has official information on it
a piece of written work that is stored on a computer
to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过文字﹑电影或照片来〕记录﹐记载

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His research documents how the crisis occurred.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的研究记录了危机是如何发生的。

Sense.DEF: to support an opinion, argument etc with recorded facts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is well documented that men die younger than women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有充分文献证明男人比女人寿命短。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to make documentaries
a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A local film crew is making a documentary about volcanoes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的一批摄制人员在拍摄关于火山的纪录片。

Sense.DEF: documentary films, programmes, photographs etc give or show information about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑电视﹑照片等〕纪录的﹐纪实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: documentary films
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪录影片

Sense.DEF: consisting of or written on documents

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the most useful sources of documentary evidence is maps.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最有价值的文献证据之一就是地图。

Sense.DEF: official documents, reports etc that are used to prove that something is true or correct
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于引证的〕文件资料﹐证明文件
Sense.EXAMPLE: Applicants must provide supporting documentation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请人必须提供证明文件。

Sense.DEF: the act of recording information in writing, on film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书面﹑电影等形式的〕记载﹐记录

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a careful documentation of the costs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对成本的细致记录

Sense.DEF: a television programme that shows what happens in the daily lives of real people
Sense.TRAN: 〔描写真实人物日常生活的〕实况电视剧﹐纪实肥皂剧

Sense.DEF: shaking slightly and walking with difficulty because of old age
Sense.EXAMPLE: a doddering old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个步履蹒跚的老人

Sense.DEF: weak and not able to do things easily because of old age
Sense.TRAN: 〔因年老而〕虚弱的﹐做事缓慢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the patients are a bit doddery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些病人有点虚弱。

Sense.DEF: to be very easy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exam was a doddle!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次考试太简单了！

Sense.DEF: to move quickly to avoid someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ran across the courtyard, dodging a storm of bullets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跑过院子﹐躲避雨点般的子弹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Helen clutched Edward’s arm as they dodged through the traffic .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦紧紧地抓住爱德华的胳膊﹐两人躲闪着穿行在车流中。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately avoid discussing something or doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔故意〕避开﹐避免〔谈论某事或做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Senator O’Brian skilfully dodged the crucial question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥布赖恩参议员巧妙地回避了这一关键问题。

GramExa.GLOSS: when someone avoids an order to join the army, navy etc

Sense.DEF: something dishonest that is done to avoid a rule or law
Sense.TRAN: 〔为逃避法规而使用的〕伎俩﹐诡计
Sense.EXAMPLE: Businesses are investing in tree plantations as a tax dodge a way of avoiding paying tax .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业投资林场作为避税手段。

Sense.DEF:
a city in the US state of Kansas. In the 19th century, Dodge City was a place where many people came to drink and play cards for money, and there was a lot of fighting and shooting. Various
western s
have been set in Dodge City. If someone says that they ‘have to get out of Dodge’, they mean that they have to leave quickly.
Sense.TRAN: 道奇城〔美国堪萨斯州一城市。 19世纪时有很多人来此地饮酒作乐﹑打牌赌博﹐该城经常发生打斗和枪击事件。 许多西部片都以该城作为背景。 have to get out of Dodge用来表示“得赶紧离开”〕

Sense.DEF: a car used on the dodgems

a ride at a
funfair
in which people drive small electric cars in an enclosed area, trying to hit other cars
someone who dishonestly avoids paying taxes or paying to travel on a bus or train
not working properly or not in good condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Norton Disk Doctor can perform miracles on a dodgy hard disk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺顿磁盘医生对损坏的硬盘有奇效。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon was rushed to hospital after eating what must have been dodgy prawns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙吃了肯定已变质的对虾后被紧急送往医院。

Sense.DEF: seeming to be false, dishonest, or not to be trusted
Sense.EXAMPLE: One girl thought the men looked dodgy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个女孩觉得这几个男人形迹可疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: dodgy share dealings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可靠的股票交易

Sense.DEF: involving risk or danger
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a few dodgy moments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些时候相当危险。

Sense.DEF: a large bird that was unable to fly and no longer exists
Sense.TRAN: 渡渡鸟〔一种不会飞的大鸟﹐已灭绝〕

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
completely dead or inactive, or no longer used
Sense.TRAN: 彻底死亡﹔已经失效﹔不再使用

Sense.DEF:
a female rabbit or
deer
large attractive eyes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pretty girl with big brown doe eyes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长着一对美丽的褐色大眼睛的漂亮女孩

Sense.DEF: someone who does things instead of just thinking or talking about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dole is a doer, not a talker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多尔是个实干家﹐不是夸夸其谈的人。

Sense.DEF:
the third person singular of the present tense of
do
Sense.TRAN: do的第三人称单数现在式
the short form of 缩略式= ‘does not’

Sense.DEF: to remove the hat you are wearing as a sign of respect
a common animal with four legs, fur, and a tail. Dogs are kept as pets or trained to guard places, find drugs etc.
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear a dog barking .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到了狗吠声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s taken the dog for a walk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去遛狗了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We used to have a dog when I was young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候我们养过狗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most popular breed of dog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最受人喜欢的犬种

Sense.DEF:
a male dog,
fox
, or
wolf
an offensive word meaning an unattractive woman
when people compete against each other and will do anything to get what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a dog eat dog world out there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面是个人吃人的世界。

Sense.DEF: if a country or organization is going to the dogs, it is getting worse and will be difficult to improve
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家或机构〕每况愈下﹐趋于衰败﹔一蹶不振

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for an unpleasant or dishonest man
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌的家伙﹔不老实的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: You dirty dog !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这不老实的东西！

Sense.DEF: a life that is difficult and unpleasant, with very little pleasure
Sense.TRAN: 苦难的生活﹐猪狗不如的生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife’s a nag who leads him a dog’s life makes his life unpleasant .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老婆是个唠叨鬼﹐把他的日子搞得苦不堪言。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a dog’s breakfast of sth
Sense.DEF: to do something very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The orchestra made a complete dog’s breakfast of the fourth movement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支管弦乐队把第四乐章演奏得一塌糊涂。

Sense.DEF: something that is meant to be impressive or fashionable but that other people think is not
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was dressed up like a dog’s dinner .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打扮得俗艳不堪。

Sense.DEF: to have no chance of being successful
Sense.TRAN: 毫无成功的机会﹐毫无希望

Sense.DEF: used to say that even the most unimportant person has a time in their life when they are successful and important

Sense.LEXUNIT: like a dog with two tails
Sense.DEF: very pleased and happy because something good has happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因发生了好事情而〕非常高兴﹐极开心

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot have or does not need something, but does not want anyone else to have it
feet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boy, my dogs really hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天哪﹐我的脚好疼。

Sense.DEF: something that is of very poor quality
an event that has only been organized so that people can admire it and think that it is impressive, not for any real purpose
Sense.TRAN: 装门面的活动﹐纯粹为了炫耀的活动

Sense.DEF: a very rude expression used to say that something is very good
Sense.TRAN: 真他妈的棒〔粗鲁的表达法〕

Sense.DEF: to pretend to be richer, more clever etc than you really are
a sports event consisting of a series of races for dogs
if a problem or bad luck dogs you, it causes trouble for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题或噩运〕长期困扰﹐紧随〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has been dogged by injury all season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他整个赛季不断受伤。

Sense.DEF: to follow close behind someone
a vehicle with two wheels and seats that is pulled by a horse
a small vehicle pulled by a dog

a
dog warden
Sense.TRAN: 捕狗员〔专职捕捉无主狗的人〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of thin leather that you fasten around a dog’s neck
a stiff round white collar worn by priests
Sense.TRAN: 〔神职人员戴的〕白色硬圆领﹐牧师领

Sense.DEF: the hottest days of the year
a period of time when something is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 不景气的时候﹐不成功的时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few opera houses survived the dog days of the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有几家歌剧院挨过了20世纪80年代的萧条期。

Sense.DEF: dog-eared books or papers have been used so much that the corners are turned over or torn
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或纸因翻得多而形成〕折角的﹐卷角的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dog-eared novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本卷角的小说

Sense.DEF: the small part of a cigarette left after it has been smoked
an organized fight between dogs
a fight between armed aircraft

a type of small
shark
dogged behaviour shows that you are very determined to continue doing something
Sense.TRAN: 坚持不懈的﹐顽强的﹐不屈不挠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dogged determination to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不屈不挠的成功决心

Sense.DEF: poetry that is silly or funny and not intended to be serious

another spelling of
doggy
used when you are slightly annoyed about something
Sense.TRAN: 该死的﹐讨厌的﹐天杀的〔用于表示有些生气〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: What are those doggone kids doing in my yard?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些讨厌的小孩在我的院子里干什么？

Sense.DEF: a dog – used by or to children
like or relating to dogs
Sense.TRAN: 像狗一样的﹔和狗有关的
Sense.EXAMPLE: doggy smells
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗的气味

Sense.DEF: a way of having sex in which a man has a position behind his partner
Sense.TRAN: 〔性交时男性在后面的〕后面进入式﹐狗交姿势

Sense.DEF: a small bag for taking home the food that is left over from a meal in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 打包袋〔顾客把在餐厅吃剩的食品带走的小袋子〕

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation in which someone is annoyed with you because of something you have done
a small house outdoors for a dog to sleep in
a place where a road, path etc suddenly changes direction
a set of firm beliefs held by a group of people who expect other people to accept these beliefs without thinking about them
Sense.TRAN: 教条﹔〔不容怀疑的〕教义﹐教理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rejection of political dogma
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政治教条的拒绝

Sense.DEF: someone who is dogmatic is completely certain of their beliefs and expects other people to accept them without arguing
Sense.TRAN: 教条的﹐自以为是的﹐武断的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her staff find her bossy and dogmatic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的员工认为她爱指挥别人而且自以为是。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the narrow dogmatism of the past

Sense.DEF: someone who helps people who are in bad situations, but who is annoying because their help is not needed – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自以为好心却帮倒忙的人﹐做好事不得法的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got very little time for those interfering do-gooders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没时间去理会那些爱管闲事的好心人。

Sense.DEF: a simple way of swimming by moving your legs and arms up and down
someone who has to do all the small boring jobs that no one else wants to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the summer helping out as a general dogsbody .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个夏天我帮忙做杂务工。

Sense.DEF:
a
sledge a vehicle that travels over snow
that is pulled by dogs
a small piece of metal that soldiers wear on a chain around their necks with their name, blood type etc written on it
Sense.TRAN: 身份识别牌〔士兵挂在颈部标有名字﹑血型等的牌子〕

Sense.DEF: very tired
someone whose job is to collect dogs without owners
Sense.TRAN: 捕狗员〔专职捕捉无主狗的人〕

Sense.DEF:
the first or eighth note in the
sol-fa
musical
scale
used humorously when you have just realized that you have done or said something stupid
Sense.TRAN: 噢﹐呀〔幽默用法﹐意识到自己做错事或说错话时发出的感叹语〕

Sense.DEF: a British government department which is responsible for health programmes in the UK and for the National Health Service
a circle of paper or cloth with a pattern of holes in it that you put under things to protect the surface below, or for decoration
Sense.TRAN: 〔缕空花纹纸或布做的〕网眼垫﹐装饰垫

Sense.DEF: if something bad is someone’s doing, they did or caused it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you fall into this trap, it will be all your own doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你中了这个圈套﹐那是你自找的。

Sense.DEF: to be hard work
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to be on the parade ground for 5.30 a.m. and that took some doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得在清晨5点半到阅兵场上集合﹐那可不是件轻松的事。

Sense.DEF: events, activities etc that someone is involved in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supper is a family get-together, where the doings of the day are talked about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚餐是家人的聚会﹐一天里发生的事情就在这个时候谈论。

Subsense.DEF: if an industry, company, activity etc is in the doldrums, it is not doing well or developing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The property market has been in the doldrums for months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产市场不景气已有好几个月了。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Recent economic doldrums have damaged the rural west.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的经济萧条给西部乡村带来了严重损害。

Subsense.DEF: if you are in the doldrums, you are feeling sad
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Fay is in the doldrums today.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天费伊情绪低落。

Sense.DEF: money given by the government in Britain to people who are unemployed
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国政府发放的〕失业救济金

GramExa.GLOSS: be unemployed and receiving money from the government
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 领取政府的失业救济金
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Too many young people are still on the dole.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 还在吃政府救济的年轻人太多了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The number claiming dole went up by 3,500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请领取救济金者增加了3,500人。

Sense.DEF: the number of people who are unemployed and claiming money from the government, or a line of people waiting to claim this money each week
Sense.TRAN: 领取失业救济金的人数﹔等待领取失业救济金的队伍
Sense.EXAMPLE: As two factories closed today, 500 people joined the dole queue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于今天两家工厂倒闭﹐又有500人加入了领取失业救济金的行列。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dole queues lengthened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领失业救济金的人数增加了。

Sense.DEF: money given by the government in the US to people who need financial help

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How many people are on the public dole ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多少人在领取政府救济金？

Sense.DEF: to give something such as money, food, advice etc to more than one person
Sense.TRAN: 发放﹐分发〔钱﹑食物等〕﹔〔给多人〕提供〔建议〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vera was doling out candy to all the kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维拉正在给所有的孩子分发糖果。

Sense.DEF: very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: a doleful song about lost love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首关于逝去的爱情的哀歌

Sense.DEF: a child’s toy that looks like a small person or baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small wooden doll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小木玩偶

Sense.DEF: a word meaning an attractive young woman – now usually considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 俊妞﹐美人〔现通常被视为具有冒犯性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, doll, why don’t you get me a cup of coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐大美人﹐干吗不给我来杯咖啡？

Sense.DEF: a very nice person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks, you’re a doll.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐你可真是个大好人。

Sense.DEF:
if a woman dolls herself up, she puts on attractive clothes and
make-up
, especially before going out to a party, club etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子为参加聚会﹑俱乐部活动等而〕打扮起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie was in her room, dolling herself up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉在自己的房间里﹐正在打扮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girls were all dolled up for a party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩子们都打扮得漂漂亮亮去参加派对。

Sense.DEF:
the standard unit of money in the US, Canada, Australia, and some other countries, divided into 100
cent s
: symbol $
Sense.TRAN: 元﹐圆〔美国﹑加拿大﹑澳大利亚等国的货币单位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It cost three dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它要三美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ten-dollar bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张十元钞票
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can pay in dollars or euros at the airport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在机场你可以使用美元或欧元。

Sense.DEF: the value of US money in relation to the money of other countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔和其他国家货币对比的〕美元价值
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pound has risen against the dollar increased in value in relation to the dollar .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑对美元的比价上升了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: you can bet your bottom dollar

Sense.DEF: a situation in which countries outside the US want to use the dollar rather than their own country’s money
Sense.TRAN: 美元化〔指有些国家不愿使用自己的货币﹐而宁可使用美元的情况〕

Sense.DEF: financial
Sense.EXAMPLE: From a dollars-and-cents point of view, this idea just won’t work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从经济的角度看﹐这个想法根本行不通。

Sense.DEF:
a
doll’s house
a small amount of soft food, usually dropped from a spoon
Sense.TRAN: 一团﹐一块〔通常指勺中掉下的软食〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dollop of thick cream
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块浓稠的奶油

Sense.DEF: an amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll need a big dollop of luck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要相当好的运气。

Sense.DEF: a small toy house with furniture inside

a
doll
– used especially by children
a flat frame on wheels used for moving heavy objects
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来移动重物的〕台车﹐滑动台架

Sense.DEF: a pretty young woman, especially one who wears fashionable clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指身穿时髦衣服的〕漂亮女郎

Sense.DEF: two or more large upright stones supporting a large flat piece of stone, built in ancient times
Sense.TRAN: 〔古时建造的〕石桌坟﹐支石墓〔由两块或多块竖立的石头支撑起大块扁平的石板构成〕

Sense.DEF: great sadness
a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose
dolphin-safe fish is caught in a way that does not harm or kill dolphins
Sense.TRAN: 〔鱼〕以不伤害海豚的方式捕到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: dolphin-safe tuna
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以不伤害海豚的方式捕到的金枪鱼

Sense.DEF: a silly or stupid person
the state of being something
Sense.EXAMPLE: freedom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由
Sense.EXAMPLE: boredom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无聊

Subsense.DEF: an area ruled in a particular way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a kingdom
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王国

Subsense.DEF: a particular rank
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a dukedom
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公爵的爵位

Sense.DEF: an area of activity, interest, or knowledge, especially one that a particular person, organization etc deals with
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑兴趣或知识的〕领域﹐范围﹐范畴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This problem is outside the domain of medical science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题不属于医学范畴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Looking after the house was viewed as a woman’s domain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 料理家务被认为是女性的份内之事。

Sense.DEF: an area of land owned and controlled by one person or government, especially in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the extent of the royal domain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家领地的范围

Sense.DEF: the set of possible quantities by which something can vary in mathematics
a domain name
the first part of a website’s address, which usually begins with ‘www.’ and ends with ‘.com’, ‘.org’, ‘.uk’, or other letters that show which country the website is from
a round roof on a building
a shape or building like a ball cut in half
covered with a dome or shaped like a dome
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high domed ceiling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高高的穹形屋顶

Sense.DEF: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the booming domestic economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迅速增长的国内经济

Sense.EXAMPLE: US foreign and domestic policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的对外及对内政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: our nation’s domestic affairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我国的内政
Sense.EXAMPLE: Domestic flights flights that stay inside a particular country go from Terminal 1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内航班从一号航站楼出发。

Sense.DEF: relating to family relationships and life at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately his domestic life wasn’t very happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐他的家庭生活并不幸福。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nowadays there is more sharing of domestic chores.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今分担家务已变得更为常见了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: families that can afford domestic help help with cleaning, washing etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请得起人帮忙做家务的家庭
Sense.EXAMPLE: an organization that supports women facing domestic violence violence in a family, especially from a husband to his wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对面临家庭暴力的妇女提供援助的组织

Sense.DEF: used in people’s homes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new tax on domestic fuel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对家用燃料征收的一种新税

GramExa.EXAMPLE: such as washing machines
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗衣机之类的家用电器

Sense.DEF: someone who is domestic enjoys spending time at home and is good at cooking, cleaning etc
Sense.TRAN: 喜爱家庭生活的﹔善于操持家务的
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, I’m not very domestic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐我不大喜欢做家务。

Sense.DEF: a domestic animal lives on a farm or in someone’s home

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家养的宠物

Sense.DEF: a servant who works in a large house
a fight between members of a family in their home
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounded like the neighbours were having a bit of a domestic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居家里好像在吵架。

Sense.DEF: to make an animal able to work for people or live with them as a pet
domesticated animals are able to work for people or live with them as pets
someone who is domesticated enjoys spending time at home and doing work in the home
Sense.TRAN: 喜爱家庭生活的﹔乐意操持家务的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ray’s very domesticated and even likes baking cakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷很喜欢做家务﹐他甚至爱烤蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: life at home with your family
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scene of happy domesticity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个幸福家庭生活的场景

Sense.DEF: someone who you live with and have a sexual relationship with, but who you are not married to
the study of cooking, sewing etc, taught as a subject at school
Sense.TRAN: 家政学〔教授烹饪﹑缝纫等的学科〕

Sense.DEF: the work of a servant in a large house
the place where someone lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: Military service entails frequent changes of domicile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服兵役需要频繁更换住所。

Sense.DEF: to live in a particular place

if a company is domiciled in a place, it is officially
register ed
there
services, care etc in someone’s home
the fact of being more powerful, more important, or more noticeable than other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the continuing dominance of the army in Uganda
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队在乌干达继续保持的主导地位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the economic and political dominance of Western countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方国家的经济和政治优势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: television’s dominance over other media
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对其他媒体而言电视拥有的优势

Sense.DEF: more powerful, important, or noticeable than other people or things
Sense.TRAN: 强大的﹐占优势的﹐突出的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dominant male gorilla is the largest in the group.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领头的公猩猩是这群大猩猩中体形最大的一个。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan became dominant in the mass market during the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪80年代日本在大众市场上开始占据优势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: its dominant position within the group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它在该组织中的突出地位

Sense.DEF: controlling or trying to control other people or things – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 专横的﹐盛气凌人的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dominant personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专横的个性

Sense.DEF:
a dominant
gene
causes a child to have a particular physical feature or illness, even if it has been passed on from only one parent
Sense.EXAMPLE: The disease is under the control of a single dominant gene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病受一个显性基因控制。

Sense.DEF:
the fifth note of a musical
scale
of eight notes
to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

Sense.DEF: to be larger and more noticeable than anything else in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cathedral dominates the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大教堂俯视全城。

Sense.DEF:
a woman who is the stronger partner in a
sadomasochistic
sexual relationship
Sense.TRAN: 〔性施虐受虐关系中的〕女性施虐者﹐施虐女

Sense.DEF: someone who is domineering tries to control other people without considering their feelings or ideas – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a domineering mother
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专横的母亲

Sense.DEF: a member of a Christian religious group who leads a holy life
the power or right to rule people or control something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The King held dominion over a vast area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王统治着辽阔的疆域。

Sense.DEF: the land owned or controlled by one person or a government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the king’s dominions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王的领地

Sense.DEF:
a country belonging to the British
empire
or
commonwealth
Sense.EXAMPLE: opinion at home and in the dominions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内及自治领的观点

Sense.DEF: one of a set of small flat pieces of wood, plastic etc, with different numbers of spots, used for playing a game
the game played using dominoes
a situation in which one event or action causes several other things to happen one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 多米诺（骨牌）效应﹐连锁反应

Sense.DEF: a university teacher, especially one who teaches at the universities of Oxford or Cambridge
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指牛津大学或剑桥大学的〕大学教师

Sense.DEF: the leader of a Mafia organization
to put on a hat, coat etc
to give something, especially money, to a person or an organization in order to help them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last year he donated $1,000 to cancer research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年他捐了1,000美元用于癌症研究。

Sense.DEF: to allow some blood or a body organ to be removed from your body so that it can be used in a hospital to help someone who is ill or injured
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who volunteer to donate blood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自愿献血者

Sense.DEF: something, especially money, that you give to a person or an organ-ization in order to help them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like to make a donation give money to our charity appeal?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你愿意响应我们的慈善呼吁捐款吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been generous donations from EU funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟基金给予了慷慨的捐款。

Sense.DEF: the act of giving something, especially money, to help a person or an organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the donation of a quarter of a million pounds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 25万英镑的捐助
献血/器官捐献

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
do

Head.GRAMTRAN: 不用于名词前，无比较级

Sense.DEF: finished or completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job’s nearly done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作快做完了。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone has finished doing or using something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As soon as I’m done, I’ll give you a call.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一忙完就给你打电话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you done with this magazine?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志你看完了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be glad when the exams are over and done with completely finished .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等考试全部结束我就开心了。

Sense.DEF: cooked enough to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the pasta done yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利面好了没有？

Sense.DEF: to be in serious trouble or likely to fail
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we get caught, we’re done for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是被抓住﹐我们就完了。

Sense.DEF: extremely tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look done in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去累坏了。

Sense.DEF: to be socially acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Showing affection in public just isn’t done in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公开场合表示爱意在日本是不得体的。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop thinking about or trying to decide something because they have already done this enough
Sense.TRAN: 赶快把它结束〔因已经考虑或犹豫很长时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just buy it and have done with it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它买下来就是了！

Sense.DEF: to be deceived or cheated
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you paid £50, you were done, mate!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你付了50英镑﹐那就上当了﹐老兄！

Sense.DEF: to be caught by the police for doing something illegal, but usually not too serious
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不太严重的违法行为而〕被警察逮住

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got done for speeding last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚超速行驶被警察逮住了。

Sense.DEF: an agreement that has been made and cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 已达成的协定﹐不可再更改的协议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The merger is far from a done deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合并事宜远未谈妥。

Sense.DEF: completely finished or completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was all done and dusted within forty-five minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 45 分钟内就全部完成了。

Sense.DEF: used to agree to and accept the conditions of a deal
Sense.TRAN: 好﹐行﹐成交〔用于表示同意或接受某交易的条件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll give you $90 for it.’ ‘Done!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我出90美元买。” “成交！”

Sense.DEF: a small piece of equipment that you must connect to a computer before you can use a particular piece of software
a man who is good at persuading women to have sex with him
Sense.TRAN: 唐璜﹐善于勾引女性的人﹐风流浪子﹐花花公子

Sense.DEF: a grey or brown animal like a horse, but smaller and with long ears
a very long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve had this jacket for donkey’s years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件夹克衫我穿了好多年了。

Sense.DEF: a short thick coat, usually very dark blue, with a piece of leather or plastic across the shoulders
Sense.TRAN: 短厚外衣〔通常为深蓝色﹐肩部有一块皮革或塑料〕

Sense.DEF: the hard boring work that is part of a job or project
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作或项目中的〕单调乏味的苦差事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do I always have to do the donkeywork ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么苦活累活总得我来干？

Sense.DEF: clever, serious, and more interested in ideas than real life
a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An anonymous donor whose name is unknown has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

Sense.DEF: someone who gives blood or a body organ so that it can be used in the medical treatment of someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some patients die before a suitable donor is found.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些病人在找到合适的器官捐献者之前就已死去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the shortage of blood donors
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 献血者紧缺

Sense.DEF: a card that you carry to show that when you die a doctor can take parts of your body to use in the medical treatment of someone else
Sense.TRAN: 器官捐赠卡〔随身携带﹐上面写明死后器官可捐赠〕

Sense.DEF: lazy or unwilling to make any changes, especially in politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政治上〕庸碌的﹐无所作为的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the do-nothing government of the last few years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去几年里的那个庸碌无为的政府

Sense.DEF:
someone who is determined to change what is wrong, but who does it in a way that is silly or not practical. This name comes from the main character in the humorous book Don Quixote de la Mancha by Miguel de Cervantes. Don Quixote wants to be a
knight
like the characters he admires in old stories, but when he tries to copy their adventures and behaviour, he makes many stupid mistakes.
Sense.TRAN: 堂吉诃德〔指一心要改变不合理现象﹑所用方法却又愚蠢且不切实际的人。堂吉诃德是塞万提斯同名讽刺小说中的主人公﹐他仿效骑士﹐却犯下许多愚蠢的错误〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘do not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know him, don’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认识他的﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: an incorrect short form of ‘does not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: She don’t like it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢它。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
doughnut
a small object whose name you have forgotten or do not know
Sense.TRAN: 〔忘记或不知名称的〕小装置﹐小玩意
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s the doodah to turn off the TV?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关电视的那个东西呢？

Sense.DEF: to draw shapes, lines, or patterns without really thinking about what you are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brad was doodling on a sheet of paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德在一张纸上乱涂着。

Sense.DEF: a small object whose name you have forgotten or do not know, especially a part of a machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔忘记或不知其名称的〕小物件〔尤指机器的小部件〕

Sense.DEF: crazy
to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many species are doomed to extinction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多物种注定要灭绝。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan was doomed from the start .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划一开始就注定要失败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are all doomed to die in the end.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最终都是注定要死的。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这趟劫数难逃的航班上的乘客

Sense.DEF: something very bad that is going to happen, or the fact that it is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sense of impending doom coming very soon gripped her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心头被一种大难临头的感觉所笼罩。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在劫难逃的感觉

GramExa.GLOSS: mean that something will be unable to continue or survive
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recession spelled doom for many small businesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次经济衰退给许多小公司带来了厄运。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of soldiers met their doom died on this very field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数千名士兵就是在这个战场上丧生的。

GramExa.GLOSS: when there seems to be no hope for the future
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite these poor figures,it’s not all doom and gloom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管这些数字很糟糕﹐但还不至于说一点希望也没有。

Sense.DEF: saying or making you feel that something very bad is going to happen soon
Sense.TRAN: 预言厄运将至的﹔令人预感不祥的
Sense.EXAMPLE: documentaries full of doom-laden predictions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满灾祸预言的纪录片

Sense.DEF: someone who says that bad things are going to happen
for a very long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could wait till Doomsday and he’d never show up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以永远地等下去﹐他不可能出现的。

Sense.DEF: the last day of the Earth’s existence, when everything will be destroyed, according to some religions

GramExa.GLOSS: a description of a very bad and hopeless situation
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 末日景象﹐令人绝望的形势

Sense.DEF:
a
doomsayer
the large flat piece of wood, glass etc that you move when you go into or out of a building, room, vehicle etc, or when you open a cupboard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you open the door for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你帮我开门好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door flew open and Ruth stormed in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门一下子打开了﹐露丝气冲冲地跑了进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to lock the garage door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了把车库的门锁上。

Sense.DEF: the space made by an open door

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rick turned and ran out of the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克转身跑出门外。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I glanced through the open door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门开着﹐我向里看了一眼。

Sense.DEF: if someone is at the door, they are waiting for you to open the door of a building so they can come inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s somebody at the front door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前门有人。

Sense.DEF: outside
Sense.EXAMPLE: I prefer working out of doors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我更喜欢在室外工作。

Sense.DEF: to take someone to the main way out of a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: My secretary will show you to the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书会送你到门口。

Sense.DEF: used to say how many houses or buildings there are between your house, office etc and another building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Patrick lived two doors away from me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克的住处和我家相隔两户人家。

Subsense.DEF: from one place to another
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How long is the journey, door to door?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全程有多远？

Subsense.DEF: going to each house in a street or area to sell something, collect money, or ask for votes
Subsense.TRAN: 挨家挨户〔推销﹑筹钱或拉选票〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Joe sold vacuum cleaners door to door for years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔挨家挨户推销真空吸尘器已很多年了。

Sense.DEF: to work at the entrance to a theatre, club etc, collecting tickets
Sense.TRAN: 在〔剧院﹑俱乐部等〕门口把门[收票]

Sense.DEF: to make something impossible
Sense.EXAMPLE: The accident shut the door on her ballet career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场事故使她的芭蕾舞生涯终结了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: get in through the back door

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I opened the door and Dad was standing there.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打开门,爸爸站在那里。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: shut it loudly, usually because you are angry
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔一般因为生气而〕摔门,砰地关门
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He strode from the room, slamming the door behind him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大步走出房间,重重地摔上门。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: open it for someone who has knocked or pressed the bell
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Lucy ran downstairs to answer the door.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西跑下楼去开门。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to say what place is on the other side of a door
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This door leads into the garden.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这扇门通向花园。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We were still waiting for the train doors to open.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还在等火车开门。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: shuts loudly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I heard the front door slam.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到前门砰地关上了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: opens very suddenly and quickly
moves forward to open or backwards to shut
moves smoothly to the side or back again
slide a metal bar across to fasten it
hit it with your hand to make someone open it
hit it very loudly and urgently
hit it very gently
open or close it for someone
of a house
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I heard someone knocking at the front door.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见有人在敲前门。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the door into a building that most people use
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The main door to the hotel is on Queen Street.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店的正门在皇后街上。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 厨房/卧室/盥洗室等的门

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: for the person in a car who sits beside the driver
a door at the back of a vehicle
that you move up or down to open a door
that you turn to open a door

Sense.DEF: to hit someone with a car door when they are riding past on a bicycle
Sense.TRAN: 开车门撞到〔骑自行车经过的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I nearly got doored as I went past the flats in Camden Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在经过坎登大街的公寓时差点被车门撞到。

Sense.DEF: a button outside a house that makes a sound when you push it so that people inside know you are there
very determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: a do-or-die attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 破釜沉舟的态度

Sense.DEF:
a
doorpost
someone who guards the main door of a large building and lets people in and out
a round handle that you turn to open a door
a heavy metal ring or bar on a door that you use to knock with
a man who usually wears a uniform and works in a hotel, club etc letting people into the building, helping people find taxis etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒店﹑俱乐部等的〕门厅侍者﹐门卫﹐门童

Sense.DEF: a piece of material inside or outside a door for you to clean your shoes on
someone who lets other people treat them badly and never complains
Sense.TRAN: 逆来顺受的人﹐出气筒﹐受气包
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him treat you like a doormat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他把你当出气筒来欺负。

Sense.DEF: completely dead
one of two upright posts on either side of a doorway
a prize given to someone who has the winning number on their ticket for a show, dance etc
a step just outside a door to a house or building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stood on the doorstep , straightening his tie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在门阶上整理领带。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the front doorstep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正门门阶

Subsense.DEF: very near someone’s home
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Wow! You’ve got the beach right on your doorstep !
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇！海滩就在你家门口！

Subsense.DEF: at someone’s home
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I got a shock when he just turned up on the doorstep .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他忽然出现在家门口﹐让我大吃一惊。

Sense.DEF: a very thick piece of bread

if politicians or
journalist s
doorstep people, they visit people at their homes in order to get votes or information – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔政客为拉选票〕上门拜访﹔〔新闻记者为找新闻〕登门采访〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists had doorstepped the couple and their neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者走访了这对夫妇及他们的邻居。

Sense.DEF: something you put under or against a door to keep it open
a rubber object fastened to a wall to stop a door hitting it when it opens
visiting each house in a street or area, usually to sell something, collect money, or ask for votes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a door-to-door salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挨家挨户上门的推销员

Sense.DEF: the space where a door opens into a room or building

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was Paolo, standing in the doorway .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗就在那里﹐站在门口。

Sense.DEF: something that is extremely good, bad, strange, big etc
Sense.TRAN: 极好[极坏﹐极奇怪﹐极大等]的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard lies before, but that one was a real doozy !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谎话我以前也听到过﹐不过这个谎可是太离谱了！

Sense.DEF:
a drug that is not legal, especially
marijuana
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff used to smoke dope all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫以前经常抽大麻。

Sense.DEF: a stupid person
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a dope!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是个傻瓜！

Sense.DEF: a test given to people or animals taking part in a sport, to see if they have taken or have been given a drug to improve their performance
Sense.TRAN: 药物检测〔对参赛运动员或动物所做的检测﹐以确定其是否服用过违禁药物〕
