Sense.DEF: new information about someone or something, especially information that not many people know
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the dope on the new guy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么关于这个新来的家伙的内部消息？

Sense.DEF: to give a person or an animal a drug, often in their food or drink, to make them unconscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl had been doped and kidnapped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女孩被麻醉后遭到绑架。

Sense.DEF: to give an animal a drug that makes it perform better in a race
Sense.TRAN: 给〔动物〕服用违禁药物〔以提高比赛成绩〕

Sense.DEF: to be unable to think or behave normally, because of the effects of drugs or alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 〔因药物或酒的影响〕感到昏昏沉沉﹐觉得迷迷糊糊

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was doped up on drink and drugs most of the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大部分时候都因为酗酒和吸毒而昏昏沉沉的。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dope album
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张很棒的歌曲专辑

Sense.DEF: someone who takes a lot of illegal drugs
thinking or reacting slowly, as if you have taken a drug
Sense.TRAN: 昏昏沉沉的﹐迷迷糊糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s still a little dopey from the anaesthetic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于麻醉药的作用﹐她还有点昏昏沉沉的。

Sense.DEF: slightly stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dopey grin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咧开嘴的傻笑

Sense.DEF: the practice of using drugs to improve performance in a sport
Sense.TRAN: 使用违禁药物〔以提高体育比赛的成绩〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: doping offences
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服用药物的违规行为

Sense.DEF: someone who looks exactly like someone else
an imaginary spirit that looks exactly like a living person

a British spelling of
dopey
in the oldest and simplest of the Greek building styles
Sense.TRAN: 陶立克式的〔古希腊建筑中最古老﹑最简朴的式样〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Doric column
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陶立克式立柱

Sense.DEF: someone who you think is or looks stupid

a
dormitory
not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The seeds remain dormant until the spring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天到来之前这些种子呈休眠状态。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge dormant volcano
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座巨大的休眠火山

Sense.DEF: a window built into a roof, so that it sticks out from the roof
Sense.TRAN: 〔建在斜屋顶上的〕竖天窗﹐老虎窗﹐屋顶窗

Sense.DEF:
a large room for several people to sleep in, for example in a
boarding school
or
hostel
Sense.TRAN: 〔寄宿学校﹑招待所等供多人住宿的〕寝室

Sense.DEF: a large building at a college or university where students live
a town that is near a city with more work opportunities, so that many people who live there travel to work in the city every day
Sense.TRAN: 〔每天去市区上班的人居住的〕郊外住宅区

Sense.DEF: a small European mouse with a long furry tail
Sense.TRAN: 榛睡鼠〔 产于欧洲﹐长有毛茸茸的长尾巴〕

Sense.DEF: on or relating to the back of an animal or fish
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shark’s dorsal fin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲨鱼的背鳍

Sense.DEF: a rowing boat that has a flat bottom and is used for fishing
a flat sea fish that can be eaten, or the flesh of this fish
software that is loaded onto a computer system to make all the different parts work together
the amount of a medicine or drug that you should take at one time, especially regularly

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大/小剂量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was recommended a high dosage of morphine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被建议使用大剂量的吗啡。
增加/减少剂量

Sense.EXAMPLE: The daily dosage is steadily reduced over several weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几周之内逐渐减少每日剂量。

Sense.DEF: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take
Sense.TRAN: 〔药物的〕一剂﹐一服﹔一次服用量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never exceed the recommended dose of painkillers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服用止痛药不可超过建议的剂量。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Start with a low dose and increase it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从小剂量开始﹐然后再增加。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that you do or experience at one time, especially something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 一次﹐一番﹐一回〔尤指不愉快的经历〕

GramExa.GLOSS: making you feel very ill or only slightly ill
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave had a bad dose of flu.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫得了严重的流感。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lethal dose of radiation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 致命的放射剂量

Sense.EXAMPLE: I quite like Jamie in small doses in limited amounts but not a lot or often .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果偶尔在一起的话﹐我还是蛮喜欢杰米的。

Sense.DEF: very quickly and easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cleaners went through the house like a dose of salts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清洁工又快又轻松地把房子打扫了一遍。

Sense.DEF: to give someone medicine or a drug

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sumi dosed herself up with aspirin and went to bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 舒米服用了阿司匹林﹐然后就上床睡觉了。

Sense.DEF: money

an action in
country dancing
in which partners move around each other with their backs towards each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔乡村舞蹈中〕舞伴背靠背换位的舞步

Sense.DEF: to sleep somewhere that is not your usual place, or not a real bed
Sense.TRAN: 〔不在通常睡觉的地方或不在床上〕将就着睡﹐过夜
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dossed down on the couch downstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在楼下的长沙发上过夜的。

Sense.DEF: to spend your time in a lazy way, doing very little
Sense.EXAMPLE: We just dossed around all day Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六我们闲混了一整天。

Sense.DEF: work that does not need much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: This job’s a real doss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作真是轻松得很。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has nowhere to live, and sleeps in the street or in cheap
hostel s
Sense.TRAN: 居无定所的人﹐露宿街头者﹔住廉价客栈的人

Sense.DEF: someone who is very lazy
a place where people who have nowhere to live can stay cheaply
Sense.TRAN: 〔供居无定所者居住的〕廉价客栈

Sense.DEF: a set of papers containing detailed, usually secret information about a person or subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常含机密信息的〕档案﹐卷宗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A firm of detectives produced a dossier on his activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家侦探社出示了一份档案﹐里面记录了他的行为活动。

Sense.DEF: a small round mark or spot
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pattern of dots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圆点图案

Sense.DEF: exactly on time or at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be there on the dot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会准时到那里。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at three o’clock/seven thirty etc on the dot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Green arrived at six on the dot .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林先生正好在6点到达。

Sense.DEF: something that looks like a small spot because it is so far away
Sense.TRAN: 〔因相距很远〕看似一个小点的物体
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was just a dot on the horizon .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机当时只是地平线上的一个小点。

Sense.DEF:
a short sound or flash of light used when sending messages by
morse code
to mark something by putting a dot on it or above it
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某物上面或上方〕加点
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never dots her i’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来不在i上面加点。

Sense.DEF: if an area is dotted with things, there are a lot of them there but they are spread far apart

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lake was dotted with sailboats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖面上星星点点布满了帆船。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has over 20 stores dotted around the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司现有超过20家商店散布在全国各地。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Poppies dotted the field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田野里遍布着星星点点的罂粟花。

Sense.DEF: to put a very small amount of something on a surface, especially in several places

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dot the apples with butter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在苹果上点些黄油。

Sense.LEXUNIT: dot the i’s and cross the t’s
Sense.DEF: to pay careful attention to all the details when you are finishing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔即将完成某事情时〕检查所有细节﹐一丝不苟地完成

Sense.DEF: in your old age
Sense.TRAN: 在某人衰老之年﹐在某人年老糊涂时

Sense.DEF: relating to a person or company whose business is done using the Internet or involves the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dot-com company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网络公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: dot-com millionaires
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网络巨富

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Several of the leading dot-coms saw their share prices slide yesterday.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 几家主要的网络公司的股票价格昨天下跌了。

Sense.DEF: to love someone very much, and show this by your actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone doted on Sally, the only girl in the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都溺爱萨莉﹐她是家里唯一的女孩。

Sense.DEF: a form of ‘does’

a machine connected to a computer that prints letters, numbers etc using many small
dot s

a series of printed or drawn
dot s
that form a line
slightly crazy
Sense.TRAN: 疯疯癫癫的﹐行为古怪的

Sense.DEF: liking or loving someone or something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gemma’s dotty about horses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰玛非常喜欢马。

Sense.DEF: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double sink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双水槽
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double wardrobe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双门衣柜
Sense.EXAMPLE: the great double doors of the cathedral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大教堂宏伟的双开大门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可以在双黄线处停车。

Sense.DEF: combining or involving two things of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double murder case
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双重谋杀案
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the jokes were based on double meaning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多笑话都语带双关。

Sense.DEF: twice as big, twice as much, or twice as many as usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double whisky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双份威士忌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城被两倍厚的墙围了起来。

Sense.DEF: made for two people or things to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you need a double bed or two singles?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们要一张双人床还是两张单人床？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双人房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double garage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双位车库

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular letter or number is repeated
Sense.EXAMPLE: My name’s Robbins with a double ‘b’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姓罗宾斯﹐有两个b字母。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number is 869 double 2 86922 .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 号码是869两个2。

Sense.DEF:
a double flower has more than the usual number of
petal s
something that is twice as big, as much etc as usual or as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scotch and water, please – make it a double.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来苏格兰威士忌加水——要双份的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They offered me £10,000.’ ‘I’ll give you double.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们向我开价1万英镑。” “我给你加倍。”

Sense.DEF: a room for two people in a hotel
Sense.EXAMPLE: A double costs $95 a night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间双人房一晚的价格是95美元。

Sense.DEF: a game played between two pairs of players, especially in tennis
Sense.EXAMPLE: the men’s doubles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男子双打

Sense.DEF:
a hit in baseball which allows the
batter
to reach second
base
Sense.EXAMPLE: Walker led the inning with a double.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔克是那一局的第一个击球手﹐击出一个二垒安打。

Sense.DEF: someone who looks very like someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s her mother’s double.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和她母亲长得一模一样。

Sense.DEF: an actor who takes the place of a more famous actor in a film, especially because the acting involves doing something dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think they used a double in the shower scene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他们在淋浴镜头里用了替身。

Sense.DEF: very quickly and without any delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was told to get back to Washington on the double.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被告知要尽快赶回华盛顿。

Sense.DEF: a situation in a game when you must do something that could either win you twice as much money or make you lose it all
Sense.TRAN: 〔下注的一种方式〕要么赢双倍﹐要么全输光

Sense.DEF: to become twice as big or twice as much, or to make something twice as big or twice as much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Within two years the company had doubled in size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在两年时间内﹐这家公司的规模扩大了一倍。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The church has doubled its membership in the last five years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂的会众在过去的五年里增加了一倍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A promise was given to double the number of police on duty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有承诺要将执勤的警察人数加倍。

Sense.DEF: to fold something in half
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a sheet of paper and double it over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿一张纸﹐然后把它对折。

Sense.DEF:
to hit the ball far enough to get to second
base
in a game of baseball
to have a second use, job, or purpose as a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school doubled as a hospital during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争期间这所学校兼作医院。

Sense.DEF: to turn around and go back the way you have come
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver doubled back and headed for Howard Bay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机从原路折回﹐向霍华德湾方向驶去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We kept getting lost and having to double back on ourselves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不断迷路﹐得不断折回原路。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly bend over at the waist because you are laughing so much or are in pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emilio doubled over, grabbing his leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米利奥弓起身子﹐抱住自己的腿。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be doubled up/over with laughter/pain etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both the girls were doubled up with laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个女孩都笑得直不起身。

Sense.DEF: to share something, especially a bedroom

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to double up with Susie while your aunt is here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 姨妈来的时候你得和苏茜同住一间房。

Sense.DEF: to be bent over a long way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees were almost bent double in the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些树都快被风吹折了。

Sense.DEF: twice as big, twice as much, or twice as many

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll need double this amount for eight people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 八个人的话我们要加一倍的量。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The value of the house is double what it was.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子的价值比原来翻了一番。

Sense.DEF:
two actors, especially
comedian s
, who perform together
Sense.TRAN: 〔演员的〕双人组合﹐双人搭档〔尤指喜剧演员〕

Sense.DEF: someone who finds out an enemy country’s secrets for their own country but who also gives secrets to the enemy
a double-barrelled gun has two places where the bullets come out
a double-barrelled family name has two parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔姓氏〕由两部分组成的﹐复姓的

Sense.DEF: very strong or using a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 强有力的﹐使用大量武力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double-barreled attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猛烈的攻击

Sense.DEF:
a very large musical instrument shaped like a
violin
that the musician plays standing up
a bed made for two people to sleep in
a cinema, theatre, concert etc performance in which you can see two films, plays etc, one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧﹑音乐会等的〕连场﹐双场

Sense.DEF: a situation in which any choice you make will have bad results
a double-blind scientific test or study compares two groups in which neither the scientists nor the people being studied know which group is being tested and which group is not
Sense.TRAN: 〔科学试验或研究〕双盲的〔指研究人员和受试者均不知道哪一组为测试组﹐哪一组为对照组〕

Sense.DEF: an attempt to deceive someone by telling them the truth, hoping that they will think you are lying
Sense.TRAN: 实话实说以迷惑对方的手段

Sense.DEF: a pot for cooking food, consisting of one pan resting on top of another pan with hot water in it
to promise the same seat in a theatre, on a plane etc to more than one person by mistake
Sense.TRAN: 重复预订〔误将剧院﹑飞机等的同一座位预订给不同的人〕

Sense.DEF: a double-breasted jacket, coat etc has two sets of buttons
to check something again so that you are completely sure it is correct, safe etc
a fold of loose skin under someone’s chin that looks like a second chin
to press a button on a computer mouse twice in order to send an instruction to the computer
very thick cream
to cheat someone, especially after you have agreed to do something dishonest with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在答应与对方一起做坏事后〕叛卖﹐出卖

Sense.DEF:
an occasion when two
couple s
meet to go to a film, restaurant etc together
Sense.TRAN: 两对男女一起去的社交约会

Sense.DEF: someone who deceives other people
Sense.TRAN: 骗子﹐表里不一的人﹐两面派

Sense.DEF: a bus with two levels
a sandwich made with three pieces of bread and two layers of food
relating to the numbers 10 to 99
Sense.EXAMPLE: double-digit inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位数的通货膨胀率

Sense.DEF: the numbers from 10 to 99
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam’s team scored in the double digits in nine out of ten games.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆的球队十场比赛里有九场得分上双。

Sense.DEF: to get money from two places at once, usually in a way that is not legal or not fair
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常以非法或不正当的方式〕同时从两处领取报酬

Sense.DEF: speech or writing that you cannot understand
Sense.TRAN: 莫名其妙的话﹔无法理解的文章

Sense.DEF: a game in which one child jumps over two long ropes that are being swung around by other children
to do more than one job or be useful for more than one thing at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 做两份工作﹔有双重作用﹐可以两用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sofa does double duty as a guest bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张沙发还可以在有客人时当床用。

Sense.DEF: something that seems to be good, but that can have a bad effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being famous is often a double-edged sword.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出名常常是一把双刃剑。

Sense.DEF: having two different parts
Sense.TRAN: 有两部分的﹔有双重作用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double-edged attack on global warming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从两方面着手的应对全球气候变暖的方法

Sense.DEF: a double-edged remark has two possible meanings, one of which is not very nice
Sense.TRAN: 意义双关的﹐模棱两可的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounded like a double-edged comment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它听起来像意义双关的评论。

Sense.DEF: with two cutting edges
Sense.EXAMPLE: a double-edged knife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双刃刀

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase that may be understood in two different ways, one of which is often sexual

two mistakes, one after another, when you are
serving
in tennis, which make you lose a point
Sense.TRAN: 双误〔指网球连续两次发球失误﹐失一分〕

Sense.DEF: a cinema performance in which two films are shown one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 连场〔两部影片连续放映〕

Sense.DEF: a video with two films on it
relating to the numbers 10 to 99
Sense.EXAMPLE: Almost all leading shares had double-figure gains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎所有主要股票的股价都有两位数的涨幅。

Sense.DEF: the numbers from 10 to 99

GramExa.EXAMPLE: King’s was the only other score in double figures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 金是此外唯一得分上双的选手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The death toll is thought to have reached double figures.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡人数据认为已达到了两位数。

Sense.DEF: a British university degree in which a student reaches the highest standard in two subjects
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国大学中的〕双优学位〔两门学科均获得第一等成绩〕

Sense.DEF: glass on a window or door in two separate sheets with a space between them, used to keep noise out and heat in
two baseball games played one after the other
Sense.TRAN: 连续举行的两场棒球赛

Sense.DEF:
a shape consisting of two parallel
spiral s
that twist around the same centre, found especially in the structure of
DNA
Sense.TRAN: 双螺旋〔尤指脱氧核糖核酸结构中的双螺旋结构〕

Sense.DEF:
a feature of a life insurance
policy
that allows double the value of the contract to be paid in the case of death by accident
Sense.TRAN: 〔人寿保险中规定在意外死亡情况下给予的〕双倍赔偿

Sense.DEF: when someone is taken to court a second time for the same crime, in some unusual situations
Sense.TRAN: 〔在极个别情况下对同一罪行的〕双重追诉

Sense.DEF: able to move the joints in your fingers, arms etc backwards as well as forwards
Sense.TRAN: 〔手指﹑手臂等关节〕可前后弯曲的﹐可反弯的

Sense.DEF: if someone lives a double life, they deceive people by having two separate homes, families, or sets of activities, one of which they keep secret

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marje had no idea that her husband was leading a double life with another woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛杰不知道她丈夫另有女人﹐过着双重生活。

Sense.DEF: two negative words used in one sentence when only one is needed in correct English grammar, for example in the sentence ‘I don’t want nobody to help me!’
Sense.TRAN: 双重否定〔一个句子中带有两个否定词﹐而正确的英语语法只需要一个﹐如I don’t want nobody to help me!便是双重否定句〕

Sense.DEF: to leave a vehicle on a road beside another vehicle that is already parked there
Sense.TRAN: 并排停放（汽车）〔把车并排停放在另一辆已停在路边的车旁〕

Sense.DEF:
the action of making two runners in a game of baseball have to leave the field by throwing the ball quickly from one
base
to another before the runners reach either one
Sense.TRAN: 双杀〔棒球的防守方快速传球﹐使进攻方两名球员一起出局〕

Sense.DEF: as quickly as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Call an ambulance double quick!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快叫救护车！

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Lunch was produced in double-quick time .

Sense.DEF: something such as tape or paper that is double-sided has something on both surfaces
Sense.EXAMPLE: double-sided sticky tape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双面胶带

Sense.DEF: speech that is complicated and can have more than one meaning, sometimes used deliberately to deceive or confuse people
Sense.TRAN: 模棱两可的讲话﹐含糊的言辞

Sense.DEF: a rule, principle etc that is unfair because it treats one group of people more severely than another in the same situation
a man’s tight jacket, worn in Europe from about 1400 to the middle 1600s
Sense.TRAN: 〔约15到17世纪中期欧洲的一种〕男用紧身外衣

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something again because you are very surprised by what you saw or heard
speech that is complicated and can have more than one meaning, sometimes used deliberately to deceive or confuse people
Sense.TRAN: 模棱两可的讲话﹐含糊的言辞
Sense.EXAMPLE: legal double-talk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律上模棱两可的话

Sense.DEF: a dishonest belief in two opposing ideas at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 〔同时接受两种矛盾观念的不诚实的〕双重信念﹐双重观点

Sense.DEF: double pay given to someone when they work at a time when people do not normally work
very quick or as quickly as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get upstairs and clean your room – double-time!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上楼打扫你的房间——越快越好！

Sense.DEF: a medical condition in which you see two objects instead of one all the time, for example after an accident
two bad things that happen together or one after the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: the double whammy of higher prices and more taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 物价上涨与加税的双重打击

Sense.DEF: a gold coin used in the past in Spain and Spanish America
Sense.TRAN: 达布隆〔旧时西班牙以及西班牙属美洲国家使用的金币〕

Sense.DEF: much more than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be doubly careful when driving in fog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在雾中开车要加倍小心。

Sense.DEF: in two ways or for two reasons
Sense.TRAN: 在两个方面﹔由于双重原因造成
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are doubly mistaken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有两个方面的错误。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of being not sure whether something is true or right

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The incident raises doubts about the safety of nuclear power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事故让人对核动力的安全性产生了怀疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some government ministers had serious doubts as to whether the policy would work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些政府部长对此项政策是否能起作用有很大的疑问。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was still one little nagging doubt at the back of his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的心头仍有一丝挥之不去的疑虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: he was a major artist.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问他是个大艺术家。

Sense.DEF: used when you are saying that you think something is probably true
Sense.EXAMPLE: No doubt you’ll have your own ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐你会有自己的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a top student, no doubt about it it is certainly true .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个优秀的学生﹐这是毫无疑问的。

Sense.DEF: used when advising someone what to do if they are uncertain about something
Sense.TRAN: 如（你）无把握﹐如（你）有怀疑〔用于建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If in doubt, consult your doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有疑问﹐咨询医生。

Sense.DEF: if something is in doubt, it may not happen, continue, exist, or be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The future of the peace talks is in doubt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和谈前途未卜。

Sense.DEF: if something is beyond doubt, it is completely certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prosecution must prove beyond reasonable doubt that the accused is guilty of the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 控方必须确凿无疑地证明被告有罪。

GramExa.GLOSS: do something which makes it certain that a particular player or team will win a match
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使竞赛分出胜负/确定结果/给比赛定胜负
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ferdinand’s second goal put the game beyond doubt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 费迪南德的第二个进球决定了比赛的胜负。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize an opinion
Sense.TRAN: 确实﹐的确〔用于强调某个观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo is without doubt one of the finest swimmers in the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔毫无疑问是学校最优秀的游泳选手之一。

Sense.DEF: something that is open to doubt has not been proved to be definitely true or real
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authenticity of the relics is open to doubt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文物的真假有待考证。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: give sb/sth the benefit of the doubt

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Scientists still have some doubts about the theory.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家们对这一理论仍有疑问。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: have some doubts
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone else thinks it’s a good idea, but I have my doubts.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人都觉得这是个好主意,但我却有所怀疑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have no doubt that you are right.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我毫不怀疑你是正确的。

Collocate.COLLOC: be in no/any doubt about sth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 对某事没有丝毫怀疑/颇有怀疑
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government is in no doubt about the seriousness of the situation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府丝毫不怀疑局势的严重性。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people sure or almost sure about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The evidence left no doubt that he was the murderer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据毫无疑问地表明他是凶手。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people unsure about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Research has cast doubt on the safety of mobile phones.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究使人们对移动电话的安全性产生了怀疑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make people unsure about something
make people unsure about something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 使人们对某事物产生怀疑

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you have doubts

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have some serious doubts as to his honesty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很怀疑他的诚实。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that does not go away
used to talk about how sure people are about something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 没有/几乎没有/有一些怀疑
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is little doubt that he will play for England one day.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有疑问,他终有一天会代表英格兰参赛。

Collocate.COLLOC: without a shadow of a doubt
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: without any doubt
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I knew without a shadow of a doubt that I was going to win.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信自己会赢。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a slight doubt
no doubt

Sense.DEF: to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kim never doubted his story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金对于他讲的事情从不怀疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I doubt we’ll ever see him again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们再也见不到他了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can complain, but I doubt if it’ll make any difference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以投诉﹐但是我看未必有用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you think there’ll be any tickets left?’ ‘ I doubt it I don’t think so .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你认为还会有余票吗？” “我看是没有了。”

Sense.DEF: to not trust or have confidence in someone
Sense.TRAN: 不信任〔某人〕﹐对〔某人〕没有信心
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never doubted myself. I always knew I could play tennis at this level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都相信自己﹐一向都知道我网球能打出这个水平。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She loved him, and had never doubted him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱他﹐对他从来没有产生过怀疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no reason to doubt his word think that he is lying .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有理由不相信他的话。

Exponent.DEF: to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you think she really is eighteen?’ ‘I doubt it.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你觉得她真是18岁吗？” “我怀疑。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was so much noise that I doubt if anyone slept.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 声音那么吵,我怀疑有没有人睡得着。

Exponent.DEF: to doubt that something will happen, is true, or is a good idea
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Economists are doubtful that the situation will improve this year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济学家不能肯定今年形势会好转。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘You can eat the whole fish including the head.’ Janey looked dubious.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你可以把鱼连头整个都吃下去。” 珍妮看上去有些疑惑。

Exponent.DEF: to feel that a plan or idea may not be good because you think there may be some problems with it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Health care professionals had reservations about giving both vaccines together.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健专业人士对同时注射两种疫苗持保留意见。

Exponent.DEF: to feel worried about doing something, because it may have a bad result
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ralph had serious misgivings about changing his career at the age of 50.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫对于50岁改行有很大的顾虑。

Exponent.DEF: to be unsure exactly how you feel about something or someone because there are both good and bad things about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have very mixed feelings about moving house – it’s exciting but I’ll miss this area.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于搬家我心情很复杂——搬家是令人兴奋的,但我又会怀念这个地方。

Exponent.DEF: to start having doubts about whether a decision you have just made is the right one
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对先前的决定〕产生怀疑﹔改变想法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I liked the dress in the shop, but when I got it home I had second thoughts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在商店的时候我喜欢那条连衣裙,可是买回家后,我的想法变了。

Sense.DEF: probably not true or not likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prospects for a lasting peace remain doubtful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持久和平的前景难料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was doubtful whether the patient would survive the operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人能否挺过这次手术还无法确定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is doubtful that the missing airmen will ever be found.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失踪的空军士兵能否找到还很难说。

Sense.DEF: not sure that something is true or right
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Everything’s going to be all right, you’ll see.’ Jenny looked doubtful .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “一切都会顺顺当当的﹐你等着看好了。” 珍妮看起来不大相信的样子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m still doubtful whether I should accept this job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍在犹豫要不要接受这份工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At first we were doubtful about employing Charlie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初我们犹豫要不要聘用查利。

Sense.DEF: unlikely to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Already the whole scheme was looking increasingly doubtful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个计划成功的可能性看起来已经越来越小了。

Sense.DEF: probably not good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here the tap water is of doubtful quality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的自来水水质有问题。

Sense.DEF:
someone who does not always believe things until they have seen proof of them. This expression comes from the story of the
apostle
Thomas in the Bible. He doubted the truth of the
resurrection return to life
of Jesus Christ and demanded to feel Jesus’ wounds before he would believe it.
Sense.TRAN: 疑心重的人﹐有证据才相信的人〔源自《圣经》中使徒多马的故事。他不相信耶稣复活﹐要触摸到耶稣的伤口后才信〕

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something is almost certain to happen or be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doubtless there would be lots of rumours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无疑会谣言四起。

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of water and something such as
vinegar
, that a woman puts into her
vagina
to wash it, or the object that she uses to do this
Sense.TRAN: 冲洗液﹐灌洗液〔水与醋等的混合液﹐供妇女清洗下体之用〕﹔〔妇女用于清洗下体的〕冲洗器﹐灌洗器

Sense.DEF:
a mixture of flour and water ready to be baked into bread,
pastry
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔做面包﹑糕点等用的〕生面团﹐湿面团

Sense.DEF: money
a small round cake, often in the form of a ring
brave and determined
looking and feeling like dough
doughy skin is pale and soft and looks unhealthy
serious, never smiling, and unfriendly
a dour place is one that is plain and dull, and where people do not have any fun
to stop a fire from burning by pouring water on it
to cover something in water or other liquid

a kind of small white
pigeon bird
often used as a sign of peace
Sense.TRAN: 鸽子〔常用作和平的象征〕

Sense.DEF: someone in politics who prefers peace and discussion to war
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治上的〕鸽派人物〔指主张和平与对话﹑反对战争的人〕

Sense.DEF:
a past tense of
dive
a small house built for doves to live in
to fit together perfectly or to make two plans, ideas etc fit together perfectly
Sense.TRAN: 吻合﹔使〔两个计划﹑观点等〕吻合

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My vacation plans dovetail nicely with Joyce’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的度假计划与乔伊丝的计划正好吻合。

Sense.DEF: to join two pieces of wood by means of dovetail joints
Sense.TRAN: 用燕尾榫接合连接〔两块木头〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of
joint
fastening two pieces of wood together
preferring peace and discussion to war
a woman from a high social class who has land or a title from her dead husband
Sense.TRAN: 〔承袭亡夫土地或封号的〕孀居贵妇
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dowager Duchess of Devonshire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德文郡公爵的遗孀

Sense.DEF: a respected and impressive old lady
a dowdy woman is not attractive, because she wears dull and unfashionable clothes
dowdy things are dull, unattractive, and unfashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dowdy dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 款式陈旧的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: a wooden pin for holding two pieces of wood, metal, or stone together
wood in the shape of a round rod, cut up to make dowels
a daily list of prices of shares on the American Stock Exchange, based on the daily average prices of 30 industrial shares
Sense.TRAN: 道琼斯（工业）平均指数〔美国证券交易所的股票价格指数〕

Sense.DEF: to or towards a lower place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: David bent down to tie his shoelace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维弯腰系鞋带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get down off the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从桌子上下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tears were streaming down my face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我泪流满面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夕阳西下﹐天很快就要黑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They came running down the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们跑下楼来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单﹐注意到了一个熟悉的名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair came down to her waist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ken fell asleep face down with his face towards the ground on the couch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。

Sense.DEF: in a lower place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard the sound of laughter down below.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到下面有笑声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bathroom is down those stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浴室在那段楼梯下面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Halfway down the page, there was the item I was looking for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这一页中间有我在找的内容。

Sense.DEF: into a sitting or lying position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please sit down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll go and lie down for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想去躺一会儿。

Sense.DEF: at or to a place that is further along something such as a road or path
Sense.EXAMPLE: A young man came hurrying down the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个年轻人急匆匆地沿着街道走来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked down the road to see if anyone was coming.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她顺着马路望去﹐看是否有人来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a pleasant little cafe bar a hundred yards down the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿这条路往前100码处有家很舒适的小咖啡馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus stop is a bit further down on the left-hand side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车站还要往前一点﹐在左边。

Sense.DEF: in or towards the south
Sense.EXAMPLE: They drove all the way down from Boston to Miami.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从波士顿开车南下一直到迈阿密。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sailed down the east coast of Africa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们驾船沿非洲东海岸南下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now he’s bought a villa down south.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在他在南部买下了一座别墅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a trip down Mexico way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往南向墨西哥的旅行

Sense.DEF: at or to a place that is not far away
Sense.TRAN: 在[向]附近（的）﹐在[向]不远处（的）
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just gone down to the shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚到附近的商店去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw her down at the station this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上我在附近的车站看见了她。

Sense.DEF: away from the place where a river starts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chunks of ice came floating down the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大块大块的冰顺河漂下。

Sense.DEF: used with verbs that mean ‘fasten’ to show that something is fastened firmly to the surface or object below it
Sense.TRAN: 固定在表面[下面的物体上]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The coffin lid had been nailed down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棺盖已被钉上。

Sense.DEF: at or towards a level or amount that is less
Sense.TRAN: 〔程度或数量〕处于低水平（的）﹐减少（的）﹐下降（的）
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your speed down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速度放慢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: House prices have come down in recent months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几个月房价降下来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the radio down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把收音机的音量调低。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sharif cut his report down to only three pages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙里夫把报告删减到只有三页。

Sense.DEF: losing to an opponent by a certain number of points

GramExa.PROPFORM: two goals down/three points down etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Swindon were six points down at one stage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯温登队一度落后六分。

Sense.DEF: used with verbs that mean ‘write’ to show that you write something on paper or in a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll write down the address for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我替你把地址写下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Start by jotting down a few ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始先记下几个想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s put you down as self-employed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就写你是自由职业者吧。

Sense.DEF: if you are down for something, your name is on a list of people who want to do something or are intended to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Purvis is down for the 200 metre freestyle event.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珀维斯上200米自由泳比赛名单了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve already put his name down for nursery school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经给他报名上幼儿园了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got you down to do the table decorations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我准备让你装饰桌子。

Sense.DEF: from an earlier time in history to a later time or to people who are born in later times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a person whose words and actions have inspired millions of people down the centuries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其言论和行为在以后几百年里激励了无数人的一个人
Sense.EXAMPLE: This knowledge was handed down in the family from father to son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一知识在家族里父子相传。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story has been passed down the generations for a thousand years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则故事一千年来代代相传。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: traditions that have come down to us from medieval times
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从中世纪流传到我们这一代的传统

Sense.DEF: paid to someone immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: A top quality freezer for only £20 down and £5 a week for a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台优质的冰柜只需20英镑首付款﹐余额每周付5英镑﹐一年内付清。

Sense.DEF: from top to bottom
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want you to wash my car down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把我的车彻底冲洗干净。

Sense.DEF: in or into your stomach as a result of swallowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meg’s been very ill and can’t keep her food down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格病得很重﹐咽不下东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gulped down the coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大口喝下咖啡。

Sense.DEF: unhappy or sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim’s been feeling down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆最近情绪很低落。

Sense.DEF: if a computer is down, it is not working
Sense.TRAN: 停止工作的﹐停机的﹐不运行的

Sense.DEF: if an action or decision is down to you, it is your responsibility
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s down to me to make sure that everyone is happy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让每个人愉快是我的责任。

Sense.DEF: to be the result of one person’s actions or one particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 是某人/某事的结果﹐归因于某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris’s success is all down to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯的成功完全是他自己努力的结果。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be down to your last pound/dollar/litre etc
Sense.DEF: to be left with only a small amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 只剩下最后一英镑/一美元/一升等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re down to our last five dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只剩下最后五美元了。

Sense.DEF: including everything or everyone, even the smallest thing or the least important person
Sense.TRAN: 下至〔最小的〕某物/〔等级低或职位低的〕某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone uses the cafeteria, from the managing director down to the office boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上至常务董事下至办公室的工友﹐大家都在食堂用餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plans were all complete down to the last detail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划连最后的细节都已经敲定了。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular illness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane’s gone down with flu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简得了流感。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you strongly oppose a government, leader etc and want them to lose their power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Down with the government!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打倒政府！

Sense.DEF: to have a severe attitude towards someone or something, especially when this is unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why is Mark so down on her at the moment?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克现在为什么对她态度这么恶劣？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone leaves or has left a university at the end of a period of study

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sarah came down from Oxford in 1966.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉是在1966年从牛津大学毕业的。

Sense.DEF: already done or completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, you’ve passed your second test, so it’s two down and four more to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐你已经通过了第二项测验﹐那么已有两项完成﹐还有四项。

Sense.DEF: in or to Australia or New Zealand
Sense.TRAN: 在[前往]澳大利亚[新西兰]

Sense.DEF: used to tell a jumping dog to get down
Sense.TRAN: 趴下！〔用于命令起跳的狗〕

Sense.DEF: to be friends with someone
to drink or eat something quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He downed the coffee in one gulp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一口就把咖啡喝了下去。

Sense.DEF: to knock or force someone to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: O’Malley downed his opponent in the first round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥马利第一回合就把对手击倒。

Sense.DEF:
to stop working, especially because you are taking part in a
strike protest about pay or conditions by stopping work
soft hair like a baby’s
the soft fine feathers of a bird
one of the four chances that an American football team has to move forward when it is their turn to have the ball
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球中的〕10码进攻〔进攻方必须累计推进10码的四次机会之一〕

Sense.DEF: low round hills covered with grass, as in the south of England
to dislike or have a bad opinion of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some reason, Malcolm had a down on the whole teaching profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于某种原因﹐马尔科姆看不起整个教书行业。

Sense.DEF: at or towards the bottom or end of something
Sense.TRAN: 在[接近]某事物的底部[一端]
Sense.EXAMPLE: downstairs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在楼下﹔往楼下
Sense.EXAMPLE: downriver nearer to where it goes into the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近河口的﹔下游的

Sense.DEF: used to show that something is being made smaller or less important
Sense.TRAN: 缩小〔规模〕﹔使降低〔重要性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: to downgrade a job make it less important
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低一项工作的重要性
Sense.EXAMPLE: to downsize a company reduce the number of jobs in it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缩小一家公司的规模

Sense.DEF: used to show that something is bad or negative
Sense.EXAMPLE: the downside of a situation the negative part of it
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况的不利一面
Sense.EXAMPLE: downmarket products low quality products
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低档产品

Sense.DEF: having no luck or money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a down-and-out actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穷困潦倒的演员

Sense.DEF: having no home and living on the street
someone who has no home and who lives on the street
unattractive and not well cared for, because of a lack of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town today is a shabby, down-at-heel place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今这个市镇成了破旧邋遢的地方。

Sense.DEF: not showing any strong feelings, especially not happy ones
Sense.TRAN: 冷漠的﹐无激情的﹔〔尤指〕忧郁的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Al was surprisingly downbeat about the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的是﹐阿尔对那次聚会一点也不热心。

Sense.DEF:
the first note in a
bar
of music

the movement a
conductor
makes to show when this note is to be played or sung
Sense.TRAN: 下拍〔乐队指挥表示要演奏或唱出某个音符时的手势〕

Sense.DEF: sad or upset because of something bad that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔因发生坏事而〕悲哀的﹐不安的

Sense.DEF: downcast eyes are looking down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Penelope sat silently, her eyes downcast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佩内洛普一言不发地坐着﹐目光低垂。

Sense.DEF: a drug that makes you feel very relaxed or sleepy
a person or situation that stops you feeling happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was a bit of a downer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这天气有点让人沮丧。

Sense.DEF: to be sad or experiencing a series of sad events
Sense.TRAN: 沮丧﹔经历一连串伤心事
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s up with Ruth? She’s been on a downer all week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝怎么啦？她整个星期都郁郁寡欢。

Sense.DEF: complete loss of your money, moral standards, social position etc, or the sudden failure of an organization
Sense.TRAN: 破产﹔堕落﹐衰败﹔〔组织的突然〕垮台
Sense.EXAMPLE: the scandal that led to the president’s downfall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 导致总统下台的丑闻

Sense.DEF: something that causes a complete failure or loss of someone’s money, moral standards, social position etc
Sense.TRAN: 造成破产[堕落﹐衰败﹐垮台等]的原因

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an addiction to gambling that proved to be her downfall
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后导致她堕落的赌瘾

Sense.DEF: to make a job less important, or to move someone to a less important job
Sense.TRAN: 降低〔某职位〕的重要性﹔降〔某人〕的职

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less important or valuable than it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police often downgrade the seriousness of violence against women in the home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方往往低估妇女所受家庭暴力的严重性。

Sense.DEF: to state that something is not as serious as it was
Sense.TRAN: 宣布〔某事〕不那么严重﹐使降级
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurricane Bob has been downgraded to a tropical storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飓风 “鲍勃” 已被降级为热带风暴。

Sense.DEF: feeling sad and disappointed, especially because you have tried to achieve something but have failed
Sense.TRAN: 情绪低落的﹐垂头丧气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When no replies came, I began to feel downhearted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点回应都没有﹐我开始感到灰心了。

Sense.DEF: towards the bottom of a hill or towards lower land
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was going downhill and my brakes failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正开车下山﹐刹车坏了。

Sense.DEF: if a situation goes downhill, it gets worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grandma fell and broke her leg, and she went downhill quite rapidly after that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶奶跌了一跤﹐摔断了腿﹐此后情况恶化得很快。

Sense.DEF: on a slope that goes down to a lower point
Sense.EXAMPLE: downhill skiing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速降滑雪
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a long walk back, but at least it’s all downhill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回程要走的路很长﹐所幸都是下坡路。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be all downhill (from here)/be downhill all the way (from here)
Sense.DEF: to be easy to do, because you have already done the hard part
Sense.TRAN: （从此）都是容易做的﹐一切都好办了
Sense.EXAMPLE: The worst is over – it’s all downhill from here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最坏的已经过去——现在开始一切都顺利了。

Sense.DEF: typical of the simple values and customs of people who live in the country, especially in the southern US
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指美国南部居民的价值观和传统〕淳朴的﹐乡村的
Sense.EXAMPLE: down-home family recipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村家常菜食谱

Sense.DEF: the government or Prime Minister of Great Britain
Sense.TRAN: 唐宁街﹔英国政府﹔英国首相
Sense.EXAMPLE: Downing Street declined to comment on the allegations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国政府拒绝就那些说法发表意见。

Sense.DEF: a small light, usually one of many, that is fitted into a ceiling and shines light down towards the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔装在天花板上向下照射的〕小聚光灯﹐筒灯

Sense.DEF: to move information or programs from a computer network to a small computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: games that can be downloaded free from the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以从因特网上免费下载的游戏

Sense.DEF:
a computer
file
or program that has been downloaded, or the process of downloading it
Sense.TRAN: 下载的文件﹐下载的计算机程序﹔下载（过程）
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got reviews and downloads of the latest business software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有最新商务软件的评论和下载的程序文件。

Sense.DEF:
if a computer program or
file
is downloadable, you are allowed to copy it from a computer network onto your own computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机程序或文件〕可下载的

Sense.DEF: downmarket goods or services are cheap and not of very good quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔商品﹑服务〕低档的﹐廉价的﹐质量不好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: downmarket tabloid newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低级小报
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company wanted to break away from its traditional, downmarket image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司想要摆脱其传统的﹑价廉质低的形象。

Sense.DEF: to start buying or selling cheaper goods or services
Sense.TRAN: 开始向低端市场发展﹔开始买[卖]廉价商品

Sense.DEF: to change a product or service so that it is cheaper and more popular – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 把某物降低档次〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of taking the radio station downmarket in order to compete with commercial stations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指责为了和商业电台竞争而降低电台的档次。

Sense.DEF: a payment you make when you buy something that is only part of the full price, with the rest to be paid later
Sense.TRAN: 〔分期付款购物的〕首付款﹐首期付款﹐头款﹐订金
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve almost got enough money to make a down payment on a house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们差不多有足够的钱支付买房的首付了。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less important than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 淡化…的重要性﹐对…轻描淡写
Sense.EXAMPLE: White House officials attempted to downplay the President’s role in the affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫官员试图为总统在这一事件中的责任开脱。

Sense.DEF: a lot of rain that falls in a short time
used to emphasize that something is completely bad or untrue
Sense.TRAN: 十足地﹐彻底地〔用来强调某事物极差﹑极不真实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jed’s downright lazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰德这个人懒透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s downright disgusting!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简直太恶心了！

Sense.DEF: in the direction that the water in a river is flowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bridge was another mile downriver.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桥在河下游方向距此一英里处。

Sense.DEF: downscale goods or services are cheap and not of very good quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔商品﹑服务〕低档的﹐廉价的﹐质量不好的

Sense.DEF: to sell or buy cheaper goods of lower quality
Sense.TRAN: 卖出[买进]（价廉质次的商品）

Sense.DEF:
to put the engine of a vehicle into a lower
gear
in order to go slower
if someone downshifts, they choose to do a less important or difficult job, so that they do not have to worry about their work and have more time to enjoy their life
Sense.TRAN: 放慢生活节奏〔改做不重要或轻松的工作以减轻压力﹑多享受生活〕

Sense.DEF: the negative part or disadvantage of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事物的〕不足之处﹐不利方面﹐缺点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Digital cell phones offer more security, but the downside is that they have less power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字手机安全性更好﹐但其劣势在于电力不足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The downside of the book is that it is written in a rather boring style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的缺点是写作风格太单调。

Sense.DEF: if a company or organization downsizes, it reduces the number of people it employs in order to reduce costs
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑机构为缩减开支而〕裁（员）﹐紧缩（编制）
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airline has downsized its workforce by 30%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家航空公司裁员30%。

Sense.DEF: a pipe that carries water away from the roof of a building
a condition that someone is born with, that stops them from developing in a normal way, both mentally and physically
towards or near the front of the stage in a theatre
towards or on a lower floor of a building, especially a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rosie ran downstairs to answer the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗茜跑下楼去开门。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles was downstairs in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯在楼下厨房里。

Sense.DEF: the rooms on the ground floor in a house
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have still got to paint the downstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还得把楼下粉刷一下。

Sense.DEF: in or from the southern part of a state
Sense.TRAN: 在某州南部的﹔来自某州南部的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A downstate judge was called in to hear the case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请了一位南部的法官来审理此案。

Sense.DEF: in the direction that the water in a river or stream is flowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a boat drifting downstream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺流漂下的小船

Sense.DEF: the time when a computer is not working
a period of time when you have finished what you were doing, and you can relax or do something that you had not originally planned to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔完成工作后的〕自由支配时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: Often, during semesters, you have down time when you can do some exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学期当中常常会有可供自由支配的时间来进行锻炼。

Sense.DEF: practical and direct in a sensible honest way
Sense.TRAN: 实际的﹐务实的﹐脚踏实地的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fran’s a friendly, down-to-earth person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰是个友善务实的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chef with a down-to-earth approach to cooking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个以脚踏实地的态度对待烹饪的厨师

Sense.DEF: to or in the centre or main business area of a town or city
Sense.TRAN: 向[在]城镇商业中心区﹐向[在]巿中心
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have to go downtown later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过一会儿我得到市中心去。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She works for a law firm in downtown Miami.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为迈阿密市中心的一家法律事务所工作。

Sense.DEF: downtrodden people are treated badly and without respect by people who have power over them
Sense.TRAN: 被践踏的﹐受压迫的﹐遭蹂躏的

Sense.DEF: a period or process in which business activity, production etc is reduced and conditions become worse
Sense.TRAN: 〔经济活动﹑生产等的〕下降﹐衰退
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s current economic downturn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国目前经济的衰退

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a downturn in the auto industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车工业的衰退

Sense.DEF: moving or pointing towards a lower position
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gentle downward slope
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缓坡

Sense.DEF: moving to a lower level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Share prices continued their downward trend .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股价继续呈下跌趋势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was caught in a downward spiral of drink and drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又是酗酒又是吸毒﹐在这个旋涡中越陷越深。

Sense.DEF: computer software that is downwardly compatible can be used on older computers as well as very new ones
someone who is downwardly mobile is becoming poorer
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕越来越穷的﹐趋向贫困的﹐走下坡路的

Sense.DEF: towards a lower level or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nina glanced downwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜向下瞥了一眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hold out your hands with your palms facing downwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把手伸出来﹐手掌朝下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The body was lying face downwards with the front of the body on the floor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体趴在地上。

Sense.DEF: used when a number or amount becomes smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: The death toll was later revised downwards to 689.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后来死亡人数经修正减少到689人。

Sense.DEF: used to mean that people of all levels in an organization, country etc are affected by something
Sense.TRAN: 从主席/总统/最高层等开始往下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone from the chairman downwards is taking a pay cut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从董事长开始往下都将减薪。

Sense.DEF: in the direction that the wind is moving
covered in or filled with soft fine hair or feathers
Sense.TRAN: 被绒毛覆盖的﹔充满绒毛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the baby’s downy head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿毛茸茸的脑袋

Sense.DEF: property and money that a woman gives to her husband when they marry in some societies
to look for water or minerals under the ground using a special stick that points to where they are
Sense.TRAN: 用探测杆探测〔水源或矿物〕

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
douse
someone who dowses for water or minerals
a special stick in the shape of a Y used by a dowser
the oldest, most respected, or most experienced member of a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔某团体中的〕最资深者﹐元老﹐泰斗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the doyen of sports commentators
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育评论员中的元老

Sense.DEF: the oldest, most respected, or most experienced woman in a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔某团体中的〕最资深女性﹐女性元老

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the doyenne of piano teachers in the city
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市最资深的钢琴女教师

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= dozen 一打

Sense.DEF: to sleep lightly for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grandad was dozing in his chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爷爷在椅子上打瞌睡。

Sense.DEF: to go to sleep, especially when you did not intend to
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must have dozed off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一定是睡着了。

Sense.DEF: twelve
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dozen eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一打鸡蛋

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of deaths has risen to more than two dozen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡人数已增至24人以上。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 好几十人/家公司/辆汽车等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dozens of people were killed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数十人被杀。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris, Helen, and half a dozen others went on holiday together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯﹑海伦和其他六个人一起去度假了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A dozen or so about 12 cars were parked near the entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 入口附近停了大约十二辆汽车。

Sense.DEF: a lot of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard this story a dozen times before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这故事我以前听过很多次了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s had dozens of boyfriends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她交过许多男朋友。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We collected dozens and dozens of shells on the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在海滩上捡了很多很多贝壳。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: six of one and half a dozen of the other

Sense.DEF: not feeling very awake
Sense.TRAN: 昏昏欲睡的﹐神志迷糊的

Sense.DEF: slow to understand things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those kids are really dozy sometimes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候那些孩子真是笨啊！

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= data processing 数据处理

Sense.DEF:
a university degree of a very high level, which involves doing advanced
research

a way of measuring how much ink is put on the page by a
printer
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算打印机在页面上用墨量的〕每英寸点数
the abbreviation of 缩写= the Director of Public Prosecutions 公共检控处长﹐刑事检控专员
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= doctor 医生﹔博士
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= drive 路﹐道〔用于路名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: 88 Park Dr
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园大道88号

Sense.DEF: not bright in colour, especially in a way that stops you from feeling cheerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The walls were painted a drab green.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙刷成了暗绿色。

Sense.DEF: boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: people forced to live grey, drab existences in ugly towns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被迫在丑陋的城市里过着平淡乏味生活的人

Sense.DEF:
the standard unit of money used in Greece before the
euro
Sense.TRAN: 德拉克马〔希腊使用欧元前通行的货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: very strict and cruel

GramExa.EXAMPLE: draconian measures to control population growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 控制人口增长的严厉措施

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing or a plan that is not yet in its finished form
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rough draft of his new novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新小说的草稿
Sense.EXAMPLE: I read the first draft and thought it was very good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我读了第一稿﹐觉得非常好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All parties eventually approved the final draft finished form of the peace treaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各方最后都同意了和平条约的终稿。

Subsense.DEF: a system in which people are ordered to join the army, navy etc, especially during a war
the group of people who are ordered to do this

Sense.DEF: a written order for money to be paid by a bank, especially from one bank to another
a system in which professional teams choose players from colleges to join their teams

the American spelling of
draught
to write a plan, letter, report etc that will need to be changed before it is in its finished form
Sense.TRAN: 起草﹐草拟〔计划﹑信件﹑报告等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eva’s busy drafting her speech for the conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃正忙着起草她的大会发言稿。

Sense.DEF: to order someone to join the army, navy etc, especially during a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指战时〕强制征召〔某人〕入伍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My dad was eighteen when he got drafted into the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸18岁被征召入伍。

Sense.DEF: to choose a college player to join a professional team
Sense.TRAN: 选拔〔大学的校队运动员〕进职业队
Sense.EXAMPLE: Craigwell was drafted by the Chicago Blackhawks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克雷格维尔入选芝加哥黑鹰队。

Sense.DEF: to ask or order someone to work in a place where they do not normally work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Extra staff were drafted in to deal with the Christmas rush.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增派了员工去应付圣诞营业高峰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of police have been drafted into the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几百名警察被抽调到该地区。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing that is not yet in its finished form
Sense.TRAN: 提议的草案/草稿/草拟中的版本等

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
draught
the committee that decides who will be drafted into the army, navy etc
a card sent to someone telling them they have been drafted into the army, navy etc
someone who illegally avoids joining the army, navy etc, even though they have been ordered to join
someone who has been drafted into the army, navy etc
a draftsman
someone who puts a suggested law or a new law into the correct words

the American spelling of
draughtsman

the American spelling of
draughty
to pull something along the ground, often because it is too heavy to carry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Inge managed to drag the table into the kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英奇费了很大劲把桌子拖进厨房里。

Sense.DEF: to pull someone somewhere where they do not want to go, in a way that is not gentle
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed her arm and dragged her into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓住她的手臂把她拖进房间。

Sense.LEXUNIT: drag yourself to/into/out of etc sth
Sense.DEF: to move somewhere with difficulty, especially because you are ill, tired, or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因患病﹑疲惫或不开心而〕费力地走到/进/出某处等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dragged myself out of bed and into the bathroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃力地下床走进浴室。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you drag yourself away from stop watching the TV for a minute?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能停一下不看电视吗？

Sense.DEF: if you drag someone somewhere, you persuade or force them to come with you when they do not want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom dragged us to a classical music concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈拉我们去听了一场古典音乐会。

Sense.DEF:
to move words, pictures etc on a computer screen by pulling them along with the
mouse
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can drag and drop text like this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以这样拖放文本。

Sense.DEF: if time or an event drags, it seems to go very slowly because nothing interesting is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friday afternoons always drag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五下午时间总是过得很缓慢。

Sense.DEF: if something is dragging along the ground, part of it is touching the ground as you move

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your coat’s dragging in the mud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的外套拖在泥里了。

Sense.DEF: to take too much time to do something because you do not want to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authorities are dragging their feet over banning cigarette advertising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局在禁止香烟广告一事上迟迟不采取行动。

Sense.DEF: to look for something in a lake, river etc by pulling a heavy net along the bottom
Sense.TRAN: 〔用沉重的拖网〕搜索湖底/河底等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police are dragging the lake for the missing girl’s body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在用拖网搜索湖底﹐寻找失踪女孩的尸体。

Sense.LEXUNIT: drag sb’s name through the mud
Sense.DEF: to tell people about the bad things that someone has done, so that they will have a bad opinion of them
to force someone to go to a court of law, especially in order to make them have a bad experience because you are angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔因憎恨某人﹑想出口恶气而〕把某人告上法庭

Sense.LEXUNIT: drag sb kicking and screaming into sth
Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something that they do not want to – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 逼某人做其不情愿做的某事〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party will have to be dragged kicking and screaming into the 21st century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个政党﹐不管是否愿意﹐都将不得不面对21世纪。

Sense.LEXUNIT: look as if you’ve been dragged through a hedge backwards
Sense.DEF: to look very untidy – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 看上去凌乱不堪﹐看上去极不整洁〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: if you drag your leg, foot etc, you cannot lift it off the ground as you walk because it is injured
Sense.TRAN: 拖着〔受伤的腿﹑脚等〕走动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bird dragging its broken wing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拖着断翅的鸟

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel unhappy and weak
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕感到不愉快[虚弱]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe’s been ill for weeks now – it’s really dragging him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔已经病了几个星期了﹐这使他很沮丧。

Sense.DEF: to make the price, level, or quality of something go down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Declining prices for aluminium have dragged down the company’s earnings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铝材价格下跌使这家公司的利润下降了。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something bad drags you down, they make you become worse or get into a worse situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔坏人或坏事〕把…拖下水﹐使…堕落
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let them drag you down to their level .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他们把你带坏﹐使你堕落到他们那种地步。

Sense.DEF: to make someone get involved in an argument, war, or other unpleasant situation that they do not want to be involved in
Sense.TRAN: 把…硬扯进〔争论﹑战争或其他不好的情况〕之中
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry to drag you into this mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐把你扯进这烂摊子。

Sense.DEF: to talk about something when you are having a discussion or argument, even though it is not connected with it
Sense.TRAN: 把〔不相干的人或事〕扯进谈话[争论]中
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t drag my past into this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把我的过去扯进来！

Sense.DEF: if an event or situation drags on, it continues for too long

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an expensive court battle that could drag on for years
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能拖延好几年的费用昂贵的官司

Sense.DEF: to make an event or situation last long-er than is necessary
Sense.TRAN: 使〔事件﹑情况〕不必要地拖延
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither of them wanted to drag the divorce out longer than they had to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都不想把这场离婚案不必要地拖延下去。

Sense.DEF: to make someone tell you something when they had not intended to tell you or were not supposed to tell you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police finally dragged a confession out of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方最终迫使他供认了罪行。

Sense.DEF: to mention an unpleasant or embarrassing story from the past, even though it upsets someone
Sense.TRAN: 提起〔令人不愉快的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do you have to drag that up again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干吗又要提起那件事？

Sense.DEF: if a child is dragged up, their parents do not teach them to behave properly – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔孩子〕被胡乱拉扯大〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those children have been dragged up, not brought up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些孩子是胡乱拉扯大的﹐没有好好培养！

Subsense.DEF: something or someone that is boring
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a drag! Come to the party.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别扫大家的兴了！来参加聚会吧。

Subsense.DEF: something that is annoying and continues for a long time
Subsense.TRAN: 令人讨厌且耗费时间的事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s a real drag having to travel so far to work every day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每天上班得跑这么远实在讨厌。

Sense.DEF: to make it hard for someone to make progress towards what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any slowdown in the economy is going to be a drag on the President’s re-election campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济增长稍有减缓﹐便会成为总统竞选连任的绊脚石。

Sense.DEF: the act of breathing in smoke from your cigarette
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank took a drag on his cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克吸了一口香烟。

Sense.DEF: wearing clothes worn by the opposite sex, especially to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为逗乐而〕穿着异性服装
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole performance is done in drag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整场演出都是男女反串。

Sense.DEF: the force of air that pushes against an aircraft or a vehicle that is moving forward
Sense.TRAN: 〔作用于行进中的飞行器或车辆的〕空气阻力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s rounded edges reduce drag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的圆形边缘降低了空气阻力。

Sense.DEF: the biggest or longest street that goes through a town
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our hotel is right on the main drag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的宾馆就位于主干道上。

Sense.DEF: a system in which the police look for criminals, using very thorough methods
a net that is pulled along the bottom of a river or lake, to bring up things that may be there
a large imaginary animal that has wings and a long tail and can breathe out fire
a woman who behaves in an angry, unfriendly way
a brightly-coloured insect with a long thin body and transparent wings which lives near water
a soldier in past times who rode a horse and carried a gun and sword
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时骑马﹑佩枪和剑的〕龙骑兵

Sense.DEF: to force someone to do something they do not want to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Monica was dragooned into being on the committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫妮卡被强拉进委员会。

Sense.DEF:
a
homosexual
man who dresses as a woman, especially to entertain people
Sense.TRAN: 变装皇后〔着女装的男同性恋者﹐尤为了逗乐〕

Sense.DEF: a car race over a very short distance
Sense.TRAN: 直线竞速赛﹐全速疾驰短距赛

Sense.DEF: a car used in drag races that is long, narrow, and low

Subsense.DEF: to make the water or liquid in something flow away
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The swimming pool is drained and cleaned every winter.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年冬天这座游泳池都要排干清洗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brad drained all the oil from the engine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德将引擎中的润滑油全部放掉。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you drain the spaghetti, please pour away the water from the pan ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把意大利面滤干好吗？

Subsense.DEF: if liquid drains away, it flows away

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I watched the bath water drain away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着浴缸里的水流光。

Subsense.DEF: if something drains, the liquid that is in it or on it flows away and it becomes dry
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Open ditches drain very efficiently.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明沟排水效果非常好。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She washed up and left the dishes to drain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她洗好碗碟﹐放着沥干。

GramExa.GLOSS: soil from which water flows away quickly or slowly
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 排水性能好/差的土壤
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This plant needs rich, well-drained soil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物需要排水性能优良的肥沃土壤。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very tired and without any energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working with children all day really drains you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整天和小孩打交道真是让人疲惫不堪。

Sense.DEF: to use too much of something, especially money, so that there is not enough left
Sense.EXAMPLE: Huge imports were draining the country’s currency reserves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的进口正在耗尽该国的货币储备。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the colour/blood drains from sb’s face/cheeks
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s face becomes very pale, because they are frightened or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔因恐惧或震惊〕某人变得脸色苍白
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the verdict was read out, all the colour drained from Zeida’s cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣读判决时势田面无人色。

Sense.DEF: written to drink all the liquid in a glass, cup etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah drained her mug in one gulp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜把大杯中的饮料一饮而尽。

Sense.DEF: if something drains away, it is reduced until there is none left
Sense.EXAMPLE: I watched the light drain away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看着光线渐渐消逝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sally felt her anger drain away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉感到自己的怒气慢慢消散了。

Sense.DEF: to make water or a liquid flow off something, leaving it dry
Sense.EXAMPLE: After cooking the meat, drain off the excess fat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉煮好以后把多余的油沥干。

Sense.DEF: a pipe that carries water or waste liquids away
Sense.TRAN: 下水管﹐下水道﹐排[废]水管
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flood was caused by a blocked drain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 溢水是由排水管堵塞引起的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a problem with the drains .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下水道有问题。

Sense.DEF: the frame of metal bars over a drain where water etc can flow into it

the hole in the bottom of a bath or
sink
that water flows out through
Sense.TRAN: 〔浴缸或洗涤槽底下的〕排水孔

Sense.DEF: something that continuously uses a lot of time, money etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war was an enormous drain on the country’s resources .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战争大量消耗了国家的资源。

Subsense.DEF: if time, effort, or money goes down the drain, it is wasted or produces no results
Subsense.TRAN: 〔时间﹑努力或金钱〕白白浪费掉
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well that’s it. 18 months’ work down the drain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得了﹐就这么回事了﹐18个月来的工作就白干了。

Subsense.DEF: if an organization, country etc goes down the drain, it becomes worse or fails
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s why this country’s going down the drain!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那就是这个国家败落的原因！

Sense.DEF: the process or system by which water or waste liquid flows away
Sense.EXAMPLE: A handful of pebbles in the bottom of a flowerpot will help drainage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在花盆底下放一把鹅卵石能够帮助排水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plan to improve the town’s drainage system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善城里排水系统的计划

Sense.DEF: an American word for draining board
very tired and without any energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, she felt totally drained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然感觉筋疲力尽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt depressed and completely drained of energy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到情绪沮丧﹐精疲力竭。

Sense.DEF:
a slightly sloping area next to a kitchen
sink
where you put wet dishes to dry
a pipe that carries rainwater away from the roof of a building
Sense.TRAN: 〔排除屋顶雨水的〕排水管﹐雨水管

Sense.DEF: a pipe that carries waste water away from buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔把废水排出建筑物的〕排水管﹐污水管

Sense.DEF: tight trousers with narrow legs
a male duck

a small alcoholic drink, especially
whisky
– used especially in Scotland
Sense.TRAN: 少量的酒〔尤指威士忌﹔尤为苏格兰英语〕

Sense.DEF: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the award-winning TV drama ‘Prime Suspect’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖电视剧《头号嫌疑犯》

Sense.EXAMPLE: a new drama series for Saturday nights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drama critic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧评论员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a courtroom drama one that takes place in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lavish costume drama one about events in a past century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪华古装剧
Sense.EXAMPLE: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

Sense.DEF: acting – used when talking about it as a subject to study or teach
Sense.EXAMPLE: young actors coming out of drama school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧学校出来的年轻演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: our drama teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的戏剧老师

Sense.DEF: an exciting event or set of events, or the quality of being exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie’s life is always full of drama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉的生活总是充满了戏剧性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: accidents, burst pipes, and other domestic dramas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外事故﹑水管爆裂及其他家庭生活中的戏剧性事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: a night of high drama very exciting events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个高潮迭起的晚上
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drama of the moment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一刻的戏剧性

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a drama out of sth
Sense.DEF: to become upset about a small problem and make it seem worse than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 对某事大惊小怪﹐对某事小题大做
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian always makes such a drama out of everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩对什么事都是大惊小怪的。

Sense.DEF:
a woman or
homosexual
man who tends to behave as if situations are worse than they really are – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 大惊小怪的人〔用于指女人或同性恋男人﹔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: great and sudden

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Computers have brought dramatic changes to the workplace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑给职场带来了巨大的变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Universities have suffered a dramatic drop in student numbers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学里学生的数量急剧减少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A serious accident can have a dramatic effect on your family’s finances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次严重的意外事故可能会突然给家庭经济情况带来巨大的影响。

Sense.DEF: exciting or impressive
Sense.TRAN: 激动人心的﹔给人深刻印象的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A superb goal by Owen earned United a dramatic victory yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天欧文的一个超级入球为联队赢得了激动人心的胜利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the most dramatic events in American history happened here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国历史上一些最震撼人心的事件发生在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dramatic scenery of the Grand Canyon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大峡谷的壮丽景致

Sense.DEF: connected with acting or plays
Sense.EXAMPLE: the amateur dramatic society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业余剧团
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dramatic arts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧艺术

Sense.DEF: intended to be impressive, so that people notice
Sense.TRAN: 引人注目的﹐给人深刻印象的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She needed a stunning dress to help her make a dramatic entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要一件能让她在登场时大出风头的惊艳礼服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tristan threw up his hands in a dramatic gesture .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里斯坦以戏剧性的姿势把双手向上一甩。

Sense.DEF: when the people watching a play know something that the characters do not, and can understand the real importance or meaning of what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 戏剧性讽刺〔一种戏剧效果﹐观众所知多于剧中人﹐因而能理解剧中情节真正的重要性或含义〕

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows too much emotion, and is annoying or does not seem sincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rex had no time for her dramatics, and left the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷克斯没工夫去理睬她的装腔作势﹐就离开房间走了。

Sense.DEF: the characters in a play
someone who writes plays, especially serious ones
to make a book or event into a play or film
Sense.TRAN: 把〔文学作品﹑事件〕改编为戏剧[电影]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a novel dramatized for television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被改编成电视剧的小说

Sense.DEF: to make a situation seem more exciting, terrible etc than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 使戏剧化﹐戏剧性地表现﹐夸张
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do you have to dramatize everything?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么事事都要夸张呢？

Sense.DEF: to make something more noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: This incident dramatized the difficulties involved in the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件使得项目中的种种困难更为引人注目了。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
drink
to put something somewhere so that it hangs or lies loosely
Sense.TRAN: 将〔某物松散地〕挂[披]在〔某处〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He took off his coat and draped it over a chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱下外套搭在椅子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mina lay back, her arms draped lazily over the cushions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米娜向后躺着﹐手臂懒懒地搁在靠垫上。

Sense.DEF: to cover or decorate something with a cloth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack emerged with a towel draped around him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克披着一条毛巾走了出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The soldiers’ coffins were draped with American flags.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵的灵柩上盖着美国国旗。

Sense.DEF: someone who sells cloth, curtains etc
cloth arranged in folds
Sense.EXAMPLE: a table covered with drapery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 覆有打褶罩布的桌子

Sense.DEF: long heavy curtains
cloth and other goods sold by a draper
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drapery business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家纺织品企业

Sense.DEF: long heavy curtains
extreme and sudden

GramExa.EXAMPLE: NATO threatened drastic action if its terms were not met.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果条件得不到满足﹐北约威胁将要采取严厉的行动。

Sense.EXAMPLE: drastic cuts in government spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府开支的急剧削减
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drastic changesare needed if environmental catastrophe is to be avoided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想避免环境灾难就需要重大的变革。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The size of the army was drastically cut.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队的规模被大幅度裁减。

Sense.DEF: used to show you are annoyed
cold air that moves through a room and that you can feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you close the window? I’m in a draught .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把窗户关上好吗？我正对着风口。

Sense.DEF: beer that is on draught is served from a large container rather than a bottle

Subsense.DEF: a game played by two people, each with 12 round pieces, on a board of 64 squares
one of the round pieces used in the game of draughts

Sense.DEF: a medicine that you drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sleeping draught
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安眠药水

Sense.DEF: the depth of water needed by a ship so that it will not touch the bottom of the sea, a river etc
the act of swallowing liquid, or the amount of liquid swallowed at one time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mick took a long draught of lager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米克喝了一大口拉格啤酒。

Sense.DEF: draught beer is served from a large container rather than a bottle
a draught animal is used for pulling heavy loads
a board with 64 squares on which the game of draughts is played
material that you put around the edge of windows and doors to stop cold air from coming into the house
someone whose job is to draw all the parts of a new building or machine that is being planned
someone who draws well
the skill of drawing or the ability to draw well
a draughty room or building has cold air blowing through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a draughty old house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 透风的老房子

Sense.DEF: to produce a picture of something using a pencil, pen etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katie had drawn a cottage with a little stream running next to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯蒂画了一间小茅舍﹐旁边流淌着一条小溪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She asked the little girl to draw a picture of the man she’d spoken to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她让小女孩把刚才和她说话的那个男人画出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keith was drawing a complicated-looking graph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思在画一张看上去很复杂的图表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been able to draw very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来就画不好图画。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you draw me a map of how to get there?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否给我画一幅怎么去那里的地图？

Sense.DEF: to make someone notice something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have been asked to draw your attention to the following points.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让我叫你注意以下几点。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A dark house can draw attention to the fact that the house is empty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑乎乎的房子会使人注意到这房子里面没人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to draw attention to himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想吸引别人的注意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The case drew international attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一案件引起了国际上的关注。

Sense.DEF: to decide that a particular fact or principle is true according to the information you have been given

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be unwise to draw firm conclusions from the results of a single survey.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 仅凭一次调查的结果就得出确切的结论是不明智的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say reach a conclusion or come to a conclusion .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 reach a conclusion 或 come to a conclusion。

Sense.DEF: to compare two people or things and show how they are similar or different
Sense.TRAN: 进行比较/找到相似点/加以区别等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The author draws a comparison between East and West Germany and the North-South divide in England.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 作者把东德﹑西德和英格兰的南北差异作了比较。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report draws a distinction between various forms of health care.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告把各种形式的保健制度作了对比。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say make a comparison or distinction (but NOT make a parallel ).
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 make a comparison 或 distinction（但不说 make a parallel）。

Sense.DEF: to get a particular kind of reaction from someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His remarks drew an angry response from Democrats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话引起了民主党的愤怒回应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The movie drew praise from critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片得到了评论家们的好评。

Sense.DEF: to attract someone or make them want to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What first drew you to teaching?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 是什么最先把你吸引去教书的？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Beth felt strangely drawn to this gentle stranger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝丝感觉到自己莫名其妙地被这个温文尔雅的陌生人吸引了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The festival is likely to draw huge crowds .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次节庆活动可能会吸引来大量群众。

Sense.DEF: to get something that you need or want from someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I drew a lot of comfort from her kind words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她善意的话让我得到了很大的安慰。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plants draw nourishment from the soil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物从土壤里获取养分。

Sense.DEF: to give information in reply to questions about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to be drawn on the subject.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝对这个话题作出回应。

Sense.DEF: to move in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: She drew away, but he pulled her close again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往后退﹐但他又把她拉近了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat drew alongside us and a man appeared on the deck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小船驶到我们旁边﹐甲板上出现了一个男人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I arrived just as the train was drawing into the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正好在火车进站时赶到。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use pull rather than draw .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般用 pull ,而不用 draw
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The train was pulling into the station.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车正在进站。

Sense.DEF: to become closer in time or space
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria grew anxious as the men drew closer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当那几个男人靠近时﹐玛丽亚变得焦虑起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christmas is drawing near.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节越来越近了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get nearer/closer .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 get nearer/closer
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Christmas is getting nearer .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节越来越近了。

Sense.DEF: to move into a position where you are equal to someone else in a race, game, or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Black drew level with the other runners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布莱克追上了其他赛跑选手。

Sense.DEF: to move someone or something in a particular direction by pulling them gently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bobby drew a chair up to the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 博比将一把椅子拉到桌边。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hussain drew me aside to whisper in my ear.
