GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 侯赛因把我拉到一旁在我耳边说悄悄话。

GramExa.GLOSS: close them by pulling them gently
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 拉上窗帘/放下百叶窗帘等

Sense.DEF: if an animal draws a vehicle, it pulls it along
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carriage drawn by six horses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六匹马拉的马车
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ox-drawn cart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛车

Sense.DEF: to take something out of a container, pocket etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ali reached into his pocket and drew out a piece of paper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里把手伸进口袋﹐拿出一张纸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maria drew her gun nervously and peered out into the gloom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚紧张地抽出手枪﹐盯着外面黑暗的地方。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use pull something out or take something out rather than draw something out .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 pull something out 或 take something out,而不说 draw something out
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Ali reached into his pocket and pulled out a piece of paper.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里把手伸进口袋,掏出一张纸。

Sense.DEF: to think or show that one thing is different from another
Sense.TRAN: 划清（与某事的）界线﹐（对某事物）加以区别
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adolescents often use drugs simply to try to draw a line between their own and their parents’ way of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 青少年吸毒常常只是为了试图与父母的生活方式划清界线。

Sense.DEF: to allow or accept something up to a particular point, but not beyond it
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝（做某事）﹐给（某事）定出界线
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind doing some gardening but I draw the line at digging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做些园艺活我不反对﹐但我不挖土。

Sense.LEXUNIT: where do you draw the line?
Sense.DEF: used to say it is impossible to decide at which point an acceptable limit has been reached
Sense.TRAN: 这标准该怎么定呢？谁又说得清呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some say 50 is too old to have a baby, but where do you draw the line?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人说50岁生孩子年纪太大了﹐但这又有什么标准呢？

Sense.DEF: to say that something is completely finished and you will not think about it again
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to draw a line under the relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想把这段关系彻底了断。

Sense.DEF: if something draws your eye, it makes you notice it
Sense.TRAN: （某事）引起某人注意﹐吸引某人的视线
Sense.EXAMPLE: My eye was drawn to a painting on the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上的一幅画引起了我的注意。

Sense.DEF: to take money from your bank account
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hughes had drawn $8,000 in cash from a bank in Toronto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休斯从多伦多的一家银行取了8,000美元现金。

Sense.DEF: to receive an amount of money regularly from a government or financial institution
Sense.TRAN: 从政府或金融机构〕定期领取〔一定数量的钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long have you been drawing unemployment benefit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你领取失业救济金有多久了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be drawing my pension before he’ll ever get around to asking me to marry him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等到他来向我求婚的时候我都在领取养老金了！

Sense.TRAN: to write a cheque for taking money out of a particular bank account 开〔从某银行账户取款的〕支票

Sense.DEF: to take air or smoke into your lungs
Sense.EXAMPLE: She drew a deep breath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她深深吸了一口气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth paused to draw breath , her voice barely hiding her excitement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝停下来吸吸气﹐她的嗓音掩饰不住激动的心情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lit his pipe and drew deeply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他点燃烟斗﹐大口吸了起来。

Sense.DEF: to find time to have a rest when you are busy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve hardly had a moment to draw breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我几乎连停下来喘口气的时间也没有。

Subsense.DEF:
to take a liquid from something such as a
barrel
or
tap
Subsense.TRAN: 〔从木桶或水龙头中〕取出﹐放出〔水等液体〕

Subsense.DEF:
to take water from a
well

Sense.DEF:
if a fire or
chimney
draws, it lets the air flow through to make the fire burn well
Sense.TRAN: 〔炉火或烟囱〕通风好﹐通气〔使火烧得旺〕

Sense.DEF: to choose by chance a ticket etc that will win a prize
Sense.EXAMPLE: The winning ticket will be drawn at the Christmas Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获奖的票将在圣诞派对上抽取。

Sense.DEF:
to decide who will do something by taking pieces of paper out of a container or choosing
straw s
of hidden lengths
Sense.TRAN: 抓阄﹐抽签〔以决定谁来做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drew lots to see who would go first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们抽签决定谁先去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has been unlucky because they were chosen to do something that no one else wanted to do
Sense.TRAN: 倒霉地被选派去做不愿做的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drew the short straw and had to drive everyone to the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很倒霉﹐要开车送所有的人去参加派对。

Sense.DEF: to finish without either side winning in a game such as football
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔足球等体育比赛〕打平﹐打成平局﹔以平局结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: They drew 3-3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以3比3打平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liverpool drew with Juventus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦队和尤文图斯队踢成平局。

Sense.DEF: to be chosen by chance to play or compete against someone
Sense.TRAN: 抓阄[抽签]决定与某人竞赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: England have been drawn against France in next month’s game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据抽签结果﹐下个月的比赛英格兰队将对阵法国队。

Sense.DEF: to be unsuccessful in finding information or the answer to a problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔在查找信息或问题的答案时〕不成功﹐无结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: All his investigations have drawn a blank so far.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他所有的调查迄今为止都没有结果。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle draws to a halt or stop, it slows down and stops
to end
Sense.EXAMPLE: Festival-goers began to drift off as the evening drew to an end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚会渐近尾声﹐前来参加节庆活动的人开始散去。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately keep something unpleasant or embarrassing from being known
Sense.TRAN: 避而不谈某事﹐故意隐瞒某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d rather draw a veil over what happened last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚发生的事我还是不谈为好。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone bleed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The dog bit her so hard that it drew blood.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗把她咬得那么狠﹐都流血了。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone angry or embarrass them in an argument, especially a public one
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Barker sought to draw blood by mentioning his rival’s weakness of character.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克提及他对手性格上的缺点﹐想要使他难堪。

Sense.DEF:
to bend a
bow
by pulling back the string in order to shoot an
arrow
if a ship draws a particular depth, it needs that depth of water to float in

Exponent.DEF: to make a picture, pattern etc using a pen or pencil
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children were asked to draw a picture of their families.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们被要求画一张自家人的画。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m going to art classes to learn how to draw.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要去上美术班学画画。

Exponent.DEF: to draw a picture of something or someone quickly and without a lot of detail
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Roy took a pencil and sketched the bird quickly, before it moved.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊拿出铅笔,趁鸟还没飞走,赶快画了一张速写。

Exponent.DEF: to draw the pictures in a book
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a beautiful book, illustrated by Arthur Rackham.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书很漂亮,插图由阿瑟·拉克姆绘制。

Exponent.DEF: to draw shapes or patterns without really thinking about what you are doing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was on the phone, doodling on his notepad as he spoke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在打电话,一边说一边在笔记本上涂写。

Exponent.DEF: to draw shapes or lines without making a definite picture or pattern. Small children do this before they have learned to draw or write
Exponent.TRAN: 乱画,乱涂〔小孩子学画或学写字之前就在乱涂〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At the age of two, she loved scribbling with crayons and coloured pencils.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两岁时,她喜欢拿着蜡笔和彩色铅笔乱涂乱画。

Exponent.DEF: to copy a picture by putting a piece of thin paper over it and drawing the lines that you can see through the paper
Exponent.EXAMPLE: First trace the map, and then copy it into your workbooks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 先把地图描摹下来,然后照着它画到练习册上。

Sense.DEF: to move backwards, especially because you are frightened or surprised
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因恐惧或诧异〕往后闪﹐后退
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, she drew back, startled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐她惊得往后一缩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She peeped into the box and drew back in horror.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝盒子里看了看﹐恐惧地往后退。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to do something, especially because you think it would be bad for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government drew back from their extreme standpoint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府放弃了其极端立场。

Sense.DEF: to obtain money that it has been agreed that you can borrow, or to use money that has been saved
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drew down the final $25 million of the loan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿到了这笔贷款最后的2,500万元。

Sense.DEF: if the days or nights draw in, it starts to get dark earlier in the evening because winter is coming
Sense.EXAMPLE: In October the nights start drawing in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 10月份天开始黑得早了。

Sense.DEF: to get someone involved in something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人卷入[参与]进来﹐吸引某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should use the demonstration as an opportunity to draw more supporters in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该以游行为契机吸引更多的支持者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite himself, he found himself being drawn in by the man’s warmth and ease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不由自主地被那人的热情与随和所吸引。

Sense.DEF: to spend less money because you have financial problems
to make someone become involved in something, especially when they do not want to be involved
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to draw her into conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想把她拉进谈话中来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found herself drawn into a disagreement between two of her neighbours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发觉自己被扯进了两位邻居的意见分歧之中。

Sense.DEF: to remove some liquid from a larger supply
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cold water is heated as it is drawn off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷水在排出的过程中被加热。

Sense.DEF: to use information, experience, knowledge etc for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某种目的〕利用某事物﹐动用〔信息﹑经验﹑知识等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work draws heavily on learning theories of the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品很大程度上得益于20世纪80年代的学习理论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has 20 years’ teaching experience to draw on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有20年的教育经验可用。

Sense.DEF: to use part of a supply of something such as money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I drew on my savings to pay for the repairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我动用了存款来支付修理费。

Sense.DEF: to breathe in smoke from a cigarette etc
if a period of time or an event draws on, it comes closer to its end
Sense.TRAN: 〔一段时间﹑某一事件〕临近结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter is drawing on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天快过去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the journey drew on, he started to feel tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅程将尽﹐他开始感到累了。

Sense.DEF: to take money from your bank account
to make someone feel less shy and more willing to talk
Sense.TRAN: 消除某人的羞怯﹐使某人愿意说话
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just needed someone to draw her out and take an interest in her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就需要有个人能让她说出心里的话﹐并且来关心她。

Sense.DEF: to mention a particular piece of information and explain it clearly and in detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are two major themes to be drawn out in this discussion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次讨论中有两大主题需要详细探讨。

Sense.DEF: to make an event last longer than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final question drew the meeting out for another hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一个问题使会议又延长了一个小时。

Sense.DEF: if the days or nights draw out, it stays light until later in the evening because summer is coming
Sense.TRAN: 〔因夏季来临而白昼〕变长﹔〔天黑〕渐晚

Sense.DEF: to prepare a written document, such as a list or contract
Sense.TRAN: 起草某文件﹐拟定〔名单﹑合同等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: of all the things you want to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你要做的所有事情列个清单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was asked to draw up proposals for reforming the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受委托起草议案修改法律。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The contract was drawn up last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份合同是去年拟定的。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle draws up, it arrives somewhere and stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: A taxi drew up at the gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆出租车在大门口停下了。

Sense.DEF: to move a chair closer to someone or something

Sense.LEXUNIT: draw yourself up (to your full height)
Sense.DEF: to stand up very straight because you are angry or determined about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生气或下决心而〕挺直身体站立
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drew himself up and said, ‘This has gone far enough.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直起身子说道: “这已经很过分了。”

Sense.DEF: to bring your legs closer to your body
Sense.TRAN: 曲起双膝〔让腿靠近身体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth sat, knees drawn up under her chin, and waited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝双膝抵在下巴上坐着等候。

Sense.DEF: the final result of a game or competition in which both teams or players have the same number of points
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match ended in a draw .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛以平局结束。

Sense.DEF:
an occasion when someone or something is chosen by chance, especially the winning ticket in a
lottery
, or the teams who will play against each other in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: England has been selected to play Germany in the draw for the first round of the World Cup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据抽签结果﹐世界杯首轮比赛英格兰队对阵德国队。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which people whose names or tickets are chosen by chance win money or prizes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congratulations! You have been entered into our £100,000 prize draw !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恭喜你！你已参与了我们的10万英镑抽奖活动！

Sense.DEF: a performer, place, event etc that a lot of people come to see
Sense.TRAN: 吸引许多人的表演者[地方﹐事件等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is hoped that the new art gallery will be a big draw for visitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望新建的美术馆能吸引大量的参观者。

Sense.DEF: when you breathe in smoke from a cigarette
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maltravers took a long draw on his cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔特拉弗斯长长地吸了一口烟。

Sense.DEF: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a great city – the only drawback is the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是座很不错的城市﹐唯一的不足就是天气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main drawback to these products is that they tend to be too salty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些产品的主要不足之处在于它们总是偏咸。

Sense.DEF: a bridge that can be pulled up to stop people from entering a castle, or to let ships pass

Subsense.DEF: to stop being involved in something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps we should just pull up the drawbridge and let them get on with it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们应该抽身退出﹐让他们接着干下去。

Subsense.DEF: to stop more people coming into a country, joining an organization etc
Subsense.TRAN: 关上大门〔指阻止更多人进入一个国家﹑加入一个组织等〕

Sense.DEF: part of a piece of furniture, such as a desk, that you pull out and push in and use to keep things in
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a file from her desk drawer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从书桌的抽屉里拿出了一个文件夹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scissors are in the kitchen drawer drawer in a piece of kitchen furniture .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剪刀在厨房的抽屉里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He opened the top drawer of his desk, and took out a brown envelope.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开书桌顶层抽屉﹐取出一个棕色信封。

GramExa.GLOSS: one for keeping socks, or knives, forks etc in

Sense.DEF: underwear that women and girls wear between their waist and the tops of their legs
a picture that you draw with a pencil, pen etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drawing of Canterbury Cathedral
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅坎特伯雷大教堂的素描画

Sense.DEF: the art or skill of making pictures, plans etc with a pen or pencil
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用钢笔﹑铅笔的〕绘画﹐素描﹐制图
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been very good at drawing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向来不擅长画图。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which people whose names or tickets are chosen by chance win money or prizes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church social will include a buffet dinner and a prize drawing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会联谊活动将包括自助餐和抽奖。

Sense.DEF: if you go back to the drawing board, you start again with a completely new plan or idea, after the one you tried before has failed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The current system just isn’t working – we need to go back to the drawing board and start afresh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前的方法行不通﹐我们得另起炉灶﹐从头再来。

Sense.DEF: if a plan or product is on the drawing board, it is in the process of being planned or prepared
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other car manufacturers have similar projects on the drawing board.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他的汽车生产商也在筹划类似的项目。

Sense.DEF:
a large flat board that artists and
designer s
work on
a short metal pin with a round flat head, used especially for putting notices on boards or walls
an event’s, performer’s, place’s etc ability to attract people to come and see them
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件﹑表演者﹑地方等的〕吸引力﹐诱惑力

Sense.DEF: a room, especially in a large house, where you can entertain guests or relax
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指大宅子中的〕客厅﹐起居室

Sense.DEF: to speak slowly, with vowel sounds that are longer than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can’t do that,’ he drawled languidly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不能那样做。” 他懒洋洋地拖着长音。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘What you got there?’ he asked in a slow Texan drawl.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是什么东西？” 他带着得克萨斯拖腔慢悠悠地问道。

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
draw
someone who looks drawn has a thin pale face, because they are ill, tired or worried
Sense.TRAN: 脸色苍白的﹐形容枯槁的﹐憔悴的

Sense.DEF: taking more time than usual or more time than you would like
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government wants to avoid a long drawn-out war against the rebel forces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府想避免与叛军打持久战。

Sense.DEF: a string through the top of a bag, piece of clothing etc that you can pull to make it tighter
Sense.EXAMPLE: trousers with a drawstring waist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 束带裤

Sense.DEF:
a flat
cart
with four wheels that was used in the past for carrying heavy loads, especially
barrel s
of beer
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时尤用于装运大桶啤酒等的〕四轮平板车

Sense.DEF: to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got an interview tomorrow and I’m dreading it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我要去面试﹐我正担心呢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m dreading going back to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我害怕回去工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tim dreaded his parents finding out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆担心他父母发现。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m dreading that I’ll be asked to make a speech.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我害怕被要求去演讲。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dreaded the prospect of being all alone in that house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他害怕今后要独自一人生活在那房子里。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I dread to think what will happen if they get elected I think it will be very bad .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢去想一旦他们当选将会怎样。

Sense.DEF: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the dread of losing those we love
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 担心失去我们的所爱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bernice looked with dread at the end of the passage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯尼斯惧怕地看着通道的尽头。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives in dread of is continuously very afraid of the disease returning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

Sense.DEF: making you feel afraid or anxious – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的﹐令人忧虑的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t put off the dreaded moment forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不可能把这一可怕的时刻永远推迟下去。

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 糟糕透顶的﹐极其讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had some dreadful weather lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近我们这里的天气糟透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michelle felt absolutely dreadful very ill .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔感觉病得很厉害。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how bad something or someone is
Sense.TRAN: 极糟的﹐可怕的〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dreadful mistake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的错误

Sense.DEF: extremely or very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re dreadfully busy at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此刻他们非常忙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you mind dreadfully if I didn’t come?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我不来的话你会很介意吗？

Sense.DEF: very badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team played dreadfully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个球队表现得太差劲了。

Sense.DEF: a way of arranging your hair, popular with Rastafarians, in which it hangs in thick pieces that look like rope
Sense.TRAN: 〔常见于牙买加拉斯塔法里教信徒的〕“骇人” 长发绺﹐拉斯塔法里发绺

Sense.DEF: a series of thoughts, images, and feelings that you experience when you are asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had lots of dreams last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我做了很多梦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dream about drowning
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 溺水的梦

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In my dream I flew to a forest of enormous trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在梦中飞到了一片生长着巨树的森林里。

Sense.DEF: a wish to do, be, or have something – used especially when this seems unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dream is to make a movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的梦想是要拍一部电影。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had dreams of university.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的梦想是上大学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I fulfilled a childhood dream when I became champion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我成为冠军﹐圆了我儿时的梦。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I have just met the man of my dreams the perfect man !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚刚遇到了我梦中的白马王子！

GramExa.GLOSS: better than anything you imagined or hoped for

Sense.DEF: something that seems perfect to someone
Sense.TRAN: 梦想中的房屋/家/工作等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve finally found my dream house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于找到了理想中的房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Win a dream holiday for two in San Francisco!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来赢取旧金山双人梦幻假期大奖啦！

Sense.DEF: having a state of mind in which you do not notice or pay attention to things around you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth went about her tasks in a dream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝神思恍惚地做着事情。

Sense.DEF: if something is a dream come true, it happens after you have wanted it to happen for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marriage to her is a dream come true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结婚对她来说是梦想成真了。

Sense.DEF: extremely well or effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan worked like a dream .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划进行得非常顺利。

Sense.DEF: to have ideas or hopes that are not correct or likely to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you think that all homeless people have it as easy as me, then you are living in a dream world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你认为所有无家可归的人都能像我那样轻松自在﹐那你就想得太美了。

Sense.DEF: be perfect or very desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her latest boyfriend is an absolute dream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新任男友非常理想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some performers are a dream to work with; others are not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些演员合作起来很愉快﹐但有些却不行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s every adolescent schoolboy’s dream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是每一个青春期男生的梦中女神。

Sense.DEF: used to say in a rude way that something is not likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 痴心妄想﹐在做梦〔表示某事不可能发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m going to ask her to go out with me.’ ‘In your dreams!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要约她出来。” “做你的梦吧！”

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had a dream about you last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我梦到了你。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: unpleasant or frightening
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The movie gave the kids bad dreams.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那部影片让小孩子做噩梦。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I have a strange dream in which I try to speak but I can’t.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我会做怪梦,梦见自己张嘴却不能说话。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very clear
that you have many times
seem unreal
Collocate.EXAMPLE: That summer was so wonderful it seemed like a dream.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个夏天非常美好,就像是在做梦。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: said to someone who is going to bed

Sense.DEF: to think about something that you would like to happen or have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dreamed of becoming a chef.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梦想成为一名大厨。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s got the sort of money that you and I can only dream about .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有的钱你我之辈只能在梦里想想了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dreamed that one day she would be famous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梦想有一天能成名。

Sense.DEF: to have a dream while you are asleep

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I dreamt about you last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚梦到你了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s quite common to dream that you’re falling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梦到自己坠落是常有的事。

Sense.DEF: to think about something else and not give your attention to what is happening around you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been dreaming and had not followed the conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直在走神﹐没注意听谈话。

Sense.DEF: to imagine that you have done, seen, or heard something that you have not
Sense.TRAN: 想象着做过[见过﹐听到过]（某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was sure I posted the letter but I must have dreamt it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾确信自己已经把信寄出去了﹐不过我肯定是做梦了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you did not think that something would happen
Sense.TRAN: 从没想过﹐做梦也没想过
Sense.EXAMPLE: We never dreamed that we would get through to the next round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从没想过会进入下一轮。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would never do something because you think it is bad or wrong
Sense.TRAN: 无论如何也不会做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t dream of letting strangers look after my own grandmother!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无论如何也不会让陌生人来照顾我自己的祖母！

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise about something that has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who would have dreamed that this would happen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁能想得到会发生这种事？

Sense.DEF: to waste time by thinking about what may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She would just sit in her room dreaming away the hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她常常会在自己房间里坐着遐想几个小时。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they are hoping for something that will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 别做梦了〔用于告诉某人希望的事情不可能发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You think I’m going to help you move house? Dream on!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以为我会帮你搬家？别做梦了！

Sense.DEF: to think of a plan or idea, especially an unusual one
Sense.TRAN: 想出〔不同寻常的计划﹑主意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was continually dreaming up new schemes to promote and enlarge the business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不断想出奇特的新计划来促进和扩大业务。

Sense.DEF: someone who has ideas or plans that are not practical
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was a dreamer – not pragmatic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个空想家﹐并不务实。

Sense.DEF: someone who dreams while they are asleep
thinking about something pleasant and not about what is happening around you
Sense.TRAN: 神情恍惚地﹐心不在焉地
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m coming,’ he replied dreamily, without moving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我就来。” 他心不在焉地回答着﹐动都没有动一下。

Sense.DEF: a happy place or situation that exists only in your imagination
sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids are both far away in dreamland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个小孩都早已进入了梦乡。

Sense.DEF: dreamless sleep is very deep and peaceful
Sense.TRAN: 〔睡眠〕无梦的﹐安宁的﹐很沉很香的

Sense.DEF: as if happening in a dream
Sense.TRAN: 如梦的﹐虚幻的﹐梦幻般的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film had a dreamlike quality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影有一种梦幻般的情调。

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
dream
a combination of people who you think will be sure to win an election for a political party
Sense.TRAN: 〔被认为一定会为某政党赢得选举的〕梦幻候选人组合

Sense.DEF: looking as though you are thinking about something pleasant rather than what is happening around you
Sense.TRAN: 神情恍惚的﹐心不在焉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dreamy smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心不在焉的一笑

Sense.DEF: someone who is dreamy has a good imagination but is not very practical
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was an artist, not particularly tidy, too dreamy to match her ways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个艺术家﹐不修边幅﹐太爱幻想﹐和她不般配。

Sense.DEF: pleasant, peaceful and relaxing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windows cast a dreamy light in the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔和的光线透过窗户照进了房间。

Sense.DEF: very attractive and desirable
Sense.TRAN: 极富吸引力的﹐理想的﹐极好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of dreamy chocolate recipes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本介绍美味巧克力配方的书

Sense.DEF: sadly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura stared drearily at herself in the mirror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉悲哀地看着镜子里的自己。

Sense.DEF: dully
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drearily predictable thriller
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部乏味﹑没有悬念的惊悚片

Sense.DEF: dull and making you feel sad or bored
Sense.EXAMPLE: the same dreary routine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一成不变的﹑乏味的日常事务
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dreary winter’s day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉闷的冬日

Sense.DEF: something that is of very bad quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Readers for publishing houses see a lot of good stuff and a lot of dreck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出版社的审稿人能阅读到许多好东西﹐但垃圾货也不少。

Sense.DEF:
to remove mud or sand from the bottom of a river,
harbour
etc, or to search for something by doing this
Sense.TRAN: 疏浚﹐清淤﹔〔在河床﹑港湾底泥中〕挖掘
Sense.EXAMPLE: They dredged for oysters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在挖牡蛎。

Sense.DEF: to cover food lightly with flour, sugar etc
to start talking again about something that happened a long time ago, especially something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 翻出﹐重提〔不愉快的陈年旧事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Newsweek magazine dredged up some remarks which he made last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《新闻周刊》杂志翻出一些他去年讲过的话来。

Sense.DEF: to manage to remember something, or to feel or express an emotion, with difficulty
Sense.TRAN: 〔困难地〕追忆起﹐回忆﹔感到﹐表达〔某种感情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robertson tried to dredge up an image of her in his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯逊努力回想她的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From somewhere she dredged up a brilliant smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她努力装出灿烂的一笑。

Sense.DEF: to pull something up from the bottom of a river, lake etc
a machine or ship used for digging or removing mud and sand from the bottom of a river, lake etc
a small amount of a drink, sometimes with bits in, left at the bottom of a cup, glass, or bottle
not polite an offensive expression used to describe the people that you consider are the least important or useful in society

a
top a toy that you spin
with a Hebrew letter on each of its four sides and a point at the bottom, used in a game played during Hanukkah
Sense.TRAN: 四面陀螺﹐献殿节陀螺〔四面刻有希伯来字母﹐用于献殿节时玩的一种游戏中〕

Sense.DEF: to make something or someone extremely wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the early morning they had got drenched in the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大清早他们在草丛里弄得浑身湿透。

Sense.DEF: covered with a lot of a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on in – you’re drenched!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快进来﹐你都湿透了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was drenched in sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浑身是汗。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: chips drenched in vinegar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浸在醋里的炸薯条

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He changed out of his rain-drenched clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把被雨水淋透的衣服换了下来。

Sense.DEF: something that is drenched with light has a lot of light shining on it
a piece of clothing worn by a woman or girl that covers the top of her body and part or all of her legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheila wore a long red dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉穿了一条红色的连衣长裙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a summer dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天穿的连衣裙

Sense.DEF: clothes for men or women of a particular type or for a particular occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种款式或在特别场合穿的〕服装﹐衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gentleman in evening dress clothes worn especially at important social events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿晚礼服的绅士
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play was performed in modern dress clothes from the present time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏里演员是现代装束。

GramExa.GLOSS: a standard of what you should wear for a particular situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This restaurant has a strict dress code – no tie, no service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅有严格的衣着要求——不系领带﹐恕不招待。

Sense.DEF: to put clothes on yourself or someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you wait a minute? I’m just getting dressed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稍等一会儿﹐我穿下衣服就好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dressed quickly and went out of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快穿好衣服﹐走到房子外面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I usually have to dress the kids in the mornings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上我通常得给孩子们穿衣服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dressed Louis in his best blue shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给路易斯穿上他最好的蓝色衬衣。

Sense.DEF: to wear a particular kind of clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dress warmly if you’re going out for a walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你出去散步要穿得暖和些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spend most of my time in the house with young children, so I dress casually.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大部分时间都在家里带小孩子﹐所以我穿得比较随意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do you normally dress for work?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上班一般都穿什么？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We usually dress for dinner wear formal clothes for our evening meal .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们用晚餐一般都穿得很正式。

Sense.DEF: to make or choose clothes for someone
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人〕制作服装﹔为〔某人〕挑选衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: Versace dressed some of the most famous people in Hollywood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 范思哲为好莱坞部分最知名人士制作衣服。

Sense.DEF: to clean, treat, and cover a wound
to clean and prepare meat or fish so that it is ready to cook or eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: dressed crab
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 填在蟹壳里的熟蟹肉

Sense.DEF:
to put oil,
vinegar
, salt etc onto a
salad
to put an attractive arrangement in a shop window
to stand in a straight line, or to make soldiers do this
to arrange someone’s hair into a special style
to prepare or put a special surface onto wood, stone, leather etc
Sense.TRAN: 加工﹐处理〔木头﹑石料﹑皮革等〕

Section.SECHEADING: TO PUT ON CLOTHES 穿上衣服

Exponent.DEF: to put on all your clothes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’d better get dressed! It’s almost time to leave for school!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好穿好衣服！差不多该去上学了！

Exponent.DEF: to put on all your clothes - used especially in literature. In everyday English, people usually say get dressed .
Exponent.TRAN: 穿衣〔尤用于文学作品,日常英语中一般说get dressed〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That day she dressed with extra care, choosing a brown velvet jacket that matched her skirt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天,她特别精心地打扮了一下,选了一件褐色丝绒外套配她的裙子。

Exponent.DEF: to put on a particular piece of clothing, jewellery etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Wait – I just have to put my shoes on!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 等等——我穿上鞋子就好！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was putting on her earrings in front of the mirror.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在镜子前戴耳环。

Exponent.DEF: to put on more formal clothes than you usually wear, or to put on special clothes for fun
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We always used to dress up to go to church.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们过去总是穿正装去做礼拜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Paul dressed up as a pirate for the party.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗装扮成海盗参加聚会。

Exponent.DEF: to put on your clothes – used when this is difficult for someone because they are very old, young, injured etc
Exponent.TRAN: 给自己穿衣〔在某人因年事已高﹑年纪尚小或有伤在身等而穿衣困难时使用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s hurt his arm so badly that he can’t dress himself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他胳膊伤得很重,自己无法穿衣服。

Section.SECHEADING: TO BE WEARING CLOTHES 穿着衣服

Exponent.DEF: to have a particular piece of clothing or a particular style of clothing on your body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All visitors must wear a protective helmet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有访客必须戴上安全帽。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She always wears black.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是穿着一身黑。

Exponent.DEF: to be wearing a particular piece of clothing, jewellery etc. Have sth on is more informal than wear .
Exponent.TRAN: 穿着某物﹔戴着某物〔不如wear正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had my new blue top on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我穿着蓝色的新上衣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had on a red tie and a grey jacket.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他系着红领带,穿着灰夹克。

Exponent.DEF: used especially in written descriptions when describing the clothes that someone is wearing
Exponent.TRAN: 穿着某物〔尤用于书面描写〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Alistair was dressed in his best suit and tie.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿利斯泰尔穿着他最好的西装,系着他最漂亮的领带。

Sense.DEF: to wear clothes that are more informal than the ones you would usually wear
Sense.EXAMPLE: In many offices, people dress down on Fridays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在许多办公室里﹐星期五大家就穿得随便了。

Sense.DEF: to speak angrily to someone about something they have done wrong
to wear special clothes for fun, or to put special clothes on someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He went to the party dressed up as a Chicago gangster.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他装扮成一个芝加哥匪徒去参加聚会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I keep a box of old clothes for the children to dress up in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保存着一箱旧衣服让孩子们装扮着玩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We dressed him up as a gorilla.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把他装扮成大猩猩。

Sense.DEF: to wear clothes that are more formal than the ones you would usually wear
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a small informal party – you don’t have to dress up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个非正式的小型聚会——你不用穿得那么正式。

Sense.DEF: to make something more interesting or attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the old offer dressed up as something new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这还是原来的建议﹐改头换面像新的罢了。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which a horse performs a complicated series of movements in answer to signals from its rider
Sense.TRAN: 〔马术〕盛装舞步赛﹐花样骑术赛

Sense.DEF: the lowest of the curved rows of seats upstairs in a theatre
a Friday when people who work for a company are allowed to wear informal clothes to work
to put your clothes on
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go and get dressed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去把衣服穿好！

Sense.DEF: having your clothes on or wearing a particular type of clothes
Sense.TRAN: 穿好衣服的﹔穿着〔某种〕服装的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aren’t you dressed yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还没有穿好衣服吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lay down fully dressed on the bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和衣躺在床上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a very well-dressed young man
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着很体面的小伙子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was dressed in a two-piece suit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一身两件套的套装。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children came dressed as animals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们穿成动物的样子来了。

Sense.DEF: wearing very attractive clothes so that everyone notices and admires you
Sense.TRAN: 穿得引人注目的﹐打扮得非常漂亮的

Sense.DEF: wearing your best or most formal clothes
Sense.TRAN: 穿着盛装的﹐衣饰华丽的

Sense.DEF: a large piece of furniture with open shelves for storing plates, dishes etc
a piece of furniture with drawers for storing clothes, sometimes with a mirror on top
someone who dresses in a fashionable etc way
Sense.TRAN: 穿着新潮者/时髦者/邋遢者等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stanley was an impeccable dresser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯坦利穿得十分得体。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes care of someone’s clothes, especially an actor’s in the theatre, and helps them to dress

a mixture of liquids, usually oil and
vinegar
, that you put on
salad
or raw vegetables
Sense.TRAN: 〔放在色拉或生蔬菜上面的〕调料﹐调味酱
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vinaigrette dressing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 醋油调味料

Sense.DEF: a special piece of material used to cover and protect a wound
Sense.TRAN: 〔包扎﹑保护伤口用的〕敷料﹐绷带
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse came to change his dressing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士来给他换敷料。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you talk angrily to someone because they have done something wrong

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tobacco companies got a severe dressing-down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各烟草公司受到了严厉的责骂。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing like a long loose coat that you wear inside the house, usually over night clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔室内穿的﹑通常套在睡衣外的〕晨衣

Sense.DEF: a room where an actor or performer can get ready before going on stage, appearing on television etc
a room or area in a store where you can try on clothes
a small room next to a bedroom in some houses where you can get dressed

a piece of furniture like a table with a mirror on top, sometimes with drawers, that you use when you are doing your hair, putting on
make-up
etc
a children’s game in which they put on special clothes and pretend that they are someone else
someone who makes their own clothes, or makes clothes for other people as a job
Sense.TRAN: 给自己做衣服的人﹔裁缝

Sense.DEF:
the final practice of a play,
opera
etc, using all the clothes, objects etc that will be used for the actual performance
the ability to choose clothes that make you look attractive

a formal shirt, sometimes with a special decoration at the front, that a man wears under a
dinner jacket
a uniform that officers in the army, navy etc wear for formal occasions or ceremonies
dressy clothes are suitable for formal occasions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her outfit was smart but not too dressy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的衣服漂亮但又不过于正式。

Sense.DEF: someone who is dressy likes to wear very fashionable or formal clothes

the past tense of
draw
to let liquid come out of your mouth onto your face
Sense.TRAN: 流口水﹐垂涎﹔使〔液体〕从口中淌出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Watch out, the baby is dribbling on your shirt!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心﹐宝宝的口水淌到你的衬衫上了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was dribbling tea onto his tie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 茶水从他口里流出来﹐滴到他的领带上。

Sense.DEF: if a liquid dribbles somewhere, it flows in a thin irregular stream
Sense.EXAMPLE: Blood from the wound dribbled down the side of his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤口的血顺着他脸颊流下来。

Sense.DEF:
to move the ball along with you by short kicks,
bounce s
, or hits in a game of football,
basketball
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑篮球等运动中〕运（球）﹐带（球）
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was trying to dribble the ball past his opponents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想带球晃过对方球员。

Sense.DEF: if something such as money or news dribbles somewhere, it comes or goes in small irregular amounts
Sense.TRAN: 〔钱〕零星地流散[耗掉]﹔〔消息〕慢慢流传
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money is finally dribbling back into the country now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在资金最终又一点一点地流回国内了。

Sense.DEF: to pour something out slowly in an irregular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dribble a few drops of olive oil over the pizza.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在比萨饼上滴几滴橄榄油。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of liquid that has come out of your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wiped the dribble from his chin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拭去下巴上的口水。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a dribble of brandy in the bottom of the bottle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓶底有少量的白兰地。

Sense.DEF:
the act of moving the ball along with you by short kicks,
bounce s
or hits in a game of football,
basketball
etc
in small irregular amounts or numbers over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guests arrived in dribs and drabs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客人们三三两两地到来。

Sense.DEF: dried substances, such as food or flowers, have had the water removed
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物﹑花等〕干的﹐除去水分的﹐脱水的
Sense.EXAMPLE: dried herbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干药草

Sense.DEF:
fruit, usually
grape s
, that has been dried and is often used in cooking
milk that is made into a powder and can be used by adding water

another spelling of
dryer
to move slowly on water or in the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rubber raft drifted out to sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡皮筏子漂向大海。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoke drifted up from the jungle ahead of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们前方的丛林里有烟升起。

Sense.DEF: to move, change, or do something without any plan or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 随意移动﹐漂泊﹔摇摆不定﹔漫无目的地行动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenni spent the year drifting around Europe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮这一年来一直在欧洲各地漂泊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just drifted into teaching, really.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是碰巧入了教书这一行﹐不骗你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The others drifted away. Melanie stayed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人都散去了﹐唯有梅拉妮留了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conversation drifted from one topic to another.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 话题从一个跳到另一个。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Idly she let her eyes drift over his desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的目光百无聊赖地在他的书桌上游移。

Sense.DEF: to gradually change from being in one condition, situation etc into another without realizing it
Sense.TRAN: 不知不觉地转变﹐无意间变成〔另一种状况〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was just drifting into sleep when the alarm went off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迷迷糊糊刚睡着﹐突然响起了警报。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He drifted in and out of consciousness .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的神志时而清醒﹐时而迷糊。

Sense.TRAN: 〔价值﹑价格﹑股价等〕浮动﹐慢慢变化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar drifted lower against the yen today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天﹐美元对日元的汇率下滑了。

Sense.DEF: if snow, sand etc drifts, the wind blows it into large piles
to allow something, especially something bad, to continue in the same way
Sense.TRAN: 听任某事发展下去﹐对某事听之任之〔尤指坏事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t let the matter drift for much longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不能长期放任这件事情不管。

Sense.DEF: if people drift apart, their relationship gradually ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the years my college friends and I have drifted apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 久而久之﹐我和大学时期的朋友们逐渐疏远了。

Sense.DEF: to gradually fall asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was just drifting off when the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迷迷糊糊地刚要入睡﹐电话铃响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt himself drifting off to sleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉自己迷迷糊糊地睡着了。

Sense.DEF: a large pile of snow or sand that has been blown by the wind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The road is blocked with massive drifts of snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大堆大堆的积雪把路堵死了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a snow drift
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪堆

Sense.DEF: a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drift towards longer working hours
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作时间不知不觉的变长

Sense.DEF: a slow movement of large numbers of people that has not been planned
Sense.TRAN: 〔大量人口缓慢﹑无计划的〕流动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the drift from the countryside to the cities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量人口从乡村往城市的流动

Sense.DEF: the general meaning of what someone is saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: So what’s the drift of the argument?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么这一论点的大意是什么？

GramExa.GLOSS: understand the general meaning of what someone is saying
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She didn’t quite get my drift, did she?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有弄懂我的意思﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: the movement of a ship or plane from its original direction because of the movement of the wind or water
very slow movement, especially over water or through the air
someone who is always moving from one job or place to another with no real purpose
a fishing boat that uses a floating net
a large fishing net that floats behind a boat
wood floating in the sea or left on the shore
Sense.TRAN: 漂流木﹐浮木〔指在海上漂流或被海水冲上岸的木头〕

Sense.DEF: a tool or machine used for making holes in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an electric drill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电钻
Sense.EXAMPLE: a whine like a dentist’s drill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像牙钻发出的那种呜呜声

Sense.DEF: a method of teaching students, sports players etc something by making them repeat the same lesson, exercise etc many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pronunciation drill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发音练习

Sense.DEF: an occasion when people practise what they should do in a dangerous situation such as a fire
military training in which soldiers practise marching, using weapons etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: rifle drill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步枪操练

Sense.DEF: the usual way that something is done
Sense.TRAN: 惯常的步骤﹐一般的程序
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You know the drill?’ ‘Not really. Tell me again what to do.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知道惯常步骤吧？” “还不大明白﹐再跟我讲一遍怎么做。”

Sense.DEF: a type of strong cotton cloth

Subsense.DEF: a machine for planting seeds in rows
a row of seeds planted by a machine

Sense.DEF: to make a hole in something using a drill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drill a hole in each corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在每个角上钻一个孔。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He accidentally drilled into a water pipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不小心把一根水管钻穿了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: BP has been licensed to drill for oil in the area.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国石油公司获准在该地区钻探石油。

Sense.DEF: to teach students, sports players etc by making them repeat the same lesson, exercise etc many times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was drilling the class in the forms of the past tense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在教学生反复练习过去时形式。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I acted instinctively because I had been trained and drilled to do just that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的行动是出于本能﹐因为我受过这方面的培训并反复练习过。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The team were well-drilled .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队训练有素。

Sense.DEF: to train soldiers to march or perform other military actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sergeant was drilling the new recruits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中士在操练新兵。

Sense.DEF: to plant seeds in rows using a machine
to get a more detailed level of information relating to something, when using a computer
Sense.TRAN: 向下钻取〔指利用计算机获得更详细的资料〕

Sense.DEF: to keep telling someone something until they know it very well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother had drilled it into me not to talk to strangers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈和我反复讲过不要和陌生人说话。

Sense.DEF: a large structure in the sea used for drilling for oil, gas etc

another spelling of
dryly
to take liquid into your mouth and swallow it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should drink plenty of water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该大量喝水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would you like to drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想喝点什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take a seat while I get you something to drink .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请坐﹐我去给你倒杯喝的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She filled the glass and drank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把杯子倒满后喝了起来。

Sense.DEF: to drink alcohol, especially regularly or too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been drinking heavily since his wife died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子死后﹐他一直酗酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喝酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t drink and drive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要酒后驾车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My flatmate Cherry drinks like a fish regularly drinks a lot of alcohol .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和我同住公寓套间的彻丽经常豪饮。

Sense.LEXUNIT: drink yourself silly/into a stupor/to death etc
Sense.DEF: to drink so much alcohol that you become very drunk or unconscious, or die
Sense.TRAN: 喝得晕头转向/酩酊大醉/死掉等
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he goes on this way he’ll drink himself to death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照他这样喝下去会送命的。

Sense.DEF: to drink more alcohol than someone but not feel as ill as them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could drink nearly anyone under the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他几乎可以把任何人喝趴下。

Sense.DEF:
used to offer to buy someone a drink, especially in a
pub
Sense.TRAN: 你想喝点什么？〔尤在酒馆里给人买酒时说的话〕

Sense.DEF: to wish someone good health before having an alcoholic drink

Exponent.DEF: to drink something very slowly
to drink something in a noisy way
to drink all of something very quickly
to drink all of an alcoholic drink very quickly
to drink something quickly with large mouthfuls, especially from a bottle
to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She swallowed the bitter medicine instead of spitting it out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把苦药咽了下去,没吐出来。

Sense.DEF: to look at, listen to, feel, or smell something in order to enjoy it
Sense.TRAN: 享受地看[听﹐感觉﹐嗅]﹐品味
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just sat there, drinking in the atmosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是坐在那里﹐细细地感受那种氛围。

Sense.DEF: to wish someone success, good luck, good health etc before having an alcoholic drink
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人的成功﹑好运﹑健康等〕祝酒[干杯]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s drink to your success in your new job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们为你在新的工作中取得成功而干杯。

Sense.DEF: used to agree with what someone has said
Sense.TRAN: 我同意！我赞成！〔用于表示赞同某人的话〕

Sense.DEF: to drink all of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drink up your milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把牛奶都喝了。

Sense.DEF: an amount of liquid that you drink, or the act of drinking something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have a drink of water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝点水吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a drink of his coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了一口咖啡。

Sense.DEF: liquid that you can drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your favourite drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最喜欢喝什么饮料？
Sense.EXAMPLE: food and drink companies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品饮料公司

Sense.DEF: an alcoholic drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d obviously had a few drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然喝了几杯酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去喝一杯吧。

Sense.DEF: the habit of drinking too much alcohol, in a way that is very bad for your health
Sense.EXAMPLE: The marriage ended because of her husband’s drink problem he drank too much alcohol .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为她丈夫有酗酒问题﹐这桩婚姻破裂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had driven him to drink made him start drinking too much alcohol regularly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们逼得他酗起酒来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After her retirement from the stage she took to drink started drinking too much alcohol .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她退出舞台生涯后就开始酗酒了。

Sense.DEF: a social occasion when you have alcoholic drinks and sometimes food

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget we’re invited to the Jones’ for drinks on Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别忘了我们受邀到琼斯家参加星期日的酒会。

Sense.DEF: the sea, a lake, or another large area of water

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1, 2 & 3

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: drink something, especially an alcoholic drink
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Let’s go and have a drink.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去喝一杯吧。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He took another long drink of water.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又喝了一大口水。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: go to a pub or bar
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we go for a drink after work?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么不下班后去喝一杯呢？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in a pub or a bar
make tea or coffee
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: （给某人）沏[泡，冲]一杯〔茶或咖啡〕

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: drink it in very small amounts
drink it very quickly
which does not contain alcohol
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Would you like some wine, or a soft drink?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要来点葡萄酒还是软饮料？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: containing alcohol
with bubbles of gas
making you feel less tired or hot
a drink with a lot of strong alcohol

Exponent.DEF: something that you drink
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like a drink?’ ‘Yes, I’ll have a lemonade.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “想喝杯饮料吗？” “好的,来杯柠檬水吧。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had a few drinks in a local bar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在当地的一家酒吧喝了几杯。

Exponent.DEF: a drink
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I get you something to drink?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你拿点什么喝的,好吗？

Exponent.DEF: a cold drink that does not contain alcohol, especially one that is sweet and has bubbles in it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Coca-Cola and other soft drinks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可口可乐以及其他软饮料

Exponent.DEF: a drink, usually of wine, that a group of people have on a special occasion, for example to celebrate something or wish someone luck in the future
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At midnight they all drank a toast to the New Year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 午夜,他们一起举杯庆祝新年。

Exponent.DEF: especially written a drink – often used on menus and signs
Exponent.TRAN: 饮料〔常用于菜单及招牌〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Beer is the most popular alcoholic beverage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 啤酒是最受人欢迎的酒精饮料。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the list of beverages
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒水单

Sense.DEF: water that is drinkable is safe to drink
wine, beer etc that is drinkable is of good quality and tastes pleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔葡萄酒﹑啤酒等〕质量好的﹐好喝的

Sense.DEF: driving a car after having drunk too much alcohol
someone who regularly drinks alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 经常喝酒的人﹔酗酒者﹐酒徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave has always been a bit of a drinker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫一直是个小酒鬼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a heavy drinker he drank a lot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个大酒鬼。

Sense.DEF: someone who regularly drinks coffee, wine etc
Sense.TRAN: 常喝咖啡/葡萄酒/香槟等的人

Sense.DEF: the activity of drinking alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: after a night of heavy drinking drinking a lot of alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂饮一夜之后

Sense.DEF:
sweet
cocoa
powder, which is made into a drink with hot milk or water
a piece of equipment in a public place that produces a stream of water for you to drink from

the time when people are allowed to finish their drinks in a
pub
, but cannot buy any more drinks
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒馆停止卖酒后给予顾客的〕喝完余酒时间

Sense.DEF: water that is pure enough for you to drink
a machine that serves hot and cold drinks when you put money into it
a party at which alcoholic drinks are served and where you mainly talk to people
to let liquid fall in drops
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tap’s dripping .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水龙头在滴水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her boots were muddy and her hair was dripping .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的靴子沾满了泥﹐头发在滴水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John came in, his arm dripping blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰进来了﹐他的手臂在滴血。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hand that held the gun was dripping with sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿枪的手汗水直往下滴。

Sense.DEF: to fall in drops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rain dripped down his neck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨水顺着他的脖子往下滴。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Water was dripping through the ceiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水正透过天花板滴下来。

Sense.DEF: to contain or be covered in a lot of something
Sense.TRAN: 满是某物﹔充满[充溢]某物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the princes were dripping with gems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子们个个珠光宝气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His tone was now dripping with sarcasm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语调现在充满了嘲讽。

Sense.DEF: one of the drops of liquid that fall from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put some plastic buckets on the floor to catch the drips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把几个塑料桶放在地板上接滴下来的水。

Sense.DEF: the sound or action of a liquid falling in drops
Sense.EXAMPLE: The silence was broken only by a regular drip, drip, drip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯有嘀嗒嘀嗒的滴水声打破这宁静。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used in hospitals for putting liquids directly into your blood through a tube

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the hospital they put me on a drip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在医院﹐他们给我输液。

Sense.DEF: someone who is boring and weak
Sense.TRAN: 怯懦无趣的人﹐平庸乏味者

Sense.DEF:
drip-dry clothing does not need
ironing
to put a liquid directly into a person’s blood through a tube
to keep giving someone small amounts of information, money etc
Sense.TRAN: 向…一点一滴提供信息[资金等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public was drip-fed with news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众一点点地知道了这一消息。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used in hospitals for putting liquids directly into your blood through a tube
the oily substance that comes out of meat when you cook it
extremely wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take off that jacket – you’re dripping wet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那件上衣脱下来﹐你都湿透了。

Sense.DEF: very emotional in a silly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie is nothing but a drippy melodrama.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是部幼稚煽情的通俗片。

Subsense.DEF: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am planning to drive to Morocco next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年我打算驾车去摩洛哥。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: the man driving the car
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开车的男子
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you drive?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会开车吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: So when did you learn to drive ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么你是什么时候学会开车的？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bye! Drive carefully!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再见！开车小心！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He drives 12 miles to work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他驾车12英里去上班。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He drives has a BMW estate.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开一辆宝马旅行车。

Subsense.DEF: if a car, truck etc drives somewhere, it moves there
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After the accident, the other car just drove off.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出事后另外一辆车径自开走了。

Subsense.DEF: if people drive somewhere, they travel somewhere in a car
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Shall we drive or take the bus?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开车去还是坐公共汽车去？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They drove back to Woodside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开车回到了伍德赛德。

Subsense.DEF: to take someone somewhere in a car, truck etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She drove Anna to London.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开车送安娜去伦敦。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll drive you home .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来开车送你回家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I drove myself to hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己开车去了医院。

Sense.DEF: to force a person or animal to go somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Torrential rain drove the players off the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滂沱大雨迫使选手们离开了赛场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着几声响亮的哨声﹐他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

Sense.DEF: to strongly influence someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The detective wondered what had driven Christine to phone her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警探不明白是什么原因促使克里斯蒂娜打电话给她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The noises in my head have nearly driven me to suicide.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脑子里乱七八糟的声音几乎逼得我要自杀。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil, driven by jealousy, started spying on his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔在嫉妒心的驱使下开始暗中监视他的妻子。

Sense.SIGNPOST: MAKE SB/STH BE IN A BAD STATE
Sense.SIGNTRAN: 使某人/某物处于糟糕状态
Sense.DEF: to make someone or something get into a bad or extreme state, usually an emotional one
Sense.TRAN: 迫使﹐逼得〔某人或某物处于极糟糕的状态〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This cough is driving me mad!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咳嗽快把我逼疯了！

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone feel very sexually excited

GramExa.PROPFORM: drive sb up the wall/out of their mind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mosquitoes drive me to distraction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚊子搞得我心烦意乱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The factory had been driven into bankruptcy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂被迫破产。

Sense.DEF: to hit or push something into something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We watched Dad drive the posts into the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着爸爸把木桩打入地里。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She drove her heels into the sand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她鞋跟踩进了沙子里。

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal work hard
Sense.TRAN: 驱使﹐逼迫〔人或动物拼命干活〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t drive yourself too hard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把自己逼得太狠了。

Subsense.DEF: to move a ball etc forward in a game of baseball, football, golf etc by hitting or kicking it hard and fast
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在棒球﹑足球﹑高尔夫球等运动中〕猛击﹐猛踢﹐猛抽（球）
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He drove the ball into the corner of the net.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脚抽射﹐球直挂网窝。

Subsense.DEF:
to run with the ball towards the
goal
in sports such as
basketball
and American football
Subsense.TRAN: 〔篮球﹑美式橄榄球等中〕带（球）前进

Sense.DEF: to provide the power for a vehicle or machine
Sense.TRAN: 为〔车辆或机器〕提供动力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a petrol-driven lawn mower
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽油驱动的割草机

Sense.DEF: if rain, snow, wind etc drives somewhere, it moves very quickly in that direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain was driving down hard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨下得很猛。

Sense.LEXUNIT: drive a coach and horses through sth
Sense.DEF: to destroy an argument, plan etc completely
Sense.TRAN: 彻底推翻某事﹐摧毁某事 〔指论点﹑计划等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new bill will drive a coach and horses through recent trade agreements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新法案将彻底推翻最近达成的贸易协定。

Sense.DEF: to make a large hole in something using heavy equipment or machinery
Sense.EXAMPLE: They drove a tunnel through the mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开凿出一条穿山隧道。

Sense.DEF: to make something completely clear to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t have to drive the point home . The videotape had done that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不用详细解释﹐录像带里已说得很清楚了。

Sense.DEF: to do something that makes people disagree or start to dislike each other
Sense.TRAN: 挑拨某人之间的关系﹐离间某人﹐使某人不和
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to drive a wedge between you and your father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想破坏你和你父亲的感情。

Sense.DEF: the thing someone is really trying to say
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still couldn’t understand what Toby was driving at.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是没弄懂托比到底想说什么。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that makes someone leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was cruel because he wanted to drive me away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很残忍﹐因为他想把我赶跑。

Sense.DEF: to make prices, costs etc fall quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to drive down costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须把成本降下来。

Sense.DEF:
to hit the ball so that another player can score a
run
in baseball
to hit the ball to begin a game of golf
to force a person or animal to go away from you
Sense.EXAMPLE: We keep dogs in the yard to drive off intruders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在院子里养了几条狗防止外人闯入。

Sense.DEF: to force someone or something to leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: Downtown stores are being driven out by crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪活动使得巿中心的商店一家家搬走了。

Sense.DEF: to make something stop existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we went forward, our fear was driven out by horror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走上前去﹐这时担心变成了恐惧。

Sense.DEF: to make prices, costs etc rise quickly
Sense.TRAN: 迫使〔价格﹑成本等〕快速上升
Sense.EXAMPLE: The oil shortage drove gas prices up by 20 cents a gallon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油短缺使得每加仑油价上涨了20美分。

Sense.DEF: a journey in a car

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a drive along the coast.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开车沿着海岸去兜兜风吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Taylor took me for a drive through the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒开车带我在城里兜风。

GramExa.PROPFORM: an hour’s/a two hour etc drive
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a two hour drive from Calais to Thiepval.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从加莱开车到蒂耶普瓦尔要两小时。

Sense.DEF: a strong natural need or desire
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treatment will not affect your sex drive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种治疗不会影响你的性欲。

Sense.DEF: the hard area or road between your house and the street
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋与街道之间的〕私人车道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He parked his car in the drive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车停在私人车道上。

Sense.DEF: an effort to achieve something, especially an effort by an organization for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指有特定目的的有组织的〕活动﹐运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a recruitment drive for new members
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招募新成员的活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: an economy drive effort to reduce spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节约运动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nationwide drive to crack down on crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 打击犯罪的全国性运动

Sense.DEF: determination and energy to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian has got tremendous drive .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩干劲十足。

Sense.DEF: the power from an engine that makes the wheels of a vehicle go round

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 前轮/后轮/四轮驱动

Sense.DEF:
a piece of equipment in a computer that is used to get information from a
disk
or to store information on it

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 硬驱/软驱/A驱等

Sense.DEF: an act of hitting a ball hard, especially in tennis, baseball, or golf
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指网球﹑棒球或高尔夫球的〕猛击﹐猛抽
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hit a long, high drive to right field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打了个又高又远的球到右场。

Sense.DEF: several military attacks

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drive deep into enemy territory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 深入敌区的大规模攻击

Sense.DEF: when animals such as cows or sheep are brought together and made to move in a particular direction
used in the names of roads
Sense.EXAMPLE: 141 Park Drive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公园路141号

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone is shot by someone in a moving car
a restaurant where you are served and eat in your car
a place where you can watch films outdoors while sitting in your car
something that is said or written that is silly or does not mean anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t talk such drivel!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别胡说八道！

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
drive
trying extremely hard to achieve what you want
Sense.TRAN: 奋发努力的﹐发愤图强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He claims he is not a driven workaholic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他声称自己不是个奋发努力的工作狂。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: as pure as the driven snow

Sense.DEF: someone who drives a car, bus etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a taxi driver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车司机
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think you’re a good driver?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为自己是个好司机吗？

Sense.DEF: a piece of software that makes a computer work with another piece of equipment such as a printer or a mouse

a
golf club
with a wooden head
Sense.TRAN: 〔有木制槌头的〕高尔夫球杆﹐发球杆

Sense.DEF: a course, usually taken in high school, that teaches you how to drive a car
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般在中学学习的〕驾驶课程

Sense.DEF: an official document or card that says that you are legally allowed to drive

a part of a vehicle that takes power from the
gearbox
to the wheels
a restaurant, bank etc where you can be served without getting out of your car
Sense.TRAN: 得来速〔不必下车即可获得服务的餐馆﹑银行等〕

Sense.DEF: the time during the morning or afternoon when many people are driving to or from work
Sense.TRAN: 〔许多人开车上下班的〕驾车高峰时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a morning drivetime radio show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨驾车高峰时间的电台节目

Sense.DEF: the hard area or road between your house and the street
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子与街道之间的〕私人车道

Sense.DEF: the activity of driving a car, truck etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: driving lessons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was charged with causing death by dangerous driving .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因危险驾车致人死亡而被起诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: hazardous driving conditions weather that makes driving dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的驾车天气

Sense.DEF: rain or snow that falls very hard and fast
someone or something that strongly influences people and makes them do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hawks was the driving force behind the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍克斯是推动这个项目的主要人物。

Sense.DEF: a very great desire to do or achieve something
an official document or card that says that you are legally allowed to drive
an open outdoor area where people practise hitting golf balls
a business that teaches people how to drive a car
the official test that you must pass in order to be legally allowed to drive on public roads
if it is drizzling, light rain and mist come out of the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rain isn’t too bad – it’s only drizzling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨下得不大——只是毛毛细雨而已。

Sense.DEF: to let a liquid fall on food in a small stream or in small drops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drizzle the soy sauce over the chicken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在鸡肉上洒点酱油。

Sense.DEF: weather that is a combination of light rain and mist
Sense.EXAMPLE: A light drizzle had started by the time we left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走的时候﹐天已经开始下毛毛雨了。

Sense.DEF: amusing in an unusual way

a
camel
, with one
hump
on its back
to make a continuous low dull sound
Sense.TRAN: 发出持续的嗡嗡声﹐嗡嗡作响
Sense.EXAMPLE: An airplane droned overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架飞机在头顶上轰鸣。

Sense.DEF: to speak in a boring way, usually for a long time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom was droning on about work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆在没完没了地谈工作。

Sense.DEF: a continuous low dull sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the steady drone of traffic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车来车往发出的持续的嗡嗡声

Sense.DEF:
a male
bee
that does no work
someone who has a good life but does not work to earn it or give anything back to society
an aircraft that does not have a pilot, but is operated by radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔无线电操纵的〕无人遥控飞机

Sense.DEF:
to let
saliva the liquid in your mouth
come out of your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog was drooling at the mouth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那狗嘴上流着口水。

Sense.DEF: to show in a silly way that you like someone or something a lot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was drooling over a Porsche.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对一辆保时捷很眼馋。

Sense.DEF: to hang or bend down, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant needs some water – it’s starting to droop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这株植物需要浇些水——它开始打蔫了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyelids began to droop close, because he was sleepy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼皮开始耷拉下来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jessie drooped her head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰茜垂下头。

Sense.DEF: to become sad or weak
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our spirits drooped as we faced the long trip home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面临回家的漫长路程﹐我们情绪低落下来。

Subsense.DEF: to stop holding or carrying something so that it falls
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He dropped his briefcase on a chair.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把公文包丢在椅子上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She screamed and dropped the torch.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尖叫一声﹐把手电筒丢在了地上。

Subsense.DEF: to make something such as a bomb fall from a plane
Subsense.EXAMPLE: U.S. planes began dropping bombs on the city.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国飞机开始轰炸该城市。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Supplies are being dropped for the refugees.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在向难民空投物资。

Sense.DEF: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The apples are beginning to drop from the trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果开始从树上落下来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Your button has dropped off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的纽扣掉了。

Sense.DEF: to lower yourself or part of your body suddenly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dropped down onto the floor and hid under the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他蹲到地板上﹐藏在桌子底下。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She dropped her head back against the cushion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她倒头靠在靠垫上。

Sense.DEF: to fall to a lower level or amount, especially a much lower level or amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Temperatures drop quite dramatically at night, so bring some warm clothing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里气温骤降﹐所以要带上些暖和的衣服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their share of the market dropped to 50 percent this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年他们的市场占有率下降到了50%。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the level or amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 降低〔…的水平〕﹔减少〔…的数量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You might be able to get them to drop the price .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许能够让他们把价格降下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as she saw the police car she dropped her speed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一看到警车就放慢了速度。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to include someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His name was dropped from the list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被剔除出名单。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Taylor was bitterly disappointed to be dropped from the England side.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒对没入选英格兰队感到非常失望。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something, discussing something, or continuing with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal was dropped after opposition from civil liberties groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遭到公民自由组织的反对后这一提案便被驳回了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: New evidence was presented to the court and the case was dropped.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的证据提交给法庭后该案就被撤销了。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 在学校/大学退修[不学]一科
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students are allowed to drop history in Year 9.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 九年级的学生可以不学历史。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t expect me to drop everything completely stop doing whatever I am doing whenever you’re in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能指望你一进城我就得放下手头的所有事情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, drop the ‘Senator’ stop calling me ‘Senator’ – just call me Gordon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐不要叫我 “参议员” ﹐就叫我戈登吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some time later, the matter was quietly dropped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了一段时间﹐这件事就不了了之了。

Sense.DEF: to stop talking about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To her relief, Julius dropped the subject .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让她感到宽慰的是﹐朱利叶斯停止了那个话题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just drop it, will you? I don’t want to talk about it any more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到此为止﹐行不行？我再也不愿意谈这事了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What about the money?’ ‘We’ve agreed to let it drop we have agreed not to talk about it any more .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “钱呢？” “我们都已经说好不再提了。”

Sense.DEF: to take someone by car to a place and leave them there, especially on your way to another place
Sense.TRAN: 〔开车〕顺路送〔某人〕到〔某处〕﹐放…下车
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just drop me here – I can walk the rest of the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就让我在这里下车吧﹐剩下的路我可以走过去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She dropped Johnny at the school gates at about 8:30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约8点30分时她把约翰尼送到了校门口。

Sense.DEF: to take something to a place and leave it there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got your books – I’ll drop them round to your place later.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买到你要的书了﹐晚些时候我会送到你那里去。

Sense.DEF: to visit someone you know, usually without arranging a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just dropped by to see how you were getting on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是顺道来看看你过得怎样。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids drop round and see her from time to time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们时不时地过来看看她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jan dropped into the office this morning to tell me her news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简今天上午顺道来办公室把她的消息告诉我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you drop in for a drink one evening?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你哪天晚上过来喝一杯怎么样？

Sense.DEF: if a path, land etc drops, it goes down suddenly, forming a steep slope

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cliff dropped down over a hundred feet to the sea below.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬崖从距海面一百多英尺的地方陡然而下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the left the ground drops away, giving a view over the rooftops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 左边﹐地势陡降﹐可以看到一个个屋顶。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly stop having a relationship with someone, especially a romantic relationship
Sense.TRAN: 突然终止与〔某人〕的（恋爱）关系﹐将〔某人〕给甩了
Sense.EXAMPLE: She dropped him as soon as she found out he had been seeing another woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一发现他和另一个女人有来往后就和他一刀两断了。

Sense.DEF: until you are too tired to continue doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to shop till we drop!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要逛街购物直到走不动为止！

Sense.DEF: to suggest or ask for something in an indirect way, hoping that the person you are talking to will understand what you mean
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dropped some big hints about what he wanted for his birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己生日要什么礼物作了明显的暗示。

Sense.DEF: to write a short letter to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drop us a line to let us know how you’re getting on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写封短信告诉我们你过得怎样。

Subsense.DEF: to die suddenly
an impolite expression which you say to someone when you are extremely angry with them
Subsense.TRAN: 去你的﹐去死吧〔生气时对别人说的不礼貌的话〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone was very surprised
to stop looking at someone and look down, usually because you feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: 垂下眼睛/目光〔通常因为尴尬或不自在〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben looked at me in horror for a moment and then dropped his gaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本惊恐地看了我一会儿﹐然后垂下了目光。

Sense.DEF: the wind stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: They waited for the wind to drop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们等风停下来。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly tell someone a shocking piece of news
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally she dropped the bombshell. She was pregnant and I was the father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后她说出一个惊人的消息: 她怀孕了﹐而我就是孩子的父亲。

Sense.DEF: to say or do something that gets someone else into trouble
Sense.TRAN: 给某人捅了娄子﹐使某人遇到麻烦
Sense.EXAMPLE: You told her where we went on Friday night! You’ve really dropped me in it now!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你告诉她星期五晚上我们去哪儿了！这下你把我给害惨了！

Sense.DEF: to lose money in a business deal, a game etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔做生意﹑赌博等〕输掉50美元/2,000英镑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phil dropped $200 playing poker yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔昨天打扑克输了200美元。

Sense.DEF:
to fail to catch a ball hit by a
batsman
in
cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球比赛中〕没接住〔击球手击来的〕球

Sense.DEF: to lose a point in a sports competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Real Madrid dropped a point at home yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皇家马德里队昨天在主场失了一分。

Sense.DEF: if people are dropping like flies, they are getting ill or dying in large numbers
to say something embarrassing in a social situation

to let the wool fall off the needle when you are
knitting

to lower a boat’s
anchor
to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc so that the boat does not float away

to swallow
LSD an illegal drug
to move more slowly than other people so that they get ahead of you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started out with the leaders but at the first fence he dropped back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起跑时他和领先的选手并驾齐驱﹐但到第一栏时落后了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen dropped behind to tie her shoelace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦落在后面系鞋带。

Sense.DEF: to begin to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: She kept dropping off at her desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在书桌前不停地打瞌睡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must have dropped off to sleep .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定是打了个盹。

Sense.DEF: to take someone or something to a place by car and leave them there on your way to another place
Sense.TRAN: 〔开车〕顺便把某人/某物送到〔某处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll drop you off on my way home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回家路上顺道送你吧。

Sense.DEF: to fall to a lower level or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of graduates going into teaching has dropped off sharply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事教育行业的大学毕业生人数急剧减少了。

Sense.DEF: to no longer do an activity or belong to a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group gets smaller as members move away or drop out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着成员搬走或退出﹐这个团体的规模变小了。

Sense.DEF: to leave a school or university before your course has finished

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill dropped out of college after his first year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔在大学读完第一年后就辍学了。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to take part in ordinary society because you do not agree with its principles
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝接受〔传统规范〕﹐离经叛道
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the 60s, Leary urged kids to ‘Turn on, tune in and drop out.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代时﹐利里鼓励年轻人 “打开心扉﹐同流脱出” 。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of liquid that falls in a round shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As the first drops of rain began to fall, Michael started to run.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚有雨滴落下﹐迈克尔就开始跑了起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A single drop of blood splashed onto the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一滴血溅落在地板上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A drop of sweat ran down her forehead and into her eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一滴汗珠从她额头滚下来落到眼睛里。

Subsense.DEF: a small amount of liquid that you drink, especially alcohol

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She likes to add a drop of brandy to her tea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢在茶里加一点点白兰地。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: George hasn’t touched a drop drunk any alcohol for years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治已经好多年滴酒未沾了。

Subsense.DEF: a small amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t got a drop of sympathy for him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点也不同情他。

Sense.DEF: a reduction in the amount, level, or number of something, especially a large or sudden one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Manufacturers report a big drop in new orders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产商报告说新订单大幅减少。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drop in temperature
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 气温下降

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The results showed a sharp drop in profits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果显示利润急剧下降。

Sense.DEF: a distance from a higher point down to the ground or to a lower point
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a steep drop on one side of the track.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小道的一边是陡坡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 20-metre drop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20米的落差
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an almost sheer vertical drop to the valley below.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到下面的山谷几乎是垂直的峭壁。

Sense.LEXUNIT: at the drop of a hat
Sense.DEF: immediately and without pausing to think about what you are going to do
Sense.TRAN: 立即﹐不假思索﹐毫不迟疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of these corporations threaten to sue at the drop of a hat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些大公司中有几家威胁说要马上提起诉讼。

Sense.DEF: an act of delivering something somewhere, for example by dropping it from a plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: Air drops from a plane of food aid were made to the region yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天对该地区空投了救援食品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My first drop of the day is usually somewhere in north London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天中第一个送货地点通常是在伦敦北部的某个地方。

Sense.DEF:
a sweet that tastes of
lemon
etc
Sense.TRAN: 柠檬/水果/巧克力等味的糖果

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of something compared to what is needed or wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: 5,000 new schools are to be built, but this is just a drop in the ocean for such a vast country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要新建5,000所学校﹐但对这么个幅员辽阔的国家来说也只是杯水车薪。

Sense.DEF: a type of medicine that you put in your eye, ear etc, one drop at a time
a large cloth for covering furniture or floors in order to protect them from dust or paint
Sense.TRAN: 〔防止家具或地板落上灰尘或弄上油漆的〕罩单﹐罩布

Sense.DEF: a date by which you must have completed something, because after this date it is no longer worth doing
Sense.TRAN: 〔必须完成某事﹐否则就不再值得去做的〕最后日期﹐最后期限﹐截止日期

Sense.DEF: very attractive

a list of choices which appears on a computer screen when you
click
on a place on the screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机屏幕上的〕下拉式菜单

Sense.DEF:
a
goal
in
rugby
football made with a dropkick
Sense.TRAN: 〔英式橄榄球中的〕以抛踢球射门得分

Sense.DEF: a drop-in place is a place offering a service or support where you can go without having to make arrangements first
Sense.TRAN: 〔服务场所〕无需预约的﹐随到随进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drop-in advice centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无需预约的咨询中心

Sense.DEF:
a kick in a game such as
rugby
football, made by dropping the ball and kicking it immediately
a very small drop of liquid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tiny droplets of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小滴的水

Sense.DEF: someone who leaves school or college before they have finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high school dropout
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中学退学者

Sense.DEF: someone who refuses to take part in ordinary society because they do not agree with its social practices, moral standards etc
a short glass tube with a hollow rubber part at one end, that you use to measure liquid one drop at a time
the solid waste that passes out of the bodies of animals or birds
a shot in a game such as tennis in which the ball is hit softly and falls quickly to the ground
something that is of very low quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the poems were pretentious dross.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些诗大部分都是矫饰的俗烂之作。

Sense.DEF: waste or useless substances
Sense.EXAMPLE: gold with impurities or dross
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含杂质的黄金
