Sense.DEF: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

the past tense of
drive
crowds of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tourists come in droves to see the White House.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客成群结队前来参观白宫。

Sense.DEF: a group of animals that are being moved together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a drove of cattle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛群

Sense.DEF: someone who moves cattle or sheep from one place to another in groups
to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people drowned when the boat overturned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船翻后许多人淹死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane was drowned in the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简在那条河里溺水身亡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Depressed, Peter tried to drown himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得因为抑郁试图投水自尽。

Sense.DEF: if a loud noise drowns out another sound, it prevents it from being heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: A train blew its whistle and drowned his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车鸣响汽笛﹐淹没了他的话音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The noise of the battle was drowned out by his aircraft’s engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交战声被他飞机引擎的轰鸣声盖过了。

Sense.DEF: to cover something, especially food, with more liquid than is necessary or nice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fish was drowned in a rich sauce.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼浸泡在浓浓的酱汁里。

Sense.DEF: to have a very strong feeling or a serious problem that is difficult to deal with
Sense.TRAN: （为）〔强烈的感情或严重的问题〕困扰﹐烦恼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Relief agencies are drowning in frustration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援机构里弥漫着沮丧情绪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The country is drowning in debt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家负债累累。

Sense.DEF: to drink a lot of alcohol in order to forget your problems
to be in a light sleep or to feel as though you are almost asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was drowsing in front of the television when you called.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正坐在电视机前打瞌睡﹐恰好你打电话来。

Sense.DEF: tired and almost asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug can make you drowsy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药会让人昏昏欲睡。

Sense.DEF: so peaceful that you feel relaxed and almost asleep
Sense.TRAN: 令人松弛的﹐令人困倦欲睡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drowsy summer afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人困倦欲睡的夏日午后

Sense.DEF: an occasion when one team easily beats another team in sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ireland gave England a drubbing at Twickenham.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰队在维克汉姆体育场轻取英格兰队。

Sense.DEF: someone who does hard boring work
Sense.TRAN: 做苦工者﹐干乏味工作的人

Sense.DEF: hard boring work
Sense.TRAN: 辛苦乏味的工作﹐苦工﹐贱役

Sense.DEF:
an illegal substance such as
marijuana
or
cocaine
, which some people take in order to feel happy, relaxed, or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of young people start taking drugs at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻人上学时开始吸毒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always looks as though she’s on drugs taking drugs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是看上去一副吸过毒的样子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jimi Hendrix died of a drug overdose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米·亨德里克斯死于吸毒过量。

Sense.DEF: a medicine, or a substance for making medicines
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drug used in the treatment of cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于治疗癌症的一种药物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: new drugs for AIDS-related conditions
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗艾滋病相关病症的新药

Sense.EXAMPLE: Drugs prescribed ordered for people by doctors can be extremely hazardous if used in the wrong way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生开的处方药如果使用不当是非常危险的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The big drug companies make huge profits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大型制药公司利润丰厚。

Sense.DEF: a substance that people doing a sport sometimes take illegally to improve their performance
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was banned from the Olympics after failing a drug test a test that shows if you have taken drugs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她药检未能过关﹐被禁止参加奥运会。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高成绩的药物

Sense.DEF: a substance such as tobacco, coffee, or alcohol, that makes you want more and more of it
Sense.TRAN: 成瘾性物质〔如烟草﹑咖啡﹑酒〕

Sense.DEF: if an activity is like a drug, you enjoy it so much that you want to do it more and more
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项活动〕使人上瘾﹐让人欲罢不能
Sense.EXAMPLE: Athletics is like a drug – it keeps dragging you back for more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育运动会让人上瘾﹐会不断地使你想练了又练。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think I took drugs to escape my problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我吸毒是为了逃避问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take drugs
Collocate.EXAMPLE: All my friends were doing drugs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的朋友都在吸毒。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: take drugs regularly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It can be very hard to tell if your teenager is on drugs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时很难断定自己处于青春期的孩子是否吸毒。

Collocate.COLLOC: be addicted to drugs/dependent on drugs
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be unable to stop taking drugs
Collocate.EXAMPLE: People who are addicted to drugs need help.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸毒成瘾的人需要帮助。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be/get addicted
try taking drugs
stop taking drugs permanently
sell drugs
use a needle to put drugs into your body
be experiencing the effects of a drug
taking drugs
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She is being treated for drug abuse.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因吸毒而正在接受治疗。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who takes drugs
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We set up a counselling service for drug users.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为吸毒者提供咨询服务。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the problem of not being able to stop taking drugs
Collocate.EXAMPLE: his struggles with alcoholism and drug addiction
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与酗酒和毒瘾的斗争

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who cannot stop taking drugs
the problem of being addicted to drugs
taking too much of a drug at one time
someone who sells drugs
someone involved in bringing drugs into a country
the crime of bringing drugs into a country
a long struggle by the authorities to control drugs

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of crime is connected to illegal drugs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多犯罪都和毒品有关。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: strong drugs such as heroin, cocaine etc
less strong drugs such as marijuana
taken for pleasure
produced artificially from chemicals

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘light drugs’. Say soft drugs. Instead of ‘heavy drugs’, you usually say hard drugs. 不要说light drugs,而要说 soft drugs。人们不说 heavy drugs,一般说 hard drugs。

Sense.DEF: to give a person or animal a drug, especially in order to make them feel tired or go to sleep, or to make them perform well in a race
Sense.TRAN: 使服用麻醉药﹔使服用兴奋剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson drugged and attacked four women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊下药侵犯了四名妇女。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no evidence that the horse had been drugged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有证据表明这匹马服过禁药。

Sense.DEF: to put drugs in someone’s food or drink in order to make them feel tired or go to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 在〔食物或饮料〕中下麻醉药﹐投放麻药
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine had been drugged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这酒里放了麻药。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be drugged up to the eyeballs
Sense.DEF: to have taken a lot of illegal drugs, or to have been given a lot of medicine
Sense.TRAN: 已吸食大量毒品﹔已服用大量药品﹔被〔医生〕用了大量药
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in pain, despite being drugged up to the eyeballs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管用了大量的药﹐她仍然觉得痛。

Sense.DEF: someone who cannot stop taking illegal drugs
someone who leads an organization that buys and sells large quantities of illegal drugs
an official employed by a government to try to stop the trade of illegal drugs
someone who sells illegal drugs
rough heavy cloth used especially as a floor covering, or a piece of this cloth
Sense.TRAN: 粗毛织物﹔〔尤指〕粗毛地毯

Sense.DEF: someone who often takes illegal drugs
someone who is trained to prepare medicines, and works in a shop

the process of helping someone to live without illegal drugs after they have been
addict ed
to them
someone who brings illegal drugs from one country to another
a shop where you can buy medicines, beauty products etc
a member of an ancient group of priests, in Britain, Ireland, and France, before the Christian religion
Sense.TRAN: 德鲁伊特〔在基督教传入之前﹐古代不列颠﹑爱尔兰和法兰西的祭司〕

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument made of skin stretched over a circular frame, played by hitting it with your hand or a stick
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big bass drum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一面低音大鼓
Sense.EXAMPLE: 1,000 people marched, beating drums and carrying flags.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1,000人打着鼓扛着旗游行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trumpeter Red Rodney was playing with Kenny Clarke on drums playing the drums .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小号手雷德·罗德尼在肯尼·克拉克的鼓声伴奏下表演。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones played the drums in an all-girl band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯在一个女子乐队里打鼓。

Sense.DEF: a large round container for storing liquids such as oil, chemicals etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔装油﹑化学制品等液体的〕大桶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 5 gallon oil drum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5加仑的油桶

Sense.DEF: something that looks like a drum, especially part of a machine
Sense.TRAN: 鼓状物﹔〔尤指机器的〕鼓轮﹐滚筒
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brake drum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制动鼓

Sense.DEF: to speak eagerly in support of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 为某人/某物竭力鼓吹[摇旗呐喊]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is banging the drum for their new software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在大力宣传自己的新软件。

Sense.DEF: a sound like the sound a drum makes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drum of the rain on the window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨打在窗户上发出的啪嗒声

Sense.DEF: to play a drum
to make a sound similar to a drum by hitting a surface again and again
Sense.TRAN: 有节奏地击打〔使发出打鼓似的声音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear the rain drumming against the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到雨滴有节奏地打在窗上的声音。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lisa drummed her fingers impatiently on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨不耐烦地用手指嗒嗒地敲桌子。

Sense.DEF: to use repeated arguments or messages in order to make sure that people understand something
Sense.TRAN: 重复某事以确保让人明白
Sense.EXAMPLE: An information booklet will be available and press advertisements will drum home the message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先提供资料手册﹐再用报刊广告进一步加深印象。

Sense.DEF: to keep telling someone something until they cannot forget it
Sense.TRAN: 向〔某人〕反复灌输〔某种观点直到记住为止〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t talk to strangers’ is a message drummed into children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别跟陌生人说话” 是反复向儿童灌输的一句警告。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave an organization, place, or job
Sense.TRAN: 迫使〔某人〕离开〔某个组织﹑场所等〕﹔开除﹐逐出
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was drummed out of the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被军队开除了。

Sense.DEF: to get support, interest, attention etc from people by making an effort
Sense.TRAN: 争取〔支持〕﹔引起〔兴趣﹑注意等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He travelled throughout Latin America drumming up support for the confederation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他游遍拉丁美洲为联盟谋求支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization is using the event to drum up business get more work and sales .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构将利用这次活动来增加业务。

Sense.DEF: the sound made when someone hits a drum
a set of drums, used especially by professional musicians
a piece of electronic equipment that makes patterns of sounds like drum music

the male leader of a
marching band

a
majorette
someone who plays drums
when you play a drum, or the sound of a drum being played
the sound of something hitting a surface again and again
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drumming of the horses’ hooves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蹄的嘚嘚声

Sense.DEF: a type of electronic dance music with a very hard fast beat
Sense.TRAN: 鼓打贝斯〔一种节奏强烈快速的电子舞曲〕

Sense.DEF: a quick continuous beating of a drum, used especially to introduce an important event
Sense.TRAN: 一阵隆隆的鼓声﹐一通鼓声〔尤用于宣告某重大事件开始〕

Sense.DEF: the lower part of the leg of a chicken or other bird, cooked as food
Sense.TRAN: 〔鸡或其他禽类的〕腿下段﹐琵琶腿

Sense.DEF: a stick that you use to hit a drum

the past participle of
drink
unable to control your behaviour, speech etc because you have drunk too much alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re drunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喝醉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: David would get drunk and I would have to take him home and put him to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维常会喝醉﹐我就得把他弄回家放到床上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was drunk on beer and whisky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝啤酒和威士忌喝醉了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All she wants to do is get blind drunk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只想把自己灌个烂醉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned up one morning, drunk as a lord.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天早上他出现了﹐喝得酩酊大醉。

Sense.DEF: the crime of behaving in a violent noisy way in a public place when you are drunk
so excited by a feeling that you behave in a strange way
Sense.TRAN: 因某事兴奋得忘乎所以
Sense.EXAMPLE: drunk with happiness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸福得飘飘然

Sense.DEF: someone who is drunk or often gets drunk
driving a car after having drunk too much alcohol
drunk or showing that you are drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a drunken bully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个喝醉酒的恶霸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was lying in a drunken stupor nearly unconscious from being drunk on the sidewalk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她醉得神志不清﹐躺在人行道上。

Sense.DEF: a party etc where people are drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom got into a drunken brawl fight in a bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆在酒吧里酒后闹事了。

Sense.DEF: a cell in a prison for people who have drunk too much alcohol
without water or liquid inside or on the surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to change into some dry clothes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要换上干衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure that the surface is clean and dry before you start to paint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆之前一定先要确保表面清洁干燥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should store disks in a cool, dry place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该把磁盘存放在阴凉干燥的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean rubbed her hair dry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼把头发擦干。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The path is dry as a bone very dry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小道很干燥。

Sense.DEF:
having very little rain or
moisture
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather was hot and dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气炎热干燥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eastern areas should stay dry tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东部地区明天仍将无雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dry season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旱季
Sense.EXAMPLE: These plants do not grow well in dry conditions when there is not much rain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物在干旱的环境中长不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prolonged dry spell period
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段持续的干旱天气

Sense.DEF: without enough of the liquid or oil that is normally in your mouth, skin etc
Sense.TRAN: 干燥的嘴巴/皮肤/嘴唇/头发等
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart was pounding and his mouth was dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的心怦怦跳﹐嘴巴发干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary has dry, sensitive skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽的皮肤干燥而敏感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shampoo for dry hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适用于干性发质的洗发液
Sense.EXAMPLE: She licked her dry lips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她舔了舔干燥的嘴唇。

Sense.DEF: if a lake, river etc runs dry, all the water gradually disappears, especially because there has been no rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river ran dry last summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年夏天这条河干涸了。

Sense.DEF: someone with a dry sense of humour says funny and clever things while seeming to be serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a delightfully dry sense of humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一种很逗人的冷幽默。

Sense.DEF: boring, very serious, and without humour
Sense.EXAMPLE: In schools, science is often presented in a dry and uninteresting manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里﹐科学往往用枯燥乏味的方式来讲授。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dry debate on policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政策的无聊辩论

Sense.DEF:
a cough which does not produce any
phlegm
wine etc that is not sweet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of dry white wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯干白葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: not drinking alcohol, or not allowing any alcohol to be sold
Sense.TRAN: 不喝酒的﹔不允许出售酒精饮料的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paula had been dry for a year before she started drinking again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葆拉一年没喝酒﹐后来又开始喝了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kuwait’s a dry country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科威特是个禁酒的国家。

Sense.DEF: showing no emotion when you speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Good evening gentlemen,’ he said, in a dry voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “先生们﹐晚上好。” 他冷冰冰地说道。

Sense.DEF:
bread etc eaten on its own without anything such as butter or
jam
spread on it
Sense.TRAN: 未涂黄油[果酱]的面包/吐司

Sense.DEF: thirsty

Sense.LEXUNIT: not a dry eye in the house
Sense.DEF: used to say that everyone was crying because something was very sad – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔因伤心之事〕在场众人无不眼泪汪汪〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to make something dry, or to become dry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Brown hung the washing on the line to dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗太太把洗好的衣服挂在绳上晾干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was drying his hair with a towel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在用毛巾擦干头发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary dried her hands .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽把手擦干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the first coat of paint to dry before adding another.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等第一遍油漆干了以后再刷第二遍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood up and dried her eyes wiped away her tears .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站起身﹐擦干眼泪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He quickly dried himself on the thin towel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用那块薄毛巾很快把身体擦干了。

Sense.DEF: to rub plates, dishes etc dry with a cloth after they have been washed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You wash and I’ll dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你洗碗碟﹐我来擦干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall I dry up these glasses?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来把这些玻璃杯擦干好吗？

Sense.DEF: to become dry or to make something dry, especially on the surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: We swam in the sea, then stretched out on the sand to dry off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在海里游了泳﹐然后伸开手脚躺在沙滩上把自己晾干。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dried the camera off, hoping it would still work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把相机擦干﹐希望它还能使用。

Sense.DEF: to become completely dry or to make something completely dry, especially after it has been very wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: In summer, water the plants regularly and never let the soil dry out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天要经常给植物浇水﹐不要让土干透。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kitchen was flooded and it took ages to dry it out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房浸了水﹐过了很长时间才完全变干。

Sense.DEF:
to stop drinking alcohol after you have become an
alcoholic
, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been drying out at a private clinic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一家私人诊所戒酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital dried Michael out and sent him home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院帮助迈克尔戒酒后送他回家了。

Sense.DEF: if a supply of something dries up, it comes to an end and no more is available
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foreign investment may dry up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自国外的投资可能会枯竭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work soon dried up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快就没工作了。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a river dries up, the water in it disappears
Sense.EXAMPLE: Across central and west Texas, waterholes and wells have dried up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在得克萨斯州整个中部和西部﹐水坑和水井都干涸了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Taking too much water for household use is drying up the river.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民用取水过多使这条河日益干涸。

Sense.DEF: if someone dries up, they stop talking
Sense.TRAN: 停下来不说话﹐说不出话来
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It was –’ She dried up again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是——” 她又说不出来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone became embarrassed and conversation dried up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都很尴尬﹐谈话停了下来。

Sense.DEF: to rub plates, dishes etc dry with a cloth after they have been washed
Sense.TRAN: 用布擦干〔洗好的盘﹑碟等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll just dry up these mugs and we can have a coffee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把这些杯子擦干﹐我们就来喝咖啡。

Sense.DEF: a female spirit who lives in a tree, in ancient Greek stories
Sense.TRAN: 林中女仙〔古希腊神话中的树神〕

Sense.DEF:
an electric
battery
containing chemicals that are not in a liquid form
the type of cell used in a dry battery
to clean clothes etc with chemicals instead of water
a shop where you can take clothes etc to be dry-cleaned
a place where a ship can be taken out of the water for repairs
a machine that dries things, especially clothes
not crying
goods such as tobacco, tea, and coffee that do not contain liquid
Sense.TRAN: 干货〔如烟草﹑茶叶﹑咖啡等〕

Sense.DEF: things that are made from cloth such as clothes, sheets, and curtains
Sense.TRAN: 纺织品〔如衣服﹑床单﹑窗帘等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dry goods store
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纺织品商店

Sense.DEF:
carbon dioxide
in a solid form, which is used to make mist in a theatre or
disco
, or to keep food or other things cold
land rather than water
Sense.EXAMPLE: After three weeks at sea we were glad to be back on dry land again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海上航行三个星期后﹐我们很高兴又回到了陆地。

Sense.DEF: if you say something dryly, you say something that is amusing but you appear to be completely serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hear you’re a hero,’ Philip said dryly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我听说你是个英雄。” 菲利普面无表情地幽默了一句。

Sense.DEF: dry-roasted nuts have been cooked without any oil
a disease in wood that turns it into powder
an event that is a practice for a more important event
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both the parties are treating the local elections as a dry run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两党都把地方上的选举当成一种预演。

Sense.DEF: without getting your feet wet

in Britain, a wall built with pieces of stone that are fitted closely together without using
cement
to hold them in place
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的不用水泥等固定的〕干砌石墙

Sense.DEF:
a type of board made of two large sheets of
cardboard
with
plaster
between them, used to cover walls and ceilings
a telephone line that has special equipment which allows it to receive information from the Internet, or send information at very high speeds
Sense.TRAN: 数字用户线路〔一种连接因特网的电话线〕
the abbreviation of 缩写= the Department of Trade and Industry in Britain 〔英国的〕贸易工业部

Sense.DEF: the work of arranging the writing and pictures for a magazine, small book etc, using a computer and special software
Sense.TRAN: 桌面出版〔使用计算机和专门软件为书刊等排版〕

Sense.DEF: a condition in which your body shakes and you see imaginary things, caused by drinking too much alcohol – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔酗酒造成的〕震颤性谵妄（症）〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: having two of something or two parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bridge has a dual role, carrying both road and rail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座桥有双重用途﹐既作公路又作铁路。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a dual system of education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二元[双元]教育体系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has dual nationality , of Canada and Britain she is a citizen of Canada and Britain .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有加拿大和英国双重国籍。

Sense.DEF:
a dual-band
mobile phone
is able to work in at least two different countries because it can receive two different types of signals
a main road that has two lines of traffic travelling in each direction, with a narrow part between them that has no traffic
Sense.TRAN: 〔有中央分隔带的〕双向公路﹐对向车道

Sense.DEF: the idea that there are two opposite parts or principles in everything, for example body and soul, or the state of having two parts or principles
to give something or someone a name that describes them in some way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The body, thousands of years old, was found in the Alps and dubbed ‘The Iceman’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这具千年古尸发现于阿尔卑斯山﹐被称为 “冰人”。

Sense.DEF: to change the original spoken language of a film or television programme into another language
Sense.TRAN: 为〔电影或电视节目〕配音

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a British film dubbed into French
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部用法语配音的英国影片

Sense.DEF: to make a record out of two or more different pieces of music or sound mixed together

to copy a recording from a tape or
CD
onto another tape

if a king or queen dubs someone, they give the title of
knight
to that person in a special ceremony
a style of poetry or music from the West Indies with a strong regular beat
Sense.TRAN: 〔西印度群岛的〕强节拍诗歌﹐强节奏音乐

Sense.DEF: probably not honest, true, right etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住﹐或者说至少有误导性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

Sense.DEF: not sure whether something is good or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can see you are dubious; take some time to think about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看得出你在犹豫﹐花点时间考虑一下吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some universities are dubious about accepting students over the age of 30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些大学对录取30岁以上的学生有所犹豫。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure you know what you are doing?’ Andy said, looking dubious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你肯定知道自己在做什么吗？” 安迪有点疑虑地说道。

Sense.DEF: a dubious honour etc is the opposite of an honour – used about something unpleasant that happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Stephensons had the dubious honor of being the 100th family to lose their home in the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬森一家不幸地成为第100个在火灾中失去家园的家庭。

Sense.DEF: not good or not of good quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was decorated in dubious taste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房间的装修品位不佳。

Sense.DEF:
like a
duke
or belonging to a duke
a gold coin that was used in several European countries in the past
Sense.TRAN: 达克特〔旧时欧洲一些国家通用的金币〕

Sense.DEF:
a woman with the highest social rank outside the royal family, or the wife of a
duke
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Duchess of York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约克公爵夫人

Sense.DEF:
the land and property of a
duke
or
duchess
a very common water bird with short legs and a wide beak, used for its meat, eggs, and soft feathers
a female duck
the meat of a duck used as food
Sense.EXAMPLE: roast duck with orange sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烤鸭配橘子酱

Sense.LEXUNIT: take to something like a duck to water
Sense.DEF: to learn how to do something very easily
Sense.TRAN: 轻而易举地学会做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took to dancing like a duck to water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她学跳舞简直是易如反掌。

Sense.DEF: used to speak to someone, especially a woman, in a friendly way
Sense.TRAN: 乖乖﹐宝贝〔尤为对女人的友善称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What can I get you, ducks?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能为你端点什么过来吗﹐宝贝？

Sense.DEF:
a
score
of zero by a
batsman
in a game of
cricket

Crossrefto.REFLEX: like water off a duck’s back

Sense.DEF: to lower your head or body very quickly, especially to avoid being seen or hit
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为避免被看见或打中而迅速地〕低下（头）﹐弯（腰）
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she hadn’t ducked, the ball would have hit her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她没有弯腰躲闪的话﹐那个球就可能击中她了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jamie saw his father coming and ducked quickly behind the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米看到他父亲来了﹐就赶快弓身躲到墙后面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim ducked down to comb his hair in the mirror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆低下身在镜子前梳头发。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She ducked her head to look more closely at the inscription.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她低下头更仔细地看碑文。

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere very quickly, especially to avoid being seen or to get away from someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two men ducked into a block of flats and disappeared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个男人躲进一幢公寓楼不见了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ducked out of the door before he could stop her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还没来得及阻止﹐她就闪到了门外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Wait a minute,’ he called, ducking back inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “等一下。” 他边叫边躲回里面去了。

Sense.DEF: to avoid something, especially a difficult or unpleasant duty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ruling body wanted to duck the issue of whether players had been cheating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理机构想避开运动员是否作弊的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Glazer duck ed a question about his involvement in the bank scandal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格莱泽避开了关于他涉及银行丑闻的问题。

Sense.DEF: to push someone under water for a short time as a joke

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom grabbed him from behind to duck him under the surface.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆从后面抓住他﹐要把他按入水里。

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing something that you have to do or have promised to do
Sense.TRAN: 躲避﹐逃避〔应该做或答应做的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always ducked out of history lessons at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上学时总是逃避上历史课。

Sense.DEF:
a
platypus
long boards used to make a path over muddy ground
a seat on the end of a long pole, used in the past to put a person under water as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 浸水刑凳﹐浸水椅〔旧时的一种刑具﹐被罚者被捆于椅上浸入水中〕

Sense.DEF: a young duck
a children’s game in which you make flat stones jump across the surface of water
a plant that grows on the surface of ponds
used to speak to someone in a friendly way, especially a woman or child
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐宝贝〔尤用于对妇女﹑小孩的友善称呼〕

Sense.DEF: perfect or satisfactory
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, that’s just ducky .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐那真是好极了。

Sense.DEF: attractive in an amusing or interesting way

a pipe or tube that liquids, air,
cable s
etc pass through
Sense.TRAN: 〔输送液体﹑气体﹑电缆等的〕管道﹐槽
Sense.EXAMPLE: Air is heated and then circulated through large ducts to all parts of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气加热后通过大管道循环输送到房子的各处。

Sense.DEF: a narrow tube in your body or in a plant that liquid passes through
Sense.TRAN: 〔人体或植物中输送液体的〕细管﹐导管
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tear duct
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪管

Sense.DEF: ductile metals can be pressed or pulled into shape without needing to be heated

a system of pipes or tubes that liquids, air,
cable s
etc pass through
something that is useless, especially because it does not work correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several of the fireworks were duds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟火中有几个是哑炮。

Sense.DEF: clothes
a man
Sense.EXAMPLE: a real cool dude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个很酷的男人

Sense.DEF:
an American man from a city, who is living in or visiting a farm or
ranch
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国住在乡村或去乡村游览的〕城里男人

Sense.DEF:
a holiday place in the US where you can ride horses and live like a
cowboy
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国供游客骑马和像牛仔一样生活的〕度假牧场

Sense.DEF: in an angry or offended way – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 极为愤怒﹐气冲冲〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 预定的﹐预期发生[到达]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His new book is due to be published next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新书预计明年出版。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s pregnant and the baby’s due in April.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怀孕了﹐预产期是在4月份。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The final results of the experiment are due on December 9.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验的最终结果预计在12月9日出来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m due at his office at 4.30.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要在4点半到他的办公室。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car is due for its annual service again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车又该做年度保养了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When are the library books due back?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的书什么时候该还？

Sense.DEF: owed to someone either as a debt or because they have a right to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thanks are due to all those who took part.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向全体参加者致谢。

Sense.DEF: if an amount of money is due, it must be paid at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next income tax payment is due on 31 January.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一次的所得税支付期限是1月31日。

Sense.DEF: at some time in the future when it is the right time, but not before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Further details will be announced in due course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更多的细节将在适当的时候公布。

Sense.DEF: proper or suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was banned for six months for driving without due care and attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因为鲁莽驾驶而被罚六个月不准驾车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We want the best for each individual child with due regard for the interests of the other children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要满足每一个孩子的最大需求﹐也要照顾到其他孩子的利益。

Sense.DEF: used when you disagree with someone or criticize them in a polite way
Sense.TRAN: 恕我冒昧﹐恕我直言〔不同意或批评某人时的客气说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad, with all due respect, was not a very good husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恕我直言﹐我爸爸可不是个好丈夫。

Sense.DEF: your due is what you deserve, or something it is your right to have
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accepted all the praise he received as his due.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为他得到这些表扬是当之无愧的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Freddy, to give him his due to be fair to him , always tried to be honest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说句公道话﹐弗雷迪一直想诚实做人。

Sense.DEF: regular payments you make to an organization of which you are a member
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robert failed to pay his dues last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年罗伯特没有缴纳会费。

Sense.DEF: directly to the north, south, east, or west
the date on which something is supposed to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fewer than five percent of women have their babies on their due date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不到百分之五的妇女在预产期生产。

Sense.DEF: a fight with weapons between two people, used in the past to settle a quarrel
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时两人为解决争执的〕决斗
Sense.EXAMPLE: The officer challenged him to a duel .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那军官向他提出决斗。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which two people or groups are involved in an angry disagreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: a verbal duel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舌战

Sense.DEF: to fight a duel
the correct process that should be followed in law and is designed to protect someone’s legal rights
a piece of music for two singers or players
if one singer or musician duets with another, they sing or play together
because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court of inquiry ruled that the crash was due to pilot error.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查法庭裁定飞机失事是由驾驶员的失误造成的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has been absent from work due to illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因病没去上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant’s success was due largely to its new manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐馆的成功很大程度上归功于新来的经理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attendance at the meeting was small, due in part to partly because of the absence of teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加会议的人数不多﹐部分原因是教师缺席。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Due to is mostly used in formal or official contexts. In everyday English, people usually use because of .
F2NBox.TRAN: due to 大多用于正式或官方文章。在日常英语中,人们一般用 because of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We cancelled the picnic because of the weather.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于天气原因,我们取消了野餐。

Sense.DEF: the part of your body that you sit on
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get off your duff stop sitting or stop being lazy and help me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别坐着不动﹐来帮我忙！

Sense.DEF: bad or useless
to fight someone and injure them
a bag made of strong cloth, with a round bottom and a string around the top

a coat made of rough heavy cloth, usually with a
hood
and
toggle s buttons shaped like tubes
Sense.TRAN: 粗呢外套〔通常带兜帽和棒形纽扣〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is stupid or not very good at something

the past tense and past participle of
dig
Sense.TRAN: dig 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a low shelter at the side of a sports field, where players and team officials sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔球场边供运动员和教练等坐的〕休息棚

Sense.DEF: a shelter dug into the ground for soldiers to use
a small boat made by cutting out a hollow space in a tree trunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dugout canoe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独木舟

Sense.DEF: used to say that what someone else has just said or asked is stupid
Sense.TRAN: 咄〔表示某人说的话或问的问题很愚蠢〕

Sense.DEF: the crime of driving when you have had too much alcohol to drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a large number of DUI arrests on New Year’s Eve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除夕夜有许多人因醉酒驾车而被捕。

Sense.DEF: a man with the highest social rank outside the royal family
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Duke of Norfolk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺福克公爵

Sense.DEF: the rank of a duke
the land and property belonging to a duke
someone’s voice – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某人悦耳的嗓音〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Basil’s dulcet tones could be heard in the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴兹尔那 “悦耳” 的嗓音在走廊里都听得见。

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument with up to 100 strings, played with light hammers

a small instrument with strings that is popular in American
folk music
, and is played across your knees
Sense.TRAN: 杜西莫琴〔美国的一种民间乐器〕

Sense.DEF: not interesting or exciting
Sense.TRAN: 无趣的﹐枯燥的﹐沉闷的﹐无聊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is never dull when Elizabeth is here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有伊丽莎白在这里生活绝不会无聊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dull movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部沉闷的电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sounded pretty dull to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我听来﹐这很无聊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weekly meeting tends to be deadly dull very dull .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周一次的会议总是十分无聊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last week we had a hurricane. Never a dull moment running a hotel in the Caribbean it’s always interesting or exciting .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周我们这里刮飓风了﹐在加勒比海开酒店从来都不会有沉闷的时刻。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say boring rather than dull .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 boring,而不说 dull
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a long, boring film
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部冗长而沉闷的电影

Sense.DEF: not bright or shiny
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bird is dull brown and gray in colour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只鸟是暗淡的棕灰色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes were dull with dark shadows beneath them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的眼睛暗淡无光﹐挂着黑眼圈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dull afternoon light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗淡的午后光线

Sense.DEF: not bright and with lots of clouds
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside the weather was hazy and dull.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面薄雾朦胧﹐天色灰暗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dull sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴沉的天空

Sense.DEF: a dull pain is not severe but does not stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dull ache in her lower back
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她后腰的隐痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain was dull but persistent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛感不严重但一直持续。

Sense.DEF: not clear or loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gates shut with a dull thud .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一声闷响﹐大门关上了。

Sense.DEF: not sharp
not able to think quickly or understand things easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t understand then you’re duller than I thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不明白的话﹐那么你就比我原先想的还要笨。

Sense.DEF: if business on the Stock Exchange is dull, few people are buying and selling

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “怎么样﹐迈克尔？” 他木然地说。

Sense.DEF: to make something become less sharp or clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: He drank some alcohol to dull the pain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝了些酒来减轻疼痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her fear and anxiety dulled her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐惧和焦虑使她的头脑变得麻木了。

Sense.DEF: to become less bright or loud, or to make something become less bright or loud
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes dulled a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼神变得暗淡了一些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The constant rain dulled all sound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连续不断的雨使得所有的声音都变低沉了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is stupid and has no imagination
Sense.TRAN: 愚笨的人﹐无想象力的人

Sense.DEF: in the proper or expected way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here are your travel documents, all duly signed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是你的旅行证件﹐都签好了。

Sense.DEF: at the proper time or as expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Queen duly appeared on the balcony to wave to the crowds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王准时出现在阳台上﹐向人群招手。

Sense.DEF: stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a dumb question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么愚蠢的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of dumb kids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一帮笨孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb pretending to be stupid .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s no dumb blonde a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

Sense.DEF: unable to speak, because you are angry, surprised, shocked etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因愤怒﹑惊讶﹑震惊等而〕说不出话的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stared at the burnt-out car in dumb disbelief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他难以置信地望着烧毁的汽车﹐话也说不出来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was struck dumb with terror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吓得说不出话来。

Sense.DEF: someone who is dumb is not able to speak at all. Many people think that this use is offensive
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕哑的〔许多人认为此词具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: something good that happens in an unexpected way, especially when it is not deserved
Sense.TRAN: 纯粹是运气〔尤指不配得到〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was just dumb luck that we found the place at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们找到那地方纯粹是靠运气。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about animals when you want to emphasize that humans often treat them badly and they cannot protect themselves
Sense.TRAN: 不会说话的动物/生物〔用于强调人们常虐待动物﹐而它们却无法保护自己〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: For a few seconds she gazed dumbly at him.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几秒钟她呆呆地凝视着他。

Sense.DEF: to present news or information in a simple and attractive way without many details so that everyone can understand it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔为使大家能够理解而〕降低〔某物〕的标准﹐使〔某物〕简单化〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have history textbooks been dumbed down over the past decade?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史教科书在过去的十年里是否被简化了？

Sense.DEF: two weights connected by a short bar, that you can lift to strengthen your arms and shoulders
someone who is stupid
extremely surprised
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was completely dumbfounded by the incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他完全被这次事件惊呆了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is stupid
the use of movements without words to express something
so shocked or surprised that you cannot speak

a small
lift
used to move food, plates etc from one level in a restaurant, hotel etc to another
Sense.TRAN: 〔餐厅﹑酒店等中在楼层间运送食物﹑餐具等的〕小型升降机

Sense.DEF: a soft bullet that causes serious wounds because it breaks into pieces when it hits you
Sense.TRAN: 达姆弹〔一种会炸成碎片﹑杀伤力很强的软头子弹〕

Sense.DEF: a model that is the shape and size of a person, especially used in order to show clothes in a shop or when you are making clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔制作或陈列服装用的〕人体模型
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shop-window dummy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橱窗人体模型
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tailor’s dummy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁缝用的人体模型

Sense.DEF: an object that is made to look like a tool, weapon, vehicle etc but which you cannot use
Sense.TRAN: 〔工具﹑武器﹑车辆等的〕仿制品﹐仿真物品
Sense.EXAMPLE: During practice runs, the warheads in the missiles will be dummies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在演习中使用的导弹弹头将是仿制品。

Sense.DEF: a small model of a person, with a mouth that can be moved so that it looks as though it is talking, used for entertainment
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表演﹐嘴巴会动的〕玩具娃娃﹐玩偶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ventriloquist’s dummy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表演腹语术用的玩偶

Sense.DEF: a move in a sport such as football in which a player pretends to pass the ball but does not, in order to deceive the other team’s players
a specially shaped rubber object that you put in a baby’s mouth for it to suck
someone who is stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, you dummy. The other hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不对﹐你这个笨蛋。另一只手。

Sense.DEF:
cards that are placed on the table by one player for all the other players to see in a game of
bridge
a dummy tool, weapon, vehicle etc is made to look like a real one but you cannot use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dummy rifle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿真步枪

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you practise doing something in complete detail to see if it works
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do a dummy run to see how long it will take.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做一次演习看看要花多少时间。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere in a careless untidy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Merrill dumped her suitcase down in the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅里尔把手提箱扔在门厅里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They dump tons of salt on icy road surfaces to make driving safer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把成吨的盐撒到结冰的路面上使行车更安全。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He found a can of beef stew and dumped it in a saucepan to heat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他找到一罐炖牛肉﹐便把它扔进深平底锅里加热。

Subsense.DEF: to get rid of something that you do not want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ellie dumped all the photos of her ex-husband.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉把前夫的所有照片都扔了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He dumped her body into the sea.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她的尸体扔进了海里。

Subsense.DEF: to get rid of waste material by taking it from people’s houses and burying it under the soil
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Britain dumps more of its waste than any other European country.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国掩埋垃圾的数量超过任何一个欧洲国家。

Sense.DEF: to end a relationship with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vicky dumped Neil yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薇姬昨天把尼尔甩了。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of goods by selling them in a foreign country at a much lower price

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻止在西非倾销廉价欧洲牛肉的运动

Sense.DEF:
to copy information stored in a computer’s memory onto something else such as a
disk
or
magnetic tape
Sense.TRAN: 转储﹐转存﹐转出〔将存储在计算机中的资料转存到磁盘或磁带等中〕

Sense.DEF: to unfairly give someone an unwanted job, duty, or problem to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 把〔不想要的工作﹑职责或麻烦〕丢给某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just dump the extra work on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把额外的工作都丢给我。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly
to criticize someone very strongly and often unfairly
Sense.EXAMPLE: politicians dumping on their opponents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诋毁对手的政客

Sense.DEF: to tell someone all your problems and worries
Sense.TRAN: 将（烦恼）向某人和盘托出
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all dump our troubles on Mike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都向迈克倾诉烦恼。

Sense.DEF: a place where unwanted waste is taken and left

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fire probably started in a rubbish dump.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火可能是从垃圾场开始烧起来的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the rest into a sack to take to the dump .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把其余的放进麻袋拿到垃圾场去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an underground nuclear waste dump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下核废物堆
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dump site
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 垃圾场

Sense.DEF: a place where military supplies are stored, or the supplies themselves
Sense.TRAN: 军需品仓库[存放处]﹔军需品
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been a series of explosions in an ammunition dump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹药库发生了一连串爆炸。

Sense.DEF: a place that is unpleasant to live in because it is dirty, ugly, untidy etc
Sense.TRAN: 脏乱的居住地﹐邋遢地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘ What a dump ,’ she added as they entered the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “多邋遢的地方。” 他们进村时她加了一句。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you living in a dump like this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么要住在这样的邋遢地方？

Sense.DEF: very sad and without much interest in life
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s feeling a bit down in the dumps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得有点忧郁。

Sense.DEF:
the act of copying the information stored in a computer’s memory onto something else, such as a
disk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a screen dump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屏幕转储

Sense.DEF:
to pass solid waste from the
bowel s

a
dump truck
the act of getting rid of dangerous waste material in a place that is not safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised to stop dumping by the state-owned chemical plants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已保证停止国营化工厂的倾倒行为。

Sense.DEF: a place where people get rid of waste material

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rivers have always been a dumping ground for man’s unwanted waste.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河流一直是人类的垃圾倾倒场。

Sense.DEF: a place where people are sent when no one knows how to deal with them
Sense.TRAN: 把难缠的人打发去的地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prison has been the dumping ground for difficult prisoners for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座监狱多年来一直是关押难缠犯人的地方。

Sense.DEF: a round lump of flour and fat mixed with water, cooked in boiling liquid and served with meat
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken and dumplings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡肉和汤团

Sense.DEF:
a sweet dish made of
pastry
filled with fruit
Sense.EXAMPLE: apple dumplings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苹果馅饼

Sense.DEF: a large metal container used for waste in the US
the activity of looking through Dumpsters for clothes, food, furniture etc that other people have thrown away
Sense.TRAN: 〔在垃圾桶中找出衣服﹑食品﹑家具等的〕垃圾搜寻

Sense.DEF: a vehicle with a large open container at the back that can move up to pour sand, soil etc onto the ground
someone who is dumpy is fat, short, and unattractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dumpy little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矮胖的小个子男人

Sense.DEF: a brownish-grey colour
someone who is slow at learning things
Sense.EXAMPLE: the dunce of the class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个班上的笨学生

Sense.DEF: a tall pointed hat that a stupid student had to wear in school in the past
Sense.TRAN: 笨蛋帽〔旧时劣等生必须在学校戴的尖顶高帽〕

Sense.DEF: a British cake made with fruit and nuts
Sense.TRAN: 邓迪蛋糕﹐杏仁水果蛋糕

Sense.DEF: someone who is stupid
a hill made of sand near the sea or in the desert
a car with big wheels and no roof that you can drive across sand
Sense.TRAN: 〔装有大号轮胎﹑无车顶﹑适合在沙地行驶的〕沙地汽车

Sense.DEF: solid waste from animals, especially cows
loose trousers that have a square piece of cloth that covers your chest, and long thin pieces that fasten over your shoulders
heavy cotton trousers used for working in
a dark underground prison, especially under a castle, that was used in the past
to quickly put something into a liquid and take it out again, especially something you are eating
Sense.TRAN: 把〔尤指吃的东西〕浸一浸﹐蘸一蘸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill dunked her ginger biscuit in her tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔把姜味饼干在茶里蘸了一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dunked my head under the water and scrubbed at my hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把头浸到水里揉搓头发。

Sense.DEF: to push someone under water for a short time as a joke
Sense.TRAN: 将 〔某人〕按到水里片刻〔作为玩笑〕

Sense.DEF:
to jump up by the basket and throw the ball down into it in
basketball

a determination to succeed despite being in a difficult or impossible situation, which is believed to be a typical British quality. The expression comes from the events involving British soldiers during World War II at Dunkirk.
Sense.TRAN: 敦刻尔克精神〔在危机时刻不屈服﹑不绝望的精神﹐被认为是英国人的典型品质﹐源于第二次世界大战期间英军在敦刻尔克的事迹〕

Sense.DEF: a way of saying ‘I don’t know’. Some people think that this use is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 不知道〔I don’t know的一种说法﹐有些人认为这种说法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want to come?’ ‘I dunno, I might.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想来吗？” “我不知道﹐也许吧。”

Sense.DEF: two people who perform together or are often seen together
Sense.TRAN: 〔在一起表演的〕一对艺人﹐搭档﹔形影不离的两个人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the comedy duo Reeves and Mortimer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜剧搭档里夫斯和莫蒂默

Sense.DEF: a piece of music for two performers

the top part of your
bowel
, below your stomach
someone who is tricked, especially into becoming involved in something illegal
Sense.TRAN: 受骗者﹐上当者〔尤指受骗参与违法之事的人〕

Sense.DEF: to trick or deceive someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Consumers are being duped into buying faulty electronic goods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费者受骗购买有问题的电子产品。

Sense.DEF: a type of house that is divided into two parts, so that it has two separate homes in it
Sense.TRAN: 毗联式住宅〔并排住两家人〕

Sense.DEF: to copy something exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: New copies of the form can be duplicated from a master copy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以用原件来复制新的表格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The video was duplicated illegally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这盘录像带是非法拷贝的。

Sense.DEF: to repeat something in exactly the same way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t want staff to duplicate each other’s work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不希望员工重复彼此的工作。

Sense.DEF: exactly the same as something, or made as an exact copy of something
Sense.TRAN: 完全一样的﹐复制的﹐副本的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A duplicate copy should be made for the county record office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该制作一个副本呈交县档案室。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a duplicate key
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配制的钥匙

Sense.DEF: an exact copy of something that you can use in the same way
Sense.TRAN: 完全一样的东西﹐复制品﹐副本

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Locksmiths can make duplicates of most keys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数钥匙锁匠都能配制。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She kept both the duplicate and the original.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把复制本和原本都保留着。

Sense.DEF: if something is in duplicate, there are two copies of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Copies of the proposal should be sent in duplicate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建议书应该一式两份送去。

Sense.DEF: dishonest behaviour that is intended to deceive someone
staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wood is a durable material.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头是耐用材料。

Sense.DEF: continuing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: His poetry has proved durable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的诗已经证明经久不衰。

Sense.DEF: large things such as cars, televisions, and furniture, that you do not buy often
Sense.TRAN: 〔大件〕耐用消费品〔如汽车﹑电视﹑家具等〕

Sense.DEF: the length of time that something continues
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course is of three years’ duration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该课程为期三年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The package includes cycle hire for the duration of your holiday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一包价中包括度假期间的自行车租用费。

Sense.DEF: illegal or unfair threats

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The confession was obtained under duress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 供词是在威逼之下取得的。

Sense.DEF:
a rubber
contraceptive
that a man wears over his
penis
during sex
AusE clear narrow plastic that is sticky on one side and is used for fastening paper
from the beginning to the end of a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天她当过救生员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。

Sense.DEF: at some point in a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 在〔一段时间中的〕某一时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was killed during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲在战争中牺牲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I mentioned the subject during our discussions at her Washington office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在她华盛顿的办公室里讨论时﹐我提到了这件事。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘during doing something’ or 或 ‘during someone does something’. Use 用 while: They chatted while waiting for the train (NOT 不说 during waiting for the train). 他们一边等火车一边聊天。 | He stole her money while she slept (NOT 不说 during she slept). 他趁她睡觉时偷了她的钱。

Exponent.DEF: at one point in a period of time, or through the whole of a period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you hear the storm during the night?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚上你听到狂风暴雨的声音吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: During the summer we spend a lot more time out of doors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天,我们很多时候在户外。

Exponent.DEF: during all of a period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The cafe’s closed all through the winter and opens again in April.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家咖啡馆整个冬天都停业,4月份又重新营业。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Throughout her career she has worked hard and achieved the highest standards.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个职业生涯中,她工作努力,取得了最高成就。

Exponent.DEF: at one point or at various different points during a period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m going to redecorate my bedroom over the holidays.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假日里我打算重新装修卧室。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s been a great help to me over the past year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去的一年里她对我帮助很大。

Exponent.DEF: during a particular process or period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the course of the study we consulted with leading experts in global warming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在研究过程中,我们和全球变暖方面的顶级专家进行了探讨。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was huge social change in the course of the 1960s.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代期间,发生了重大的社会变革。

Exponent.DEF: during a period of time, or before the end of a period – used when you want to emphasize that it is a short or limited period
Exponent.TRAN: 在…时间内〔用于强调时间短或有限〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There have been five serious accidents within the last few days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去几天内发生了5起严重的事故。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Payment must be made within 30 days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须在30天之内付款。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
dare
the time before it gets dark when the sky is becoming less bright
Sense.EXAMPLE: The street lights go on at dusk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街灯在黄昏时亮起来。

Sense.DEF: dark or not very bright in colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was filled with dusky shadows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里到处都是朦胧的影子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dusky pink room
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗粉色调的房间

Sense.DEF: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of dirt that is in buildings on furniture, floors etc if they are not kept clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the furniture was covered in dust .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的家具都蒙上了灰尘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thick layer of dust
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厚厚的一层灰尘
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s not a speck of dust in the kitchen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里一尘不染。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her old trophies were collecting dust on the shelves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的旧奖杯在书架上积起了灰尘。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Dust particles floated in the sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光里飘浮着尘埃颗粒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden breeze sent motes of dust small bits of dust dancing in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然刮起一阵微风吹得灰尘飞扬。

Sense.DEF: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of earth or sand
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind was blowing dust and leaves up from the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风吹起了地上的尘土和树叶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car sped past in a cloud of dust .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆汽车疾驰而过﹐扬起一片尘土。

Sense.DEF: powder consisting of extremely small bits of a particular substance

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤灰/砖粉/粉笔灰等

Sense.DEF: the act of dusting something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to give the sitting room a dust .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要给起居室掸掸灰尘。

Sense.LEXUNIT: let the dust settle/wait for the dust to settle
Sense.DEF: to allow or wait for a confused situation to become clear
Sense.TRAN: 让尘埃落定/等待情况明朗

Sense.DEF: to clean the dust from a surface by moving something such as a soft cloth across it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel dusted the books and the bookshelves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔给书和书架除尘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was dusting in the bedroom when the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在卧室里打扫﹐电话铃响了。

Sense.DEF: to remove something such as dust or dirt from your clothes by brushing them with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手〕掸（衣服上的灰尘或脏物）
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got to his feet and dusted his knees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起来拍拍膝上的灰尘。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Corbett dusted himself down and walked off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科比特掸掸身上的灰走开了。

Sense.DEF: to put a fine powder over something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dust the biscuits with icing sugar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把糖粉撒在饼干上面。

Sense.DEF: to remove something such as dust or dirt from your clothes by brushing them with your hands
Sense.TRAN: 〔用手〕掸去〔衣服上的灰尘或脏物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were dusting off leaves and twigs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们掸去身上的树叶和细枝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got to his feet and dusted himself off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起来拍拍灰。

Sense.DEF: to get something ready in order to use it again, after not using it for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 把〔长期不用的东西〕备好待用﹐准备重新使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is dusting off schemes for supporting creative industries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府准备重新启动搁置已久的支持创意产业的方案。

Sense.DEF: a large container outside your house, used for holding waste until it is taken away

a
dustman

an area of land that has
dust storm s
and very long periods without rain
Sense.TRAN: 干旱尘暴区〔长期干旱而多尘暴的地带〕

Sense.DEF: a small ball of dust that forms in a place that is not cleaned regularly, such as under furniture
Sense.TRAN: 〔家具等底下不常打扫处积起来的〕小尘团

Sense.DEF: a large vehicle that goes from house to house to collect waste from dustbins
a paper cover of a book, which you can remove
a cloth for removing dust from furniture
a light coat that you wear to protect your clothes while you are cleaning the house

a
dust storm
a paper cover of a book, which you can remove

someone whose job is to remove waste from
dustbin s
a flat container with a handle that you use with a brush to remove dust and waste from the floor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got a dustpan and brush?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有畚箕和刷子吗？

Sense.DEF: a large sheet of cloth used to protect furniture from dust or paint
a storm with strong winds that carries large amounts of dust
a fight
covered with dust
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adrian cycled along the dusty road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿德里安沿着满是尘土的路骑自行车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything’s really dusty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有东西都布满灰尘。

Sense.DEF: blue etc that is not bright but is slightly grey
Sense.EXAMPLE: The curtains had faded to a dusty pink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗帘的颜色已经褪成了暗粉色。

Sense.DEF: relating to the Netherlands, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 荷兰的﹔荷兰人的﹔荷兰语的

Sense.DEF: to share the cost of a meal in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔在餐馆里〕（和某人）各自结账﹐平摊费用

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you share the cost of something such as a meal in a restaurant
people from the Netherlands
the language used in the Netherlands, and in some parts of Belgium
a public sale at which the price of something is gradually reduced until someone will pay it
Sense.TRAN: 荷兰式拍卖﹐降价式拍卖〔逐渐降价直到有人购买为止〕

Sense.DEF:
a farm building with a curved roof on a frame that has no walls, used for storing
hay

a round rubber
contraceptive
, that a woman wears inside her
vagina
during sex
courage or confidence that you get when you drink alcohol

a disease that affects and kills
elm
trees
a man from the Netherlands
used to show that you do not believe something
Sense.TRAN: 〔要是…〕我就不是人〔表示不相信〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If that ball was out, then I’m a Dutchman .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是那个球出界了﹐我就不是人。

Sense.DEF: a large cooking pot with a lid
a woman from the Netherlands
dutiable goods are those that you must pay duty on
doing what you are expected to do and behaving in a loyal and obedient way
Sense.TRAN: 尽责的﹔忠诚的﹔顺从的﹐恭敬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dutiful son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孝顺儿子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dutiful applause greeted his speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的讲话被报以礼节性的鼓掌。

Sense.DEF: if you do something dutifully, you do it because you think it is the correct way to behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: I dutifully wrote down every word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽责地写下了每一个字。

Sense.DEF: something that you have to do because it is morally or legally right
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promise I will do my duty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保证会尽到我的责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We feel it is our duty to help her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们感到帮助她是我们的责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local authorities have a duty to keep the streets clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方当局有责任保持街道整洁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have a duty to your husband and to your children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对你丈夫和孩子负有责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a strong sense of moral duty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的道德责任感很强。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unions have failed in their duty to female workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会未能对女职工尽到责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the traditional Hindu family, the son is duty-bound to look after his mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在传统的印度家庭里﹐儿子负有照顾母亲的责任。

Sense.DEF: something you have to do as part of your job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Martin’s duties included cleaning the cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁的职责包括清洗汽车。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She works for her father doing part-time secretarial duties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为她父亲做兼职的秘书工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He will soon be fit enough to carry out his duties do his job .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就能康复起来重新工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He can only do light duties .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只能干点轻活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When Juliet reported for duty arrived and said she was ready to start work she was sent to check on a new patient.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱丽叶报到上班后被派去检查一名新病人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A teacher may be fired for neglect of duty failing to do their job properly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师会因失职被开除。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did three tours of duty in Vietnam three periods working in a foreign country as a soldier, government officer etc .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他曾三次在越南服役。

Sense.DEF: to be working or not working at a particular time, especially when you are doing a job which people take turns to do, so that someone is always doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s on night duty .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在值夜班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary goes on duty starts working tonight at half past ten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽今晚10点半上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time do you go off duty finish work ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候下班？

Sense.DEF: a tax you pay on something you buy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the duty on cigarettes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟税

GramExa.GLOSS: tax paid on goods coming into the country

Sense.DEF: to be used as something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The living room also does duty as a home office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起居室也用作家庭办公室。

Sense.DEF: duty-free goods can be brought into a country without paying tax on them
Sense.EXAMPLE: duty-free cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免税香烟
Sense.EXAMPLE: the duty-free shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免税商店

Sense.DEF: alcohol, cigarettes etc that you can bring into a country without having to pay tax on them
a large cloth bag filled with feathers or similar material that you use to cover yourself in bed
a day when you are supposed to go to work, but stay at home and relax instead
Sense.TRAN: 枕头假﹐减压假〔指赖在家里不上班的一天〕

Sense.FULLFORM: digital video disc or digital versatile disc
Sense.DEF:
a type of computer
disc
that can store a large amount of information, sound, pictures, and video
Sense.TRAN: 数字影碟﹐数字多功能光碟

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字影碟机
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is now out on video and DVD.

Sense.DEF:
a type of computer
disc
that can store more information than a CD-ROM

Sense.FULLFORM: the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
Sense.DEF:
the British government department that is responsible for collecting road tax from people who own vehicles, for giving driving tests, and for giving people their
driving licence s
Sense.TRAN: 交通管理局〔英国政府部门﹐负责收取道路税﹑举行驾照考试及颁发驾照〕
the abbreviation of 缩写= deep vein thrombosis 深静脉血栓形成

Sense.DEF: an imaginary creature that looks like a small man
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《白雪公主和七个小矮人》

Sense.DEF: a person who is a dwarf has not continued to grow to the normal height because of a medical condition. Many people think that this use is offensive.
Sense.TRAN: 矮子﹐侏儒〔许多人认为这一用法具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a dwarf plant or animal is much smaller than the usual size
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dwarf conifer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矮生针叶树

Sense.DEF: to be so big that other things are made to seem very small
Sense.TRAN: 〔因自身巨大而〕使显得矮小﹐使相形见绌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cathedral is dwarfed by the surrounding skyscrapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周围的摩天大楼使得大教堂显得很矮小。

Sense.DEF: someone who is weak, slightly strange, and not popular or fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 怪人﹐不合群的人﹐落伍的人

Sense.DEF: to live in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: They dwelt in the forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在森林里。

Sense.DEF: to think or talk for too long about something, especially something unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 老是想着[详述﹐唠叨]某事〔尤指令人不快之事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That is not a subject I want to dwell on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不是我愿意多谈的话题。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that lives in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 居住在城里/镇上/洞穴中等的人[动物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: City dwellers suffer higher pollution levels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市居民承受的污染程度更严重。

Sense.DEF: a house, apartment etc where people live
a house that people live in, not one that is being used as a shop, office etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔与商店﹑办公室等相对而言的〕住宅房屋

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
dwell
the crime of driving when you have had too much alcohol to drink
to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller
Sense.EXAMPLE: The elephant population is dwindling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大象的数量在减少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His money had dwindled away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的钱在逐渐变少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stream has dwindled to a trickle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条小河变成了细流。

Sense.DEF: a substance you use to change the colour of your clothes, hair etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: hair dye
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 染发剂

Sense.DEF: someone who has had a dye job has used a substance to change the colour of their hair
to give something a different colour using a dye

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Priscilla’s hair was dyed jet black.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 普里希拉的头发染成了乌黑色。

Sense.DEF: having strong beliefs, likes, or opinions that will never change
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰﹑爱好﹑见解等〕根深蒂固的﹐顽固不化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even dyed-in-the-wool traditionalists were impressed by the changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至连顽固不化的传统主义者都被这些变化所打动。

Sense.DEF:
the present participle of
die
during the last minutes, seconds etc before something ends
Sense.TRAN: 最后的时刻/几分钟/几秒钟
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chandler’s goal was in the dying minutes of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱德勒的进球是在最后几分钟里打入的。

Sense.DEF: happening just before someone dies
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was her dying wish to have a simple burial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的临终遗愿是办个简朴的葬礼。

Sense.DEF: for the rest of your life
Sense.EXAMPLE: He regretted the decision to his dying day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他至死都后悔作了这个决定。

Sense.DEF: gradually decreasing until soon there will be none left
Sense.TRAN: 快要绝迹的﹐行将消亡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women who enjoy baking are a dying breed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢做烘烤食品的女人快要绝迹了。

Sense.DEF: people who are dying
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hospice for the dying
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临终安养院

Sense.DEF: a wall or bank built to keep back water and prevent flooding

an offensive word for a
lesbian woman who is sexually attracted to women
. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 同性恋女子〔蔑称﹐勿用此词〕

Sense.DEF: a narrow passage to carry water away
full of energy and new ideas, and determined to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 精力充沛的﹔有创新思想的﹔志在成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: dynamic and ambitious people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精力充沛且雄心勃勃的人

Sense.DEF: continuously moving or changing
Sense.TRAN: 不断移动的﹔不断变化的﹐动态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dynamic and unstable process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断变化的﹑不稳定的过程

Sense.DEF: relating to a force or power that causes movement

Subsense.DEF: the way in which things or people behave, react, and affect each other
Subsense.TRAN: 动态﹐〔事物或人〕相互作用的方式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the dynamics of the family
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭互动

Subsense.EXAMPLE: He did research on group dynamics and leadership styles.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他研究群体互动和领导风格。

Subsense.DEF: the science relating to the movement of objects and the forces involved in movement
changes in how loudly music is played or sung

Sense.DEF: something that causes action or change
Sense.TRAN: 〔导致某种行动或变化的〕动力﹐活力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She regards class conflict as a central dynamic of historical change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把阶级冲突看成是历史变革的核心驱动力。

Sense.DEF: energy and determination to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: her entrepreneurial dynamism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的创业劲头

Sense.DEF: a powerful explosive used especially for breaking rock
Sense.TRAN: （尤用于爆破岩石的）达纳炸药﹐硝酸甘油炸药
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dynamite blast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸药爆炸

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is likely to cause a lot of trouble
Sense.TRAN: 会惹出大麻烦的事物[人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the proposals became public they would be dynamite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建议一旦公开就会惹出大乱子。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is very exciting or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band is dynamite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队棒极了。

Sense.DEF: to damage or destroy something with dynamite
a machine that changes some other form of power directly into electricity
Sense.EXAMPLE: bicycle lights powered by a dynamo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以直流发电机供电的自行车车灯

Sense.DEF: someone who is excited about what they do and who puts a lot of energy into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: the team’s midfield dynamo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队的中场主力

Sense.DEF: something that has a strong effect on something else, and that makes things happen
Sense.TRAN: 举足轻重的事物﹐原动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil is the dynamo of the country’s economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油是该国经济的原动力。

Sense.DEF: a family of kings or other rulers whose parents, grandparents etc have ruled the country for many years
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Habsburg dynasty ruled in Austria from 1278 to 1918.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈布斯堡王朝在1278至1918年间统治奥地利。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when a particular family ruled a country or area
a group or family that controls a particular business or organization for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔长时间掌控某一企业或组织的〕王朝﹐家族
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Rothschild banking dynasty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯柴尔德银行家族

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘do you’
Sense.EXAMPLE: D’you know what I mean?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道我的意思吗？

Sense.DEF: a condition that makes it difficult for someone to recognize numbers correctly, so that they cannot do simple sums
Sense.TRAN: 计算困难症﹐计数障碍症

Sense.DEF:
a serious disease of your
bowel s
that makes them
bleed
and pass much more waste than usual
not following the normal patterns of social behaviour, especially with the result that someone cannot behave in a normal way or have a satisfactory life
Sense.EXAMPLE: dysfunctional family relationships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反常的家庭关系

Sense.DEF: not working properly or normally
Sense.TRAN: 有机能障碍的﹔有故障的

Sense.DEF: a condition that makes it difficult for someone to read and spell

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Two of the children in the class are dyslexic.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 班上有两个孩子患有诵读困难症。

Sense.DEF: a problem that your body has in dealing with the food you eat
suffering from dyspepsia
bad-tempered
a condition that makes it difficult for someone to control their movements accurately and can affect their learning
an imaginary place where life is extremely difficult and a lot of unfair or immoral things happen
Sense.TRAN: 反面乌托邦﹐反面假想国﹐敌托邦〔想象中生活极其艰难的地方〕
